Imagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Duties
The Regulatory Data Management (RDM) Division is seeking a highly motivated individual to join their team of Regulatory Business Analysts. In support of OSFI’s mandate and strategic objectives, the successful candidate would work in partnership with internal and external data stakeholders to analyse and identify data collection needs.

Under the supervision of the Manager, Returns Data Analyst, the Regulatory Data Analyst works collaboratively with IM/IT and business units to optimize OSFI’s cross-sector requirements gathering and analysis.

This liaison role requires above average abilities to communicate effectively.

Responsibilities include:
Liaise with Supervision and Regulation sectors (the business clients) to analyze and identify their data requirementsIdentify and develop solutions to optimize data collection, including the maintenance and improvement of existing regulatory data returnsProvide day-to-day direction and assistance to clients, aiding in their understanding of data, associated data processes and tools, and best practices for data governance and managementManage multiple data requests from internal and external sources, including the management of conflicting or non-integrated requirements and responsibilitiesProvide users of OSFI’s Business Intelligence (BI) data access tools with functional supportProvide an interface between business clients and IM/IT on BI issues

Information on employment equity
In order for your application to be considered, you must submit a completed questionnaire. You will be required to demonstrate how you meet the education and experience criteria (essential and asset) for the initial screening, in answering online screening questions. It is NOT sufficient to only state that the qualifications are met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities. Rather, you must clearly demonstrate HOW, WHEN and WHERE the qualification was met through substantiation by examples. Information on your described education and experience provided in the screening questions should be supported by your résumé. Failure to provide the above information in the format required may result in your application being rejected from the process.

A written examination will be administered.

An interview will be administered.

Reference checks may be sought.

Please note that OSFI has offices located in Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal, and Vancouver. If you are screened in, you may be required to travel to one of these locations to complete assessment (exam, interview, etc.).

Candidates invited to an interview will be required to bring proof of their education credentials, in the form of a diploma or official transcript (original documents only). Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca/.

Candidates must meet all of the essential qualifications to be appointed to a position. A candidate may be appointed to a position even though he/she does not meet any or all of the asset qualifications. However, meeting these criteria is desirable and may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed.

Depending on the requirements of the position(s) being staffed from this process, for current or future vacancies, any or all of the asset qualifications, operational requirements, and organizational needs may be applied at the time of staffing. Candidates may be contacted and assessed against these criteria at any time during this process.

Achieving a representative workforce has been identified as an organizational need and may be applied in this appointment process. If this criterion is used, only those who have indicated that they are members of the specified designated group(s) will be considered.
A top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

For this selection process, our intention is to communicate with applicants by e-mail (including sending invitations for written tests and interviews). As a Separate Agency, the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) appoints employees in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act (PSEA). OSFI is named in Schedule V of the Financial Administration Act (FAA) and it offers the same pension and benefits plans as the core Federal Public Service. In addition to this, OSFI employees obtain a minimum of 4 weeks of vacation leave per year, earn a competitive salary, and are eligible for an annual performance bonus.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

job_title: Data Analyst (internally known as Business Analyst)
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporary$36.17 an hourMake a difference
Are you passionate about data analysis and looking for an opportunity to positively impact your community? If so, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) position at Toronto Community Housing may be for you!
The Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be part of the Data Governance team, reporting to the Data Governance Manager within the Information and Technology Services (ITS) department.
The main focus will be on supporting various initiatives under the Data Governance program, including, but not limited to, establishing best practices in Master Data Management and Data Quality areas. Initially, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be focusing on understanding and modeling TCHC’s current state data in collaboration with the Data Governance and Data Management teams. Also, the Data Analyst will be one of the key resources as part of data conversion effort to consolidate TCHC data into the new business solution.
This role will be actively engaged with different business divisions as part of the Data Governance program to identify data requirements and to ensure that data governance will address various business data needs.
What you’ll do
Data Analysis
Identifies data requirements for enterprise data throughout whole data lifecycle
Performs research and analysis on a regular and ad hoc basis to support data governance activities
Ensures the integrity, quality and accuracy of data while collecting data from internal and external sources supporting data governance activities
Collects, interprets and analyzes data and provides ongoing reporting
Supports and enforces established data standards and guidelines
Manages master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Proactively monitors data accuracy and facilitates required data corrective actions with business owners
Provides assistance and analytical support to ensure that decision-making processes are aligned with values, policies, and organization-wide business
Data Governance Strategy support
Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data flows, business constrains and requirements
Provides support to data owners/ data stewards in performing data validation
Participates in the creation of data standards, drafting of data and governance policies and management of related documentation
Partners in troubleshooting and resolving master data transactions, SLA impacts, or other operational challenges affected by master data issues
Develops and implements governance oversight and KPI metrics to successfully complete data governance objectives
Collaborates with division and other staff to interpret data, identify trends, communicate meaning and develop recommendations based on findings
Research
Maintains up to date knowledge of information technology products and methodologies as well as government and TCH data policies and standards
Contributes to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within master data and data quality
Participates in research projects with external and internal partners
 What you’ll need
University Degree in computer science, MIS or other relevant specialty/discipline
University degree in computer science, MIS is preferred
3 years - Previous experience in data analysis and data modeling, 3-5 years’ experience is preferred
Knowledge of data modeling tools
Working experience of SQL
Exposure to data architecture best practices
Previous experience in Data Governance, MDM and / or Data Quality initiatives
Has participated in data conversion activities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate architectural concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
Nice to have:
Previous experience in data conversion initiatives
Ability to manage multiple demands within tight timelines
Demonstrate good problem-solving abilities, and have initiative and show sound judgment
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints are required
Ability to exhibit maturity, reliability and stability by adhering to commitments is critical in order to maintain business credibility
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision
What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please note: This temporary position may be extended or become permanent in order to meet business needs. If this occurs, the position may not be reposted.

Toronto, ONTemporary$87,888 - $103,249 a yearPlease note that the salary is based on 2018 rates.


Major Responsibilities:


Reporting to the Senior Systems Integrator Clerks, the Business Analyst SII will analyze business operations and application systems in order to bridge the gap of translating business requirements into system specifications to develop custom application solutions.

Assesses information technology and data/systems needs and requirements of business units and identifies and evaluates feasibility of operations, policies, technology, information systems and management practices to improve service delivery
Evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of business systems and determines information systems strategies by means of feasibility and cost/benefit studies.
Assesses impact of technology on service delivery/resources/business and costs/savings, and develops recommendations, including opportunities for maximizing technology and improving efficiency of business practices
Designs system specifications; preparing requirements for ensuring proper system testing, implementation and operation
Prepares system and user documentation and provides consultation, technical support and user training to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented
Documents and analyzes business requirements utilizing various methods such as: interviewing (JAD sessions), data modeling, business process modeling, business object modeling and user interface design
Provides support to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented and utilized in support of the business
Assists in the development, testing, training and configuration of the specific applications and the fine tuning and implementation of upgrades, new releases and enhancements to the applications
Contributes to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
Works closely with various stakeholders and partners to understand priorities and impact.
Develops and delivers presentation and training sessions tailored to specific stakeholder groups
Prepares RFI/P/Qs and other formal project documentation
Manages vendors and external contracts
Travels to off-site locations


Key Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Information Management, Information Technology, Business / Public Administration or other discipline pertinent to the job function, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience performing system analysis and business analysis and/or managing medium to large scale projects.
Experience in documentation and process design techniques such as cases, data and workflow modelling, swim lane diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, activity diagrams, business rule documentation, functional & non-functional identification and screen mock-ups
Experience and of MS Office Suite including Visio, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and/or other project management software. Experience using Blueprint would be an asset.
Considerable experience coordinating, supporting and facilitating medium to large scale projects including the definition of project purpose and objective, project activities, milestones and deliverables, monitoring and tracking progress, and communication to stakeholders.
Strong understanding of privacy, security and auditing; how these can be reviewed, monitored, and enhanced with regards to systems implementation.
Strong understanding of application deployment approaches, and standard dev-QA-Production cycles.
Knowledge of software development and project management methodologies (RUP, SDLC, Waterfall, Agile, Prince, Zachman).
Knowledge of Municipal Freedom of Information & Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA).
Excellent written and oral communication skills, presentation and interpersonal skills to deal effectively with city staff, city councillors, senior management and the public.
Analytical skills in assessing and reviewing business processes to identify options, best practices and opportunities to improve service delivery through technology change and business process innovations.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills to provide troubleshooting support, prepare technical documentation and reports on problems and to deal effectively with staff at all levels within the organization.
Excellent organizational, conceptual, analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills.
Strong leading, listening and interacting skills to work with competing demands, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects, work with cross-functional teams, set clear directions and design terms of references and project plans.
Ability to report to various work sites within the City of Toronto as required.

$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@visoinc.com with the subject title “Business Analyst”.

We look forward to receiving your resume!

Overview
ACCEO Solutions Inc., Retail Solutions division, is a Canada-wide leading provider of Retail Point of Sale Software, and is part of the Constellation Software family. If you derive job satisfaction from data analytics, problem solving, and providing guidance and consultation to others, this could be the opportunity you have been looking for. We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst & Reports Specialist for our Markham office to serve our clients. They look to us to provide turnkey solutions, with recommendations and guidance on rolling out their systems. Our clients’ computer skills range from advanced to novice. In this role, the successful candidate understands intuitively how to communicate, coach, and guide the client through their next steps. Technical writing

Project management skills

Toronto, ONAbout Us:
SnapTravel is a conversational commerce (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOFWv4REqls) startup, allowing millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging.
We are working on complex problems within NLP (understanding and replying to ambiguous human messaging), Conversational Commerce (optimizing conversions and user behavior over chat) and Machine Learning (choosing the best hotel automatically from a large data set with complex market dynamics) to push the boundaries of tech and travel globally.
SnapTravel has a fast-moving & transparent environment where everyone works as a team with complete transparency. We value data-driven decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the team.
About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team, working within Operations & Global Supply! As a Data Analyst at SnapTravel, you will be responsible for using data to answer strategic questions and drive our business strategy and customer success. With a strong analytical and data-driven approach, you are an expert in quantitative analysis and will use your skills to help our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to Customer Experience and Global Inventory/Supply. This is an exciting opportunity to take ownership in a role as you run deep-dive analyses, create regression models, build dashboards and reporting to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product and user data.
Challenges You'll Solve:
Data-driven Culture: you will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making for our Operations & Global Supply teams
Data Management: you will pull, clean and organize raw data to create models that depict trends in the customer base to improve forecasting activities
Visualizations: you will help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams to communicate customer pain points and successes
Hard Questions: your quantitative analysis will be an integral part of helping us to answer the toughest questions in our business, such as:
Where in the operations and customer success funnels should we concentrate our efforts and our spend? Where can we improve the most?
What key insights can be drawn from our users and the way that they use our product?
How can we analyze and better understand our Global Supply, to ensure that our pricing and hotel rate availability is optimized against user demand?
What A/B tests, experiments and multivariate product tests can be used to explore new ideas, and how can they be effectively tracked, measured and monitored? When are the results statistically significant? When do we pull the plug?
About You:
You have at least 2 years of experience in a Data Analysis role, ideally from the eCommerce industry
You are outstanding at pulling, cleaning and manipulating large sets of complex data to turn them into stories that key stakeholders can understand
You are an expert at writing SQL queries & doing data analysis with Python and/or R, and know your way around visualization tools (Tableau, Periscope, etc.)
You are naturally curious, and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and their real-world applications
Experience working with Operations and Customer Support is an asset, particularly around setting, tracking and monitoring SLA's and KPI's
What To Expect:
After applying, you'll receive an email with all of this info. So feel free to skip it for now.
Review - you'll hear from us within 48 hours of applying
Phone Call - a quick call to learn who you are (resumes suck, we want to know the real you!)
Assessment - a chance for you to tackle a realistic problem and show us how you manage, analyze and visualize data
Onsite Interview - 60-90 min onsite with our Head of Operations to present your case study and tackle a whiteboarding problem collaboratively
Final Interview - connect with one of our Data Engineers, more Q&A to ask us about SnapTravel; deeper dive into culture and team; meet the Cofounders
The Perks:
Compensation: top of market salaries and equity; full benefits package
Flexible Work Arrangements: work from home, work remotely, take vacation... do what makes sense for you. This includes a holistic Parental Leave policy.
Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, Twitter, Asana, YouTube, Uber and more.
Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work.

Ottawa, ON$52,854 - $149,416 a yearHelp bring research to life and drive your career forward with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC), Canada’s largest research and technology organization.

We are looking for a vibrant and dynamic Technical Business Analyst to support our National Programs and Business Services Branch. The Technical Business Analyst would be someone who shares our core values of Integrity, Excellence, Respect and Creativity.

National Programs and Business Services (NPBS) aligns Business professionals to NRC Research Centres and programs, providing business expertise and Intellectual Property (IP) support in a coordinated and responsive manner. This centralized approach allows NRC to prioritize and channel resources in order to grow its diverse business in a strategic and pro-active way.

The Technical Business Analyst (TBA) provides competitive technical and business intelligence analysis services to its internal clients in the NRC Research Centres, advises on technology commercialisation strategies, and evaluates and makes recommendations to support NRC’s intellectual property (IP) strategy. In doing so, the Analyst develops leading edge industry insights that build on the existing business acumen and result in improved understanding of risk and uncertainty in the evaluation of new potential programs/investment opportunities.

The incumbent participates in market analysis, technology forecasting, technology road mapping and business planning activities as requested by NRC Divisional, Research Centres and Program Management and Client Relationship Leaders. The incumbent supports NRC’s leaders in identifying and making effective decisions on the key marketing challenges, improving their competitive intelligence, developing future programs and strategies, and responding to market situations for the business through the development and application of insightful and objective competitive and business analysis.

English

Solid knowledge of current and emerging technologies, market awareness and key stakeholders in providing client support.

Relocation
Relocation assistance will be determined in accordance with the NRC's directives.
Salary Range
This position is classified as a Research Council Officer (RCO), a group that is unique to the NRC. The RCO group uses a person-based classification system instead of the more common duties-based classification system. Candidates are remunerated based on their expertise, skill, outcomes and impacts of their previous work experience. The salary scale for this group is vast, from $52,854 to $149,416 per annum, which permits for employees of all levels from new graduates to world renowned experts to be fairly compensated for their contributions.

IPG Mediabrands was created by Interpublic Group in 2007 to manage all of its global media related assets. Today that means we manage and invest $38 billion in global media on the behalf of our clients, employ over 8,500 diverse and daring marketing communication specialists worldwide and operate our company businesses in more than 130 countries.
Are you a go getter? Do you want to work in a fast-paced modern environment? Are your SQL skills better than all your friends? Are you passionate about data, efficiency and Business Intelligence? Do you love Application Development? Are you a creative out-of-the-box thinker?
If so, IPG Mediabrands has the perfect opportunity to get your career to the next level!
Working in a growing team, the Data Warehouse Engineer is responsible for managing the data load processes for our Data & Technology Solutions team.
You will predominately be working with a variety of data sources, including APIs, relational databases and flat files and will be responsible for extracting & loading them into a Data Warehouse using SSIS & Python scripting for the team of Data Analysts & Report Writers to then visualize in BI Reports & Dashboards for IPG Mediabrands Agency clients (internal and external).
This role will involve maintaining current SSIS packages and API pulls for various sources (including Facebook & Google) and then working to extract new metrics from other new sources as and when they are identified.
You will participate in all aspects of the report creation process, from the initial requirements gathering meetings with internal teams to learning how to gather the data from various external sources, to modelling this data for efficient reporting. Then by using the SDLC, follow through on these steps in designing & creating the necessary database objects before the design & development of the extract, transform and load process to populate them.
Responsibilities:
Managing Data Load processes from multiple data sources using Python API calls and MS SSIS ETL packages. This will include maintaining a scheduled load process & upkeep of existing packages as well as new ones that you will design & develop.
Designing & development of customized load packages from existing and new data sources based on client requirements.
Make recommendations for improvements to management & senior management on improvements for existing API Calls or Extract pulls.
Assist Data Analysts in Ad-Hoc BI report requests including identifying necessary data sources, fields and metrics needed before writing queries to obtain the report output where necessary.
Debug existing application software and create patches and hot fixes when necessary.
Work closely with team during QA to facilitate quick diagnosis & resolutions for the identified defects
Documentation of all processes & code including upkeep and maintenance of software design documentation and traceability matrixes in accordance with organizational standards
Mentor other team members with an aptitude for learning on how to work with API’s.
Participation in DBA tasks on MS SQL Server data warehouse (shared with rest of team).
Immediately integrate & work closely with established team.
Required Skills
Extremely Strong SQL and PL/SQL skills with ability to work independently with stored procedures, functions, views & materialized views to write complex queries against large datasets.
Fluent in Python scripting & C#, jQuery and .Net Web Forms (Nice to have).
3+ years of experience working with MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) including demonstrated knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices & procedures with the tool. Experience of cube building with MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) (Nice to have).
Demonstrated experience of various RDBMs reporting databases (MS SQL Server & MySQL) including knowledge of data modeling for reporting data warehouses such as star schema, snowflake schema designs.
5+ years of experience working in application development including demonstrated understanding of full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Demonstrated logical thought process through appropriate & inquisitive questioning.
Good understanding of IT operations including standards, protocols, methods & processes, ticketing systems, configurations.
Basic knowledge of Database Administration tasks & processes.
Proficient user of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Extremely keen sense of attention to detail, excellent listening and communication skills (verbal and written).
Eagerness to learn new tools, technologies, concepts as well as knowledge sharing within the team on your own experience.
Post-secondary education in computer sciences, engineering, social sciences or related fields.
Experience working in a related field or media planning related experience would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.
Experience with Dashboards and Data Visualization Software (Tableau or Domo) would be a great asset & will be beneficial in your application, but is not required.

What we need.

Inbox Marketer offers value by telling our clients’ customer stories. We need a highly skilled and passionate Data Analyst to dive into the data in order to bring that story to life.

 You’re someone who can perform statistical analysis, score data, model data, cluster data and create test plans for data. You have a general understanding of the role of digital marketing and how our campaigns serve to achieve overarching business and marketing KPIs.

 Our clients are EVERYWHERE!

Our clients are some of the biggest brands in Canada and the US and are within nearly every industry: telecommunications, energy, retail, grocery, financial, not-for-profit, sports, and entertainment. Each company comes with its own challenges, and we’re up to solving them. That’s why we’re looking for bright minds just like you!

Data Analyst


Reports To:

Manager, Data Governance & Data Analytics


Tier:

Staff

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto

Contract, (12 Months)


Job Number:

 1435



Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.
Watch our video: GS1 Canada Overview (https://youtu.be/3__lBt8SLvw)

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role
The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Manager of Data Governance & Analysis to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Manager to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers, but tells a story about the data being evaluated.
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
Exposure in coding SQL and/or VBA is desired
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

Toronto, ONTemporary, InternshipAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.

The Role
We are looking to bring aboard a high energy intern to join our Toronto office. We are open to considering a student entering their last year of study or a new grad as there is a possibility the opportunity may evolve into a permanent position. The opportunity represents a paid work-term beginning May 6th and concluding at August end.

This person would be given the opportunity to contribute in several areas across our business and teams. They will gain broad exposure to what we do and work alongside some of the best minds in the industry. A steep learning curve is anticipated.

Possible initial areas for contribution include:

Provide support on energy & water benchmarking, building certification (LEED & BOMA), and emissions/utility reporting projects.
Continuously work with utility providers to maintain accurate billing and consumption data.
Load data from multiple sources into our system; manage data flow and address issues.
File management responsibilities including downloading data and scanning documents.
Be directly involved in other miscellaneous office & operations tasks.

About You


We seek an intelligent and dynamic individual with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles.
Nominally, we seek a 3rd year student or spring 2019 grad (university or college). We are open to students or a new grad from environment & applied sciences, sustainability, data analytics, business admin, and engineering programs.
Passion for data (analysis & management) and intermediate proficiency in Excel are required; experience with SQL is a bonus.
It is important that the applicant can communicate succinctly and clearly (verbally and in writing).

job_title: Business Analyst Intern, Strategy & Corporate Development
job_description:
Mississauga, ONWhat we’re about


IMAX Corporation is one of the world's leading entertainment technology companies, specializing in immersive motion picture technologies. The worldwide IMAX® theatre network is among the most important and successful theatrical distribution platforms for major event Hollywood films around the globe, with IMAX theatres delivering the world's best cinematic presentations using proprietary IMAX, IMAX® 3D, and IMAX DMR® technology. The IMAX® brand is world famous and stands for the highest-quality, most immersive motion picture entertainment. As the IMAX theatre network grows, so does the visibility of the IMAX brand – a name that is unique in the entertainment business.
IMAX Corporation hires individuals with diverse talents and backgrounds who are creative, entrepreneurial, innovative and passionate. We offer a challenging work environment operating in a global context, a competitive compensation and opportunities for development and growth. By welcoming diversity and respecting the value of work and lifestyle balance, IMAX has earned a reputation as a preferred employer.
Required Skills
What you’ll be doing:


This Analyst will serve as a key member of the Strategy & Corporate Development team, supporting the group VPs in identifying, evaluating and executing high impact strategic growth initiatives. The individual will support cross-functional work streams aimed at aggressively growing IMAX core business while simultaneously working to grow the brand outside of the cinema


Provide project management support for various team initiatives, developing and monitoring cross-functional work plans, project timelines, data/resource requirements, and specific steps/benchmarks.
Create highly polished power point presentations to support internal and external team presentations
Conduct due diligence of externally sourced business opportunities including: business partnerships, technology acquisition and M&A.
Conduct market research, including market sizing, competitive benchmarking, and consumer research
Interface with other groups within IMAX and externally to collect and synthesize data
Perform detailed analyses to help filter, assess, and implement strategic opportunities
Support multiple work streams associated with strategic projects and ensure clear communication with all key stakeholders
Develop business cases in support of the corporate development opportunities being pursued

Calgary Recreation’s Golf and Sport Development (GSD) division provides affordable, quality golf services and city-wide sport opportunities to citizens. Reporting to the Lead of Sport and Business Development, the Business analyst will support division strategy and policy development while also contributing to enhanced service delivery and business performance. Utilizing strong analytical skills with a clear understanding of operations, practices, research and strategies the Business Analyst will work as part of team to identify areas of improvement and implement creative solutions to achieve business goals. The successful candidate will be results oriented possessing highly developed reasoning skills along with a keen sense of financial and social return on investment and an aptitude to identify and execute innovative ideas. Primary duties include:
Responsible for pricing strategies as well as developing, implementing and leading projects that optimize revenue, increase site utilization and broaden the market for GSD services.
Identify opportunities, options and recommendations for the GSD leadership team based on engaging staff and outcomes of detailed data analysis. The incumbent will also provide input supporting strategy and policy development as well as workflow and service delivery improvements.
Evaluate the feasibility of potential opportunities (products and services) by assessing revenue and expense implications, defining operational impacts and articulating social benefits.
Identify, prioritize, plan and monitor GSD data collection and research needs while assuring coordinated approaches and alignment with corporate initiatives. Recommend appropriate frameworks, tools and approaches enabling the division to respond to customer needs and a changing environment.
Responsible for the creating and disseminating strategic insights, reports and presentation materials to assist in decision making and used to effectively communicate information to a broad range of audiences.

Advanced experience using Microsoft Office Suite for data analysis, presentation and documentation.
Access to personal vehicle for occasional business use.

SVB is currently growing into Canada to better service the booming Canadian tech and life sciences industries.

As the market leader in providing financial services to the world’s most creative tech and life science companies and investors, SVB has exposure to vast amounts of data covering the breadth of the startup and VC landscape. While data has been integral to SVB’s growth over the past 30+ years, we’re placing an even greater emphasis on being a data-driven organization by establishing the Analytics & Sales Operations team to support all sales focused aspects of our banking practice.

JOB SUMMARY
The role of Specialist, Business Systems Integration covers Shop Floor inventory/production bar-code labelling, scanning using Eagle RF Express in conjunction with QAD EE (and MFG/Pro), and oversees a QCE (QAD Cloud EDI) communications subsystem for all EDI traffic and trading partners. As a Tier-1 Automotive Supplier, AGS requires robust and stable data transactional systems connecting the Plant manufacturing locations with a central, Corporate-managed Cloud-based QAD EE 2017 ERP system. Support of the Eagle labelling, scanning, and transactional subsystem requires some on-the-ground shop floor work for requirements gathering, solutions assessment, project planning and deployment, plus on-going support. Oversight of the EDI transactional subsystems requires coordination and planning of new requirements, such as Trading Partner set-up and configuration, knowledge of basic EDI transaction types and standards, management of the selected Cloud-based EDI vendor, and Plant operational support.
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Shop Floor Data Systems (Eagle RF Express)
Research, understand, plan, document, and implement barcode label standards as per AiAG, GM, FCA, and other customers
Manage and maintain WIP and FG barcode (2D, 3D) formats and data content in conjunction with QAD EE (and MFG/Pro) ERP environments
Interact with all AGS (and Tiercon) Plants to understand Plant operations, assess and prioritize shop-floor labelling and scanning opportunities, plan and coordinate projects, and actively deploy and support solutions, working with Plant Materials/Quality/Production staff and Corporate ERP and IT staff
Safe Operations on the shop floor of automotive manufacturing Plant environments (i.e.; awareness of and compliance with Plant Safety rules and PPE requirements)
EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)
Facilitate and coordinate general EDI requirements and support between AGS (and Tiercon) manufacturing Plants and QAD Cloud EDI hosting team
Understand basic and intermediate EDI data transactions, with the ability to lead problem determination, coordinate new or changed data map requirements, monitor data flow/transactions, and integration with QAD EE (and QAD MFG/Pro).
Provide level-2/3 support between Plant manufacturing teams and liaison with other IT and/or external EDI services provider
Monitor GM, FCA and other customer and supplier EDI standards and requirements
EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS
Strong working knowledge of Eagle RF Express and/or other shop floor labelling systems
Experience using and knowledge of ERP & MRP systems, with a very strong preference for QAD.
5 years+ manufacturing shop-floor support experience

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

InvestorCOM is a leader in providing financial technology and outsourcing services to Canada’s largest banks, asset managers, insurance companies and investment dealers. InvestorCOM has locations in Toronto and Brantford, Canada and serves over 50 enterprise clients.

About the Role

Reporting to the Supervisor, CCM Business Operations, the Data & Project Analyst is responsible for managing client data projects with a specialty in InvestorCOM publishing projects through the data onboarding, document composition and filing stages leveraging InvestorCOM's automated publishing solution, while also interacting and supporting our clients directly as required.

The Location

The role is based in our Brantford Office, with some travel to our Toronto, Ontario office as required.

Responsibilities

The Data & Project Analyst is accountable for:

Preparation of digital versions of clients’ regulatory financial documents.
Acceptance and loading of client mailing data into systems for use in the CCM and CDM client projects
Problem solving of data and composition issues in client provided source files for the Publisher platform.
Onboarding new clients: thoroughly analyzing client data, finding and understanding business rules for data processing, document layout and creation of new documents in the Publisher platform.
Executing the established programming to manipulate client provided data and upload it to the Publisher database.
Proof document content against client provided source material.
Organization of large quantities of client spreadsheets in folders, following strict rules for folder structure and file naming conventions
Troubleshooting of final documents to determine most accurate and efficient method to correct missing data or visual anomalies with the documents
Communication with Project Coordinator who is responsible to ensuring all client activities are completed within the agreed upon, regulatory timeline
Participate in client meetings, as required
Respond quickly and precisely to issues with spreadsheet content or format to enable successful import into the Publisher system.
Working with the Publisher platform to update documents and assist clients with required updates on the self-serve platform
Document Publisher processes, update Publisher product manuals, training materials and other client support materials.
Education

University degree or equivalent (completed or in progress) a major asset.
Finance, accounting or financial industry‐specific education an asset.
Experience

Experience using complex Excel spreadsheets in the above situations, with knowledge of running and editing/maintaining complex formulas.
Experience in financial services, particularly the investment industry, is an asset.
Accounting or other finance experience valuable.
The successful candidate will have strong self‐starter and self‐management skills and attributes that will enable them to succeed in a hands‐off, results‐driven environment.

Extremely keen on investigative troubleshooting of data related issues with a strong desire to determine the solution and/or gain efficiencies in processes.
Excellent Excel skills and strong all-round Windows and Office skills.
Strong organizational skills.

Strong teamwork ethic AND individual work ethic
Excel in a fast-paced cyclical environments, using off cycle times for process documentation and improvement

As part of the hiring process at Doxim, job candidates MUST complete The Predictive Index® Behavioral and Cognitive Assessments. Please set aside 5-10 minutes for the Behavioural Assessment completion, although you have unlimited time to complete the assessment once it is started. The Predictive Index Behavioral Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures work and communication needs. Please use the link provided to take the assessment.

https://assess.predictiveindex.com/zPE96

Once you have completed the Predictive Index Behavioural Assessment you will be sent an email containing a link to complete The Predictive Index® Cognitive Assessment. The Cognitive Assessment is a timed assessment that includes Verbal, Numerical and Abstract Reasoning questions. Respondents are instructed to answer as many questions as possible in the allotted 12 minutes. The score of the PI Cognitive Assessment is a scaled score based on the number of correct responses and is a measure of general cognitive ability, or the ability to quickly learn and grasp new information. Please set aside 12 uninterrupted minutes for completion and complete within 48 hours. The Predictive Index Cognitive Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures a person’s capacity to learn, adapt and grasp new concepts.

Doxim company encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

job_title: Business Analyst - MBovis - Hamilton or Christchurch
job_description:
Hamilton, ONContractThe opportunity:

We are seeking a Business Analyst for a two year fixed-term role to assist with the eradication of the cattle disease Mycoplasma bovis. You will be working as part of a diverse team seeking to eradicate Mycoplasma bovis from the dairy and beef industries across New Zealand. The role has an operational focus and will assist in developing our operational data and information sets for management.

AsureQuality has been contracted by the Ministry for Primary Industries to implement all operational tasks associated with eradicating the disease. A new business unit has been established and operations are implemented via four regional offices. We are now seeking someone to ensure that service delivery targets are being met across all regions, and that the appropriate resources are in place. Working with the Operations, Technical and Compliance Managers, you will be developing reporting systems for the field operations, sizing up specification changes, providing monthly reports and assisting with resource supply and demand modelling. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team and assist with the analyzing and implementation of systems and processes that will ensure a streamlined operation for the wider business unit.

About you:

Ideally you will have a Tertiary qualification in commerce or senior management, with proven managerial experience. You will be knowledgeable in people management and employee relations also. You will have experience in scenario planning or workload assessment and be proficient in data analysis. Previous experience with Primary Industries and an understanding of the dairy or beef industries would give you a distinct advantage. You will be able to think outside the box, challenge ideas and be able to work independently and also as part of a team.

About us:

AsureQuality provides biosecurity surveillance and response services to help protect New Zealand against exotic pests and disease incursions. We have a long history of working with MPI, successfully managing, developing and delivering capability and responding to incursions.

Join us today!

Citi’s Trade & Treasury Solutions (TTS) is a leading provider of Cash Management, Treasury and Trade Solutions. With a global network spanning more than 100 countries, TTS has a global platform that is unique in the industry for its reach and flexibility. We provide clients with timely, accurate information and dynamic, web-based tools to effectively manage their financial positions, working capital, payment capabilities and view of their financial supply chain.
We are seeking a senior Business Analyst who will be responsible for build out enterprise and conformed logical models on Citi's Big Data and GIW platform that houses our TTS products.
The ideal candidate should be:
Technically astute, well organized, proactive and be comfortable discussing issues with business and technical users at all levels
He/she requires exceptional communication skills across both technology and the business and will have a high degree of visibility.
The candidate will be dependable and resourceful software professional who can comfortably work in a large development team in a globally distributed, dynamic work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration. The ability to work in high-pressured environment is essential.
Key Responsibilities:
Overall responsibilities include creating conformance models on the Vanguard platform across various TTS products.
Should be able to understand the functional flows, complex calculation logic and data flow across various systems and products within TTS Data & Analytics platform
Review, analyze, and interpret Business Requirements Documents (BRD) and providing feedback on key functionalities and technical feasibility
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications , data dictionaries to clearly articulate requirements and mapping of data elements to UI elements.

Being the interface between the Product stakeholders and technical team and should be able to bridge any gap related to requirements

Responsible for key process improvements in business analysis space

Reverse engineer the business model for the Cash management products on existing applications.

Develop prototypes and Business Use Case Scenarios to facilitate the gathering and documentation of requirements

Work with cross functional teams across multiple countries and time zones
Follow the SDLC process established in the organization and create and maintain all relevant requirements artifacts

Qualifications

Required Skills and experience
At least 7+ years overall IT experience within Financial industries with 4+ years’ experience as business analysts or data scientist in large data oriented applications / platform is must

Expertise to create and interpret SQL queries and related software (SQL Developer, Toad).
Experience with Oracle, SQL server, Database concepts, ETL processes, reporting tools .

Excellent planning, organization and prioritization skills to meet ever changing demands of delivery stream .

Experience in supporting external clients which includes attending calls, conducting product demos and help triage client issues.

Bachelor’s degree (in Science, Computers, Information Technology or Engineering)

Hi! We're ecobee.

We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. They are connected devices which automate your home while helping you save energy and money. We're headquartered in Toronto, and play on a North American scale. We're growing. In fact, we're growing really fast. And, we're looking for great people to join our hive.

Your Impact:
This is an opportunity for you to understand ecobee's business, influence improvements, and shape the future of data-driven business decision-making and operational efficiency. In this role, you will be working closely with business users from almost all parts of the organization, collaboratively evaluating and prioritizing business problems, defining the data needs, and designing and delivering solutions that will equip stakeholders with timely information in a self-serve model.

Ways you can contribute day one:

Assemble and summarize data to generate sophisticated reports, as well as Tableau visualizations, which represent sales and operational performances of ecobee
Use scripting languages to create and maintain access to data from various sources – such as websites, relational databases, and local files – in order to enhance and simplify stakeholder access to information
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities, with a focus on implementing automated solutions in order to minimize manual ETL treatments of source data
Analyze business data to identify industry trends, opportunities, risks and best practices
Work with business leads and ecobee's management team to inform company strategy and investment

Our Requirements:

You have experience in a data analytics role with a focus on business strategy
You are an expert in Excel and SQL
You take your technical experience one step further, with a proficiency in Python and Tableau
Experience with ETL frameworks and/or statistical modelling software considered an asset
You pride yourself on being detail oriented and analytical
Strong presentation, reporting and communication skills
Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

What we are offering:

An opportunity to grow with a dynamic company, personal and professional growth
Truly meaningful work that affects our planet
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Learning opportunities supported by an education fund for every employee
Community support through our ecobee acts program

Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you.

ecobee is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process
