We are looking for a great AI Data Analyst, to join Wysdom.AI – a fast-growing company providing the world's most advanced AI-based cognitive customer care solutions.
Wysdom is a mature full-stack virtual assistant platform that uses machine intelligence for cognitive customer care management over social, web chat, and voice. We give businesses a powerful new way to connect to customers, answer questions, and transact any time, using natural language.
Wysdom provides the framework, the tools, and a massive AI training data corpus to enterprises needing to quickly implement cognitive care. Our experienced team of AI experts continuously trains the system, ensuring businesses provide the best customer experience in whatever channel their customers choose.
We are growing and expanding our team — please join us as our AI Data Analyst based in our Richmond Hill Headquarters.
What is a Wysdom.AI Data Analyst?
Behind every amazing AI-based solution is a team of really smart people, with a passion for helping our clients deliver an amazing customer experience. Your core role will be to build analytical solutions which showcase performance of the Wysdom.AI solution.
As an AI Data Analyst, you will be responsible to help drive the success of our solution in the field. Part of your work involves building deep understanding of the AI training process, knowing what drives success, and partnering with clients to enhance their deployments.
Our clients are some of the top brands in the world. You will get a chance to be a part of how these companies are transforming their customer care operations into world-class digital experiences.
But what will I actually be doing?
The day-to-day role will involve writing queries, buildings dashboards, and developing analytical reports about product performance for our clients and executive team. You will work with SQL, Tableau and Python (among other tools) to create stunning visuals showing how Wysdom is driving impact for clients and helping them making their customers' experience even better. You may also present your work to clients and executives. There will also be opportunities to improve our AI processes and drive real change in our product through developing tools and processes to streamline AI training.
Typical day-to-day responsibilities may include:
Build efficient dashboards and reports for clients and our executive
Deploy, maintain and troubleshoot Tableau Server instances for our clients
Develop prototypes of our next-generation insights products
Create, review and edit our insights products to ensure clients can easily understand Wysdom.AI's impact on their business
Continually improve our insights products through performance improvements, new metrics and visualizations
Building and presenting dashboards for client demos
Beyond these day-to-day responsibilities, your sense of curiosity and analytical mindset will challenge you to dig deeper into the ways in which we can continually improve our solution, our success rate and the customer experience.
About You
University degree is a technical or mathematical discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering)
3 or more years of experience with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server is strongly preferred, but experience with another data visualization tool is also acceptable (e.g. Mode, Qlik, PowerBI)
Strong SQL skills
Above-average Excel / Sheets skills
“All hands-on deck” mentality
Passion for delivering amazing results
Attention to detail
About Wysdom.AI
Wysdom.AI is a VC-funded start-up, and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices, full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what it's like to work at Wysdom (https://wysdom.ai/careers/).

Toronto, ONAbout EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use. We have built our reputation on doing things really well.

We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints, and quantifying energy consumption and costs.

About the Role
Recent and projected growth has led us to search for an Energy Data Analyst to join our Toronto office. Your smarts, passion and expertise will be applied to preparing building and portfolio level energy forecasts & budgets, and emissions reports for large commercial property owners. You will join us at a time where we are experiencing unprecedented company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:


Create and/or verify annual energy consumption and cost models/forecasts for large commercial buildings, factoring in historical usage, projected utility rates, and weather patterns.
Perform utility rate research and compile utility rate assumptions across Canadian and US energy markets.
Monitor and maintain utility consumption models that directly impact forecast/budget activities.
Identify ways to optimize data acquisition, modelling and analysis processes and tools.
Assist in preparing GHG emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.

About You
You are smart and act with purpose. You feel successful and accomplished when you solve complex problems associated with data acquisition, modelling and analysis. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles.

You are consistent and cautious in your review and analysis of data sets, models and reports. You are skilled in your ability to hone in on and resolve data anomalies, discrepancies and variances. You have a keen eye for finding ways optimize and improve data analysis process and tools.

Nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, applied sciences, business/sustainability or another technical field (or equivalent experience).

You offer valuable knowledge and experience in energy forecasting, budgeting/cost allocations and/or emissions reporting. Practical experience and intermediate proficiency in SQL and Excel are expected.

You are organized and able to prioritize and manage several client requirements under set timelines. You can easily adapt and respond to impromptu requests from clients and peers.

It is important that you can communicate clearly and efficiently (verbally and in written form).

What to expect
The success of our people drives the success of our company. We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their careers with our firm.

EPL team members also receive:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (truly own your time)
Insured Benefits and Health Spending Account
Paid monthly transit pass

Join our community of super-smart and nice people, who are doing good and valuable things!

Summary

As a member of CBRE’s National Research team, the primary role of this position is to design, develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analysis tools and other strategies in support of the firm’s commercial real estate market database. Working with the Research team and other departments, the candidate will produce marketable products using CBRE's proprietary data.

Key Responsibilities

Participates in the design, development, testing, maintenance and implementation of databases.
Develops tools and drives efforts to better support research and insights capabilities.
Working with management to prioritize business and information needs and seeks out and presents new opportunities for producing marketable data content.
Provides quality assurance of data sets and implementation of data quality controls.
Collaborates with the various service lines within CBRE including Valuation and Advisory Services, Leasing and Investment Brokerage, Finance, and Digital & Tech.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree, preferably with emphasis in Computer Science or related field.
Data project experience with creation, development, and/or delivery of final products.

Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Access, including VBA and Python programming.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, concise terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of best practices for data governance.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Team Player. Ability to cross-collaborate with various departments and team members.

Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles.

Job Summary
Positions within this family ensure data is properly managed and leveraged from Source to Storage to Delivery in the most efficient and effective way to benefit the organization. This position is an Entry level role into Data Management field. This position performs accountabilities under general supervision and supervisor provides guidance and examples on how to perform a task but expects the employee to use the new knowledge to independently perform the task. General supervision: the employee is told what to do but not how to do it. The how to is left up to the employee. These jobs have some discretion on work accountabilities.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Applies data derivations, rules; and data requirements that align with standards and regulatory compliance. Participates in the data governance and metadata processes by preparing artifacts for review and submission (i.e. researching, preparing simple submissions, and data quality metrics). Actively implements Data Management standards and best practices. Acts as data management representative on projects to review data requirements against data standards. Monitors, identifies, investigates, prioritizes, remediates and communicates data quality issues. Performs data profiling, analyzes and communicates results in support of data quality processes. Implements processes to certify data quality for business intelligence purposes. Applies data and data quality definitions and standards, and transformation rules, in daily work. Demonstrates understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules and participates in the creation of data models (e.g. entity design and population). Builds on existing knowledge to learn line of business specific end to end data flow and lineage from capture at source, to storage, to delivery and its business intent at each stage (i.e. capture, transformation, fragmentation and editing). Performs assigned functions to meet goals and objectives of the unit. Data Analysis: For assigned tasks, develop and maintains business data requirements to support data standards, ensuring that solutions (structure, values, relationships, quality standards) meet operational and business needs. Analyzes customer requests (internal or external regulatory, e.g. data calls) for changes/new business data requirements to production system, determines impact on existing systems processes and develops appropriate specifications, enhancements, system table updates and/or procedures to comply. Meet with customer to elicit requirements and conduct fact gathering sessions. Independently conduct root cause analysis; identify data trends, propose and implement approved specification changes to address issue, working with impacted areas. Perform testing and validation of business data requirements, including creation of test strategy and test plans. Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent education required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business preferred. 1+ yrs. general business experience, Data Management experienced preferred. Insurance knowledge preferred. Understands concepts and applications of business information models. Demonstrates understanding of relationship between data and business rules and functions (i.e. data analysis concepts). Proficient with tools and software to extract and analyze data in the data management function.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Solid knowledge of data practices and principles for data analysis. Demonstrated solid analytic and diagnostic skills. Demonstrated solid interpersonal skills. Demonstrated solid communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated ability to multi-task. Demonstrated problem solving and diagnostic skills. Seeks opportunities to learn. Solid decision making skills. Intermediate skill/competency level: demonstrates solid knowledge and ability; can apply the competency with minimal or no guidance, in the full range of typical situations. Requires guidance handling novel or more complex situations.

Toronto, ONRequisition ID: 57940
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Overview
In this role you will build and maintain the firm’s Capital Markets RiskWatch (RW) data and feeds for a variety of market risk, credit and counterparty risk and trade floor risk management systems and consumers.
The team is responsible for sourcing financial product data from a 50+ front-office and back-office systems into a centralized data repository, mapping sourced data to risk models and ensuring that pricing/valuations are as expected for downstream risk systems and data consumers.
You are also expected to have a good understanding of risk management and risk pricing models for the majority of the main capital markets products, basic principles of data management, business analysis and a thorough familiarity with SDLC. As part of onboarding new source systems’ data and maintaining current data feeds, the candidate is expected to create/modify risk model and product specifications to ensure correct pricing, perform a variety of data validation and testing to ensure data quality and manage relationships with the source system teams and downstream data consumers.
What we are looking for?
In this role we expect you to;
Use product knowledge and understanding of financial modelling to validate the pricing of a wide range of financial product
Within the context of the project, lead discussions with business partners (market risk, credit counterparty risk, trade floor risk) to better understand the business requirements and to determine potential impacts on the project scope and objectives, and to modify the requirements management plan, if required
Determine the best approach for eliciting, analyzing, validating, and prioritizing requirements to ensure that the necessary information is captured from the relevant stakeholders to address the business needs
Ensure all necessary stakeholders are engaged in communications between the Information Technology (IT) project team and the business to help identify who should be involved in the identification and development of the requirements
Participate in the development of strategic and tactical IT plans to help inform future project work of the direction of the business
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
A Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline and 3+ years of business analysis/risk experience OR a bachelor’s degree and 5+ years business analysis/risk experience
A good understanding of risk valuation models for a wide range of financial products
Solid knowledge of a wide range of financial products including swaps, bonds, FX products, commodity products and equity derivative
Knowledge of RiskWatch or of another risk system a plus
Solid business understanding and knowledge of the use of technology and applications in business
Understand and be familiar with the application of techniques associated with data modeling, process modeling, and user-centred design within the context of the organizational standards
Solid communication skills
Advanced writing and documentation skills
Advanced problem-solving and analytical skills
Advanced understanding of Excel
Knowledge of SQL, Python (or any other scripting language) a plus
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. job_title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
job_description:
Toronto, ONIf you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $25 billion in assets under management. Most recently, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 600 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Job Title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
Department: Finance and Accounting
Reports To: Director, Finance Projects & ICOFR

Purpose of Job

A member of the Finance Projects team, the Junior Business Analyst represents the team on SIT PPlus and other system enhancement projects to ensure accurate, timely and relevant financial accounting and reporting processes. The candidate will work closely with the Accounting and Finance and Business Analysis teams, as well as other departments, to assist with production support, testing, roll out of upgrades & enhancements, and to document system processes.

Main Activities:
1. New Projects (20%)
Assist with status reporting, change control, issue and risk management, quality assurance frameworks, artifact review, sign-off and archiving, regulatory compliance
Document requirements, write test cases and execute testing to ensure delivered solution results match expected outcomes
Track project milestones
Ensure project issues and risks are identified, quantified, managed and tracked

2. System Enhancement Projects (40%):

Conduct interviews to understand business requirements and system capabilities
Document requirements and write test cases to ensure requirements are met
Evaluate current processes and recommend changes for improvement
Develop and execute test plans in order to roll out new enhancements

3. Production Support (20%):

Provide support to the SIT PPlus user base by troubleshooting system issues
Track financial system-related issues (e.g. general ledger, transaction processing, or system reporting)
Determine the root cause of core system issues, i.e. system limitation/configurations, user training, or process & controls
Assist with technical and/or qualitative analyses to diagnose identified issues and develop recommendations to solve them with applicable resources
Analyze data and financial/operational processes to identify, research and provide recommendations
Execute project plans to remediate identified issues

4. Documentation (20%):

Responsible for maintaining up-to-date documentation of processes & functionality as well as end user manuals

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely with Accounting and Finance, Business Analysis and IT teams
Understanding of financial accounting and reporting systems with relevant experience performing system enhancements, upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and system implementations
Good understanding of technology from network, file system, database to software development concepts
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Business Administration
Strong understanding of Accounting & Financial reporting concepts, preferably completed/working towards an accounting designation
Proactive self-starter who is eager to learn and can work independently
Experience in re-structuring processes to enhance efficiency & controls
Proficient user of all MS desktop tools, specifically Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Detail oriented and an analytical mindset
Experience using databases (i.e. SQL) is an asset
Familiarity with banking operations and term deposit & mortgage products will be a definite asset

Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

Toronto, ONJob Description

The Information Technology department at our Home Office in Toronto has an immediate opening for the position of Project Manager / Business Analyst – AudioVisual reporting directly to the Manager, AV and Digital Signage.
The successful candidate will work closely with Business Groups, IT Resources and 3rd party vendors to deliver service and productivity solutions that provide value to our internal and external customers. Specific deliverables include:
Role & Responsibility
The successful candidate will be work within the product roadmap / lifecycle of Location Based Entertainment (LBE) Team Initiatives as well as the Digital Signage portfolio. Working closely with internal business groups, vendors and partners, this individual will provide project management, business analysis, functional expertise and 3rd tier support. More specifically, the deliverables include:
Business Analysis
Understanding “The Business” of the applicable Applications validating business value, requirements and workflow, to ensure that the solution proposed will meet the need and add value. Ensure requirements are thorough.
Document requirements in a concise and clear manner
Develop processes to manage change ensuring that changes in the build and QA cycles are validated and well merited while keeping the critical path in mind
Project Management
Author, own and keep up to date a plan of tasks, timing and people that will ensure success. Ensure key people validate the plan when it undergoes change. Ensure that the remaining effort is clear and up to date.
Contribute to Scrums and Status updates as needed
Own status update meeting with project contributors and stakeholders
Prioritize project deliverables based on business need and dependencies.
Marshal resources appropriately through the project, ensuring they and their managers have ample notice of upcoming tasks and target dates
Keeping resource managers and business stakeholders informed and engaged throughout a project - addressing their concerns and managing their expectation appropriately. A weekly update email should be part of the regular cycle of communication beyond individual meetings.
Keep executive stakeholders informed and committed to championing the work.
Communicate in an effective manner. While E-mail is a useful tool, it is not always the best method of communication. Choose the best method of communication, whether it is e-mail, a quick call followed up by an e-mail, or a meeting.
Roadmap, Client and Portfolio Management
Provide prompt responses to stakeholder questions. Ensure that you don’t lose sight of communications or individual task threads - ensuring that at the very least communication is maintained and items remain on the radar.
Keeping your roadmap up to date with latest asks of the business, re-prioritizing appropriately in line with the strategic objectives of the business and management.
Regular stakeholder and senior stakeholder communications/meetings/touch points to review the roadmap and ensure we are aligned. Ensure we are changing as the business changes.
Address the demand of the business by doing what can be done to move new requests along the process as best as possible while other projects may be the current focus of the team.
Keeping quick wins and smaller initiatives moving - always delivering some progress - while larger projects may be taking their time to complete.
Explain technical details in a manner that non-technical clients and stakeholders can understand.
Functional Role & Solution Delivery
Be a corporate functional expert, understanding how the different roles within the business and outside the business operate the application.
Ensure that documenting is authored and curated for all standard operating practices particular to Cineplex (working with business owners).
Where appropriate understand how the application configuration is maintained and managed.
Develop the skills and knowhow to build out of the box solutions with these technologies, to deliver quick wins to the business & overcome challenges.
Keep up to date with the latest and greatest regarding this technology, by following blogs, forums and user groups and other relevant information sources.
Quality Assurance Management
Authoring and curating a library of functional test scripts for the applications and business processes within your portfolio - ensuring that the scope of the business and functionality of the application is accurately covered.
Ensure that necessary changes to test scripts as result of failures in test cycles are factored back into said test scripts in a timely manner (so as to not lose sight of them)
With each application feature release, author/update test scripts that cover these new features.
Marshalling business stakeholder test signatories through the user acceptance testing cycles, acquiring appropriate sign-off artifacts at the end of this cycle.
Work with the QA Automation Specialist to migrate our current paper based test processes to automated solutions - learning these new test tools and then training users appropriately.
Housekeeping & Managing Up:
Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above.
Escalate appropriately and timely when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.
Support Management
Understand that support is our most important priority that is shared with other support personnel
Prompt response to support threads.
Triaging effectively to determine business impact and sense of urgency around a support case - providing prompt attention to incidents with the highest impact to the business
Effective problem investigation that leads to problem isolation. This involves the acquisition of all evidence available (logs, accurate UX accounts, app data etc.), leveraging technology specialists, lining up the timing of events to present probable narratives, narrowing possibilities based on the evidence and not wasting time on hypothesis with clear evidence to the contrary.
Effective management of support tickets with 3rd party Software Vendors, which involves: accurately documenting the issue within the support management tool of the vendor, including all necessary evidence to help 3rd party team isolate situation, documenting repeatable steps that produce the issue, prompt response to vendor support team queries, facilitation of calls or screen casts to assist in isolating/understanding issue, connect business users when necessary, prompting vendor team appropriately for incident updates to ensure momentum on investigation/solution.
Reducing your support load by appropriate hand off to business owners and support personnel (CMC, Guest Services etc.). Hand off includes: Knowledge Base authoring and curating, communicating and coordinating effectively with support personnel management to ensure the appropriate training.
Periodically reviewing all knowledge base materials within your portfolio to ensure that it is up to date and reflective of any recent changes in the environment.
Keeping up to date on new features and functions of software & services being leveraged in your portfolio.
Periodically touching base with support teams, reviewing KB materials and ensuring that support team are fully armed.
Escalating to support personnel management when support teams have failed to handle a support case appropriately or have handed off too soon to second tier support without leveraging KB materials/training. Reviewing and adjusting process if necessary as a result of consultation with support personnel management.
Always analyzing support incidents types, to isolate improvements to knowledge base, business processes, training or application features (likely all) - and then making these changes a priority to be addressed - drumming up the necessary support from other stakeholders and driving the changes needed to reduce support and empower users.
Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of the Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above.
Escalating appropriately when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.

Qualifications

Skills & Experience
Education
University / College education in a computer related course of study or equivalent experience required.
Professional Accreditation in Project Management would be considered and asset
Experience:
3 – 5 Years of experience in a relevant role
Proven track record of IT Project Management and Business Analysis.
Proven track record in working with internal and external customers while meeting tight timelines
Experience in Restaurant Customer Service
Experience working in a Digital Signage/Customer Engagement environment including a software platform that integrates command and controls along with technology such as LCDs, LEDs, kiosks, considered an asset
Experience in writing User Stories and Documenting User Requirements
Skills:
Must be proactive and possess strong interpersonal, customer service, communication, and organizational skills
Excellent Meeting Management and verbal presentation skills
Excellent judgement and triage skills
A solid overarching understanding of system technology and architecture
Must be self motivated and be able to manage and motivate others

job_title: Business & Predictive Analyst, Integrated Planning Management
job_description:
Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Integrated Planning Management Team supports all forward-looking merchant metrics for CTR. We own the processes, tools and reports used in Merch planning and forecasting. We use data science, analysis and business intuition to transform data into insights that can be actioned. We work closely with Category Business Management, Forecasting, Replenishment, Finance, Cross-Functional and IT teams. We are constantly striving to challenge the way we think, improve the way we operate and drive results.

The Business & Predictive Analyst supports the Merch Planning team to deliver robust and accurate plans and forecasts. You will conduct traditional and machine learning analytics to identify and quantify cause-and-effect relationships, assist in building/optimizing tools that are used by Merch Planning and issue digestible reporting on key business metrics.

What you’ll do

Deliver accurate and timely reporting and analysis to Merchandise Planning to help improve the accuracy and reliability of forecasts, targets and financial plan

Conduct what-if scenario analysis and measure the causal impact of results using predictive/statistical approaches and traditional analysis.

Design & build reporting with visualizations that surface insights effectively and enable actions to be taken efficiently

Ensure the planning and forecasting systems, reports and EUC tools are operational and support the business processes; implement enhancements/new functionality as required.

Manage multiple work requests – these initiatives can range from quick ad-hoc analysis requests, urgent system/tool support issues, or small- to medium-scale process improvements

Ensure the timely and accurate delivery of reporting and tools

Support submission of financial plans, reforecasts, and targets to appropriate teams.

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

1 to 4 years work experience in various roles within merchandising, forecasting, planning, analytics or supply chain.

University degree in business, math, computer science, statistics, engineering or related field

Strong analytical, problem solving, and data mining skills with the ability to summarize and deliver actionable insights or recommendations.

Advanced technical skills in Microsoft Access, Excel, Database systems. Programming with VBA and SQL would be an asset.

Experience using statistical modeling tools with exposure to predictive/machine learning models.

Proficiency with coding and analysis using R, Python, or KNIME

Business mindset with an understanding of the retail industry.

Effective written and verbal communication skills, including presentation abilities.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on

LinkedIn

.

Responsibilities:
Works with internal business users and assigned project resources collecting and analyzing business requirements for project implementations, ongoing maintenance and system enhancements.

Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a business analyst preferably in a technically-oriented environment and worked on technical assignments and/or projects
Experience in absence or disability management, group insurance, HR/payroll systems is an asset.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience in project management is an asset.
Solid understanding of The Software Development Life Cycle.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience with various analysis and techniques to write detailed specifications and requirements for software development.
Experience with and uses various visual modelling techniques that is appropriate for the type and scope of the assignment.

Lead and collaborate with business Subject Matter Experts (SME), business resources, Project Managers, other Business Analysts, and developers to ensure that solutions are thoroughly though through and issues and risks are identified and resolved.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving and creative-thinking skills.

Reliable, consistent, flexible and adaptable.

The ideal candidate
You’re a patient listener. You understand very technical subjects, but can easily explain them in non-technical language. You’re not necessarily a developer, but you understand application development concepts and can easily engage in a technical discussion. You’re a problem-solver and capable of proposing options to support business decision making. You also have an interest to understand the industry and business processes of the department. You focus on understanding what the user really needs and design solutions that add value, are feasible and can be implemented within budget.

A typical day
You’ll meet with business stakeholders, developers and system architects to gather the information you need to create wireframes, process models and detailed functional specifications. You’ll investigate and research both new business issues and requests for changes to our systems depending on the nature of the request. Throughout the software lifecycle, you will support developers, IT QA specialists and business UAT resources to clarify requirements. Occasionally you’ll do the testing, too. As a change is rolled out, you’ll help your business stakeholders understand how it works and how to use it. At times may be required to work overtime, weekends and evenings to accelerate requirement timelines and support testing during system deployments.

Reporting to the Manager, Career Support and Lead, Accessibility Technology, the Coordinator, Data Analyst and Participant Engagement will support the data management needs for various Programs in the GTA region and connect with participants to conduct surveys and collect service quality information. Wesgroup Equipment has been named one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, one of BC’s Top Employers and one of Canada's Top Small and Medium Employers for 2018! We are a great place to work where individual effort is recognized.
We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. You will work closely with the executive team on a number of ongoing projects that will move our business forward. The Analyst will be responsible for capturing the right data and then analyzing it along with costs, comparing this to budgets, finding trends then forecasting and planning for improved results in various areas of our business. Monitor risk throughout projects, identifying risk mitigation strategies

Self motivated.

2 to 4 years experience in a junior business analyst role

The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Director for Business and Risk Management in Treasury and Payments Solutions (TaPS), the Business Analyst will assist the TaPS leadership team through data, processes and communications to best accomplish improvements for the business. This position is accountable for the regular production and analysis of a growing suite of reports for various audiences in TaPS. The Business Analyst role will also conduct analysis on current TaPS processes and products and make recommendations on improvements to the TaPS leadership.

Focus on winning in the market by supporting the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS to deliver the strategic business priorities of enhancing client loyalty, increasing product penetration, and maximizing revenue growth & profitability for ATB.
Support Development & Integration of Business Process Management
Maintain and build industry expertise, leveraging superior networks and insights to deliver world class customer experiences and elevate the TaPS business.
Together with the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS, create and manager overall TaPS risk profiles to address all operational, transactional, regulatory and compliance, financial and liquidity, AML and sanction, and cybercrime risks

University degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Math, or other quantitative or technical discipline is required

In-depth to expert knowledge of Cash Management, Treasury Management, Payments, Investments, and Financial Systems.
In-depth understanding of the payments product/ service offerings and how they provide customer solutions alone or combined
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Highly developed analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills (ability to devise creative, workable solutions within established policies, or provide analysis and recommendations for policy changes)
Ability to network & cultivate productive working relationships at various levels within ATB
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to interact effectively with Business Unit Management, Lines of Business, as well as external vendors

Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

Who we are – TAI
Tindall Associates, Inc., known as TAI (pronounced as T.A.I.), was founded in the mid-1970s and later incorporated as a privately held 'C' Corporation. The initial business was general insurance consulting.
Today, TAI is the market leader in life reinsurance systems in North America with clients in the United States, Bermuda, the Caribbean and Hong Kong. TAI is focused on simplifying life reinsurance administration through software and services. TAI software automates reinsurance administration for life insurance companies and TAI services identifies and solves areas of reinsurance risk that are impacting the bottom line.
Reinsurance is global business, and TAI's base system is flexible and can be customized to meet the needs of these new markets. TAI offers a complete software solution for the life companies to self-report all their reinsurance information; assumed, ceded or retroceded in an electronic format to share with their partners on a cost-effective basis.
TAI was previously a subsidiary company of LOGiQ³. In early 2018, LOGiQ³ was acquired by RGAX, making TAI a portfolio company of RGAX. RGAX is the transformation engine and a wholly owned subsidiary of Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA). A Fortune 500 company, RGA is among the leading global providers of life reinsurance and financial solutions.
Position
TAI is seeking a talented Business Analyst responsible for providing insurance/reinsurance business analysis for a varying portfolio of TAI Life Reinsurance product development, product installation and consulting projects.
 This individual will report to the Senior Business Analyst, and will be responsible for supporting life and health reinsurance clients across all functions of their reinsurance administration process (Administration, Operations, Technical Accounting, Claims, Billing, and Reporting). The individual will be responsible for developing and maintaining client relationships, project and account management, and working with internal technical staff to implement life reinsurance solutions and services to TAI clients. The individual will also play an important role in the implementation of client projects, ranging from software implementations, upgrade projects, and custom modifications to align the TAI Life and Health Reinsurance system with the ceded reinsurance business processes for domestic and international clients. Under limited supervision (working individually or as part of a project team), the individual will perform complex research and analysis to support business operations, and develop recommendations to address problems/issues for their key client projects.
This position can be occupied from our main Office in Toronto, Ontario but we are also open to candidate to work remotely.
Responsibilities
Lead and participate in the implementation of client projects.
Collect, document, and analyze business requirements from key client accounts.
Publish project reports and collaborate on a weekly and monthly basis with key client accounts and management.
Provide training in the use of the TAI system, general reinsurance administration, and the process flow of using the TAI system for reinsurance administration within a clients' process environment.
Phone support for TAI clients in support of the system to determine training opportunities, TAI upgrade opportunities and/or TAI defects.
Create and conduct test plans for new release/installations in conjunction with QA Manager.
Conduct complex tasks and activities within TAI and/or externally to obtain information such as life reinsurance policy data, cession data, managing the implementation of insurance products and/or business process workflows into the TAI Life Reinsurance system. May work with other departments, conduct interviews, lead workshops, or conduct primary or secondary research to gather client data if information is not readily available.
Analyze and develop reports, proposals for action or implementation plans as necessary and presents to management. Presentations may be formal or informal depending on the nature of projects. Communicates with other departments.
Work within TAI to coordinate interdepartmental activities in order to ensure that TAI meets customer expectations. Proactively anticipates and resolves problems to ensure that customers receive prompt, efficient service.
Work internally and externally across multiple functional areas including, Product Management, Project Management, Actuarial, Finance, Underwriting, Claims, and IT.
Requirements
2+ years of experience in life and health reinsurance, policy administration, or related experience.
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills: able to clearly link results to operational performance drivers; able to generate alternatives and drive positive change.
Keen attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to clearly communicate information in a manner that is easy to understand.
Highly motivated and able to function in the absence of complete information. Ability to work independently and work across functional areas during projects.
Ability to work with management and key stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree (Finance preferred)
Skills and Certifications: FLMI, ARA, or industry related (asset).
Experience writing and managing business specifications, technical specifications, project plans, and other project documentation.
Advanced proficiency with Excel, working knowledge of SQL, database software, and Access.
Key Factors for Success
Willingness to travel up to 15% domestically, for up to two weeks at a time on rare occasions.
Ability and drive to deliver on time, while working in a semi-autonomous environment.
Ability to create and communicate an accurate schedule.
Willingness to learn to work with the tools and solutions selected by the team.
Insatiable curiosity to understand and improve the state of art.
Ability to work effectively and build relationships with all levels of personnel, customers, suppliers, consultants - both internally and externally.
Exceptional communication skills, with an ability to present and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and provides understanding of project related information to a diverse audience (engineers to executives)
 Physical Requirements
This role operates in a professional office environment
Dexterity to operate a laptop computer, cell phone, office equipment and other equipment as needed
Ability to remain in a sitting position for extended periods of time
Project work will require travel which may include domestic or international locations by means of air, train, and/or auto
Ability to travel to / from client location(s) with a laptop computer, work material and luggage.

RGAX is the "transformation engine" of RGA that leverages the talent, resources, and insight of RGA's 40+ years of innovation. By partnering with carriers and entrepreneurs, RGAX incubates and accelerates new products and services to change the life insurance ecosystem.

HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment.

What This Position Is All About:
The Business Systems Analyst engages Business Stakeholders & IT to plan, elicit, analyze, document and validate system requirements that meet business needs. The Business Systems Analyst leverages an analytical approach and their technical skills to understand business problems/requirements, as well as the capabilities of the technology, and proposes a recommended solution for new project or for enhancements to the existing applications.

Who You Are:
You’re able to speak comfortably and with credibility in both business and technical languages.
You have exceptional analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills.
You painlessly overcome obstacles while respecting others’ points of view and positions
You are able to work independently, and can prioritize and meet tight deadlines.
You have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business and technical challenges.

You Also Have:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Process Engineering or related field.
Previous experience with Retail systems such as Finance and HR.
Previous experience or understanding of Oracle applications and modules.
Previous experience with Oracle Cloud.
An understanding of and possible work experience in development and programming.
Proven record of accomplishments in major enterprise level projects.

As The Business Systems Analyst, You Will:
Collect and document business requirements and act as the liaison between the business and the appropriate technical / development teams during requirement gathering and finalization. Analyze business and user needs; gather business requirements, using a structured process, and document functional requirements.
Work with developers to define system scope and objectives based on both user needs and good understanding of applicable business systems and industry standards.
Develop strong working relationship with the business and establish yourself as their go-to person; independently and through interaction with stakeholders, identify areas of opportunity and propose improvements.
Perform application system analysis, prepare data/process flow diagrams and design screen/report layouts as part of business systems solution/application design.
Creates and maintains applicable documentation pertaining to specific SDLC phases.
Assists in creation of QA and UAT test scenarios and test cases.
Supports QA and Business teams during QA and UAT testing as well as assists in resolution of any applicable defects discovered during QA and UAT.
May perform UAT in proxy for the business when required.

Your Life and Career at HBC:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance.
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount.

Vancouver, BCRequisition ID: 13095

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Business Process Analyst (BPA) provides senior management with objective and comprehensive business and process analysis of the City’s processes, systems, and resourcing. The BPA provides recommendations based on comprehensive analysis performed with a view to continuously improve business operations using Lean Six Sigma principles; and help sponsors, process owners, and end users implement lean initiatives. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, resources, and procedures that may impact operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes in positions or staffing levels.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
This position reports directly to the Manager, Continuous Process Improvement in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management and works closely with directors, managers and staff in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management as well as key business representatives across the City. Works with front-line supervisors, departmental subject-matter-experts, external vendors, consultants and other organizations.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Leads, consult and participate in business process reviews of City Business Units, including provision of recommendations for opportunities for improvement
Lead Lean Six Sigma projects, including facilitating Kaizen events and Rapid Improvement events, conduct value stream mapping and identifies relevant KPIs,
Develop future state recommendations and build implementation plans for optimizing business processes and value streams
The value streams and processes that the role will be working on will be cross functional in nature and require the candidate to engage a number of business units and departments
Collect and analyze data to complete a current state analysis and optimize solutions
Identify implications and make recommendations for changes in processes and procedures that may impact on operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes to positions or staffing levels.
Prepares and conducts presentations to, and/or facilitates decision-making for Department Management teams, Division/Branch Heads, Project Steering Committees, and Business Unit Managers.
Teach, mentor and support the project application of Green Belt candidates
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Position Requirements
Education and Experience:
A related bachelor’s degree (i.e. Commerce, Business/Public Administration, Public Policy or Economics).
A minimum of seven years of proven experience in process documentation, business process reviews, and reengineering techniques. Training, experience and knowledge in quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies such as Lean and/or Six Sigma.
A minimum of five years’ experience at management level within the public sector or a similarly large multi-stakeholder organization. Management experience to effectively lead a business consulting team. Demonstrated experience implementing a business process re-engineering change.
Lean Six Sigma and/or Business Analyst certification (IIBA) certifications preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Detailed knowledge of business practices in effect at other local and more senior governments, and in private industry.
A thorough understanding of organization theory and design.
High degree of analysis using professional thinking.
Superior research and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills, across all levels of the organization.
The ability to think innovatively, solve complex problems and present solutions in clear and compelling terms.
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change.
Ability to analyze and anticipate implications of system changes on work processes and procedures.
Ability to solve complex problems and build relationships.
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships at all level of the organization.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, large workloads and multi-task effectively.
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Who We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.
BEworks is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are proud to be in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005 and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the recruitment and assessment (if applicable) process as required under BEworks' policies and procedures. Applicants must make their accommodation needs known when first contacted by the recruitment team.

At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility. Why? Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years.

We value you – your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company. And, we value your commitment to treat every person on our team with respect, helping us to operate safely, protect the environment and make a positive contribution to our local communities.

YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE:

Description:
The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will work at our corporate head office in downtown Toronto and assist in the cleanup and maintenance of our HR Master Data shared across multiple HR applications. The role is critical in bringing and maintaining consistency of HR data management practices across the organization.

Reporting to the HR Systems Manager, the Data and Reporting Analyst will collaborate with the HR Regional team, the Corporate HR team and the HR Systems teams to lead and deliver the HR data integrity project. The project will be run in 3 phases and the key responsibilities by phase outlined in the following responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Phase One: Discovery and Analysis

 Interpret national/provincial/federal regulations to determine implications to current HR data management and reporting practices.
 Identify system and business logic rules in data management to identify data quality gaps and business impacts. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes (e.g. client onboarding), policies, systems and data management practices.
 Audit existing data to identify issues related to accuracy, completeness and integrity. Interpret data issues to identify corrective actions for reporting practices.
 Identify opportunities to standardize and centralize HR data.

Phase Two: Data Cleaning and Data Management Standards

 Design the New Data Management and Reporting Practices to ensure HR Data integrity, accuracy and completeness.
 Seek out industry trends to generate and recommend alternative approaches to managing workforce related data and reporting.
 Test new data flows and remediate issues.
 Data Error Resolution by responding to, correcting and identifying the root of data errors - work with the Data Stewards (local payroll and HR use) to ensure HR data integrity, to clearly communicate errors, resolution procedures and new data management practices.
 Train Data Stewards in the application of the new data management practices, if needed.

Phase three: Maintenance of data - execute and optimize Data Management practices

 Support regional team in the maintenance of the data management practices. Serve as a Data Governance & Management communication point of contact to all stakeholders.
 Run bi-weekly Data Audits and correct triggering practice.
 Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to optimize the data management practices.
 Document finding regarding data challenges and corrections needs.

And all other ad hoc duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Qualifications:

 5+ years of experience on HR related projects with data impact.
 5+ years of experience as a Data Reporting Analyst
 Excellent working knowledge with MS Office applications (MS Excel in particular) and Visio.
 Knowledge of database principles and SQL language
 Strong organizational skills, prioritization and results orientated to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multinational organization (Canada, Mexico, Finland, Sweden).
 Systematic thinker, data and analytical abilities.
 Strong mathematical and literacy skills, complemented by excellent visual accuracy skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
 Experience with data manipulation, data transfer automation, analysis and reporting.
 Ability to interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems.
 Availability to travel in Canada and abroad.
 Languages: English (mandatory). French, Spanish or Finnish an asset.
Knowledge of:
o HR data concepts as they pertain to all HR processes and impact in other corporate processes (Accounting, Maintenance, Health and Safety, etc.).
o Process and data analysis practices and guidelines.
o Internal audit methodology and practice.
o Global HR processes, practices and technologies.
 Experience in:
o Previous experience using HRMS mandatory. Previous work with JD Edwards is an asset.
o Project Management or Change Management practices.
o Data mapping and data integrations between multiple systems.
o Data audits against multiple/complex criteria.
o Analyzing complex data from multiple perspectives and providing optimization recommendations.
