We're a passionate and fun group of people working hard bring financial mastery to 1,000,000 people. For many small business owners, keeping up to date on their books means less time spent growing their businesses. Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of our clients hands. We've paired our intuitive (and quite beautiful) software with a team of dedicated bookkeepers to provide monthly bookkeeping at an accessible price, giving entrepreneurs the time and the confidence to run the businesses they love.

Bench is post Series B, capitalized by a team of Silicon Valley and New York investors. We're scaling fast and we're not slowing down anytime soon. In just a few short years, we've grown from four co-founders to over 350 Benchmates. We're looking for the brightest minds to join us on this incredible journey, in pursuit of bringing financial mastery to our clients.

Data Analyst

The Data Analytics team plays a key role in driving the understanding, growth, and success of Bench. Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics, you will combine technical know-how with a deep understanding of our business and clients to make an impact across the entire data value chain at Bench:


You'll work closely with our Data Engineering team to ingest product and business information into our data warehouse;
You'll collaborate with other analysts and subject-matter experts to summarize high volumes of raw data into a useful form;
You'll be a sought-after resource by analysts throughout Bench for your subject-matter expertise on data infrastructure, analysis techniques, and data visualization.

Ultimately, your work will spawn insights that help Bench leadership and decision-makers to make informed decisions.

Here are some of the things you'll get up to:

Take in and clarify requests made of the Data team by stakeholders across Bench
Interpret and transform raw data to produce high-quality data sets for use by business users and other analysts
Build dashboards and reports to monitor business and operational metrics

The Essentials:

2-5 years progressive experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or similar roles
You balance an enthusiasm for learning and new ideas with a keen eye for detail
You have a healthy skepticism and are good at finding and pointing out flaws in quantitative reasoning (including your own)
You are unafraid of speaking up and out to make our ideas and lives better, communicating your thoughts effectively and with empathy
Post-secondary degree in Engineering, Science, Economics, Business, or other quantitative discipline (or equivalent experience)

Technical skills:

Hands-on experience using data visualization to tell compelling stories (Tableau, PowerBI)
Familiarity with querying relational databases using SQL (PostgreSQL, Amazon Redshift, MySQL)
Exposure to one or more programming languages commonly used for statistical analysis or data science (eg. Python, R)
Proficiency with Excel or Google Sheets

Other Details:

This is a full-time permanent position because we want to spend lots of time with your wonderful self
This position offers a competitive salary and stock options based on experience
Our office on Robson Street (easily accessible via transit) is dog friendly and the fridge is always stocked compliments of Bench
We offer an extended benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, massage, and a monthly Lifestyle Spending Account

$73,000 - $109,000 a yearEDC is looking to staff several Senior Business Analyst roles
across multiple portfolios within the organization.

EDC Senior Business Analysts liaise between business and solution
delivery teams to develop solutions that support the business. As a key
relationship builder with stakeholders and projects team, the Senior Business
Analysts elicit, analyze, communicate, validate and translate business
requirements into useable formats for the project team, for new functionality
and changes to business processes, data/information, and information systems.

Senior Business Analysts can act with agility and to quickly
understand the business to be able to contribute to solutions that enable the
organization to achieve its goals. The incumbents can assess processes and
information streams; and are proficient in the utilization of appropriate
tools, models and techniques as part of the requirements gathering process. Successful candidates will have experience in
fulfilling their role in both waterfall and agile environments.

Successful candidates will have experience working in large,
complex programs. Candidates will need to demonstrate experience leading other
team members including other Senior Business Analysts on the overall direction
and approach to business analysis. The successful candidates will also need to
demonstrate an ability to work across multiple projects within portfolios and
have evidence of experience in supporting teams moving to an operational model.

Discipline Summary

Acts as a liaison between the development group and business
units for the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of
existing systems.

Evaluates new applications and identifies systems
requirements.

Evaluates new developments and evolving business requirements
and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current
systems.

Prepares communications and makes presentations on system
enhancements and/or alternatives.

Key Responsibilities

Leads and conducts the requirements gathering process and
translates them into documentation for changes or enhancements to business
processes, data/information, and information systems

Delivers documentation for client validation to support
approval processes and to the technical project members to deliver the solution

Leads the development of technology change management
strategy and approaches

Elicits, analyzes, and validates clients' functional and
non-functional business requirements and translates them into documentation for
changes or enhancements to business processes, data/information, and
information systems

Acts as functional expert on one or more business
areas/applications and provides advice, instructions, and guidance to end-users
and technical support services as an application subject matter expert

Works closely with the project manager, delivery manager,
and/or Product Owner(s)

Qualifications

Screening Criteria

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management
Information Systems, Business or Accounting

At least 7 years of experience in business system analysis

Education and/or Certification in Business Analysis from a recognized
college, university or organization

Experience and knowledge of information/data management
concepts including: metadata management, data quality, data mapping and
modeling, and data architecture

Demonstrated experience working in large complex programs,
being involved in multiple projects simultaneously, leading other team members,
including other BAs and Senior Business Analysts on the team, and leading
multiple streams of work

Experience and/or certification in Agile, Scrum Master or
Hybrid IT delivery methodology

Assets

Experience in Agile and Scrum delivery frameworks

Strong experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)

Formal business analyst training in Adobe Experience Manager
(AEM)

Experience in, but not limited to one or more of the

following industries/areas of specialization:
Marketing

Financial (i.e. insurance, loan origination, loan
administration, banking systems)

Information Services

Experienced with, but not limited to:
TFS and/or VSTS 2013 or higher

Visio

Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certified

Bilingualism in both official languages (English
and French)

Salary range

$73,000 - $109,000 + performance based incentive

How to apply

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Application deadline: April 5, 2019, 11:59 p.m. EST on www.edc.ca/careers

EDC is committed to employment equity and actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.

If selected for an interview, please advise us if you require special accommodation.

Candidates must meet the requisite government security screening requirements.

Toronto, ONBUSINESS ANALYST: Challenging, Impactful, Rewarding

 WHO WE ARE: Paradigm is an innovative, flexible, leading-edge Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) company. As Canada's leading mortgage outsourcing company, Paradigm's mandate is to enable new and existing lenders with a cost effective mortgage operation solution that can quickly respond to market conditions, lead the market in innovation and ultimately provide mortgage consumers with great choice, vastly improving their mortgage experience.

PARADIGM CULTURE: Paradigm is committed to open and honest communication with our staff. We believe by being transparent, truthful and sincere, we can serve each other and our clients with integrity. Our culture can be summed up in one word: family. We work hard at creating an exceptional professional family here at Paradigm and do not take it for granted. Every initiative, new hire, company event and daily activities are focused on maintaining and fostering our Paradigm family because we know that our employees are undoubtedly the key to our success.

THE OPPORTUNITY: This position requires exceptional analytical & documentation skills, with the specific ability to maintain detail requirements concerning functionality as it relates to both front-end and back end applications. The candidate must also be proficient with the SDLC and Visual Studio tools. Specific experience in the Mortgage Brokerage and/or consulting engagements is highly preferred.

Role Specific Accountabilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Strategy & Planning
Collaborate with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision. Build relationships with product management, development, stakeholders, consultants, and end users ensuring application development meets or exceeds functional specifications and customer needs throughout the SDLC and transition periods.
Identify the project stakeholders and establish the user classes as well as their characteristics.
Apply the standard for the user requirements elicitation process. Utilize workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Leverage the standard for the identification and establishment of scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis that define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Utilize the standard approach for working with stakeholders and project teams toward the prioritization of collected requirements.
Conduct research, review of the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Use the SDLC model (Visual Studio tools) for managing user stories, business requirements and the technical process through user testing.
Utilize the Business Analyst work packages including, but not limited to, the library of Business Requirements standard documents (business process design, business context diagram, Use Cases, data requirements and mapping, root cause and business analysis, impact analysis, alternatives and recommendations, work-around identification and documentation, report/dashboard/analytics design, deployment support and production stabilization).


Acquisition & Deployment
Support the research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Support the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Support the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use. Support the creation of the evolutionary roadmap for the use of requirements documentation software solutions.
Operational Management
Work within the controls and measures that ensure quality analysis and verification of requirement for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Support the management, development and maintenance all BA software tools including but not limited to Confluence and the SharePoint sites.
Utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications. Support the continuous reassessment of the status quo to improve user experience, quality and add value to technology solutions while increasing the speed of BRD delivery and minimizing the post BRD changes.
Ensure the translation of conceptual user requirements into functional requirements occurs in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Recommend when and where the development of prototypes is required for interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Utilize process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicating these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation – to sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members.


Educational /Technical Experience:
College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, computer science, finance, economics or information systems.
Minimum of 5 years' experience in business analysis, with preference given to recent mortgage industry experience.
Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required.
Proven track record of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) experience required.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills with a demonstrated ability to work both independently and within a team environment required.
Proven experience with business requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, methodology development and working knowledge of technical requirements analysis is required.
Proven ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language is required.
Experience with the organization's core software applications preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge of the organization's core business process and operations not required but considered an asset.
Understanding of the organization's goals and objectives preferred.
Possess or working toward professional designation (ITIL, CBAP, Scrum, 6 Sigma, Lean, etc.) preferred.
Personal Attributes:
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines leveraging analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Highly self-motivated and self-directed.
Ability to handle job stress, interact effectively with others in the workplace, and act with honesty and composure in public.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.
Tenacious.
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Ability to read communication styles of team members and external partners who come from a broad spectrum of disciplines.
Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential.
Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients, and other departments.
Ability to defuse tension among project team, should it arise.
Customer service skills an asset.
Demonstrated excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Persuasive, encouraging, and motivating.
Sense of humour.

Unata in a nutshell…Look at us! We're in a nutshell!
Unata is on a mission to build the grocery shopping experience of the future. Our white label platform powers the digital customer experience for some of North America's most well-respected grocers, and we don't plan on stopping here. We were acquired by Instacart in 2018 so that we could take over the grocery world with the most comprehensive, innovative digital grocery solution in the market. Unata operates as a independent subsidiary headquartered in Toronto, Canada.
We're a group of people with a strong moral compass, and with bright ideas who actively collaborate with one another to achieve goals as a team. We're a passionate bunch who want to create something that has never been done before.
Our pieces of flare…
Canada's (#2) Best Place to Work (SMB, 2017).
Canada's 11th, and North America's 52nd Fastest Growing Tech Company (PROFIT 500),
Canada's 50 fastest growing companies
Canada's top 20 most innovative companies.
Our Data Analyst will…
Contribute to the development of our analytics engine and also perform analysis that will have a direct and measurable impact on business decisions. Analytics within Unata is a unique team encompassing data engineering, software development, research and business intelligence. You will join a small but agile team that will become the "data hub" for internal and external stakeholders.
We value Data Analysts who have the following…
Have a technical and business intelligence background
Have experience with SQL and working with unstructured data
Have experience with Python (or similar programming languages)
Are able to present findings of technical analysis to non-technical individuals
Have experience in reporting and business intelligence
Have degrees in Statistics, Economics, Engineering & Computer Science
You have experience in retail analytics
Are experienced with technologies such as SQLAlchemy, Snowflake, ElasticSearch, Hadoop & Spark
Have previously been involved in Software Development
Strong statistical analysis (w/ MatLab or R) experience
What this opportunity has to offer for you…
Shape business decisions by performing research, analytics and statistical analysis on various metrics/business cases.
Work side by side with engineering, operations and senior leadership as a key stakeholder in multiple projects.
Provide valuable insights using data to drive business decisions.
Build an analytics engine that will be used by all of Unata's clients.
A dedicated team filled with people that want to make an impact – this ain't no "another-day-another-dollar" gig!
A working environment where your opinions are valued
A place within a company that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense
Time to attend various developer conferences, like PyCon, where members of our Team are regularly selected to present
Want to join a talented team of people changing the way the world grocery shops?
Unata is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse team representative of the city we live in, and the people who use our product everyday. We believe that the best solutions are the ones created from a variety perspectives and that experience comes in many forms. If you are reading this posting and thinking 'I could do that!', we strongly encourage you to apply (i.e. exact experience not required).
Apply today with a copy of your resume, and let us know why you're a great fit for the position! Visit www.unata.com/careers/. To learn more about our parent, please visit www.instacart.com.

job_title: Love Data? Apply to become a Research Data Centre Analyst!
job_description:
Calgary, AB$81,858 - $94,219 a yearStatistics Canada - Microdata Access Division

Calgary (Alberta), Edmonton (Alberta), Lethbridge (Alberta), Burnaby (British Columbia), Prince George (British Columbia), Vancouver (British Columbia), Victoria (British Columbia), Winnipeg (Manitoba), Fredericton (New Brunswick), Moncton (New Brunswick), St. John's (Newfoundland and Labrador), Halifax (Nova Scotia), Guelph (Ontario), Hamilton (Ontario), Kingston (Ontario), London (Ontario), North Bay (Ontario), Ottawa (Ontario), Toronto (Ontario), Waterloo (Ontario), Windsor (Ontario), Montréal Island (Québec), Québec (Québec), Sherbrooke (Québec), Saskatoon (Saskatchewan)

EC-05

$81,858 to $94,219
Closing date: 31 May 2019 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Information on accommodation for persons with disabilities
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Do you love leading-edge data?
Are you very curious?
Do you want to enrich your knowledge by learning about research in multiple disciplines?
Do you enjoy sharing knowledge about research and data methods with others?

If you answered yes to all these questions, we believe that a Research Data Centre Analyst position would be an exciting choice for you! You will have the opportunity to explore the research questions of researchers in many different faculties. You will also be able to contribute to the research process by providing guidance on data, methodological techniques and software.

You will have the chance to grow in this position, as you learn more about new data,
software, techniques and disciplines. You will be part of a strong research community!
Duties
Below you will find the main duties and responsibilities you would have the chance to assume!

Administers the operation of the Research Data Centre (RDC) for its clients and ensures
that the activity is consistent with Statistics Act. This includes activities such as assisting
researchers with project preparation, administering RDC access (security checks and contracts), orientating new researchers into the RDC secure computing environment and liaising with the program management.
Responsible for maintaining the integrity of the secure computing environment by ensuring that physical, technical and legal requirements for the operation of an RDC are within standards used by Statistics Canada. This would include assigning tasks to local IT staff as required.Coordinates and participates in consultations, meetings, committees or working groups.Provides consultation on research methods and data concepts to the RDC researchers in a client service oriented environment while fostering a culture of confidentiality.Analyzes all interim and final research outputs that leave the RDC to ensure that they respect Statistics Canada’s confidentiality protection requirements.Maintains a liaison between the RDC network and Subject Matter Areas responsible for the Statistics Canada household surveys or administrative data.Participates in various program wide projects which include a range of activities, such as
recommending, documenting, developing and providing advice based on areas of specialization such as confidentiality vetting, use of administrative data, and survey data concepts and methodology.
May have to supervise local and/or other RDC staff.
Work environment
Statistics Canada is a world-renowned leader in its domain, and its employees are proud to fulfill its mission: to serve Canada with high-quality statistical information that matters. We want to help Canadians better understand their country, so they can make more thoughtful decisions. Be part of this mission by applying for this position!

In January 2018, Statistics Canada received the National Capital Region's Top Employers Award for 2018. A week later, we were also awarded a spot in Canada's Top Employers for Young People competition.

That's not it!

The advantages of a strong workplace cannot be understated. Diverse. Accommodating.
Nurturing. Rewarding. For employees to reach their full potential, a workplace MUST be meet all of these criteria. Well ours is! Statistics Canada provides you with the tools you need to succeed. Our job opportunities provide you with a unique chance to:
expand your existing knowledge and knowhow;strengthen your team spirit and extend your network;strengthen your project management skills;propose innovative ideas and participate in modernization;and so much more!
We support talent. Let your talents and interests shine and come discover new ones. If you’re looking for a place to build a career, you’ve found it!
Intent of the process
The intent of this selection process is to staff part-time determinate positions with the
possibility of extension, indeterminate positions and/or full-time positions. A pool of qualified candidates will also be established and may be used to staff identical or similar positions with different tenures, various linguistic profiles, and various security profiles at various Research Data Centres across Canada.
Positions to be filled: 1
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION

Graduation with a Master degree* or a PhD** from a recognized university with an acceptable specialization in Economics, Sociology or Statistics.

OR

An acceptable combination of education, training and/or relevant experience in a health-related field of study such as epidemiology, health sciences or health services research, or in a social-related field such as psychology, geography or demography.

Alternative to the Master degree, we accept:candidates that are currently enrolled in a PhD Direct-Entry Program and has completed Master degree level requirements or PhD course work and comprehensive exams; ORcandidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
**Alternative to the PhD, we accept candidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE

EX1. Experience using census data, administrative data or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
EX2. Experience conducting advanced quantitative analyses at the level taught in graduate-level statistics courses.
EX3. Experience in the use of Statistical Analysis System (SAS), Statistical Package for Social Sciences (SPSS) or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
EX4. Experience in making presentations to client groups, peer groups or scientific meetings, such as presenting research findings at a conference or teaching a class.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET - EDUCATION

AEd1. Graduation with a Master level degree from a recognized university.
AEd2. Graduation with a Ph.D. from a recognized university.

Other education assets may be used as needs arise.
Degree equivalency
ASSET - EXPERIENCE

AEX1. Experience with Statistics Canada's Research Data Centres Program.
AEX2. Significant* experience using individual or household census data, administrative data, or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
AEX3. Significant* experience using business, organizational survey or administrative data, such as but not limited to Statistics Canada Business Microdata.
AEX4. Significant* experience in the use of SAS, SPSS or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
AEX5. Experience using Statistics Canada microdata.
AEX6. Experience working with confidential or sensitive statistical information.
AEX7. Experience supervising employees, including the responsibility of their work objectives.
AEX8. Experience screening or vetting statistical output for confidentiality and data protection.
AEX9. Experience with administrative procedures and handling legal documents (for example, that are related to access to secure work space), with an emphasis on details and organizational skills.
AEX10. Experience in writing procedural documents for a variety of audiences.
AEX11. Experience with providing Information Technology (IT) support (for example, in a virtual computing environment, such as but not limited to VMware).

Significant experience is defined as the depth and breadth of experience normally associated with the equivalent of full-time performance of duties for approximately two (2) years working or studying in one of the domains.
Other experience assets may be used as needs arise.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative BBB/BBB
English Essential
French Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE

K1. Knowledge of statistical methods associated with the analysis of social survey data with complex sample design.
K2. Knowledge of the major social surveys or administrative data sources maintained by Statistics Canada, or comparable surveys or administrative data.
K3. Knowledge of current and emerging challenges relevant to social science research in Canada.
ABILITIES AND SKILLS

A1. Ability to advise clients on advanced analytical methods, construction of custom data files and creation of variables, using statistical software.
A2. Ability to prepare material and deliver presentations to a variety of audiences.
A3. Ability to work effectively in a client service environment.
A4. Ability to communicate effectively orally.
A5. Ability to communicate effectively in writing.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY

PS1. Effective Interpersonal Skills
PS2. Initiative
PS3. Reliability
PS4. Judgment
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Below you will find the current or future requirements of the organization for the proper
functioning of the work unit or the organization.

1) For these positions, scheduling flexibility is limited as operational requirements
necessitate the Research Data Centre (RDC) adhere to agreed upon hours of
operation.
2) Employees who hold employment elsewhere or who are otherwise engaged in outside
activities are required to give priority to the requirements of their Statistics Canada job.
3) The candidate may be required to travel occasionally.
4) Employees working part-time must be able to increase their hours and/or change their
schedule with reasonable notice due to training or workflow demands.
Conditions of employment
Reliability Status security clearance
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the targeted groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
PLEASE TAKE THE TIME to read the following information carefully as it may have an impact on the outcome of your application.

It is the applicant's responsibility to clearly and completely indicate that he/she meets the education and experience (essential and asset) aspects of the statement of merit criteria in his/her application. The responses provided in the "screening questions" portion of the application will be used as the primary tool in the screening process and the CV will only be used to substantiate the information provided. You must clearly demonstrate, through CONCRETE EXAMPLES, how you meet each screening criterion. Please note that it is not sufficient to only state that the qualification is met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities or duties. Meeting these criteria is desirable and may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed.

It is the candidate's responsibility to obtain the appropriate documentation from the recognized educational institution.

Acknowledgement of receipt of applications will not be sent. We will contact candidates when the screening process is completed.

Applicants will receive all correspondence by e-mail. Please include in your application the e-mail address you would like us to use. It is your responsibility to notify us of any e-mail address change.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of
their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their
application.
Preference

Toronto, ONGardaWorld is the largest Business Solutions Company in security services with private capital closed, in the world. Every day, our 48,000 employees solve complex problems. We ensure secure trade and protect people, assets and reputation of our customers.
We are looking for a Business Analyst, National Account for our Security Services division. The position will be based in our Mississauga Office.

Your mission at GardaWorld
The National Account Analyst supports a National team of Portfolio Directors, Senior Director of National Accounts, Vice President of National accounts and all Canadian branches in ensuring timely analysis, reporting and development of tools and measures to support the growing needs of the business.

What you will be doing
Provide analytical support for GardaWorld’s daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting to customers
Assist in collecting national business analysis and insights on a regular basis from regions and branches across the country
Provide critical support in the implementation and development of new planning and analysis tools, including creating and maintaining various models
Support presentation development and materials for customer reviews, and monthly/weekly ad hoc analysis to support the national team
Produce consolidated key KPI’s metrics and reports to coincide with reporting requirements of National Customers
Assist in the development of standardized reporting templates
Consult with the business to understand its goals and objectives for a specific initiative or project and advises on the functionality, applicability, and usability of alternative technology and reporting
Responsible for owning the solution to satisfy the business needs in coordination with the National team
Elicits, analysis, documents and manages business and solution requirements
Acts as a primary requirements management contact on projects
Recommends process improvements
Builds relationships and works collaboratively with stakeholders to identify solutions and resolve variance from requirements and specifications
Participates in post implementation/event reviews and processes (e.g. lessons learned, reviews, etc.)
Supports other team members in achieving projects/ business objectives and providing client services

Your profile
University degree/college diploma
2+ years of progressive business analysis/business consulting experience, supporting large national teams
Solid problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to multi-task in a multi-faceted role within a high-paced environment
Advanced Excel, database and Microsoft Office skills and technical capability
Strong relationship management, communication, and interpersonal skills
Solid understanding of requirements/scope development, analysis and documentation
Ability to apply techniques associated with data and process modelling
Familiarity with business assessment tools (e.g. feasibility studies, business cases, cost/benefit analysis, project sizing and costing) is an asset
Experience in the Security or Service Business to Business industry is an asset

What we offer
Competitive salary
Full-benefit plan
Dynamic team
International company offering many growth opportunities

PermanentBusiness Analyst Job DescriptionThe business analyst works with multiple stakeholders in to elicit, analyze, document and validate requirements for business or project processes, policies and systems. The business analyst interprets business issues and opportunities in the context of the requirements to recommend solutions that enable the business or project to achieve its goals.Require a degree in a related area and 2-4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. job_title: Professional Services Business Analyst - System Analyst
job_description:
Toronto, ONTier1 is a rapidly growing Fintech organization focused on global relationship management. As partners in innovation, Tier1 continually engages with our clients and industry partners to help envision the future state of capital markets and bring it to life. Our culture centers on collaboration and intellectual curiosity. Our dynamic team brings together expertise spanning capital markets, product management, technology and other corporate disciplines to ensure our clients can optimize their client relationship data and translate it into greater engagement and efficiency. We deliver the tools, connectivity, and workflows to power collaboration, transparency, and communications between capital markets participants.

In all that we do, we put our clients’ needs first, working closely to proactively address their pain points and help them clear the path toward opportunity, efficiency and profitability.

Technical Business Analyst - System Analyst

We are currently looking for technical business analysts to join our Professional Services team to serve as a Tier1CRM evangelist to a growing list of customers. Our Professional Services team is responsible for all aspects of an implementation from requirements gathering to end user training. As a technical business analyst, you will be involved in all these exciting activities such as: participate in or lead workshops with our customers to gather requirements for their Salesforce & Tier1CRM implementation, configure Salesforce & Tier1CRM solutions to meet those requirements, deploy changes into sandbox and product environments & run training sessions on how to use Tier1CRM products.

Primary responsibilities include:

Work with project managers to lead workshops with the customers to gather requirements
Recommend solutions to meet customer requirements by leveraging Salesforce & Tier1CRM best practices
Participate or lead efforts to develop and execute testing, training, and documentation
Participate in or lead deployment of Salesforce & Tier1CRM changes to sandboxes or production environments
Assist customers with their data analysis, data migration, and reporting requirements
Analyze root cause of issues to ensure a permanent resolution is implemented
What we look for:

At least 2 – 5 years of experience in a software development company or a bank/investment bank, preferably with CRM experience or Salesforce experience
Salesforce.com Administration Essentials for New Admin (ADM 201) Certification or prior Salesforce work experience
Degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics/business
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms to project stakeholders
Be able to learn quickly with minimum guidance
Write simple SOQL queries or Apex triggers
Experience working in an agile environment
Knowledge of the capital markets industry
May require up to 25% travel to United States, Europe, APAC
What we offer?

Competitive salary
Career development & growth at Tier1CRM
Health and dental benefits
Corporate discount for Goodlife Fitness
Exciting social & fundraising events (departmental & company wide)
Tier1CRM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law

$56,157 a yearThe Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) helps people overcome workplace injuries and illnesses and helps business owners make their workplaces safe and healthy. Our people are at the heart of what we do. Bring your enthusiasm and expertise to the WSIB, and we’ll help you achieve your personal and professional goals through meaningful work, development opportunities and a culture of compassion, integrity and teamwork.
We are the WSIB. And we’re here to help.


This is a temporary opportunity for up to 24 months in duration.
Starting Salary: $56,157.00
The WSIB’s Portfolio Management Office is a key partner in achieving the goals of the organization and is currently responsible for the overall management of a large internal systems project.
The position reports directly to the Manager, Portfolio Management Office and is responsible for providing support to the Project Management Office (PMO) of a large-scale project in the analysis of documentation/data and development of project deliverables. This role will ensure the regular updating of project management plans and status reports, as well assisting in the timely communication with project stakeholders related to decisions, risks and issues. In addition, this role will support the PMO to ensure project sponsors and project managers are kept up to date on the project lifecycle.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Participate in project/program activities and deliverables pursuant to project plans by:

Coordinating status reporting, issues and risk management (including those pertaining to labour relations) and change control procedures following established policies and procedures
Participating in work plan reviews to facilitate resource capacity planning process, as required
Keeping project and portfolio managers appraised of project status and any issues and variances
Performing cross-functional tasks and/or other project-related duties as required
Update and maintain project management collateral which includes:

Assisting in the development of and updates to project charters, presentations, spreadsheets and other material as required
Monitoring adherence to project schedules and budgets, tracking progress and expenses, producing status reports with critical milestones identified and escalating issues and risks to project managers
Maintaining existing project management plans and assisting in the development of new plans for future phases of work using MS project
Participate in the facilitation of stakeholder communication by:

Scheduling, coordinating and participating in meetings and events, collecting and distributing relevant materials, taking detailed meeting minutes and highlighting and following up on action items
Assisting in the preparation of clear and effective communications to project teams and stakeholders with respect to related changes and implementations
Professional Requirements and Qualifications
Completion of post -secondary education in Business Administration or related field
1 or more years of experience in an analyst position
Project analyst skills with solid understanding of project management methodologies and standards
Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) – PMI Certification or Project Management Professional (PMP) – PMI Certification are an asset



As a precondition of employment, the WSIB will require a prospective candidate to undergo a criminal records name check prior to or at any time following hire.

To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date noted above.
We appreciate the interest of all candidates. Due to the volumes of applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates that are selected to move forward in the recruitment process. The WSIB is an equal opportunity employer.

The WSIB is an equal opportunity employer and provides accommodation for job applicants in accordance with the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you are an individual with a disability and you need accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca. If you are invited to participate in the assessment process, please provide your accommodation needs at that time. Please be advised that you may be required to provide medical documentation to the WSIB’s Corporate Health Department so that appropriate accommodation can be provided to you throughout the recruitment process.

Employees of the WSIB have important ethical responsibilities, including the obligation to place the public interest above personal interests. Job applicants are therefore required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. These may include: political activity, directorship or other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with existing WSIB employees, clients and/or stakeholders). Please contact TAC if you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/ or how to make a disclosure.
Privacy Statement

Personal information will be collected from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997 and will be used by the Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties to assess/validate your qualifications and/or determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, contact the WSIB Privacy Office, 200 Front Street West, Toronto, ON, M5V 3J1 or 416-344-5323 or 1-800-387-0750 extension 5323. Be advised that information related to application status will not be provided.

Toronto, ONContractAbout Entertainment One
Entertainment One Ltd. (LSE:ETO) is a global independent studio that specialises in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. The Company’s diversified expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales; family programming, merchandising and licensing; digital content; and live entertainment. Through its global reach and expansive scale, powered by deep local market knowledge, the Company delivers the best content to the world.

Entertainment One’s robust network includes international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; Amblin Partners with DreamWorks Studios, Participant Media, and Reliance Entertainment; Makeready with Brad Weston; unscripted television production companies Whizz Kid Entertainment and Renegade 83; live entertainment leaders Round Room Entertainment; world-class music labels Dualtone Music Group and Last Gang; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.

The Company's rights library, valued at US$2.0 billion (as at 31 March 2018), is exploited across all media formats and includes about 80,000 hours of film and television content and approximately 40,000 music tracks.


Position Summary
As a Business Analyst, you will join Entertainment One’s Information Technology team to ensure process mapping, requirement gathering, data analysis, relationship management, and project and/or operational support.
Responsibilities
Create and document Business Requirements, gap analysis and support documents for projects related to Entertainment One’s Strategic Initiatives.
Analyze and synthesize stakeholder requirements into actionable items.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through interviews, workshops, meetings, and/or training.
Submit technology estimation (cost benefit analysis) documentation and provide to clients in order to facilitate feasibility assessments on project initiatives.
Act as a liaison between business and technology groups.
Provide initiative documentation as deemed necessary.
Ensure business and system requirements are documented in the form of detailed functional and non-functional requirements and business designs, which meet industry best practices and are consumable by clients, development and testing.
Provide operational support following the change management process.
Research existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design.
Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing eOne with optimum solutions to business and technology challenges
Lead requirement gathering and other sessions with Stakeholders, to capture the requirements and specifications.
Using negotiating and facilitation skills, resolve issues across competing segments and channels to arrive at solutions that meet the needs of all stakeholders. Actively manage client expectations on the BA work package and the initiative overall where providing support.
Work with the technology team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Support the work packages for the Development, Testing, Communication, Learning, and Implementation teams by conducting walkthroughs, providing clarification and facilitating issue resolution.
Conduct user training.
Business Planning and Tracking - Meet business requests within budget, on time, and within acceptable quality levels. Manage assigned work packages against timelines and within scope and budget; make recommendations on corrective actions if work package deliverables are in jeopardy. Create change requests as required. Document and raise issues for resolution encountered during the requirements definition process.
Work for consensus and contribute to achievement of team/group goals.
Provide support in RFP process and vendor management.
Continuous Improvement - Work to provide continuous improvement of and ensure high level of quality in all deliverables, processes and procedures.
Communication - Create organized and professional presentation material for clients and partner stakeholders, presenting recommendations in a logical, articulate and influencial manner. Facilitate and lead discussions as required, preparing documentation to record discussion and follow-up actions.
Key Competencies
Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who will be delivering solutions that meet our internal clients' changing needs.
At least 5 years of Business Analysis experience.
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
Experience in business requirements documentation.
Experience in Use Case creation.
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
Well-developed writing skills sufficient to create and precisely articulate requirements, ideas, and opinions.
A University degree in business and/or information technology (or equivalent work experience) is an asset.
Certified business analyst professional or equivalent work experience (preferred).
Demonstrated success in delivering initiatives across multiple business units in a matrix environment.
Extensive experience with all aspects of Requirements Management: Business Process Modeling, Use Case modeling, use case specifications, functional and non-functional requirements and interface design.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and mediation skills.
Self-driven and someone who takes ownership.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
MS Visio experience.
MS SharePoint experience (preferred).
Previous Finance system implementation experience (preferred)
Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summerParty time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events
The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag
Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
Grow: develop your career and shape your future

Waterloo, ONWhat we hope you will achieve......(circa 2020) one year from now...

Your potential story, one year from now…We’d like to thank you for your contributions providing business consulting and data analytics services to clients that helped the company achieve a consecutive year of triple digit sales growth, two more industry awards, and record customer satisfaction levels. Here are some of your contributions as a member of our ever-growing business team:

You mastered the Tangam analytics and visualization software and independently constructed valuable customer-facing presentations. You used your superior data analytics skills to create recommendations on how clients can improve their operations. You have enabled clients to optimize their game mix, table spreads, schedules and general operations to increase their profitability by 10% - 15%. You supported several successful timely rollouts of Tangam’s software along with the Account Managers and Applications Engineers.
You statistically analyzed clients’ databases with internal tools to understand their patrons’ behavioural and business volume and product performance patterns. You then shared and discussed insights with the Account Managers, and contributed to recommendations on how to configure Tangam’s software based on these findings.
You met with a couple of new clients in-person to assist with their data analytics needs and supported the rollout of Tangam's software. You also quickly prepared high-quality business reports and created presentations aimed at clients’ upper management outlining the incremental revenue/profit and return on investment for their properties.
Based on client feedback and guidance from the Business team, you identified case study opportunities and used client data to demonstrate the benefits of Tangam’s software. These case studies were then released to the press and resulted in new sales.
You went beyond expectations and advanced your knowledge of analytics, operations optimization and data visualization. You shared your knowledge with the business analyst team, thus catalyzing process/technology changes that helped them be more effective in their careers.
We can’t wait until next year. Now back to today. If you’d like this story to be yours, apply now.

Who we are

Tangam is a small and rapidly growing company that is at the cutting edge of developing data analytics, operations optimization and visualization software. Our flagship product Table Games Yield Management (TYM) helps casinos to optimize their table games operations through effective resource allocation and staff scheduling. Our software takes the complexity out of data analytics and makes data understandable and actionable to ordinary users. Many large, medium and small casinos in the U.S., Canada, and Australia already use TYM successfully to enhance their business and better satisfy their patrons. Our patented products have won numerous industry awards and recognitions. We continue to push the envelope on what is possible in the area of data analytics and optimization software, and we are always seeking new talent to join us on our exciting journey.

Visit our website for more information.

Requirements

Good communicator. Strong written/oral communication. Ability to explain complex ideas and statistical concepts in a clear, concise manner. Proficiency in spoken and written French/Mandarin/Cantonese are all assets.

Data wizard. 2-5 years of experience in data analysis. Proficient with Excel, pivot tables and macros. Experience working with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, SAS and Cognos is an asset. Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL is an asset.

Educated. Undergraduate degree in Applied Mathematics / Statistics, Business, or Computer Science / Engineering with a strong mathematics background.

Must have no criminal record, and must be willing and able to travel ~5% - 15% of working time.

Experience with casinos is an asset.

Smiths Falls, ONLegalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Canopy Growth is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain Analytics team. As a Data & Visualization Analyst, you will help lay the data foundation of the company to be data driven. You’ll have a chance to collaborate with various teams in the supply chain and logistics organization to understand different data and reporting requirements.

The ideal candidate has the following traits:

Passion to be surrounded by data and finds excitement in diving into the deep end to extract insights others don’t see
Is detailed oriented and has the ability to react quickly in a dynamic business environment
A passion in unpacking and solving complex problems
Work with structured and unstructured data to solve problems like:
Identifying and centralizing data to be the most trusted source of information in the company
Assist the business in realizing the value and importance of data in their respective business areas

Responsibilities

Define ETL processes for consolidating data from transactional / operational systems
Build and expand the data dictionary
Produce regular reports and analysis using a range of data analytics tools
Support the business in creating ad hoc reports and troubleshooting reports
Be the data evangelist and help enable the business to be power users
Drive data quality improvements and collaborative effort towards unified enterprise Business Intelligence services
Write systems queries using SQL (MS SQL and MySQL), workbooks (MS Excel & Google Sheets), and other platform-specific query languages
Track project and task requirements, issues, deliverables, and acceptance criteria for reports and dashboards
Other tasks as assigned

Experience

Understanding of Supply Chain functions and data requirements (planning, procurement, logistics, transportation, scheduling, etc.)
Experience with a range of data analysis and presentation tools such as Excel and Google Sheets, Tableau, Power BI, SSRS, Cognos, Splunk, Sumo Logic, Salesforce Einstein, Crystal Reports, ZAP BI/SDMA etc.
Desire for tailoring your work into user-friendly dashboards in enterprise ERP and CRM platforms (SAGE X3, NetSuite, SAP, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)
SQL knowledge and ability to write complex queries
Understanding and ability to build OLAP Cubes, Dimensional and Relational Data Models
Comfortable with ETL, integrations, field mappings, and other data dictionary responsibilities
Experience performing statistical, time series, and cross-sectional analysis on large data sets a plus
Python data programming experience (R, NumPy, Pandas) a plus

Other Details

This is a Full Time position based out of the Ontario Area. Must be able to travel to Smiths Falls on a regular basis to collaborate with internal clients.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

Mississauga, ONJob Summary
This position is responsible for the extraction, analysis and reporting of key data from all INVIVA and Specialty Prescription Services (SPS) pharmacy systems, including but not limited to, ISched, Salesforce Kroll, Shipmate, CMSV2, Cisco and Workforce management tools. This position will also use all available external resources to identify key trends within the infusion and pharmacy business landscape. In addition, this role is responsible for the preparation and maintenance of both the INVIVA and SPS dashboards on a national level and ensuring key trends are identified and reported to the Senior Team of both businesses. The role is responsible for identifying and monitoring business needs and determining system based solutions to the business problems.
The position will be responsible for acting as a bridge between business process and system management that will ensure a safe and well-structured database repository of all business related functions and associated reporting needs
This position has the capability to add and delete users in the INVIVA and Pharmacy systems under the direction of business leaders. This position will also have the capability to add or modify programs within system databases to ensure the data model for extraction of data is consistent.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Extraction and Analysis of data from all systems utilized by pharmacy (SPS) and INVIVA: Develop and utilize a process of inspecting, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information , suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision making of National operations and management teams on a monthly or more frequent basis as required by the business.
Assess current reporting capabilities as well as determine reporting/data gaps and develop and or leverage reporting solutions to provide meaningful data and analysis to business leads.
Responsible to engage key stakeholders (Business Leaders, Finance, Programs) to determine and execute on reporting needs.
Responsible for development, maintenance and ongoing improvement of the INVIVA and SPS Performance Dashboards with regular reviews and presentations to the Leadership Teams on developing trends.
Integrate the data from the systems that is closely linked to operations and business requirements in order to formulate reports on Key Performance Indicators for the INVIVA and Pharmacy businesses on a schedule.
Under the INVIVA and Pharmacy leadership, responsible for software database administration including but not limited to: monitoring and managing user access, managing profiles of all physicians, nurses and clinics, managing all billing related activities set in the system
Collaborate all levels and departments within the organization to ensure business needs are met as well as evaluated regularly for continuous improvement.
Responsible for on-time, accurate reporting to finance for all information used for INVIVA and SPS manufacturer billing and vendor payment.
Set-up Medical Covering Physicians in INVIVA software.
Continue to understand the business data and reporting needs and the behavior of the software in order to deploy it and to troubleshoot problems.
Section B – Main Responsibilities
Data extraction, analysis and reporting from all key systems and software utilized by both businesses.
Monthly invoicing for all INVIVA Programs including accrual process, customer invoicing, physician payments and any other revenue related activities
Demonstrate the ability to adapt and influence the teams in order to effectively lead and manage change.
Identify and coordinate activities with staff and senior management, while collaborating with other department Managers to share information formally and informally.
Follow all McKesson Canada Guidelines, Policies and Procedures as they relate to general policies, IT policies.
Section C – Key Requirements
Degree or diploma in business administration, data management/System administration or equivalent.
5 or more year’s previous operational and system experience, in a clinical and/or pharmacy setting preferred.
Proven leadership abilities.
Strong communication skills, able to manage client relationships with a proven track record of exceptional customer service.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office and reporting analytic tools.
Able to identify key issues; creatively overcome internal challenges or obstacles.
High level of integrity, confidentially, and accountability.
Sound planning and execution skills, as well as be able to think on your feet.
Working knowledge of business and/or regulatory requirements with respect to this business.

At Amazon we believe that every day is still day one.
A day to take a first step. A day to look forwards to new challenges. And today is that day for you. It's your day to be part of something great. A day to make your ideas come to life. And your day to join a company that redefines itself every day. That's the energy and passion behind Amazon. At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute millions of products each year to our loyal customers.

Our overall mission is simple: We want Amazon to be the place where our customers can find, discover and buy anything online. Whatever our customers want, we will find the means to deliver it. With your help, Amazon will continue to enable people to discover new worlds.
This is your chance to make history.
For our Fulfillment Center (FC) in Slovakia we are looking for a Business Analyst.

About the role
This role is all about making your specific Fulfillment Center the best it can be. So analyzing and reporting on our daily, weekly and monthly productivity metrics, it’ll be down to you to spot trends and opportunities to reduce costs while boosting performance. To that end, you’ll work with our Site Controller to set quarterly cost targets and get involved in our strategic financial planning. It means mining complex data warehouses and making sure all of your analyses are accurate and complete. But you won’t stop there. Casting a critical eye over your own work, you’ll streamline our processes, increase forecast accuracy and put an effective variance analysis process in place.

If you thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment, you’ll meet your match with us, as you will be part of a vibe of constant improvement, where the things you do one moment, you will not necessarily be doing 6 months later. We don’t like to sit still, which is why we always treat every day like the first day. A day to make more good things happen for our customers. It’s that kind of spirit that drives our success now and keeps us ahead of the competition in the future. And you could be part of it. It’s as simple as this: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

At Colliers International, we are building amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

You are an analytical person with a keen eye for detail, who is able to analyses large data sets to look for inconsistencies, track changes and communicate to clients or internal stakeholders if we are outside of the Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation. You are also an out of the box thinker, who can approach data compliance challenges with innovative solutions and also strive to increase accuracy of all information in the CRM+ system.

Ability to manage and prioritize your work, with excellent attention to detail.

We are very excited to be building out our Enterprise Solutions team to deliver data driven initiatives to meet our clients’ needs in the healthcare industry. We have a solid practice at Klick, with strong client engagements and are looking to elevate it by building on the CRM and Direct Marketing Strategy, Digital Marketing, Campaign Operations, Technology and Analytics solutions that we have been successful with to date.

The Business Analyst is a client-facing business opportunities and solutions focused role, responsible for leading discovery sessions, scoping, requirements elicitation and management, solution planning, validation of solution and business readiness activities for a project or group of projects. Success is measured by, amongst other things, quality of requirements and solution approach along with the reliability of project deliveries within project timelines. The Business Analyst reports to the Director, Enterprise Solutions, and will operate as their trusted advisor and feet on the ground on one or more client portfolios they support.
Team members in this role are expected to be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities to a consistently high standard:

Elicit, analyze, and manage requirements, and business rules by engaging with key internal and external stakeholders
Develop business requirements documentation and manage requirements for all project types
Support and/or lead requirements review and solution design sessions
Be the Subject Matter Expert for client(s) data and omni-channel marketing campaigns
Partner with and support Strategy, Relationship Management, Client Services, Analytics, Media and Project • Management teams to ensure the business need is understood and the solution options presented are holistic, comprehensive, and valid
Work closely with the Technology teams to determine the best solutions that meet client needs (e.g. recommend 3rd party tools and technologies, aligning with Klick’s services and technology capabilities)
Work closely with the QA team to ensure requirements are adequately accounted for in test plans and test cases
Support the Analytics team in defining data tracking, collection and extract/reporting requirements including KPIs, insights and analytics
Support and/or review work effort estimation process and timelines
Understand the Klick SDLC in detail, and escalate deviations to the Enterprise Solutions Director(s).
Required Experience and Skills

Team members in this role are expected to be able to demonstrate all of the following experience and skills:

Experience with a variety of complex projects at various phases of the project lifecycle
Ability to elicit and analyze requirements from internal and external stakeholders of various seniority levels.
Experience with a variety of project types, software and process methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, Iterative, etc.)
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills catering messages to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong analytical, problem solving, planning skills and experience applying these skills in both business and technical environments
Experience creating business requirements packages or other relevant campaign documentation
Strong understanding of one or more of the following: database, data warehousing, data management, data quality and governance practices, data analysis and list generation, loyalty program management, solution design, campaign management/testing, reporting and business intelligence
Beneficial but not required

The following skills and capabilities may be beneficial on some projects, but are not a core requirement of the role. If you don’t have these skills, it’s not a problem. Similarly, having these skills is not a substitute for excellence in any of the required skills and experience, when considering job performance and promotion readiness:

People management experience
Experience and understanding of 3rd party marketing automation and CRM platforms (e.g. Salesforce ExactTarget, Oracle Eloqua, Marketo and/or Adobe Campaign).
Knowledge of Data Management and Governance best practices
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma Process Improvement methodologies
Experience in highly regulated industries (e.g. Pharma, Financial, Insurance, etc.)
Continuously explores new techniques, tools and programs in an effort to innovate the field of data management and marketing communication in the Healthcare industry.

Toronto, ONJob Description
Aon is looking for a Business Analyst (10 months contract, with potential to getting extended or converted to Perm)

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our business group within Aon Risk Solutions, in Toronto, ON. As a Business Analyst, you will report directly to the Operations Director.

Your impact as a Business Analyst

Job Responsibilities:
Support project in acting as key liaison between the business and our Information Technology (IT) team
Support industry research activities
Work with stakeholders from across the organization to gather requirements
Perform data and operational analysis utilizing Excel and other reporting tools
Take ownership of projects: create and maintain project timelines, ensure project milestones are met on time, verify that all project deliverables are of the highest quality, and keep team members informed on status and changes in project requirements and deliverables
Coordinate activities for larger scale projects: creating and maintaining key project documents, supporting issues management, drafting project communications, etc.
Document processes, recognize opportunities for continuous improvement; suggest solutions to the team, and step-up to take on tasks to improve processes
Assist with building and execution of UAT test cases
Support development of training materials and training delivery
Coordinate with external vendors as required
Coordinate Operations activities to support the rollout of technology, training coordination, training documentation, UAT, communication

You Bring Knowledge and Expertise

A minimum of 3-5 years’ related experience ideally within the P&C insurance industry
Customer focused committed to process improvement
Experience in Project streamlining, redesigning, mapping.
Exp in small or big projects.
Strong presentation skills
Ability to work well under pressure within deadlines
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Knowledge of project management practices, procedures and principles
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner across functional and technical departments.
The successful candidate must be able to think quickly, be strategic and be able to interact with a variety of people with the organization and adapt their style to different personalities.

Project Management Professional (PMP) certification an asset, or working towards
