job_title: Business Analyst - Process, Operations and Inventory
job_description:
Toronto, ONHello, it’s a new day, and it’s time to answer the call to elevate your career and make life accessible for all.
Our purpose is to make life accessible
Our compassion and knowledge set us apart. With kindness and expertise, we support individuals by delivering the right mobility, accessibility, personal care, and daily living solutions. We believe that providing people with comprehensive solutions empowers and fulfills us all.
Our role is to care
As we strive to expand our reach and clients we care for, we are adding individuals to our teams who embody kindness, collaboration, and respect. If you want to help our clients experience their most vibrant lives while growing your own career in a nurturing, learning-focused and supportive environment - you will love being part of Motion.
Who we are
Motion is Canada’s leading provider of comprehensive and customized mobility and accessibility solutions for a wide variety of clients from children to elderly adults. Built on professional expertise and personalized service, we are proud to have served our clients for over 30 years. Whether a client is being fitted for equipment for the first time, is in need of an equipment repair or looking to upgrade their solution, our teams across Ontario, Alberta and B.C. are ready to apply their knowledge with the utmost of care and compassion. To learn more about how Motion is working to make life accessible, visit motioncares.ca.
Who we need
Reporting to the Director of Business Improvement, we are adding a Business Analyst to our team. This is a greenfield opportunity to scope out new projects and play a critical role on a new team created in response to a company-wide, cross-country reorganization. This is the chance to introduce and implement a process driven mindset into the organization and establish a culture of continuous improvement. Your work may include:
The simplification and standardization of inventory management and baseline inventory practices.
Development and implementation of an effective inventory control strategy to minimize waste and inventory variances.
Development of nationwide KPI’s for inventory and warehouse management.
Design, creation and implementation of documentation including warehouse SOP’s, processes and policies.
Who you are
You want to join a national organization undergoing an exciting period of transformation. You want to spearhead change initiatives resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction. You are drawn to the bigger cause of Motion and want to be part of making life more accessible.
You are a clear and effective communicator with a passion for continuous improvement. You believe in the power and efficiencies of Lean processes. You are entrepreneurial and creative. You are an inquisitive and high-energy team player who takes a strategic approach to managing and driving change.
What you will do
Lead and implement key strategic projects, focusing on Inventory and warehouse management. You will own and drive improvement projects with the goal of improving quality, reducing costs, increasing productivity and improving cycle time by reducing wasted time, rework, etc.
Inventory & Analysis. Every mobility device we process is custom to our clients, as a result we rely on our warehouse to play an integral role in keeping our operations running smoothly. Work closely with the regions and head office to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively, purchasing the right equipment, maintaining solid inventory data.
Be a role model. You will exemplify excellence in continuous improvement (CI). You will identify opportunity, develop sustainable targets and embed practices within the business. You will work with leadership to create an environment for learning, team goal alignment and accountability removing barriers to these objectives.
Report. You will liaise with finance and other members of the organization in assessing, tracking and reporting the financial benefit of a project. You will provide management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
What you bring
The education. You have a Bachelor Degree and possess practical financial and business acumen.
As the Expertise, you also have demonstrated success in:
Inventory reduction best practices.
Project management.
Business optimization and process improvement.
Business transformation.
Continuous improvement process- in quality, sales, distribution and operations.
Cost savings.
The technical skills. You are comfortable using the Microsoft Office Suite of products; data analysis and tools.
The analytical and collaborative approach. You can foster a positive working environment, encouraging adoption and buy-in of continuous improvement initiatives. You have outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and can relay complex concepts to audiences at any level, gaining trust and nurturing a collaborative team approach. You are comfortable providing feedback and following through to track improvement.
Some travel within Canada may be required (less than 10%).
Progressive experience (2 - 8 years) willing to hire a junior to more seasoned professional provided that individual has some logistics, manufacturing or material handling experience.
Why join?
At Motion, we’ve undergone a recent transformation, and we think that’s exciting. With a strong reputation as experts in our field, we’re turning inwards to foster a culture of belonging, giving and strength. Joining us now is a chance to be part of that momentum; an opportunity to make an impact in people’s lives and help create a company environment you believe in.
Thank you for taking the time to consider joining us. If you want to be part of our team, express your interest here.
Motion is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us.

About the role
Shopify is a fast-growing commerce company currently powering over 800,000 stores in more than 175 different countries. Merchants use our software to power their business across multiple sales channels, including web, and mobile storefronts, through social media and marketplaces, and in their brick-and-mortar and pop-up shops.
We are looking to add a Business Valuation Analyst, to our Strategic Expansion team. The Strategic Expansion team focuses on evaluating internal and external businesses, strategic identification and prioritization of new business opportunities, and developing intelligent perspectives on current and future opportunities.

About you
You have a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or relevant direct professional experience;
CFA designation is a big plus (or getting close to obtaining it - think Level II and above)
You have seen a lot of deals in your time and you’ve built a ton of sophisticated models to back them up
You have a rock solid understanding of financial modelling and valuation analysis
You’ve been exposed to a wide range of industries (SaaS should be one of them but we want to hear from folks who have been involved in other industries as well)
You possess strong technical, analytical skills and computer skills (particularly, modelling in Excel and building presentations - in other words you can teach us a thing or two!)
Your ability to synthesize tremendous amount of information/data is something you take pride in
You’re independent, a self starter and you thrive in an ambiguous, fast paced environment
Here's some of what will keep you busy
Creating sophisticated financial models including business valuations, revenue/ cost projections for acquisitions and partnership scenarios
Drafting detailed valuation reports
Assisting in the preparation of presentations targeted at senior management

Who we are
Although not a household name, State Street is one of the world’s largest and most important financial services institutions, providing round-the-clock services to the global investment community. We touch $33 trillion in assets every day and are the world’s third largest investment manager with over $2.8 trillion in assets under management. To do this we manage as much data as one of the internet giants on nearly as large a technical footprint.
In 2018, we launched one of the industry’s largest technical transformation projects, in effect building a new bank from the ground up. This project isn’t greenfield in the way most banks claim projects are; we’ve started with a blank sheet of paper both operationally and technically. We’re using the same technologies that Silicon Valley giants are using: use of multiple public clouds, building our own private cloud to achieve even better performance, transforming our industry through distributed ledger technology and machine learning.
This isn’t a traditional banking role. This is a chance to push your technical skills with people more comfortable in a technology firm than an investment bank, though solving real problems that affect anyone with any form of savings worldwide (not just trying to get people to click on ads).
What you will do
As a Jnr. Business System Analyst, your deep understanding of ITIL based processes system coupled with public cloud provider APIs enable you to design solutions enabling seamless interactions across the key SDLC ‘moments of truth’. You will be a key influencer in shaping the end to end ‘NoOps’ flow using cutting edge perspectives from our patent holding architects, process specialists. In addition, you will help shape the toolchain needed to deliver the desired experience. This role will require critical thinking necessary for diligent research into inherent tradeoffs around feasibility, cost, compatibility, etc.
Collaborate with product owners, scrum masters and architects in refining stories for proposed epics
Define end user ‘journey maps’ through process specifications and key interaction points, using ITIL processes to aid alignment with public cloud based capabilities
Map capabilities needed for journey mapping to application components and define approach for managing interim workarounds and process exceptions
Write design specifications with input from developers to aid configuration and development in a verifiable manner
Develop test cases to aid in verification of enabled processes
Who you are
General knowledge of agile software development concepts and processes (e.g., scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Understanding of DevOps principles (e.g., continuous integration and continuous delivery concepts)
Familiarity in journey mapping concepts and developing processes flows focused on addressing prioritized pain points
Ability to clearly translate business requirements into technical requirements
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes and propose redesigns or areas for improvements
Demonstrated ownership of test plan development and iteration-level testing
Understanding and comfort with the latest technologies used in the development, testing and monitoring of custom applications within a cloud environment
Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or related field
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.

Toronto, ONJob Description
IBM is seeking a Risk Analyst to strengthen the IBM Algo Risk Service and Data Management Teams.

IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud offers hedge funds, asset managers, pension funds and other buy-side organizations access to an award-winning web-based portfolio construction, financial risk management and reporting service without the costs or challenges of an in-house deployment. Offering bundled data, it provides a wide variety of simulation-based risk analytics that enable portfolio managers, traders, risk managers and senior executives to take a proactive approach to financial risk oversight and investment decision making.

The Role

Risk Analysts work in a multi-disciplinary group (business leads, technical consultants and core Development teams) to support the IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud framework or to assist in Data Quality and Validation. This framework involves data, analytics and reporting services that employ Risk Analytics Algo One applications. Working from an existing legacy platform, consultants assist in the transformation to a dynamic and flexible Cloud based risk service integrated with a proprietary Data Service.

Our team works collaboratively and members are encouraged to explore and develop unique ways to solve challenges employing advanced quantitative finance techniques. Projects require individuals who are able to research and experiment to develop new ideas and solutions. Working with an open and constructive mindset, guidance and feedback is available from the broader group.


Responsibilities :
Provide subject matter expert advice to internal and external audience for risk management topics including financial markets operations, product valuation methods, scenario based risk analysis and risk reporting standards.
Own functional projects related to feature extensions including interaction with development team (team & core), research and client service teams. Involves independent scope setting, task determination, priority setting and development support
Consulting with sales and pre-sales to present Service capabilities to prospects. Identify and fill gaps where necessary.
Investigation of data sourcing, transformation and storage for use in the risk management process. May involve extensive communication and negotiation with external vendors.
Investigation and remediation of client support issues (3rdlevel support).
Work with Development team to improve the core software offering.
Competencies and Skills :
Theoretical understanding of financial economics, mathematics and statistics.
Practical knowledge of financial markets and risk management standards.
Practical knowledge and experience around financial instrument valuation methods and (stochastic) scenario generation techniques.
Strong research and problem solving skills.
Familiarity with data science languages such as R or Python.
Written and oral presentation skills. Must be able to convey complex ideas to a functional and technical audience.
Technical aptitude including use of computer networks, Linux operating system and client/server applications.
Education :
University degree in the field of Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
Advanced degree in Financial Engineering or Mathematical Finance is beneficial.
CFA, PRM or FRM designation(s) beneficial.
**NOTE: the successful candidate will need to work from our 185 Spadina Ave office on a regular basis**

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry working with front or middle office portfolio risk management systems.
Experience in an advanced technical environment – collaborating on or writing scripts or code, integration, testing and deployment.
Experience with financial market data such as Reuters, Bloomberg or Interactive Data applications.

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

N/A

EO Statement
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Required Skills & Experience:

Diploma and/or degree preferably in Business or Computer Science
Strong analysis skills with the ability to interpret data to identify trends and present meaningful conclusions
Expert user in MS Excel
Minimum 2 years’ relevant experience (manufacturing experience preferred)
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written & presentation)
Strong people skills – able to deal with all levels of employees
Experience using SQL for analytics and reporting is preferred
Key Responsibilities:

Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information from production and sales data collection systems to help with the development of departmental budgets, improvement plans, and new product or program offerings.
Identifies the important information and trends in the analysis and highlights it for internal departments or external customers.
Generates weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad hoc reports for a variety of end-users (including both internal and external customers) to facilitate improved decision making across the organization.
Collaborates with operations and finance teams to ensure that all aspects of expense for production operations are captured within the budget and can be accurately reported.
Collaborates with the sales and customer service teams to ensure that quoting volumes, win/loss ratios, customer trend analysis, order processing costs, etc. are understood and actionable.
Understand administration, finance, sales, and production operations current process steps, systems, equipment, and techniques.
Develops Return on Investment analysis for various capital investments and projects.
Maintains quality service by following Webcom’s standards or generates requests for change when process improvements are identified.
Contributes to team effort by ensuring various project groups remain on task and provided assistance as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Please submit your cover letter and resume to human.resources@webcomlink.com noting the job title.
Only those selected for interview consideration will be contacted. Webcom encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Job Description
Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $60 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $140 billion. We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Vision
Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Values
Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride.

At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:
Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them.
Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge.
Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work.
Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.
Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader.

The Corporate Solutions Technology department within Mackenzie Investments is accepting applications for the position of Data Systems Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Systems Analysts & Architecture the successful candidate will be part of a small/agile team working with the Investment Management Division.
The Data Systems Analyst maintains a “business perspective” through all phases of the project and works with the entire IS project team to assist in the planning, designing and launching of new solutions in support of our growing business needs.

What we are looking for:
2+ years of experience working with business principles and different types of business data.
Post-secondary degree/diploma in a related discipline (Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or Information Systems Management).
Technical expertiseregarding data models, database design development, data analysis and reporting tools.
Knowledge of and experience with reporting/ business intelligence software (Tableau), databases (SQL, MongoDB), programming (Python, SQL).
Analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Understanding of IS Methodologies, processes and practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Planning and organizational skills with the ability to adapt to change and perform effectively under pressure.
Primary responsibilities will include but not limited to:
Liaise with business stakeholders to understand business objectives to design the solution that will meet their needs.
Elicit requirements from business stakeholders through interviews, workshops, business scenarios, and user stories.
Analyze system data requirements and model the data design to deliver to business requirements.
Design data acquisition and storage techniques for data from primary or secondary sources.
Query and review large data stores to understand the transactional information and business rules that govern the data. Identify outlying data patterns and data cleanliness issues for resolution.
Investigate and respond to data issues raised by business stakeholders.
Document the system specifications for the software development team.
Ensure the quality of the solution by testing the development results meet the business requirements.
Internal Applicants:
If you are interested in applying for this position please direct applications on-line using the “apply for this job” icon located at the bottom or to the left of the posting. If you would like to refer someone for the position please email the posting using the “email this job” option and have your referral indicate that they were referred by you when completing the application. All resumes should be received by March 27, 2019. If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Human Resources. Please record your extension number on your resume and cover letter. The job grade for this position is 9. The referral bonus for this position is 2.

External Applicants:
We thank all applicants for their interest in Mackenzie Investments; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Mackenzie Investments offers an exciting and challenging work environment, a competitive base salary, performance-based bonuses, excellent benefits, recognition for your accomplishments, and opportunities for personal and professional growth.

Mackenzie Investments is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodations in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please advise Human Resources if you require an accommodation.

Reporting to the Supervisor, Reference and Outreach, this position will take a support role in the provision of reference services including delivery of online reference services and the coordination of social media initiatives to enhance customer experience and engagement at the Archives. The primary functions associated with this position include, but are not limited to the following:

Provides information in response to both internal and external requests.
Develops and maintains data sets including, but not limited to business, economic activity and real estate indicators.
Inputs reports, documents, proposals and correspondence as required by the Unit.
Compiles information packages and other direct mail activities in support of Unit's activities.
Supports senior staff with special events and activities, coordinating seminars and meetings and attending functions as required to provide on-site assistance.
Establishing and maintaining filing system for Unit.
Answering telephone and written inquiries from the public and city staff.
Providing cover off on telephones for Division Staff as required.
Develops and maintains databases of programs, services, facilities, and political representation.
Reports on demographics and related statistics on subjects.
Develops, designs, and updates social media, and web pages.
Updates and maintains directories, statistics, and communications used by all levels in the division including management staff.
Responds to business-related requests for information both from internal and external sources.
Compiles and analyzes surveys used by the division for Performance Measures purposes and for other internal monitoring procedures.
Maintains a filing system of business related statistics.


Key Qualifications


Your application must describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in archives or library science or a related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
Experience in a customer service environment dealing directly with the public and staff through multiple channels (i.e. in-person, by telephone, in writing, and via social media).
Experience in providing reference services ie, identification of resources to members of the public.
Experience in researching, compiling, analyzing and reporting data for divisional performance measures.
Experience using social media to increase public engagement and outreach.
Experience using various software applications i.e. Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), databases, Outlook, Adobe, Hootsuite, etc.
You may also have:

Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and establish good working relationships with staff at all levels in the organization as well as external clients.
Ability to take initiative and identify opportunities for researcher/user engagement for the enhancement of services and programs.
Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and problem solving skills.
Ability to manage and develop relationships with customers and partners.
Ability to perform multiple tasks and work effectively, in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and the ability to complete data entry.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Interest in and understanding of Toronto history, municipal government, and archival research.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of purchasing, financial and administrative policies, procedures, and practices.
Ability to exercise good judgement and discretion, including sensitivity to public-sector information access and confidentiality requirements, and political neutrality.
Ability to work overtime as required.
Ability to lift/move boxes up to 30lbs in weight.
Ability to work under minimum supervision.

job_title: Category Business Analyst, Kids (12 Month Contract)
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporaryHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

This role will support the Kids department driven by seasonal demands of the business.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

.

Job Description
CRM Business Analyst
Reporting into the Manager of Business Insights & Analytics, the CRM Business Analyst will be the “go to” individual contributor for the Individual Insurance CRM (Salesforce.com). He/she will be responsible for CRM projects, enhancements, maintenance and best practices.
This is an exciting new role within the Insurance organization.
This unique and critical role will appeal to those individuals with a real passion for enhancing how the Insurance team currently uses the CRM. He/she will recommend best practices and improvements, and work with IT to implement technological improvements, with the intent of increasing the effectiveness and improving the overall user experience.
Key Accountabilities:
Administration and Maintenance of the CRM System – 45%
First line of support and troubleshooting for Insurance CRM users, escalating when necessary to the appropriate CRM IT Team.
Conduct ongoing needs assessment interviews with various partners to clearly understand how the system is being used
Work with Head of Sales Strategy to understand the overall sales objectives and how the technology can be enhanced to better support the objectives
Act as a central information resource to internal and external business partners.
Participate and represent Individual Insurance in multi-functional CRM meetings
Transfer knowledge to the Insurance team through coaching and consulting.
Actively work with the wholesalers to understand their needs and introduce solutions to make them more efficient and effective
Review CRM enhancement requirements with the requestor to ensure a full understanding of the needs to deliver the solution in an accurate and timely manner.
Management of inquiries received from the various internal/external Clients.
Develop and enhance controls as required including security models, user profiles and sharing rules.
Creation of change management plans for new releases, including communication strategy, training, timing of release and benefits to partners.
Project Management – 25%
Collect and prioritize all incoming requests for the Individual Insurance CRM.
As applicable, liaise with other lines of business within Manulife on new projects, initiatives and training.
Participate and help drive projects that support CRM enhancements.
Represent and advocate for the needs of the Insurance organization on new CRM projects and enhancements.
Liaise with Salesforce IT to coordinate system releases/implementations.
Work with business partners to strategically prioritize backlog.
Execution of test plans and ensuring that the delivered solution is working as understood and no additional impacts to the CRM have occurred
Take a leadership role in prioritizing enhancement requests.
Data Integrity and Management – 30%
Load and update mass data as required
Engage in weekly and/or monthly standard processes that keep the CRM updated and accurate (e.g. territory changes, wholesaler updates)
Actively monitor data for cleanliness and data integrity.
Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in CRM administration, business analysis and development.
Knowledge of Salesforce (including Apex, VisualForce, and Visual Workflow) is highly desired
Superior analytical and negotiation skills.
Strong awareness of the Insurance wholesaling processes as it pertains to financial advisors.
General business knowledge as well as knowledge of mainframe/datasets and other reporting tools.
Solid understanding of the upstream admin systems and downstream impacts to other areas.
Experience using PMF project management framework is an asset.
Experience with Agile Management Frameworks such as Scrum and Kanban is an asset.
Excellent organizational skills.
Ability to multi-task with proven customer service and coaching skills.
Proven communication skills (both verbal and written) combined with sound decision making skills.
Flexible, creative and responsive to customer needs and to miscellaneous assignments as assigned.
Attention to accuracy and detail is critical.
Excellent PC skills; knowledge of PC-Based software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Windows).
Solid team player with a high commitment to quality work and service.
Highly motivated and driven, able to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work directly with senior management contacts within Manulife and sometime with external partners and suppliers (as required).
Ability to develop positive internal business relationships and contacts.
Key Problems/Challenges:
Adapt to new requests and rapidly changing business requirements.
Keep current and adaptive to new technologies in a rapidly growing environment.
Multiple tasks with high volume and competing priorities.
Manage changing priorities and effectively handle a diverse workload.
Provide exceptional service in all business relationships while maintaining integrity and accuracy.
Maintenance of secure CRM functionalities and quality of data are critical to ensure continued business operations

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. Burlington, ONTransUnion believes in investing in the best people. Our dynamic and diverse environment values and promotes the growth of associates in their jobs, roles and careers. Our organization supports ambitious individuals who seek career satisfaction and development.

Who We Are
At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things.

Every day TransUnion offers our employees the tools and resources they need to find ways information can be used in diverse ways. Whether it is helping businesses better manage risk, providing better insights so a consumer can qualify for his first mortgage or working with law enforcement to make neighborhoods safer, we are improving the quality of life for individuals, families, communities and local economies around the world.

About the Team
Global Decisioning leverages industry data and analytics, coupled with our technology assets, to deliver decision sets, decision criteria and decisioning solutions that help our business customers achieve more. Flexibility, the desire to contribute and an entrepreneurial spirit are valued here. Other highlights include the business-casual atmosphere where our leaders are interested in removing obstacles to your success, making this a great place to grow in your career. We’ve been instrumental in winning important new business and more challenges are on the way.

What you will do

In this role, you will serve as a project manager and business analyst to deliver decisioning and fraud market initiatives on our client's industry leading decisioning platform.
We are seeking a technically savvy individual with the strong collaborative skills required to manage projects of varying scope and work with customers to elicit and document business and functional requirements.
This is a hands-on and fast-paced role where the incumbent will be a key member of the team working on a specific product, and will be responsible for configuring the customers’ requirements into business ready solutions. You will deliver projects on time and on budget, making modifications to project phases as needed to address changes or problems to original scope. You will drive projects to delivery by performing project administrative tasks such as: creating and maintaining project plans, completing project estimates, identifying and reporting action items and risks, project status reporting, meeting facilitation and preparation of meeting notes. You will facilitate meetings with customers to identify all details of business objectives and requirements. The output from those meetings will result in requirement documentation authored by you. You will lead collaboration to help identify creative solutions to meet customer needs and address problem resolution. You will configure, test and deliver decisioning solution requests (for new solutions as well as changes to existing) to customers in a timely manner ensuring that appropriate standards are followed and customer needs are met. You will work with the team’s development and quality assurance associates to ensure captured requirements are interpreted and delivered correctly. You will serve as a Subject Matter Expert and provide non-incident support to customers, sales and other team members.

What you will bring A minimum of 4 years of applicable business experience in IT / risk industry (credit or financial services background preferred). At least 4 years of project management experience, as a member of a project team with at least 1 year as a project lead. PMP designation is a preferred. A minimum of 4 years elicitation and authoring requirements as well as interaction with external customers. Technical proficiency and skill level to learn and undertake solution configurations. Excellent listening and communication skills coupled with a strong technical aptitude. Demonstrated flexibility in dealing with change and adversity. Practical understanding and experience in Agile methodology.

Accommodation is available, including for applicants with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

Job Summary

Provide functional and technical support in areas of Business Intelligence software and technologies, application delivery, life-cycle strategy and roadmap solutions. Job Description
NAV CANADA is a private company that owns and operates Canada’s civil air navigation service (ANS) and guides the world’s aircraft safely and expeditiously through Canadian-controlled airspace. With approximately 4,600 employees located from coast to coast, we offer some of the most exciting careers in the field of aviation.


Our Business Intelligence and Data Management is growing, and we are looking for candidates who are motivated and want to work with this high performing team as an experienced Analyst/Developer in Business Intelligence. This is a temporary role to start and is a great foot in the door. As part of this challenging role, you will provide support in the area of Power BI.
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Microsoft Power BI designing, developing and implementing reporting and dashboard solutions. This role will involve a significant amount of autonomy so the candidate should be comfortable working in a fast paced environment with little direction and can communicate upwards with self-confidence.
As a 2017 NCR Top Employer and 2018 Canada`s Top Employer, we offer a total compensation package that includes:
Competitive Base Salary and Leave Structure
Health Care and Dental Care Plan (with additional Health Spending Account)
Defined Benefit Pension Plan
Opportunities for professional and personal development and growth
***6 Month Term***
What you will be doing
Plan, analyze, design, develop and implement Power BI dashboards and
reports, and will advise and assist clients in support of their self-service Power BI development.
Partner and collaborate with the Business and IM teams to further advance capabilities and adoption of Microsoft Power BI.
Under the overall direction of the NAV CANADA Project Authority (the Manager, Enterprise Performance Management), will work as a member of the project team and shall be responsible for the following activities:
Develop Power BI reports and dashboard solutions.
Develop Power BI data models that aggregate data from multiple data sources to meet requirements.
Configure and setup application gateway refreshes.
Analyze of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system technical specifications.
Provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.
Create mock-up reports for proof of concept reviews.
Write functional/ non-functional and integrate test cases and test scripts from Power BI reporting business requirements and technical design documents.
Perform Power BI report test execution and document test results.
Assist clients during the User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Develop and update technical documentation.
Collaborate with our Data Architecture, Data Integration and IM teams to integrate data for Power BI applications.
Share best practices to ensure we leverage the best design available.
Provide training, mentoring, support and advice to clients on their self-service Power BI development and on how to query or analyze data and create robust visualizations.
Participate in team meetings to provide a status report of work in progress, accomplished and problems / issues encountered.
What we’re looking for
Graduated from a recognized university or college with a degree/certification in Computer Sciences/Information Technology, Business Administration, MBA and/or Aviation OR an acceptable combination of education, related experience and training.
Minimum 2 years hands-on work experience with Microsoft Power BI designing, developing and implementing dashboard and reporting solutions
Significant experience in the areas of:
Data warehousing design methodologies including Dimensional Data modelling; Star-Schema Modelling, Snowflake Schema Modelling, Fact and Dimension tables.
Business systems computer languages in particular for Oracle and MS SQL database technology (SQL, PL/SQL).
Developing reporting business requirements and translating those requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Developing test cases and scripts and performing all levels of testing and defect management.
Experience developing and optimizing Microsoft Power BI dashboards and reports with a focus on usability and performance
Experience creating compelling and meaningful visualizations, hierarchies and drill-down in Power BI
Experience using DAX Data Analysis expressions and functions, Power Pivot, Enhancing Power BI visuals, Data extraction and Power query for data transformation.
Experience with Power BI data modelling: defining a data model with calculated columns, measures and calculated tables using DAX.
Experience with Power BI security methodologies; aligning business use cases with security solutions.
Experience configuring Gateway services.
Experience with Power BI development best practices, industry standard, methodologies.
Experience with SAS and/or R language (‘nice to have’).
Experience with integrated team delivery, coordinating deliverables and contributing to planning with management.

Language Requirements:
Bilingual* (English, French)
* Language requirements are bilingual. However, in the event a qualified bilingual candidate is not found, a qualified unilingual candidate will be considered. Both bilingual and unilingual candidates are encouraged to apply
The successful candidate must meet the security requirement of the position and be legally able to work in Canada.

Calgary, ABPowering Possibilities …for Today & Tomorrow!

A leader in sustainable energy, TransAlta has over 100 years of experience generating power and is one of Canada’s top 50 Socially Responsible Companies since 2009, recognized as a global leader for sustainability and corporate responsibility standards. TransAlta operates 75 facilities in three countries; Australia, Canada, and United States.

TransAlta is committed to fostering a dynamic, productive and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountability, strong leadership and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.

Job Summary

TransAlta is currently seeking to place a qualified individual into the role of Analyst, Business Services & Analytics. This role will play a key role in tracking the flow of spend in TransAlta's Business and Operational Services team, particularly as it pertains to overhead costs, and partnering with budget leaders to reduce costs. This role will also be responsible for developing PowerBI dashboards to be used for monthly and quarterly budget updates. Developing PowerBI dashboards for tracking the performance, through quantifiable KPIs, for each group in Business and Operational Services, will also be a key component of this role. Partnering with leaders across the company, as well as Finance Leads, will be critical to success.

Reporting into the Manager, Business Services and Analytics, you will maximize the capabilities of Microsoft PowerBI, and other tools as applicable, to track, affirm and report on cost performance against budget for designated departments in TransAlta's Business and Operational Services team. You will also be tasked with creating cohesion with the applicable leaders, while driving continual efficiency improvements, to ensure alignment and understanding of monthly budget results and forecasts.

If you are seeking a challenge and are committed to building successful internal relationships, we want to hear from you!

Accountabilities:
Develop and manage Microsoft PowerBI dashboards to be used for monthly, quarterly and yearly budget updates.
Work with the leaders in Business and Operational Services to select the KPIs each group will be measured against.
Develop and manage Microsoft PowerBI dashboards to be used for monthly, quarterly and yearly performance updates as they relate to the quantifiable KPIs for each group under Business and Operational Services.
Accountable to ensure analytics raw data is accurate.
Analyze trends in cost and performance data, providing recommendations and implementing solutions where applicable, to improve and optimize the teams under Business and Operational Services.
Provide advice and guidance to leaders in Business and Operational Services in regards to processes, tools or resources.
Apply a structured methodology when developing data models.
Complete thorough testing and troubleshooting of data models.
Engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously while producing deliverables in alignment with standard templates.
Work alongside others to analyze alternative solutions and enhancements.
Cultivation of related internal relationships.
Accountable to deliver 1-3 month deliverables as agreed with the Manager.

Qualifications:
To be successful in this role, you are a technical expert in PowerBI. You have demonstrated the ability to develop and maintain simple PowerBI dashboards using complex underlying data. You will be able to demonstrate strong technical knowledge and have worked in a professional setting. You have the ability to clearly articulate what is being measured and why, and how performance is tracking against a target.

You will have:
A Bachelor's degree in Business or related field; as Accounting designation would be an asset.
Technical expertise in PowerBI; formal training would be preferable.
Minimum 3 years of experience in a professional setting.
Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining simple and easy to use PowerBI dashboards that clearly measure the quality of a service being provided, both from a performance and value perspective.
Demonstrated experience building internal relationships which deliver improvements and efficiencies, and work across organizational boundaries.
Effectiveness in working collaboratively with others and building cross functional productive relationships.
The ability to persuade or influence other people to accept a point of view, to adopt a specific agenda or to take a course of action.
The ability to exchange and report information effectively to all levels.
Demonstrated service-oriented approach with ability to listen and provide assistance in a timely manner.

Crucially, you are well organized and structured with excellent interpersonal skills and a proven capability in problem solving. You'll have a natural ability to guide people, manage stakeholder relationships, and drive change.
Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition.

Come on board!

Our commitment is to attract and retain the best talent. Some positions may require the successful completion of one or more background checks such as criminal, medical, or compliance.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Department: Information Services

Competition: 4070

Internal/External: Internal/External

Employment Type: Full time Permanent

Location: Moncton or Dartmouth

Salary: Comprehensive Compensation

Reports To: Team Leader


Role Summary:

In this role as a business analyst, you will work closely with various business areas throughout the organization to understand and analyze business requests coming into our area which is responsible for the data warehouse, the group quote and renewal system, and several business intelligence applications.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst your key responsibilities will include:

Managing business requests coming to our area and following them through to completion;
Defining and documenting requirements for business requests;
Providing frontline support of our Data Warehouse Applications;
Creation and maintenance of documentation on our work processes;
Participating in and coordination of user acceptance testing of our systems;
Providing excellent communication to business users on their requests; and
Supporting user questions and troubleshooting issues.
As the ideal candidate, you possess the following qualifications:
Education: University or college diploma in Business or Technology or equivalent work experience.

Work Experience: Minimum 3 to 5 or more years of experience as a Business Analyst

Other Qualifications:
Strong query ability in SQL;
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal);
Strong analytical skills with high technical aptitude;
Strong troubleshooting skills with high attention to detail while working in a fast paced environment;
Excellent interpersonal skills with a positive attitude and the desire to be a team player; and
Ability to manage multiple tasks at any given time.

Language: Bilingualism is considered an asset.

You also demonstrate the following core competencies:

Analytical Thinking: Strong technical aptitude with the ability to relate business needs to systems and potential solutions.

Communication Skills: Can critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying needs.

Execution and Organizational Skills: Can distinguish important details and understands how to effectively prioritize tasks and assignments.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Medavie Blue Cross is an equal opportunity employer.

FreshBooks has an ambitious vision. We launched in 2003 but we're just getting started and there's a lot left to do. We're a high-performing team working towards a common goal: building an elite online accounting application to help small businesses better handle their finances. Known for extraordinary product and customer service experiences and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries.

The Opportunity - Senior Data Analyst - Lifecycle

The Senior Analyst will enable FreshBooks to derive insight from campaign and customer interaction data to generate growth via increased Trial to Pay conversion rates. You love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with your manager and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.

What you'll do:

Consult directly with internal clients to gather requirements, scope & execute:
Dashboards for core performance metrics
Complex analyses on customer trends and long-term performance
Understand the impact of business decisions and able to provide recommendations using the data
Able to identify possible areas of improvement and drive change through working with multiple stakeholders
Provide both short and long-term solutions; able to find optimal solutions to address both
Complete regular ad-hoc analyses by translating raw data into useable information and insights:
A/B testing for campaign treatments
Email Send, Open, CTR, CTA etc review
Changes in trial usage behaviors (organically and due to marketing)
Profiling and trending of customer segments
Cohort based investigations tied to performance gains and losses
Plan selection and optimization
Designing, writing and implementing new reports, datasets and business intelligence tools to productionize 'valued' ad-hoc analyses
Assist with forecasting

What you have:

Advanced knowledge of SQL & Python or similar
At least 3 years in data analytics and/or business intelligence
Advanced knowledge of Excel (external data connections, macros, VBA, etc)
Quantitative background with strong analytical skillset
Experience using a dashboarding tool such as Periscope, Tableau, Looker etc
Experience in calculating and tracking LTV, CPA, ROI, churn, acquisition & related metrics
Knowledge of Google Analytics (or a similar web analytics tool)

Business Analysis Sr Manager
Citi’s Trade & Treasury Solutions (TTS) is a leading provider of Cash Management, Treasury and Trade Solutions. With a global network spanning more than 100 countries, TTS has a global platform that is unique in the industry for its reach and flexibility. We provide clients with timely, accurate information and dynamic, web-based tools to effectively manage their financial positions, working capital, payment capabilities and view of their financial supply chain.
We are seeking a senior Business Analyst who can also lead a team of data analysts and business analysts who will be responsible for build out enterprise and conformed logical models on Citi's Big Data and GIW platform that houses our TTS products.
The ideal candidate should be:
Technically astute, well organized, proactive and be comfortable discussing issues with business and technical users at all levels
He/she requires exceptional communication skills across both technology and the business and will have a high degree of visibility.
The candidate must have strong motivation to lead and be successful in their endeavors, great teamwork and team building skills, mentor junior resources and have sound character and interpersonal skills

The ideal candidate will be dependable and resourceful software professional who can comfortably work in a large development team in a globally distributed, dynamic work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration. The ability to work in high-pressured environment is essential.
Key Responsibilities:
Overall responsibilities include leading the team of data analysts and business analysts working on creating conformance models on the Vanguard platform across various TTS products.
Should be able to understand the functional flows, complex calculation logic and data flow across various systems and products within TTS Data & Analytics platform
Review, analyze, and interpret Business Requirements Documents (BRD) and providing feedback on key functionalities and technical feasibility
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Experience in writing & reviewing functional requirement document specification and data dictionaries to clearly articulate requirements and mapping of data elements to UI elements.
Being the interface between the Product stake holders and technical team and should be able to bridge any gap related to requirements
Work with stakeholders for requirement scoping, preparation of product backlog and work with Scrum master / project manager for defining sprint backlogs
Lead & work as product owner with Scrum teams for various streams and provide valuable inputs to deliver increment releases for given application / product
Responsible for key process improvements in business analysis space
Create business model and logical data models for cash management products.
Reverse engineer the business model for the Cash management products on existing applications.
Adhere to the requirements processes as well as SDLC to gather, write and maintain FRDs. Conduct FRD walkthroughs for multiple teams (Development, Quality Control, User Acceptance Testing, Training, Market Readiness and Operations) to explain new and enhanced functionality.
Develop prototypes and Business Use Case Scenarios to facilitate the gathering and documentation of requirements
Partner with the business and technical teams and create and maintain the Functional design for the various modules in the platform.
Work with cross functional teams across multiple countries and time zones
Follow the SDLC process established in the organization and create and maintain all relevant requirements artifacts

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:
At least 10+ years overall IT experience in Financial Services with 6+ years’ experience as business analysts or data scientist
Experience in leading team of business analysts and data scientists would be preferred
Must have hands-on experience in developing writing, and communicating business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Expertise in creating data models, process flows and sequence diagrams are must.
Expertise to create and interpret SQL queries and related software (SQL Developer,Toad).
Experience with Oracle, SQL server, Database concepts, ETL processes, reporting tools .
Some experience with Hadoop, HDFS. Impala and any other bid data platforms is an asset.
Experience in Agile methodology as Product Owner in Scrum team would be preferred.
Knowledge in Project management practices, Software Development Lifecycle, Release, Change and Stakeholder management
Experience in managing communications across business and technology stakeholders at varying levels across a medium to large scale enterprise
Strong communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation of complex information and data).
Expert in using the tools like JIRA and any other requirements tracking / traceability tools
Ability to draft Use Cases, Process Flows, and Activity Diagrams.
Experience in supporting external clients which includes attending calls, conducting product demos and help triage client issues
Non-technical knowledge, experience, and skills (leadership, management) is required
Excellent planning, organization and prioritization skills to meet ever changing demands of delivery stream
Bachelor’s degree (in Science, Computers, Information Technology or Engineering)

Toronto, ONThe Company
-----------

Our mission is to connect the world's photographers. Every month, millions of people from around the world use our website and mobile apps to find, share, and get rewarded for the world's most inspiring photography.

------

The Job
-------

As a data analyst you will bring 500px's understanding of our Community and Licensing business to the next level and help us move forward confidently with data-informed decisions. The Data Analyst is responsible for contributing to creation of KPIs and dashboards, conducting business impact analysis, evaluating product usage and trends, and using data to find business growth opportunities. The Data Analyst reports to the Data Team Lead and will collaborate with Senior Leadership to influence Licensing related decisions and performance.

------

What You'll Be Doing
--------------------


Interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions through gathering information from various sources and interpreting patterns and trends
Conduct complex queries on our data warehouse to help teams get the data they need, and maintain key reports and dashboards to track operational and business metrics
Build and maintain dashboards and reports that enable the Senior Leadership, Product, and Marketing teams to: drive business decision-making, drive performance and answer business questions in a measurable and actionable manner
Tell data stories to stakeholders by drawing insights from data analysis, bringing insights together to formulate the story and making recommendations for actions
Help your cross-functional team with data reports and data discovery by optimizing self-serve BI solutions and providing SQL support
Develop data collection plans and ensure the integrity of data collected
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns of user features and activities
Analyze trends in image usage via image metadata, sales reports, categories and keywords
Work with the technology team to identify, implement and maintain the systems we need to collect, verify, and analyze behavioural data
Define standards for data quality, and support the technology team in meeting those standards
Communicate and distribute data insights, tailoring presentations and findings to audiences across all levels of the organization

------

What the Ideal Candidate Will Have
----------------------------------


A Bachelor's or Master's degree in statistics, computer science, math, physics, or a related quantitative field
1-2 years professional experience of consultation to internal groups or departments
Expert knowledge of statistical sciences: statistical modelling and data mining
Expert knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL
Proficiency in querying MySQL and Redshift databases
Excellent analytical skills including cohort analysis, funnel analysis, AB testing, and lifetime value analytics
Hands-on experience with Python and/or R.

You'll get bonus points for:

Experience with community based platforms
Experience with commercial licensing an asset
Knowledge of third party tools like Optimizely, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Braze
Knowledge of advanced data analysis topics such as: causal inferences, data simulation, or correlated data analysis (e.g., survival analysis, longitudinal analysis, time series analysis and forecasting)
Working experience with python libraries for data wrangling, visualization, mining and modelling (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Statsmodels, SciKit-Learn, NLTK)
Working experience with R packages for data wrangling, visualization and modelling (e.g., reshape2, dplyr, stringr, lubridate, ggplot2, car, forecast, randomforeset, Caret, survival)
Knowledge of business intelligence such as SaaS metrics, time series forecasting, or pricing analysis
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL

------

Perks
-----


Interesting technical challenges
Competitive salaries
Flexible hours
Catered lunches, snacks and drinks
Great health and dental benefits

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Who We Are Looking For:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to play an instrumental role in the development of our data strategy and research innovative data solutions to solve real market problems. You will also be responsible for designing and implementing groundbreaking solutions utilizing large-scale data sets. This individual is also responsible for conducting research, coordination & collaboration with various internal teams, and working closely with engineering to integrate solutions into our production systems.
In addition to these responsibilities, you will also have exposure to other aspects of the business such as:
End-to-end ownership of data acquisition, management, preparation and presentation
Extracting and preparing actionable reports and dashboards based on gathered data
Document data flow and acceptable usage policies
Work closely with the data team with entry and analysis support
Assist in managing co-op students by providing them with a valuable learning environment and facilitating their development
Your skills & experience:
1-3 years related experience
Background in Computer Science, Computational Science, Mathematics or related field
Hands-on experience managing and overseeing data conversion, cleaning, and preparation
Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Javascript
Experience in, and knowledge of data visualization, techniques, and tools: Tableau, Google Data Studio or D3.js
Knowledge of databases and data warehouses: relational, noSQL, Hadoop
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Working knowledge of data governance principles and best practices
Seeing the 'big-picture' is easy for you, and you can look past the 'how' and understand the 'why' with ease
You have a business mind with a technology acumen – you can understand a business objective or problem, and create a valuable, flexible, and scalable technology solution (no coding required)
Experience working with cross-functional teams
Excellent MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) & Google Apps proficiency
Impeccable attention to detail is an absolute must
Strong oral and written communication skills
Possess a "Do Whatever it Takes" attitude to get the job done
Self-starter that is comfortable working with minimal oversight and tight deadlines
Ability to work among changing priorities and timelines, you are not a 9-5er
What We Do
Motoinsight data and technology are used by nearly every automaker, over 900 dealership franchises and the largest banks and insurance companies. Motoinsight's flagship digital retailing platform MotoCommerce™ enables revolutionary omni-channel and e-commerce enabled car buying experiences. Across its portfolio of owned and partnered automotive websites, Motoinsight also has one of the largest audiences of in-market new vehicle buyers which include premier brands such as Unhaggle, Consumer Reports, Globe Drive, Driving.ca, Black Book and others. The company is headquartered in Toronto, Canada and was founded in 2011. For further information, visit www.motoinsight.com.
Recently, Motoinsight has been named one of Deloitte's Technology Fast 50™ and Canadian Business Profit 500 fastest-growing companies.
Who We Are
Motoinsight technology is best-in-class, but it is our people that truly make the difference. We are serious about our culture. We hire, promote and reward based on our People Values. This is what you can expect from each member of our team.
Ownership

Summary
The Business/Reporting Analyst will help us extract meaning from large volumes of data to make the right business decisions. The candidate will have to set the right vision, strategy and roadmap and work alongside with stakeholders in the organization to make it happen. The candidate knows and has a passion for working with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner with business leaders to answer key business questions. Responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. Utilized strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer.
General Responsibilities
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions

Perform all basic phases of report development, including intake from a request queue, transformation or acquisition of data, report creation, and documentation of processes

Translate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with some effort to anticipate future questions

Develop business requirements and process documentation for ad-hoc, on demand, and standard reports

Leverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide recommendations on report design and automation; using best practices to meet business needs

Collaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processes

Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve marketing campaign targeting and measurement in the future

Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development team

Preparing and delivering business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks

Work with engineering and the data warehouse to enable the appropriate capture and storage of key data points

Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format

Participate in strategic & tactical planning discussions

Qualifications
General Qualifications
4-year degree from an accredited institution in Business, Information Technology, Business Analytics or related field Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Computer Science, Information Management or related field OR combination of education and significant experience required (advanced degree preferred)

Two (2) years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Microsoft BI stack (Excel/SSRS/PowerBI) or other current reporting tools is required.

Two (2) years of experience writing complex queries using T-SQL/PL SQL.

Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting priorities

Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.

Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisions

Understanding of relational database design and concepts.
