The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
POSITION:
Critical Care Services Ontario’s (CCSO) mission is to identify critical care system needs and collaborate with healthcare partners to improve access, quality and integration for patients. CCSO collaborates with clinicians, hospital administrators, Local Health Integration Networks (LHINs), the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care (MOHLTC) and other health sector partners in strategic planning and priority setting, monitoring performance management and system accountability, developing policy, programs, and evaluation, and integrating best practices.
The SBA (Senior Business Analyst) maintains responsibility for supporting the provincial implementation of Ontario’s Critical Care Strategy and associated programs, under the direction of the Project Manager and Director.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Event Planning:Plan, coordinate, lead and evaluate high quality events including but not limited to provincial tours, professional conferences key stakeholder meetings and webinars.Venue, AV and catering selection and room setup; venue negotiations, contract management, on-site event managementBudgeting and cost managementMarketing and communicationsInternal planning meetings including agenda setting, preparation of materials and recording of meeting minutesRelationship management including venues, printers, and speaker management
Critical care system development and related projects:Conduct health care and health system focused research including environmental scans, analysis and knowledge translation of quantitative and qualitative data, leading practice researchCoordinate stakeholder engagement activities, including agenda setting, preparation of materials for presentation/input, recording stakeholder feedback, synthesis of input to support completion of project deliverablesPlan and conduct meetings and conference calls with stakeholdersDraft and refine policy documents and other publications, including briefing notes, strategy documents, toolkits and guidelines.
Communications and program branding:Development of website content and website layoutDevelopment of communication guidelines and presentation templatesAssist with writing, copy editing, design and production of documents/materials including toolkits, briefing notes, scorecards, data booklets and reports.Review of publicly released documents to ensure alignment with CCSO communication standardsAdvise on communication strategies for maintaining stakeholder engagement and linkages with the broader critical care communityAccountability for supporting execution of communication strategies and stakeholder outreach.Other duties as assigned.
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education:

An undergraduate degree in Business Administration, communications, public relations or similar preparationEvent Management Certificate, and Project Management preparation highly desiredCommunications background preferredMasters level education an asset.

Experience:Experience working in a provincial organization is preferred (preferably in a not-for-profit or healthcare environment).Three to five years of event planning in a service-oriented industry required.Proven experience developing and executing professional events similar to provincial tours and conferences is required.Previous stakeholder engagement experience required.Excellent interpersonal skills and a confident presence in dealing with stakeholders.Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously demonstrated through strong project management and administrative skills.A solid foundation of project and critical path management in relation to complex events is required.Expert in Microsoft office applications, including MS Outlook, Excel, Access, and Word required.Experience with developing web and social media strategies, preferred.Experience using Mail Chimp, Eventbrite and other event software is required.Communications and branding experience preferred.
Skills/Abilities:Excellent analytical, problem solving, and negotiation skills are required.Excellent organizational skills and an ability to monitor and ensure project deliverables are completed accurately and on time are required.Strong competencies in planning, communications, budgeting, and stakeholder relationship management are required.Excellent interpersonal skills and a confident presence in dealing with stakeholders is required.Ability to work well under pressure and demonstrate sound judgment in determining appropriate course of action quickly (including when to escalate issues for resolution) is required.Demonstrated ability for accuracy and thoroughness with an exceptional attention to detail is required.Proactive and able to anticipate, communicate and resolve issues in a professional and tactful manner.Excellent verbal and written communications skills are required.Ability to take initiative and embrace challenges is required.Ability to work independently and as a team member is required.Computer literacy is required, preferably in a Microsoft office environment, with an aptitude for learning new computer applications quickly.Adherence to confidentiality policy for sensitive data and information is required.Excellent ability to facilitate conversations, openness to various opinions, perspectives and input, ability to analyze and synthesize discussions into written documents and actions is required.

JOB SUMMARY:
Working under general supervision, the Solution Analyst will be part of our data delivery team and contributes to Wawanesa success by designing, documenting, testing and supporting our enterprise data warehouse solutions to meet business stakeholder requirements.

You are someone that will have strong system and business analytical skills with a strong technical acumen with SQL query writing.

Contribute to the analysis, design and documentation of both system and business requirements for application enhancements and projects.
Participate in requirement sessions with business and system teams.
Collaborate with multiple functions to ensure quality software
Create test cases based on requirements documentation and defect resolutions
Contribute to the communication of system solutions in business and technical terms.
Contribute to the resolution of both business requirements and system issues.
Follow established practices, processes and guidelines.
Knowledge of system standards and IS department established methodologies.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Completion of post-secondary degree/certificate or equivalent experience.
Experience performing systems and/or business analysis or equivalent role is considered an asset.
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and best practices.
Effective analysis and problem-solving skills for collecting data to analyze options.
Effective attention to detail skills to produce deliverables that consider the areas involved.
Effective communication skills to share information with others.
Effective planning and organizing skills to develop plans and meet deadlines.

Experience with Oracle, and/or MS SQL server is an asset.
Experience in programming languages is considered an asset.
Knowledge and experience in insurance industry is considered an asset.

Toronto, ONThe Sr. Business Analyst provides Application expertise and is responsible for the customization, support, maintenance, and problem resolution of Financial Systems / applications in a high availability mission critical environment. This position requires detailed working knowledge of the underlying data flow and structure of a variety of systems including Oracle Order to Cash, ESO (Electronic Sales Order), SFDC (Sales Force Dot Com) and other supporting systems such as Datawarehouses (ESDB/CCDB) and supporting implementation systems (Estart primarily), experience in Project Management and working with the broader Sales, Finance and Implementation teams.

Duties and responsibilities:

Analyse product gaps and business needs using high level interpretative skills. Map requirements to existing Application features, determine business, technical fit, and document proposed set up change, system change or detailed business and functional specifications as appropriate to achieve required results.
Propose solutions that will meet the business need in the context of the minimal customization on common platforms between Canada and the US to enable Canadian functionality in the required timeframes.
Ensure the highest level of quality is delivered in upgrades, changes, releases and implementations by supporting the build and use of test environments. Create test strategies and plans, write specific test cases, and build transactions to run tests and verify results. All variances must be adequately explained and documented prior to implementation.
Provide operational support to business teams as required through the implementation phases of the various systems.
Build and document processes - final and interim to support business timelines
Analyse data, document data definition between existing and new systems; build report requirements where required, document reporting/data processes where needed.
Provide ongoing support and expertise of products and systems, diagnosing problems and assisting in the development of solutions. Coordinate with the users and applicable technology teams to ensure the timely resolution of daily processing difficulties and issues. Maintain a high level of quality service with minimum impact to the Business and our clients.
Facilitate and participate in project prioritization plans, adding valuable input to deliverables, impact, scope and project schedules weighing benefits vs. costs.
Plan deliverable implementation and change management ensuring sufficient lead time and communication to modify business processes, prepare impacted associates, maintain set up documentation and adhere to change control standards.
Build and manage a long term client relationship, anticipating and addressing underlying needs, proactively adding value to products, services and processes.
Mentor and train team members and peers in the Financial Systems Group in order to build bench strength within the department.
Build and share knowledge of Sales, Order to Cash and associated reporting processes, interfaces, relationships. Facilitate Project Planning activities with internal and external partners, locally and internationally
Build and manage close relationships with Development partners through fostering a win-win approach to project management and accountability.
Qualifications:

Excellent knowledge of Oracle systems (ESO and OTC) with specific emphasis on data structure, workflow, set-up and implementation
Strong knowledge of sales and financial processes and logical work flows
Strong knowledge of data, data structures, methods to integrate data from disparate sources, and build data repositories as needed.
Project Management, Business and Systems Analysis experience, proven superior analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to think strategically, grasp business linkages and communicate complex concepts to others
Ability to promote and negotiate new ideas and procedures and to influence without authority
Strong communications including documentation, facilitation, interpersonal, written and verbal skills
Ability to work independently and in project groups and manage time and multiple time-zones and work well under pressure
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, and Project Management Tools
Experience:
Minimum of 5+ years experience as Business Analyst focusing on Sales Order process, Order to Cash processes and/or reporting and data analytics

Education:
College or University degree in Computer Science or equivalent business related experience

Job Title:
Salesforce Business Analyst

Salesforce Business Analysts are tasked with providing consistent client support throughout the implementation lifecycle. The Analyst provides a balance of functional and technical expertise and supports the Solution Architect in facilitation of analysis and design sessions with the client. The Analyst then implements the design using Salesforce declarative configuration and supporting the functional requirements for any further development required outside of declarative configuration.

The Analyst presents complex information equally well to a C-level audience or a developer community, and has hands on experience implementing Safesforce.com functionality and can act as a knowledgeable liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders during the implementation phase.

Analysts can also support internal practice development efforts as needed, providing input on industry based expertise and idea generation for Slalom intellectual property.

Responsibilities:
Typically provide full time support throughout the implementation lifecycle as a key member of the implementation teamSignificant involvement in the Analysis phases of the implementation, collecting and documenting functional requirements, and understanding and possibly re-defining business process based on the capabilities of the platformWhile the Solution Architect maintains primary responsibility for the system architecture and design, the Analyst will support the design efforts by documenting suggested data models, technical process flows, integration, and migration specificationsPrimary resource responsible for all declarative configuration within Salesforce.com including security and sharing, object creation and definition, workflow and validation, approval processes, etc.Responsible for the creation of all requirements and process documentation including functional requirements, business process requirements, technical design document, integration specifications and data migration specificationsResponsible for successful completion of unit and function testing as well as all supporting documentation required for the Validation phase (i.e. test plans, test scripts)Responsible for supporting the client through User Acceptance Testing and any support for defect management during UAT processInvolved in all aspects of Deployment phase including migration of configuration/code, production data migration, and interface go-liveTypically, responsible or heavily Involved in the creation of end user and administrator training material, as well as potentially delivering end user training

Qualifications:
3-7 years of related experienceKnowledgeable on the following CRM Business Processes (Sales, Marketing Automation and Strategy, Service/Call Center, Custom Application Development using the Salesforce platform).One of the following certifications: Certified Salesforce.com Sales Cloud Consultant, Certified Salesforce.com Service Cloud Consultant.

Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Saint John, NBJob Description

Our ideal candidate:
You will be the voice of our customers – skilled at translating real business problems into practical solutions that will add value. You are curious about our customers – and are skilled at asking the right questions to fully understand their business needs: are we solving the right problem? You go beyond simply creating requirements - you lead the effort by sharing customer stories in a way that everyone on the team can understand. You are passionate about customer experience – and aren’t afraid to ask the hard questions and challenge the status quo to deliver the right solution. You can balance your love of detailed analysis with your drive to meet deadlines – and can guide the process from idea through to the testing phase.
More specifically:
A business analyst on our team is expected to:
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization from sales to development to gather and elaborate product requirements that represent the business needs
Organize, prioritize and model requirements to facilitate communication and verification with project stakeholders
Demonstrate ownership of feature analysis and test
Interact with the solution team to assure that requirements are correctly understood and implemented
Plan the project business analysis activities including the tasks, deliverables, estimates-of-effort, stakeholder list, communication of deliverables, documentation management and requirements management
Look for process quality issues and recommend process improvements
Take action on recommending solutions to issues/gaps as they arise
Identify/communicate risks on feature development
Provide accurate estimates for analysis and test
Execute work to meet requirements/quality on usability and functionality within the estimated timelines
Create/Review the test strategy definition - identify risks, scope, environment, data and test tool requirements
Create & execute test cases – raise defects where required and review test results with the development team
Provide support to Product Development, Customer and Field Teams and ensure solutions are adequately documented and understood
Clearly identify impacts of changes

Qualifications

A degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Analytics, or similar experience in Software Development processes
Strong data analysis and problem solving abilities
Knowledge of quality approaches
Ability to quickly learn and utilize new technologies
Ability to work well in a fast paced team environment
Ability to write high quality product documentation, specifications, use cases and test cases
Highly motivated
Excellent written and verbal communications skills and ability to perform product training sessions for internal and external customers
Flexible and used to working in a rapidly changing environment
Knowledge of the following would be beneficial:
Agile development methodologies.
Defect management
MS Office tools including Visio
Automated testing tools
UML and use cases
Knowledgeable on SQL Server, Oracle databases, NoSQL solutions, Windows NT, UNIX

Full-Time Permanent - Competition #19-09
Position Summary

As part of the Business Intelligence Services department, the Data Analyst is responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of enhanced reporting and analytic visualizations and dashboards to continuously enhance ASEBP's ability to fulfill its mandate. This position will be responsible for developing reports, and conducting analyses on a wide variety of issues using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience. The Data Analyst will work closely with internal business customers and subject matter experts.
Your Key Responsibilities
Enhanced reporting
Develop solutions to reporting and information requirements by analyzing information needs and developing reports for ASEBP's internal and external clients.
Respond accurately and in a timely manner to ad hoc requests for data analysis and reports.
Develop visualization and dashboard reports.
Conduct analyses that identify and assess business opportunities and address key business challenges.
Provide advice on and interpretation of business data.
Provide support to plan design.
Recommend potential visualized Board report options.
Develop solutions based on information requirements.
Create queries to support ad hoc requests for data and reports that integrate a full view of the business need into actionable information.
Provide demographic and claims utilization information to the Plan Actuary for use in premium rate setting, including experience adjustments; update the historical overview of experience adjustment standings using the Plan Actuary's results.
Assist with operational reporting
Responds to reporting requests from business areas.
Action day-to-day report requests as they relate to visual data.
Assist data warehouse team
Participate in data warehouse initiatives.
Identify any data issues with the data warehouse and other source systems.
Your Education and Experience
Completion of a two-year technical or community college certificate in Computer Science, Business, or a related discipline.
Three to five years of related experience.
Demonstrable experience working with:
Microsoft Reporting Services (SSRS)
Data Models
Database design & SQL Server
Other Microsoft programs.
Advanced working knowledge of data visualization tools.
Strong knowledge of data analysis and presentation tools such as Power BI or other similar BI tools.
Experience working with data warehouse facts and dimensions.
A strong understanding of the structure of relational databases and their implementation.
Your Abilities
Proven ability to work effectively with large volumes of data, business lines and plans.
Analytical abilities, attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Strong SQL, T-SQL, query writing abilities.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to organize workflow and priorities.
Strong customer service focus with the ability to meet varying client needs.
Demonstrated flexibility, initiative, perseverance and integrity.
Effective time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects over varying time lines.
Strong communication, presentation & interpersonal skills.
About the Alberta School Employee Benefit Plan
The Alberta School Employee Benefit Plan (ASEBP) is a health and welfare trust governed by ten Trustees, five of whom are appointed by the Alberta School Boards Association and five of whom are appointed by the Alberta Teachers' Association. ASEBP promotes programs that sustain healthy lifestyles and workplaces for over 60,000 covered members in almost 60 school jurisdictions across Alberta.
Working for ASEBP is about more than supplying great benefits. ASEBP offers:
a team-focused culture that supports people and performance
competitive compensation that goes far beyond a paycheque
an exciting chance to make an impact in the lives of Alberta's school employees
advancement opportunities in a stable, growing organization
a wide range of health and wellness initiatives that encompass mental, physical and nutritional health
For more information about ASEBP, please visit the "About" section of our website (www.asebp.ca).
If you have the required qualifications and would like to become a member of our team, please submit your resume. This posting will remain open until the role has been filled.
No phone calls please. We thank all interested individuals, but only those candidates being considered for an interview will be contacted. ASEBP is an equal opportunity employer.
Please note that an account will automatically be created for you during the application process if you do not have an ApplicantPro account set up already.

YOU ASK ALL THE right QUESTIONS.
Posted: 2019-03-25

Closing: 2019- 03-29

Location: Edmonton Kingsway
ABOUT YOU
You understand that knowledge is a powerful thing – and for you there's nothing more fulfilling than promoting and enabling data based decision making. You're an info junkie who loves diving into the data to better understand people. You have a knack for data and details, without losing sight of the big picture. You've got the skills to translate complex concepts into plain English; you communicate clearly every step of the way; and you work well with a broad group of people.
WHAT MOVES YOU
You're the ultimate multi-tasker, able to juggle multiple projects and requests with ease in a deadline-oriented environment – and you make it look easy.
You think that important stories are buried in numbers and you want to be the one that finds them.
You're an excellent communicator (both verbal and written), an even better listener, and have an almost telepathic ability to anticipate and meet the needs of others. Spooky!
You thrive in a collaborative environment, where change is the name of the game.
You're comfortable working directly with all levels of management to accomplish common goals.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Manager, Business Intelligence and Analytics.
Collaborate with business units and IT to define and document: data reporting and business analytics requirements, cubes, data dictionaries, data models and dashboards.
Ongoing development and enhancements of data integrity processes, data quality assurances, reporting, analysis and formats.
Synthesize user requirements keeping in mind data, business process and system restrictions and assist in translating requirements.
Converting data into relevant consumable information to help business in making informed decisions through data mining, statistical and predictive modeling.
Identifying and assesses relevant sources of data within AMA's business units.
Leveraging new data collection processes (e.g.: social media, NLP, Databricks, geo-location information, clickstream, metering data, etc.) to build prediction systems integrated with the future direction or AMA Insurance.
Processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of all data used for analysis.
Continually working with IT to improve processes impacting data quality, collection and the storage of internal and external data used in analysis.
Developing business metrics to measure improvements and monitoring of performance of business decisions.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have a Bachelor's degree in a related field (mathematics, statistical, economics, computing science, information management/technology).
You've an understanding of Statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, predictive analytics, multivariate testing and optimization algorithms – because you are smart that way.
You have experience with data, data warehousing, and business intelligence systems and approaches, including reporting tools like Power BI.
You're an Excel and SQL expert and can do data queries and pivot tables with one hand tied behind your back.
You'll get bonus points if you have experience programming with R, Python, Java, C++ or similar languages.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

company_name: British Columbia College of Nursing Professionals
job_description: Does the idea of data, where it comes from, how and why we use it, and under what authority, light a fire for you? Do you get excited helping people analyze their data? If yes, read on if you want to be a part of our team!The BC College of Nursing Professionals (BCCNP) has an opening for a Data Analyst (DA) in the Operations Department. In this role, you will work closely with the Information Systems Team to identify and facilitate the collection and analysis of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make various informed business decisions.DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?Data is like a puzzle for you. You enjoy understanding data, linking it to policies, recognizing the relationships of information, how it is classified, who owns it, what legislation enables the College to gather and use it. You have managed databases and data warehouses, and you know how to deliver excellent customer service.WHO WE ARE:BCCNP is the college empowered under the Health Professions Act to regulate the practice of all licensed practical nurses, registered nurses, registered psychiatric nurses and nurse practitioners in British Columbia. Regulation helps to protect the public by ensuring that professional care or service received by the public is competent, ethical and meets the standards that society views as acceptable.At BCCNP each of us strives to meet our commitment to the following values to maintain a workplace that is respectful and supports the well-being of every BCCNP employee:Trust is essentialBetter togetherSpeak the truthProtect the publicStay curiousAs a member of the team, you can expect to be treated in a respectful and professional manner. While your workload will be busy, the College supports staff in achieving a healthy work-life balance.WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?Reporting to the Chief Officer, Operations, and working closely with the Information Management and Corporate Risk Team Lead the Data Analyst (DA) requires an understanding of BCCNP’s mandate and statutory obligations to collect and disclose information under our legislative framework and information sharing agreements signed with external organizations.The work of the DA is to identify and facilitate the collection of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make informed business decisions on our registrants, support the authorized disclosure of information and to support strategic decision making, including developing reports for the management team, BCCNP Board, external stakeholders, and for predictive analytics.The DA is responsible for working with data owners to ensure the quality and integrity of data collected and created by BCCNP is reliable.RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Planning, coordinating, controlling, developing and implementing controls on the lifecycle management of data including data analysis, data preparation, data modelling, and data evaluation.Leading the evaluation of data needs of stakeholders and researching, implementing, and supporting business intelligence tools to meet these needs. Reviewing and making recommendations to improve the delivery of data requests, reports and to support e-discovery and/or FOI requests.Assessing the data, including understanding the interrelationships among data elements, investigating data quality issues, and working with the relevant data owners and stakeholders to correct and/or improve data quality issues.Implementing and maintaining a data migration project and/or a national registry.Developing and implementing various data modelling techniques to address the business needs of stakeholders, to detect patterns, interrelationships, and abnormalities among various data elements and making predictions, forecasts and monitoring trends.Responding to requests from internal and external stakeholders for data, developing reports and data extracts in meeting reporting requirements, assessing the key attributes of data and information (i.e.) integrity, accuracy, timeliness, appropriateness and their limitations within the context of the intended use.Developing, implementing and maintaining a data glossary and data dictionary which includes defining, classifying information fields and mapping BCCNP data with external organizations’ data structure as stipulated in our information sharing agreements.Reviewing and recommending policies and processes to control where data is stored and how it is shared.Assessing and evaluating data models periodically to determine the reliability and usefulness of the models in supporting business and data objectives.Monitoring and verifying that the data extracted from organizational systems is correct.Responding to and addressing privacy and confidentiality considerations relating to requests for information and reports.YOUR EDUCATION & SKILLS:A baccalaureate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. An advanced graduate certificate in data analytics is an asset.3 to 5 years of experience as a data/information and/or reporting analyst managing and controlling data.Demonstrated experience working with databases (MS SQL), advanced MS Excel, extract, transform, and load (ETL) frameworks, knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and business intelligence tools.Excellent quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Demonstrated knowledge and application of relevant legislation; ethical and legal obligations, guidelines relating to privacy, confidentiality and security of information.Ability to plan, prioritize and manage workload within a time sensitive environment.Demonstrated ability to keep track of industry trends in data analytics including artificial intelligence, machine learning and the Internet of Things.Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to use audience appropriate communication and language to present information, analyze results and convey concepts.Ability to work outside of regular work hours, on occasion, to ensure the smooth functioning of BCCNP related systems.Data warehouse implementation and experience with data dictionaries is an asset.Experience with Dynamics CRM and SharePoint is an asset.Ability to develop and apply statistics and statistical methods in managing large amounts of information, and experience with a range of statistical analysis tools is an asset.COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:As the successful candidate, you will enjoy a generous compensation and benefits package.HOW TO APPLY:To apply, please visit https://www.bccnp.ca/bccnp/Careers/Pages/data-analyst.aspxThe closing date for applications is April 1, 2019.To learn more about our organization, please visit www.bccnp.ca. Thank you for your interest in the BC College of Nursing Professionals.While we appreciate all responses, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

New Westminster, BCTemporary$64,199 a yearWork Arrangements
This temporary, full-time (35 hours per week) position is available from February 18, 2019 to March 27, 2020.

The anticipated hours of work are Monday to Friday 9:00am to 5:00pm. The work hours may change based on operational requirements. Modified or flexible schedule may be considered.

Occasional travel between campuses may be required, as will occasional evening and/or weekend work.

What Douglas Offers
DO what you love. Be good at it. That’s how Douglas College defines a great career. It’s a philosophy that resonates through our classrooms, our offices and our boardrooms. It inspires our students and drives us to make Douglas College one of BC’s Top Employers. We love what we do. And we’re looking for passionate, motivated people to join us in making one of Canada’s best colleges even better.

The Role
The Business Systems Analyst works across departments and teams to scope, to design and deliver enterprise technical solutions that support the business vision of the College. They perform as a solution specialist; they find solutions to business problems by maximizing the use of features in our current technology and minimizing creation of special cases and once-only custom solutions. They focus on gathering requirements and converting this into the architecture and design that will provide the solution. They perform as a technical solution architect pertaining to the College’s enterprise architecture

They perform as a development team lead; as such, they provide guidance to the development team to deliver on the design of the solution. They ensure that the development team delivers the correct solution in a timely manner. They ensure that the designs are reusable and fit in the broader enterprise architecture of the College. They ensure the effective use of internal and external resources.

They provide exceptional client-centered service on a consistent basis to all stakeholder groups.

Responsibilities
1. Provides leadership and supervision to appropriate team members and external resources.
a. Supervises coding and release of code into production. May need to write code when necessary.
b. Applies the BCGEU Collective Agreement to the daily decision-making, including but not limited to scheduling work hours, vacation and overtime.
c. Participates in hiring and evaluations as assigned, including providing orientation and ensuring the provision of appropriate training and professional development.
d. Provides input into staff job descriptions.
e. Manages the work queue, assigns work and manages the velocity of work done.
f. Collaborates with manager to ensure adequate coverage for areas.

2. Designs and leads the delivery of technical solutions to support the College’s business vision.
a. Conducts business analysis planning and monitoring.
b. Performs requirement gathering, management and analysis.
c. Collaborates across departments and teams to develop Application solutions.
d. Facilitates workshops to gather both functional and technical requirements.
e. Develops documentation of plans and designs from interviews with users.
f. Researches and analyzes existing practices and procedures.
g. Creates test plans and conducts system testing.
h. Participates in code deployment.
i. Plans and assists with user training for Application solutions.
j. Researches and recommends tools, strategies, methodologies and priorities involving the technologies utilized at the College.
k. Helps developers and project managers in design, planning and leading the project.
l. Liaises with vendors for technical and project related issues.
m. Performs some of the duties of the team members when required.

3. Performs other related duties.
a. Provides information, technical assistance and support to users.
b. Attends internal and external meetings.
c. Creates and maintains system documentation for technical and non-technical users.
d. Delivers training to users and peers in software functionality and business processes.
e. Keeps current with technology trends and best practices.
f. Maintains a high level of technical currency and competency by presenting and attending courses and training activities; reviewing professional publications; participating in professional societies.

To Be Successful in this Role You Will Need
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computing Science. Management Information Systems or equivalent IT Program from a recognized post-secondary educational institution supplemented by a minimum of three years’ relevant experience in programming and analysis, utilizing structured programming techniques or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Should have the following Skills:
o Analytical and problem solving skills to generate new ideas, to solve problems
o Decision-making skills
o Acquire the knowledge of applications in the organization
o Earn the trust of stakeholders
o Ability to, quickly, acquire good industry knowledge that the organization/department is in.
o Operations Analysis
o Quality control Analysis
o Good personal organizational skills
Proven experience in:
o Project management methodology.
o Facilitation, and in a leadership role (formal or informal).
o Creating use cases, data models, and other skills to get information from the users.
o Promoting process improvement
o Several programming and scripting languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, Java.
o Change management, version control (experience with GIT an asset).
A demonstrated ability to:
o Work independently with minimal supervision.
o Establish priorities and achieve deadlines.
o Establish and maintain application specific documentation and operational procedures.
Requires, excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, teaching skills (to communicate issues and requirements)Must be engaged and a team player, be able to work with different personalities (good interpersonal skills), display professionalism, develop and maintain professional relationships, and be reliable.Requires a strong technical background, keeps current with technology and is committed to a variety of learning opportunities.Proven record of continual training, upgrading and/or certification, of programming tools, business functions and of emerging technologies.

The Business Funding Analyst will work directly with Team Leads to write funding applications that range from $10,000 to $20,000,000 in size. These funding applications are positioned to assist our clients’ businesses with projects including business expansion, research & development, capital investment, and hiring initiatives. The Business Funding Analyst will report to a Team Lead.

Role Responsibilities
Preparation and Submission of Funding Proposals (90%): Work directly with a Team Lead on the preparation and submission of funding proposals. This includes synthesizing project information gathered from research, client meetings, notes from the sales team or team lead, and previous funding proposals. We typically write 90%+ of content in a written submission; this content can range from a single paragraph to more than 70 pages. A Team Lead will review your work and provide feedback for changes or improvement before submitting. Tasks include:

Research and Analysis: Research through a variety of online sources, market reports, client data, and interview notes to develop a coherent narrative for a funding proposal.
Application Preparation/Writing: Applications include varying combinations of a project and/or business focus depending on the nature of the request for funding. You will work with your team to write drafts and/or review business plans and/or formal application files.
Systemization/Document Management: As documentation (e.g. financial statements, quotes, etc.) for a project comes in, you are responsible for filing and storing the documents appropriately on our system. Additionally, the Analyst is responsible for maintaining the integrity and consistency of our file management system.
Other (10%): Support administrative and other duties as required by the company. This can include:

Administrative Support: CRM recordkeeping, emails, and reporting to Team Leads.
Internal Meetings: Meeting prep and facilitation for weekly team meetings and Pod-specific meetings.
Other: Special projects may be assigned on an on-going basis, these can include blog writing, marketing support, systems development, etc.
Role Qualities
Variety: The role includes exposure to many different business sectors. We work with clients across a variety of sectors including industrial manufacturing, food processing and production, aerospace, software, tech, geomatics, and other B2B and B2C manufacturing.
Autonomy: You will be responsible to meet client deadlines and provide exceptional quality and turnaround on services. This will include ownership of your workload and schedule.
Passionate Team: Personality is key and that’s why we have been so successful in having a vibrant team. You will be working with a group of dedicated and hard working individuals all working towards a unified goal of exceptional service to our clients.
Continuous Learning: we provide opportunities for continuous learning and also have an expectation that our candidates will be dedicated to improving their industry specific knowledge and experience.
Qualifications – Required
Bachelor of Arts in Humanities, Social Sciences, or Business
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
1+ years of experience in industry; various experience acceptable
Strong decision-making skills; ability to work with limited information
Experience in scenario planning and cost justification of investments/spend
Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines
Qualifications – Preferred
Experience in proposal writing
Experience preparing business and marketing plans
Industry experience in roles that include strategic planning, project management, or similar. Ideally, experience in a manufacturing or advanced technology sector
Understanding of accounting and finance practices; ability to interpret an income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement.

Toronto, ONMiller Thomson LLP is one of Canada’s fastest growing national business law firms, with offices located in Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Regina, Saskatoon, London, Kitchener-Waterloo, Guelph, Toronto, Markham, Vaughan and Montréal. Our consistent ability to provide practical, creative and cost-effective advice, combined with an unyielding service commitment to our clients and a strong dedication to our lawyers, staff and the communities in which we practice, gives us a unique position in the Canadian legal industry.
We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our Toronto office. This is a great opportunity to join our Information Technology team!
In this role, you will be tasked to:
Work with technology partners (i.e. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications (System Requirement Specification, Requirement Package), taking into account non-functional requirements.
Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issue.
Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in Legal Services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle
To be successful in this role, you possess:
3+ years of experience as Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst preferably in a Legal setting
Ability to develop and maintain a product roadmap
2+ years of experience with SQL or other data analysis and querying tools
Strong analytical skill set - have the ability to transform business logic described in business requirements into use cases and the ability to trace and analyze data back to its origination.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Expertise in managing various stakeholder expectations in delivering solutions to meet business requirements
Commitment to applying sound knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards, including design, development, testing and project management.
Sound knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
Ability to contribute to specialized project activities of low to moderate complexity (which will involve developing user requirements), while working under management guidance and supervision.
Technical Expertise:
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA
Experience with cloud services like AWS or Google Cloud
Proficiency with PowerPoint, Project and Visio
Write and execute MS SQL queries

Toronto, ONCOMPANY NAME:
Sunwing Travel Group Inc.

OVERALL OBJECTIVE:
The Business Analyst’s role is to plan, coordinate, assist and support the implementation of business solutions, operational systems and processes in alignment with business strategies and initiatives. Using business, technical and communication skills to work with sponsors, business partners, technical teams and vendors this role analyzes business problems and works to implement efficient solutions and processes. Acts as an enabler in continual process improvement to optimize operations and contribute to improved business results.
This individual is responsible for gathering business requirements, converting them into functional specifications, analyzing data and documenting user stories in support of projects and systems. The Business Analyst is responsible for reporting their findings and exploring possible solutions to business problems to maximize benefits and leverage investments. This position reports to the Sr. Director, Business Systems & Innovations and is based in Toronto, ON.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with business and technology stakeholders to ensure alignment between business needs and technology projects, assets and services
Facilitate discovery sessions, brainstorming and business requirements gathering. Evaluate business requirements, data models, system requirements and vendor analysis when recommending solutions
Analyze and document business problems and present recommendations including gap analysis, business process maps, flow charts and relevant technical documentation
Recreate steps taken by user to locate sources of problems using journey mapping, etc.
Capture and document business requirements, convert them into functional requirements, and identify use cases for approved projects working with business stakeholders, technical teams and vendors
Ensure solutions delivered meet expectations as well as interact with the stakeholders to simplify existing processes and streamline information flow
Participate in the coordination of upgrades and rollout of applications ensuring end user and stakeholder engagement throughout planning and implementation
Conduct business impact assessments. Plan change management activities with the business to encourage adoption by end users and high utilization of the solution. Participate in initial training sessions related to solutions when required
Document current and future state business processes, automating where appropriate
Identify gaps between business needs and deliverables
Develop recommendations to resolve gaps
Make recommendations to the business on how they can optimize their project deliverables to better achieve their objectives
Communicate regularly with business stakeholders to provide updates on key enterprise projects
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of experience in a similar role (Experience with Tour Operator/Airline/Hotel systems preferred)
Degree in a related discipline would be an asset (e.g., B. Com, B.Eng. B.Sc.)
Experience in business analysis, systems analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems
Working knowledge of capturing business needs and developing business requirements and functional requirements documentation
Strong analytical and problem solving experience to deal with complex business problems
Proven ability to integrate perspectives across many functions and generate solutions
Strong organizational skills with an aptitude to juggle priorities to meet strict deadlines
Sense of initiative, self discipline and proactive thinking
Proven ability to work well under pressure and with minimal supervision
Strong interpersonal skills; must be a team player with solid relationship management skills and a customer centric approach
Advanced communication and facilitation skills
Strong technical aptitude combined with solid business acumen
Highly developed skills with MS Office, Access and Visio. Working knowledge of XML, API’s, SQL and HTML would be an asset
Flexibility and willingness to work extended hours on occasion
ENVIRONMENT AND SCOPE:
Fast paced, deadline oriented work environment
Able to work and share responsibilities within a team environment
Open concept office environment
Sensitive to deadlines

General Summary
The primary purpose of the Sales Operation Analyst is to drive category management principles through the application of strong data analytics and consumer insights, hence providing value added services to Scotts Canada Ltd.’s internal business. S/he will work closely with the Sales team to provide business intelligence through the cross analysis of multiple sources of data. S/he will highlight areas of opportunity/risk by combining consumer insights, POS & shipment analytics.
The secondary purpose is to support to Scotts National Field Manager and the Retail Field Sales Teams. S/he will ensure all tools, reporting and program details are available to the field to ensure smooth execution of all national programs at field level.
Key Work Performed
Retail Field Analysis/Support
Manage communication to the Field Sales Team which includes production and management of all processes (Google); production and consolidation of field surveys, maintenance of the 2 orientation sites, revisions to both SM and M&C manuals, and creation of bi-weekly retailer communications
Manage all POP materials and field sales equipment/tools to the field team including coordination and distribution of warehouse fulfillment (clothing/uniforms and swag)
Provide increased visibility through daily and weekly reporting tools to the field Sales teams based on customer specific data, POS trending and shipment analysis
Manage the VMI reports to ensure information is accurate and provide improvements to ensure the reports are providing all the details required by the field.
Analyze data to assist the field sales team in identifying business issues and opportunities and achieving specific account objectives.
Manage the communication to the Field Sale team which includes maintenance of the 2 orientation sites, both SM and M&C manuals, field surveys and bi-weekly retailer communications
Category Management/POS Analysis
Provide “business intelligence” regarding trending, shipments analysis and budget comparisons to all areas of the Scotts business
Act as a main liaison of information between all stakeholders in the organization and support on-going reporting and analysis to/for Senior Leadership
Maintain customized/standardized POS and shipment data reporting across all Scotts Business units
Act as an integral partner of the sales team by identifying and clearly defining the key category and customer opportunities/risks, that help shape retailer strategies and sales tactics
Use POS data to add intelligence to new products product introductions, customer insights, account comparison, and competitive analysis
Maintains this database and provides competitive information and research data for internal sales.
Review, monitor and access operational performance against forecast, budget and sales goals
Job Specifications (Minimum Requirements)
Skill Factors (education, experience, communication, technical, etc.)
Post-secondary Degree/Diploma
One year proven experience in category analysis/management demonstrating ability to perform responsibilities similar to the key performance work list above
Two year’s experience in Consumer Packaged Goods work setting
Superior communication and presentation skills in English reflecting the ability to communicate professionally with all levels of management
Superior proficiency in Microsoft excel, with the ability to navigate data through key strokes, and manipulate it via advanced formulas(CONTIF, SUMIF, RANK, FIND, CONCATENATE, REPLACE, VLOOKUP, MATCH, INDEX, LARGE, ETC) and custom number formatting
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint

Digital Analyst Job Description
The Digital Analyst is an active and critical member of the Publicis Analytics Team. The Digital Analyst will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and providing insights that help monitor, optimize and deliver data driven recommendations to our clients on a regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and ad-hoc basis. This candidate must strive to ensure that the data used in the analytics process is accurate and robust. Candidates must also think strategically to identify issues that need to be optimized or resolved. The Digital Analyst will always work proactively to prioritize resources in order to deliver on the tasks. You are expected to know Google Analytics like the back of your hands. Knowledge of Tableau a big plus.
As Web Analyst, you will:
Lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis
Manage the designing, reporting, and analysis of A/B tests and continuously monitoring test performance
Work with client and account teams to define KPIs and develop tracking/tagging strategies to allow for the KPIs success to be measured.
Create dashboards within Tableau Desktop and publish them to Tableau Server
Manage with regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests)
Assist with efforts to optimize the client's digital experience.
Assist with the development of internal processes and documentation governing the work of the team
You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:
Think strategically in everything you do
Are intrinsically-driven and celebrate every success
Enjoy a variety of work
Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills
Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right
Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment
Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback
Are able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processes
Thrive in a collaborative work environment that has an "open door" policy since we literally have no doors in our office.
Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams
Believe in continuous learning and improvement
Desired Skills & Experience
Candidate Experience:
Must have 1-3 years' experience in web analytics, ideally within an agency setting
Must have at least 1 year of hands on experience with Google Analytics. You will be using GA on a daily basis and are expected to know how to setup new properties, filters, goals, funnels and etc.
Knowledge of user-testing technologies (Google Optimize, Adobe Target, Optimizely, or similar)
Experience in A/B testing strategies and other methodologies for digital optimization
Preferable to have 1+ years of experience with implementing analytics/tag management tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Ad Hoc, Dynamic Tag Manager, and Google Tag Manager
A big plus if you have had experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tools.
Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Candidate Education:
Undergraduate Degree (Marketing, Business, Statistics, Analysis, or other related degrees considered an asset)

Toronto, ONDIGITAL DATA ANALYST (DIGITAL AND DATA SCIENCE)

POSITION CODE: 2019-079
LOCATION: The Globe and Mail, Toronto
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Data Analyst with strong fundamental skills in data analysis and visualization. This role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. The primary responsibilities for the analyst will be to model large volumes of data to design and implement custom reports and dashboards, and perform complex ad hoc analysis using raw data to extract useful insights and identify key trends.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis: Modeling and interpreting large volumes of data, identifying trends and extracting insights. Reporting the results and insights back to the relevant stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Create, maintain, enhance and automate various dashboards and reports that provide insights into user behaviour while keeping in mind business needs and goals.
Requirement Gathering and Documentation: Assist with documenting data sources, relationships between data entities and business concepts, and methods of calculation and measurement while understanding stakeholder needs.
MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:
Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree with at least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience working with Level of Detail, Table, and Window functions in Tableau.
Experience working with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Teradata, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
Command of analytical SQL (ex. Window Functions & Frames, Group Sets, Cubes, Rollups, etc.)
Experience with of at least one of the following: Python, Scala or JavaScript.
Knowledge of inner workings of various web analytics tools (i.e. knowledge of beacons, data processing and enrichment)
Comfortable working in a ‘self-serve’ capacity as a data analyst (i.e. retrieving and modeling your own data when so required).
Experience gathering stakeholder requirements with a demonstrated ability to get to the bottom of specific business rationale
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with tight deadlines
REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Data Visualization skills and at least a year of experience working with Tableau
Working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Omniture or Google Analytics
Good understanding of SQL and relational databases.
Working knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods
Experience deploying tracking via Tag Manager(s)
OPTIONAL BUT DESIRABLE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience working with AWS
Experience working on Linux systems (shell scripting, vi, cron management, etc.)
Experience using Git
Experience with managing Analytics and Marketing tags (via a tag manager or inline)
Experience in directing and teaching non-technical stakeholders on use of analytics tools

Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills

Technical

ContractDuration: 12 months
Health Services – Family Health

Family Health, through the Nurturing the Next Generation (NTNG) strategic priority, aims to improve early child development outcomes for all children in Peel Region. NTNG is part of Peel Public Health’s 10-year strategic plan for 2009-2019, Staying Ahead of the Curve and Setting the Pace: 2014-2019.

The Analyst will provide health data and analysis to support program planning, evaluation and monitoring of Family Health programs. This includes reporting of program data to inform Family Health priorities and continuous quality improvement initiatives.

Responsibilities:
Consult with program and management staff to determine priorities and data analysis needs
Determine appropriate measurement indicators and ensure accurate collection of data
Present data in useful, understandable formats including tables, charts, maps and customized reports
Prepare and present health status and program data in a standardized format on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Compare data across programs, including trends and limitations
Provide analysis and interpretation of health status and program data to determine appropriate actions in consultation with management
Use geographic information system tools to prepare maps
Develop draft written material including commentaries, reports, summaries and syntheses of data for inclusion in policy briefs, technical reports, background documents, FAQs and correspondence
Lead process development to collect, revise and store data and reports in EIM
Qualifications:
Baccalaureate degree in science, health science, business, biostatistics or other relevant program
Minimum two years related experience
Epidemiology experience or education is an asset
Demonstrated ability to coordinate the collection and retrieval of data
Demonstrated ability to synthesize, analyze and communicate data from multiple sources to stakeholders
Effective project management skills
Basic financial skills to analyze budget impacts related to data analysis
Excellent computer skills, including MS office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), EIM and Access
Introductory familiarity with geographic information system (GIS) mapping
Knowledge of provincial databases such as ISCIS, BORN, is an asset
Location: 7120 Hurontario St, Mississauga
Hours of work: 35 hours/week – Monday through Friday

If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply online.
About Us
The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 163,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca

Together, we help empower you to achieve what’s important in your life.


What’s the job?
Does working on complex programs with ambiguous solutions seem to characterize your Business Analysis experience? If you are passionate about bringing together people from different perspectives and shepherding the solution to achieve business goals, this may be the perfect fit for you. This role plays a key role in the execution of strategy by understanding project goals, implementing business processes that effectively leverage technology and using mechanisms to monitor and manage business progress.

What you’ll get to do:
Support the development of the application roadmap that drives business value and leverages technology investments
Support the development and deployment of organizational metrics to monitor performance
Document current state and create future state solution that articulates the people, process, and technology required
Perform data analysis, identify the gap(s) in organizational capabilities and develop roadmap to solve the business need
Design business process and configure user applications to solve business need
Explore and capture business and stakeholder requirements
Create, execute and facilitate organizational change management plan
Engage with cross functional teams and work with subject matter experts to create effective solutions

Who are we looking for?
To answer that question, we are looking for someone who has a passion for change and who can effectively navigate that, sometimes bumpy, terrain. Moreover you can see the big picture and can effectively communicate that vision to your business partners to secure their support.
Your resume lists a minimum of 6 years’ experience of technology implementation experience as a stream or project lead.
Your Business Administration or Information Technologies degree proudly hangs on your wall and you have a thirst for always learning something new.
You have proven your excellent comprehension of information systems technologies and application architectures in your previous work experiences
You bring experience in Software development and/or software applications management
In your current role you’ve demonstrated your excellent organizational change management skills and you’ve effectively applied your knowledge of tools, concepts and methodologies.
You have hands-on experience with the development, delivery and facilitation of training curriculum
Over the years you’ve refined your writing skills, including the design and completion of professional reports and documents
Experience in financial institution an asset so you can bring an in-depth understanding of banking business models and the regulatory environment and during this time you learned about banking e-systems such as internet online banking, mobile banking and mobile payments
CPA, MBA, CCBA, CBAP, ACMP, Lean Six Sigma Certification an asset. Comparable combination of experience and education will be considered


Why join Coast Capital Savings?
We don’t mean to toot our own horn, but…
We improve Canadians’ financial well-being through providing simple financial help.
Employees do what’s best for our members. Every day.
We believe in being a great corporate citizen so we invest in our local communities by donating our time, money and expertise.
Our employees take advantage of the many opportunities to grow their careers.
Employees love having a cool place to work, which includes wearing their jeans on Fridays & Saturdays and being recognized with a virtual (and, at times, an actual) high-five.
Our inspiring leaders help our employees develop their talents and encourage them to be their fabulous selves.
We have a unique culture where we take our business seriously, but ourselves, not so much.
In 2017, we earned double kudos by being named one of BC’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies – two of the nation’s most coveted business ads, may we add.


Does this position inspire you? If so, apply today at Coast Capital Savings.

$57,715 a yearUnder the direction of the Associate Registrar and in collaboration with the Business Systems team, this position is responsible for the operation, maintenance, development, security, and support for the College’s student information system (Ellucian Colleague) and related business systems. Within these systems, this position is also responsible for institutional tuition and fee administration including assessment, billing, refunds, and reporting. The work of this position requires proficiency in coding, understanding technical concepts, database interactions, and query languages. This individual must be an effective team player with excellent communication skills and a drive to learn, innovate, and collaborate.
Specific Duties
Acquires and maintains an understanding of the technical and functional architecture of assigned systems and integrations.
Provides expert technical support for Colleague and assigned systems. Work may involve analysing and correcting functional issues, resolving technical problems, managing user accounts, and performing related tasks to support College operations.
Performs software maintenance and testing on systems to ensure operational efficiency and evaluate system performance.
Manages and maintains the computerized student records through regular monitoring and analysis in order to ensure data integrity/security.
Provides operational project management, business process analysis, systems support coordination, application lifecycle management, and custom software coding to meet specifications or facilitate integration.
Supports office and other department operations by providing technical assistance to business units, including researching, making recommendations and implementing new system modules and software systems.
Manages and maintains Colleague’s student finance modules to ensure accurate tuition/fee assessment, refund processing, sponsorship recording, and tax form calculation.
Prepares and maintains accurate and concise documentation related to the configuration and maintenance of all supported systems.
Ensures the functional aspects of assigned systems are set-up in compliance with College policies, services agreements, contracts, laws, and other regulations.
Develops and communicates protocols, systems policies and training programs for the data administrative systems to ensure full utilization of tools and effective integration of applications.
Develops and maintains custom workflows and reports.
Provides back-up support to the Scheduling Office during breaks/leaves.
Assists Business Systems Supervisor by liaising with Information Technology Services (ITS), and works closely with ITS on projects related to Ellucian ERP/SIS products (e.g. Colleague, CRM Recruit, Document Management, Workflow, Self Service, Student Planning), SQL reporting, Infosilem classroom scheduling, XML data interchange, and provincial application systems, ensuring peak optimization and utilization of systems and platforms.
Promotes a positive work atmosphere by interacting and communicating in a professional manner that demonstrates mutual respect with students and colleagues.
Engages as part of a team in contributing to and accomplishing the vision, mission, and goals of the College and in supporting the aspirations and needs of our learners.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Skills & Qualifications
Minimum two-year diploma in computer science, information systems or related technology field with three years recent related software support experience – preferably within a post-secondary environment. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Experience with student information systems, scheduling and reporting systems and complex relational database applications (e.g. Ellucian Colleague, Infosilem, Entrinsik Informer).
Knowledge of post-secondary operations including admissions, records, recruitment, transfer credit, program offerings, grades, scheduling, exams and graduation. Experience with student account activities including billing and collections of tuition, fees and other charges would be a strong asset.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to present complex material in a user-friendly way.
Strong project management skills with the ability to systematically plan, schedule, and implement software.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to set priorities when encountering conflicting demands.
Proven analytical, diagnostic, decision-making, and problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively and find innovative solutions.
Strong understanding of relational databases with experience in querying and report building.
Proficient in coding, understanding technical concepts, database interactions, and query languages. Knowledge of the server infrastructure, database management systems, web servers, and operating systems would be a strong asset.
Strong ability to coach, support, work with and mentor individuals from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team – working harmoniously with others.
Strong attention to detail and data entry skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and privacy requirements with regard to the position and to student information.
Ability to exercise tact, discretion, good judgement and diplomacy.

Job Description

Senior Business Analyst

Reporting to the Director, PMO, the Senior Business Analyst position is a pivotal role in the delivery of high quality services to our customers. The Senior Business Analyst works under general direction and is responsible for combining advanced analytical skills with tactical leadership skills to contribute to the quality, effectiveness and efficiency of all work completed under their guidance.

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features.

The successful candidate has been a product owner in an agile process, is great at communicating with developers, testers and designers, is detail-oriented and loves digging into requirements to understand what the requirements are and delivering them in a demonstrable way.

Responsibilities

Work closely with clients to gather, understand and define business requirements
Own and develop a relationship with clients, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration
Convert business requirements into development user stories, ensuring clear acceptance criteria are defined and understood by the delivery team
Be aware of common sources of technical issues and questions, and make recommendations to the project team
Communicate key insights and findings to the project team
Work closely with the project team to ensure requirements are understood and questions are answered
Maintain the project requirement backlog ensuring complete coverage and prioritization of requirements
Help in release planning by identifying gaps and dependencies amongst requirements
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve the monitoring and discovery of issues and deliver better value to the customer
Maintain a Quality mindset and contribute to regular reviews of project team deliverables
Assist with UAT testing

Position Specific Competencies

Service Orientation: Go above and beyond regular client and organizational expectations by offering added value
Accountability: Balances organizational, team and individual commitments
Communication: Adapts communication to respond to an audience or situational requirements
Teamwork: Encourages others to participate in team activities, ensures teams are working effectively
Leadership: Promotes and builds internal commitment
Problem solving: Analyzes complex issues to develop approaches or solutions that are considered forward thinking and best practice
If you relate to the above statements, join us! We are looking for a new colleague to take on the challenge of transforming the world of healthcare and making a difference in the lives of generations of people.

Qualifications

7+ years experience in Business / Systems Analysis
A degree in IT / Computer Science
Proven experience in eliciting and documenting requirements
Experience working on Software Development projects
Experience in analysing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Knowledge in generating clear and concise process documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Ability to travel
Additional Information

$50 - $60 an hourContractJob SummaryINTRODUCTIONThe Ministry of Central Services (the Ministry), on behalf of the Government of Saskatchewan (GoS) requires one (1) or more qualified Senior Business Analyst(s) to join the Ministry of Justice.Contract DurationThe duration of the Contract will be for one (1) year with options to extend the contract for up to two (2) additional years.Job Type / CategoryPosition OverviewThe Ministry of Central Services is looking for one (1) or more Senior Business Analyst(s) to work with the Strategic Systems and Innovation branch (SSI) of the Ministry of Justice, dedicated to the IJIMS (Integrated Justice Information Management Systems) portfolio of projects. The resource(s) should have extensive experience in business analysis and testing, with data analysis experience and change management skills as an asset. The resource(s) will participate in various projects focused on delivering appropriate and innovative solutions to Ministry of Justice stakeholders. The resource(s) will also assist with setting up industry standard processes and procedures within the Ministry and ensuring that project best practices are followed. The resource(s) will also be expected to provide coaching and mentorship to existing JU employees, thereby expanding the current skillset and capacity of the SSI branch.The full time position will be located onsite at a Government of Saskatchewan office in Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada.
