Victoria, BCBusiness/Project Analyst
Information Systems R24

An eligibility list may be established.

An opportunity to contribute your valued project and information technology expertise

The Health Sector Information Management/Information Technology Division provides sector-wide leadership in Digital Health, IM/IT planning, policy and business solutions. A major contribution of the division is to build and maintain a capacity for the integration of enabling technologies and data into health systems and services, including and policy development in support of the stewardship role of the Ministry.

Province-wide planning, implementation and delivery of Digital Health is a major focus of the division’s efforts over the next several years. The division also spearheads and actively supports the collaborative development of broad IM/IT strategies and plans intended for implementation across the BC health sector.

The Strategic Projects Branch provides leadership, coordination and expertise through the management and delivery of large scale transformation projects on behalf of Health Sector IM/IT Division (HSIMIT). These projects often cross organizational boundaries and have a broad scope of impact. Projects often include multi-partner stakeholders and vendor outsourcing, and the branch provides oversight to ensure terms and conditions of contract are met. The branch also plays a key role in fostering internal and external relationships with stakeholders through knowledge transfer and facilitated discussion. The branch employs project management and change management strategies to transition projects from the Branch to operational business areas. Projects include PharmaNet systems development and related initiatives such as e-prescribing, as well as the BC Services Card, and Virtual Care technologies to support Mental Health and Substance Use services (e.g. Personal Health Record, Video Counseling).

In the Business/Project Analyst role, you will provide cross-functional project management and change management support, technology planning, business analysis, systems design and stakeholder engagement services. The position coordinates the design, development, and enhancement of systems projects on behalf of the client(s) and works with the system developers to achieve high-quality, timely and cost-conscious solutions for the BC health sector. You are a skilled analytical thinker, an effective communicator, have excellent time management techniques, and thrive in a dynamic project environment with evolving priorities. If you are an experienced information management professional with the initiative required for this challenging role, we look forward to your application.

The ideal candidate works effectively in a team environment, while also independently managing projects and tasks

The BC Public Service is an inclusive and accessible employer. Please advise the hiring manager if any accommodations are required to assist you to ensure equitable participation.

The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.

The BC Public Service is an award-winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Business Analyst, Searcy
Winnipeg, MB

The Business Analyst (BA) is a key contributor to the implementation of process and systems improvement initiatives within the Continuous Improvement (CI) department. The BA is responsible for identifying opportunities and managing requests for systems and process change and managing projects to implement those changes. This includes gaining an understanding of current processes and systems, identifying potential solutions, organizing working groups and communicating with software developers. The BA is also responsible for planning the implementation of solutions and supporting the training of users as needed. As a member of Searcy & Bison Transport's overall Systems group the BA is committed to providing quality solutions through delivery of timely changes to, and complete support of, existing tools and processes.

Specific responsibilities include:

Gaining an understanding of and documenting current processes through participation in and/or facilitating of brainstorming sessions, root cause analysis or other discovery practices with stakeholders.
Performing analysis of business processes, highlighting issues and challenges, then assisting in the definition of the challenge and recommending improvements.
Project management; consistent build out of plans, act as liaison between the customer and the CI/developer teams, ensuring completion of projects.
Implementation of projects; Driving to implementation on projects, coordinating with L&D (Learning & Development) for training of users. Including support on creation of documentation as required.
Monitoring the implemented solution to ensure continued adoption of the tool or process change.
Report writing and analysis.
Benchmarking and innovation.
Our Ideal Candidate will possess:
Post-secondary education with a focus on any combination of Business Analysis, Economics, Supply Chain, Logistics, Management Information Systems (MIS) or demonstrated experience. Other formal education will be considered for relevance.
Pursuit of a formal certification in Project Management or Business Analysis is an asset.
Strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated experience in gathering, working with and coordinating teams.
Demonstrated facilitation skills.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to oversee projects.
Strong interviewing skills, effective data gathering.
Ability to perform analysis and present information with clear conclusions and recommendations.
Possess a strong desire to "do things better" with a willingness to get involved at the base level to make that happen.
General understanding of the programming process.
Project management, business process management, or business analysis experience is an asset.
Knowledge of Six Sigma or Lean methodologies is preferred (experience or education).

job_title: Marketing Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA) - Apply by: Friday, March 29th
job_description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom
designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of
the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders,
weld guns, cylinders, electrodes and other welding accessories. Our people are our key competitive
advantage in today’s global market. CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to
remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the
foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited requires a self-motivated individual to fill the position of Marketing
Intelligence Data Analyst (MIDA). The successful candidate will be responsible for all market research
tasks and processes that support CenterLine’s Sales & Marketing Strategy requirements. The MIDA will
use established industry best practices, tools, market knowledge, marketing experience and education to
perform all task and responsibilities of this role. This position reports to the Marketing Manager.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Identify, data mine and correlate existing company wide data to create effective measurement
processes that track sales and marketing effectiveness and provide actionable business
development insights.
 Develop, monitor and maintain market behaviour models for use in developing forecasts and data
sets for business development needs.
 Analyze customer sales and capability data from internal and external resources to classify and
measure customer needs and satisfaction for use in identifying sales opportunities, prospect
targets, new markets and market conditions affecting product demand.
 Collect, analyze and manage market data (competition, industry, emerging technologies, etc.) to
measure the market share, the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies and to recognize
market developments impacting current corporate objectives.
 Effectively communicate research findings to the Management Team including; sales forecasts,
market trends, market profiles, customer profiles, competitor profiles and customer satisfaction
survey results.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
 Bachelor of Commerce degree (Marketing major)
 Market research and business management experience required
 Excellent quantitative skills that allow for successful measurement of markets, sizing and metrics
 Strong organizational and critical thinking skills
 Excellent oral, written, listening and optic skills
 Ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision
Interested candidates should apply to careers@cntrline.com
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide
accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in he
recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may
require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

Reporting to the Manager, Business Analysis the Senior Business Analyst will be a critical enabler of cross-team collaboration and project success at the organization. The Senior Business Analyst will be charged with leading the project definition process with clients, including definition and documentation detailed functional and business requirements, facilitation of communication between cross-functional teams, and contributing to the overall improvement of our products, projects and process. As a key owner of the end product, the Senior Business Analyst will be a highly engaged individual invested in the successful delivery of transformative digital solutions.
You Are:
A strategic thinker, thinking strategically about the improvement of the client’s business through the use of digital and non-digital applications
Customer focused , being a believer in the customer experience, and acting as the bridge between technology solutions and customer needs.
Innovative , recommending new approaches to digital applications based on data driven insights provided by Analytics Specialists and Strategists
An effective communicator , ensuring an understanding the complexities of a digital project and ensuring a common understanding within the internal and external project teams
A collaborator , collaborating on the development of a standard set of tools and formats to communicate business and technical requirements to both technical and non-technical audiences
A master facilitator , interviewing the client’s key stakeholders to gather and document business and technical requirements
Extremely detailed , leaving no stone unturned when mapping out complex interactions between users and digital systems
Your Key Responsibilities:
Here’s what you’ll be doing day to day…
Collaboration: Working closely with client/team to understand objectives, scope, timing, and budget
Workshop Facilitation: Conduct stakeholder interviews and client workshops to uncover the business goals and objectives that a solution must address ; capture and present ideas, through white-boards, sticky notes, process maps – ensuring that every data point in brainstorms and workshops is identified and mapped
Visual Presentation: Produce information architecture diagrams, use cases and process maps, visually representing how information, users and processes flow
Requirements: Own the requirements gathering process, both in the Discovery of a solution (writing Business Requirements), as well as the Technical Definition & Delivery of a solution (writing Functional Requirements)
Process Improvement: Analyze and assess processes at the project level, with the goal of documenting and designing process improvements where gaps or bottlenecks are identified
Clear Communication: Ensure collaboration, and clear communication of ideas across teams – utilizing the requirements as the benchmark that Project, Strategy, Creative, Technology and QA teams are working towards
Technical Knowledge : Carry a keen understanding of technical knowledge and software development lifecycle best practices; support technology teams through the development phase of the project, triaging tickets and questions on the requirements as they arise
Change Management: Communicating changes to requirements in order to ensure a common understanding of the final product
Quality: Assist QA teams in developing their test cases, providing the guidance and support needed for a polished product delivery; manage the UAT phase of projects, leading the client through approvals of the final product, ensuring that the build is up to the standards designed initially conceived in the requirements
Mentorship: Coaching and mentoring junior BA staff to ensure a consistent process, and high quality of deliverables
Your Experience & Intangible Traits:
The ideal candidate for a Senior Business Analyst position will possess the following competencies:
Strong technical background in understanding how software and hardware systems interconnect, and how databases and information architecture is designed (via SQL, HTML5, CSS, XML, CMS, etc.)
Demonstrate experience in developing and owning Business & Functional Requirements documents, as well as managing requirements within JIRA, Teamwork, or other such project management tools
Exceptional knowledge of the software development lifecycle, while working in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies
Superior ability to manage short- and long-term projects simultaneously, managing time and prioritizing effectively across multiple initiatives
Incredible attention to detail, thoroughness, and precision in all deliverables
Excellent verbal, writing, and presentation skills
Skilled in troubleshooting and problem-solving
Engaging team player, excited to collaborate and self-start new ideas and solutions
5+ years of experience in Digital Strategy, Business Analysis, Information Architecture or UX for digital projects
Bachelor’s degree and/or diploma in Engineering, Technology, Computer Science or similar
Why you’ll love working here:
Full health benefits (100% dental coverage, prescription, vision, massages, life insurance and short term/ long term disability)
Generous vacation and retirement plans
Employee support program
A brand new cell phone, with upgrades every 24 months (we’ve got your phone bill covered, too)
Ongoing training and development opportunities, peer-taught lunch and learns and outside workshops like Ladies Learning Code
Catered Friday lunches
Loaded snack cupboards
Office-ping pong and foosball tables, plus the latest and greatest video games
Friendly community with lots of social events – from boat cruises to volleyball tournaments
Participation in charity initiatives
Like what you see and think you’re a perfect fit? Apply today.

Kingston, ON$30.86 - $34.19 an hourSystems Programmer/Analyst 2 - Business Systems
Hours of Work: Full-Time Position; Days
Wage: $30.858- $34.194 per hour
Union: CUPE
In accordance with Article 9.05, where the previous incumbent returns to this position within the thirty (30) day trial period this position shall be deemed not vacant and the posting will be cancelled. Should the vacancy be cancelled, applicants to this posting shall be notified.
PRIMARY FUNCTION:
Works with the client and/or project team to establish project scope and objectives. Develops the work plan and resource plan for small to moderately complex information systems projects. Conducts analysis and prepares detailed specifications related to system implementation. Designs, codes, configure, tests, debugs and documents system applications. Capable of working on all phases of systems analysis, development, delivery and support. Works under general supervision of the Manager and with the technical direction of more experienced analysts.
Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Tasks : Executes detailed application system tasks for all phases of the systems development lifecycle and application administration: problem definition, feasibility study, analysis, outline design, detailed design, implementation, and maintenance. For example:
Acts in conjunction with the client to establish the project and produces the statement of requirements.
Works with the client and/or team to define what constitutes a solution to the opportunity/problem and produces a logical model of the solution. Conducts workshops and presentations to validate business processes and system solutions with the functional area and/or the user community in conjunction with the project team members.
Determines ways of implementing a solution and makes recommendations based on analysis
Produces detailed system and technical design specifications
Develops system deliverables such as configuration setup, programs, enhancements, reports, forms, interfaces, and conversions required for the system solution. Ensures that proper quality, integration and standards in relation to development objects are maintained.
Creates the unit test plan and executes unit testing; works with the project team to identify mission critical business process scenarios; identifies transactions and data to be tested; manages expected results versus actual results; assigns follow up tasks to re-configure and retest; tracks error resolution.
Works to provide application administration system monitoring /tuning and configuration; application instance maintenance; installation of notes; data management / optimization; application architecture; general application administrative tasks
Assists in end user documentation, training materials development, and training
Project Management: Evaluates opportunities and establishes objectives and scope, in conjunction with the client. Develops the project work plan and resource plan working with the Project Management Office (PMO), and is responsible for the detailed planning, coordination and ultimate outcome of the project.
Production Support : Provides production support and on-call service as required; coordinates problem resolution related to production system issues or errors.
Education : Maintains a good working knowledge of KGH applications and their interrelationships with other systems; maintains knowledge of technological advances; maintains knowledge of how the hospital conducts its business; acts as trainer and mentor to junior IM staff.
Other: Develops and documents procedures, guidelines and project communications for IM; identifies opportunities for improvement in hospital operations; participates in staff performance evaluations. Provides other duties as assigned in support of the IM business systems.
Workplace Health & Safety : Adheres to the worker responsibilities as set out in the Occupational Health & Safety Act, hospital safety policies, and dept/unit established procedures at all times. Where possible, take corrective action to address a hazard, otherwise report the unresolved hazard, dangerous circumstance, unsafe situation to self, other co-workers or the community, to their supervisor. Should the employee suffer a workplace injury or illness, he/she will advise their supervisor; actively participate in identifying and resolving the underlying cause(s), and participates in early and safe return to work as per Workplace Safety & Insurance Act.
Workplace Conduct: Understands and is familiar with all pertinent KGH policies and procedures including those relating to workplace conduct. Complies with the KGH Commitment to uphold the Workplace Conduct and Reporting of Inappropriate Conduct policy and behaves in a manner that is consistent with the guiding principles and expectations.
QUALIFICATIONS:
University Degree in Computer Science, Health Informatics, Commerce or related discipline or Equivalent combination of education and experience.
3 years systems development experience in a corporate systems setting including 2 years recent experience in the development and support of business systems applications within large-scale commercial systems.
Knowledge and application of project management methodologies.
Knowledge and application of the principles of systems development methodology.
Good communication skills in both written and oral forms as demonstrated through preparation of technical, training or project documents and presentations to IM staff.
Ability to lead technical project teams.
Ability to identify issues relating to systems development, systems operation or project completion and provide solutions.
Ability to prepare/implement plans, designs or specifications in accordance with established departmental standards.
Excellent prioritization and organizational skills as demonstrated by the ability to manage own time and successfully complete multiple tasks or projects assigned simultaneously.
General Functional knowledge plus two or more years’ experience in technical maintenance of enterprise business system applications i.e. fully integrated solutions like SAP, Oracle E-Business Suite, PeopleSoft, etc This includes, but is not limited to, the functional areas of:
HCM (i.e. personnel administration, personnel development, personnel time, employee scheduling, and payroll);
Finance and Controlling;
Sales and Distribution (SD) - Billing and Receivables;
Supply Chain Management (SCM) (i.e. Inventory, Purchasing, Accounts Payable, and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM));
Clinical (i.e. Patient master data, case, visit, encounter, movement, and service / procedure / provider / diagnosis information);
Decision Support Systems/Data Warehousing i.e. SAP BI, Cognos, Informatica
Mobile Enterprise Applications Platforms (MEAP) i.e. SAP MI, Oracle MEAP
Knowledge of HL7 Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) and HL7 Reference Information Model (RIM).
General Functional Knowledge of Graphical Design concepts and software i.e. CorelDRAW, Adobe Photoshop.
Knowledge of Portal technologies i.e. SAP Netweaver Portal, Microsoft Sharepoint
Knowledge of Database Management Systems (dbms) and relational database concepts in a client server environment, including knowledge of SQL.
Understanding of Object Oriented programming concepts and at least one Object Oriented programming language.
Knowledge of Web technologies and Web applications.
Knowledge of MS-Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access).
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal reference check required.

The applicant must be able to meet the physical demands of this position.

When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Intent of the process
The advertisement is for the creation of an on-going inventory which management will access as needs are identified. It is anticipated that the first draw will occur at any time after 3 weeks from the original posting. The number/timing of subsequent draws each year will be determined based on operational requirements.

Applicants will be able to apply and/or update their information on an ongoing basis.
Initial screening will utilize self-screening where applicants will be required to respond to a series of questions, this will include indicating which/how many of the example essential experience they have and providing the who, what, when, where/why of said essential experience.

For each draw, after screening on education and experience, those who are screened In may be invited for further assessment on remaining essential qualifications (competencies/qualifications).

Once assessment is completed the results will be valid for a minimum of 12 months. During this period if an applicant is redrawn from the inventory the previous assessment will apply, this would include those who did not qualify. After the period has expired the individual may be reassessed should they be referred on subsequent draws from the inventory.


The pool(s) created from this process/inventory can be used for temporary or permanent staffing for same and/or equivalent positions.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined

Your résumé.

POSITION PURPOSE
Sustainalytics is seeking qualified ESG analysts to join its ESG analyst team. This new position presents an exciting opportunity to conduct company ESG analysis that will form a part of our newly-released flagship ESG Risk Rating. Asset owners, investment managers and other investment professionals leverage the ESG Risk Rating and its underlying research to enhance investment processes. The role involves ESG risk and controversy analysis for companies, as well as contributing to client meetings and thought leadership. You will join a growing and strategically important team and contribute to the development of a vibrant community of sector analysts. You will engage in training and development programmes which support your career development to become a top ESG analyst. The ideal candidate will have both a background in capital markets and sectoral expertise. We are currently hiring for the Mining and Materials sector and the Oil and Gas sector.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Research, analyze and rate the ESG risks and involvement in controversies of companies in the mining or oil and gas sector.
Prepare company ESG Risk Rating reports to be published in Sustainalytics’ Global Access portal;
Research and track ESG trends and issues relevant in your sector of expertise;
Contribute to responding to client queries and support clients in integrating your research insights into their investment decision-making;
Contribute to the development of intellectual capital and internal and external thought leadership.
QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate degree in related discipline (business, finance, environment and/or social science);
At least 2 years of relevant work experience but we are ready to welcome more experienced candidates as well;
Strong knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry and SRI/RI market;
Knowledge of mining or oil and gas industry processes and technologies is considered an asset
Capital markets background; MBA/CFA considered an asset;
Excellent research, analytical and writing capabilities;
Presentation skills (both in spoken and written formats), e.g. ppt skills, client interaction skills;
Alignment with Sustainalytics’ mission, vision and values;
Resourceful, flexible and embraces change and innovation;
TO APPLY
If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, please submit your application using the form below. All applications will be treated with the highest level of discretion and will be accepted until close of business on March 31, 2019. However, as we will start interviewing sooner, we advise you to apply as soon as possible.

In keeping with our ongoing efforts to represent the diversity of our community, we strongly encourage people from diverse groups to apply. Sustainalytics is committed to providing accommodations for individuals with disabilities, upon request.

Sustainalytics thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those applicants requested to participate in the interview process will be contacted. Sustainalytics accepts applications directly from applicants only; no employment or recruitment agencies, please.

Your privacy while being in contact with Sustainalytics is one of our fundamental commitments here. Review our Privacy Policy to find out more about how we handle the personal data you provide us during the recruitment process. Should you have any questions or concerns, contact us at Data Protection.

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

The Bell IT team uses emerging technologies, Agile and DevOps to design and build innovative solutions that enable Bell’s communications services for businesses and consumers. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative and ready to be on the leading edge of technological transformation.

Bell Canada’s Systems & Technology organization is looking for an IT Business Analyst to join a team of professionals who specialize in delivering and managing IT solutions for the Outright Sales (ORS) business across Enterprise, SMB, Bell West and BBM markets. The critical mandate of the IT ORS team is to deliver solutions to enable reduction in cycle time and remove manual intervention through integrated processes & back/front office systems.

The primary focus of the role is to identify, evaluate, document and implement operational changes to improve information and processing systems. Review and make recommendation on major ORS projects and NPI’s (New Product Introductions), systems enhancements, testing tools and post deployment support. Work with business users, system groups, other business units and external vendors or contractors to address system requirements and priorities.

Job Duties/Accountabilities:
Areas included are ORS Product Catalogues (Standard, Alliance & C-Net), EDI Integration and other ORS back-end systems.
Participate in solution definition, the development and delivery of the solution.
Convert business requirements into conceptual system functionality, provide specifications to development team to ensure requirements are met.
Partner with other IT ORS groups and vendors to deliver and support ORS solutions.
Co-ordinate testing of system enhancements and project within the user area.
Develop user manual and training systems for new systems development and enhancements to existing ORS systems.
Review enhancements and projects after implementation for compliance to specifications.
Facilitate identification of process improvements or system enhancements often requiring the co-ordination of multiple functional areas.
Work closely with Product management to assess tool and flow changes required to support ORS NPI’s.
Work with Operations, provisioning and supply chain group from the prospecting stage through delivery and follow-up, to ensure ORS business requirements are effectively identified and addressed.
Ensure issues and root cause of incidents and problems are understood, and ensure appropriate actions are taken to resolve and prevent recurrence.
Manage contractors for projects delivery and application support.
Maintain leading-edge business and technical knowledge.
Through a personal development plan, remain current in industry best practices related to IT Service Management

Critical Qualifications/Competencies:
Strong analytical skills.
Understanding and knowledge of the ORS (Outright Sales) business.
Ability to manage multiple activities at a high level and dive into details when challenges arise
Ability to effectively facilitate and coordinate meetings, and to negotiate consensus from cross-functional teams
Understand and articulate IT concepts and issues from a business perspective
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge and ability to use MS-Office tools (Word, Excel, Outlook and MS-Project).
General knowledge and ability to use MS-SQL data queries and extract data for analysis.
Willingness to manage own time, working extended hours when necessary to meet deliverables
Willingness to participate in scheduled post deployment system testing during off-hours

Preferred Qualifications/Competencies:
Knowledge of ORS Tools and workflow.
BA experience preferred
Bilingual
Experience in managing and co-ordinating contractors work.
Post-secondary education, preferably in Business or Technology.

Description
Overview
The Pricing and Database Analyst will be assisting both Pricing and Finance business areas. The role will be primarily responsible for running price quotes to achieve a strategic retail price, while ensuring margin profitability is maintained for all products across all provincial markets. This will involve leading cross-functional conversations between the Sales and Marketing teams to ensure alignment. Additionally, the role will be responsible for the administration of all pricing submissions with each provincial liquor board, while ensuring all internal systems are updated accordingly. The role will also support the overall Finance and Analytics department with any ad-hoc projects that will come up as a result of evolving needs of the business.
Duties and Responsibilities Prepares price quotations and scenario analyses for theoretical, existing and new products to support innovation processes and sales and marketing requirements.
 Develops an understanding of liquor board pricing structure changes and ensures the Internal Pricing System calculators are aligned to the liquor board calculators. Accurately and timely submits all price changes to each Provincial Liquor Board. Efficiently maintains Internal Price Lists to accurately match product COGS, Indirect Costs, supplier transfer prices, Forex rates, Rebates in all provinces. Ensure all ERP and Pricing systems and tools are updated with all the latest submissions/changes. Generate Monthly Price History, National Price List, and Regional Profitability reports to support suppliers and internal teams. Allocate monthly freight and storage costs by supplier. Provide support and act as a backup to the Pricing and Finance teams.
 Assists in the development of the Company’s internal reporting systems. Ad-hoc analyses and requests, as required. Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business plus 2 years of experience in an analytical role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Preferred Qualifications Strong quantitative and analytical skills, verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interpret and summarize data, identify key takeaway insights and business implications. Strong communication skills – written, verbal, persuasion, motivation. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office a must– Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. Ability to streamline processes to create efficiencies. Interpersonal skills necessary to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co- workers, other business areas, and government agencies. Energetic and works with a strong sense of urgency in a fast paced and dynamic environment. Planning and organizational skills necessary to coordinate workload around multiple assignments.

Toronto, ONPermanentEmbracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.

Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.

The Corporate Application Delivery group supports all corporate portfolios with the planning (road mapping) and new capability project delivery. The team works core business hours, with occasional weekend or after-hours engagements to support the implementation of changes. The list of supported portfolios includes, but is not limited to Real Estate, REIT, Corporate Communications, and Jumpstart.

What you’ll do

As a member of the Corporate Application Delivery team the Senior Business Systems Analyst will help define and deliver solutions that meet business objectives and will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the business and IT in truly understanding the business’ needs. The Sr. BSA will contribute to the delivery of projects using the Agile delivery methodology. In partnership with Project Managers, Product owners, Business Stakeholders and IT interfacing groups The Sr. BA will lead the planning, requirements eliciting, analyzing designs, executing configuration changes, creation of test cases, implementation planning and support.

Knowledge of Business System Analysis (BSA) principles and techniques

Experience working with business and technology partners to drive discovery of the requirements

Perform all aspects of research, analysis and problem-solve issues with exceptional attention to detail, follow up through resolution, escalating when necessary

Experience with data analysis and reporting

Strong SQL skills – ability to build complex queries, read and understand code and perform in-depth data analysis using SQL and Excel

Excellent communication (most meetings are done over the phone), elicitation and facilitation skills

Strong documentations skills using MS Office tools (incl. Visio diagrams)

Strong team player with ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders of varying levels of seniority

Think critically, and provide innovative/creative solutions to existing problems

Effective time management skills; Able to work independently and manage multiple deadlines/projects

Experience in infrastructure and application upgrade projects is an asset

Facilitate or participate in JAM sessions to refine scope into a project’s initial requirements (user stories) and high-level design, producing appropriate documentation as needed.

Support the Scrum Master and Project Manager during all phases of the project

Understanding of business case development and ongoing project level financials

Enterprise analysis – plan and scope several inter-related initiatives

Apply process standards to technology solutions

Execute system configuration changes as per project requirements

Provide support and participate in change management

Translate system functionality into business relevant language

Strong knowledge of business process design, mapping and optimization

Strong interpersonal and communication skills to play a key role within the project team

Strong planning and organizational skills, ability to prioritize, meet time commitments

Bridge the gap between both business and IT teams, ensuring common understanding and alignment of both functional and non-functional requirements

Build stakeholder trust by understanding business concepts, issues, opportunities and language

Convey requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, UE cases and prototypes

In waterfall projects: using best practice methods and tools, you will be responsible for creating key deliverables like process flows, requirements packages, high level design packages, test cases and implementation plans for stakeholder approval

In waterfall projects: you will implement complete requirements tracking from business objectives, through all project phases, and into downstream processes to ensure consistent and accurate translation of requirements through all SDLC phases

In Agile projects: you will be responsible for creating, refining and maintaining user stories and associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases to meet development and stakeholder needs

Facilitate problem-solving discussions and general communications between the business and IT and within IT itself

Canadian Tire experience and organizational knowledge preferred

Who you are

We are looking for high performing individuals who are:
Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers

Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.

What you’ve done

University degree or equivalent

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst in a project-based environment

Fluent in technology and strong knowledge of project and software administration methodologies/techniques

Excellent verbal and communication skills.

Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills.

Good interpersonal skills.

The Group Creditor Project Delivery Systems Analyst is a key interface between various departments within the Group Customer business unit, in support of delivering projects driven by Group Customer. The role will also work closely with vendors as well as business partners in the Strategic Customer Marketing and Shared Enterprise Services when project delivery accountabilities and/or business value outcomes are shared.

The Systems Analyst will be responsible for collection, analysis and documentation of business requirements, needs and features, contribute to solutioning discussions and translate business needs and features into developer-consumable functional and non-functional requirements as an input to design, development and testing exercises associated with application delivery or configuration.

The successful candidate will develop a strong and deep understanding of Group Customer needs and how systems support the core business unit mission.

Accountabilities:
Works closely with cross-departmental staff to understand how systems are used to support business functions.
Works with cross-departmental staff and management to analyze how existing systems may be improved to better support their business functions.
Works with vendors and cross-business unit staff to deliver new systems and technology solutions.
In conjunction with development staff, is responsible to plan and analyze data structures for internal and vendor business systems.
Writes detailed functional and non-functional specifications for developing or modifying various systems.
Prepares detailed workflow diagrams to specify operations performed by equipment and system applications and operations to be performed by personnel in system.
Plans, prepares or contributes to technical reports, memoranda, and instructional manuals as necessary.
Responsible to support system upgrades and maintenance after implementation during the warranty period.
Enforce application delivery methodologies, specifications and standards associated with CEO/CFO delivery controls.
Provide technical documentation and analysis, help administer or contribute to training for users, and support end users during the transition to maintenance period.
Create use cases for testing, as part of the System Requirements documentation process and work with quality assurance resources to ensure understanding of the requirements and traceability of test strategies, plans and test cases back to business requirements.
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary Degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology.
10+ years of relevant experience or the equivalent in experience plus education.
Experience working with data, function and design of database applications supporting business functions.
Experience managing substantial, cross-departmental projects.
Experience working with outside developers, vendors and consultants.
Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving, and organizational skills; attention to detail; and ability to coordinate multiple tasks, set priorities, and meet deadlines.
Experience with requirements gathering and documentation of functional and non-functional specifications.
A self-starter who can work effectively as a member of a team or independently as the particular assignment requires.
Demonstrated analytical and computer proficiency necessary.
Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to build strong relationships with internal clients, and a successful track record of collaboration toward achieving objectives expected.
Strong technical skills in Microsoft office (excel, access, word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks while meeting tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills both orally and written as communication is internally and externally with clients.
Ability to work well in a team environment and independently.
Working knowledge of web development, master data management, identity and access management software and logical architecture.
Experience with development or translation of customer personas, journey maps and wireframe into functional and non-functional specifications.
Ability to provide shared leadership and oversight of a project team, alongside the Project Manager and Systems Architect and/or other Systems Analysts on larger programs.
Experience with agile project delivery.

As a Data Analyst at Vendasta you will ask questions and discover the answers. For the Existing Enterprise division, you will be responsible for building and maintaining a variety of data channels required for monitoring business intelligence, success metrics, and user behaviour.

You will report directly to the individuals prioritizing your work and will leverage the interdepartmental analyst group to review, develop, and share information and analyses. The Data Analyst will be articulate, analytical, and a team player who understands the power of data. Build and interpret internal dashboards and data, analyze results, and provide ongoing reporting

Push requirements to Vendasta Business Intelligence teams to leverage their tech/strategy

Experience performing statistical analysis
Competent in cleaning and formatting data
Proven ability to analyze and model data

Familiarity with Google Cloud Infrastructure, App Engine, and tools (Bigquery, Data Store, Google Analytics, Data Studio, etc.)
Familiarity with databases and various querying techniques (SQL, NoSQL, API)
General knowledge of Python and agile development practices (would be considered an asset)
Knowledge of design principles and data visualizations
Awareness of key users to surface actionable insights (partners, local businesses, Partner Success Managers, Sales Reps, vendors, etc.)
Continuous learner with a drive to explore new technologies and processes
Analytical business sense as aligned to division strategies and goals
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented with a strong pursuit for truth and accuracy

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
At Loblaw Companies Limited, our purpose – Live Life Well – supports the needs and well-being of Canadians who make one billion visits each year to our stores.
Ambitious, right?
We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond the limits of what’s comfortable. Our goal is a relentless customer-first commitment. We analyze. We challenge. We connect. We are innovators. And what we are achieving is revolutionizing the retail and digital advertising industry. By transforming data into knowledge, we provide our partners a deeper understanding about their customers — who they are and what they are about.
Loblaw Media offers a new way to plan and deliver meaningful digital advertising to help consumer brands more effectively reach customers who will love their products. We use transaction-based insights from our online and bricks and mortar stores to target and measure campaign effectiveness.
Bringing our mission to life requires amazing people and the right workplace. We have a diverse team of experts who want to take ownership and make an impact. People who are energized by collaboration and passionate about solving complex problems. People hungry to venture well beyond their corner of the business to discover new products and new ways of doing things. We have gathered this cross-functional team in a unique and open loft-style space in downtown Toronto.
Your job description starts here, but it ends where you’re willing to take it…
Loblaw Media is hiring a Data Analyst with a background in web development. What You'll Do:
Responsible for the extraction and analysis of complex information from a variety of databases.
Develop capabilities to identify areas of opportunity and improve processes and efficiency on reporting.
Work with IT in terms of identifying opportunities to make key information more easily and reliably accessible.
Act as gatekeeper with regards to security and confidentiality of data obtained through all sources.
Translating business requests and questions into SQL logic. Business requests can be strategic nature or tactical focus, including but not limited to initiatives about in-store activities, CRM initiatives, marketing promotion, etc.
Extract, review and prepare sales and customer behavior data for analysis, reporting using SQL
Analyze data to help determine insights to solve business problems
Work collaboratively with Product, Sales and Marketing and Operations groups, on cross functional projects and initiatives
Support with designing and deploying advanced campaign performance reporting dashboards
Support with designing and delivering, and maintaining enterprise-wide / in-production analytic solutions
Troubleshooting issues related to data and analytics, including the management of ad-hoc reporting requests
Support with developing data driven insights and analytics presentations to internal and external stakeholders and partners
What You'll Bring:
Mandatory: Programming skills with Python. Optional: Scala or R.
Mandatory: Experience with Django Framework, HTML, JavaScript. Optional: React, Angular
University Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, and Mathematics is preferred
Experience with Hadoop and understanding of its components (HDFS, HBase, Spark) is an asset.
Data mining experience working with a large relational customer database
3 years experience in utilizing advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools (MS SQL, Unix, Linux, IBM Netezza, IBM DB2, Teradata).
Experience in BI platform (Power BI, Microstrategy, Cognos, SAS, etc)
Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A Team player and self starter
Advanced MS Office skills (Excel, Word, Access)

At L3 WESCAM, we develop the most advanced and complex optical and sensor systems for global defense and military sectors, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement. Vancouver, BCYou are a sharp, disciplined individual who has a passion for mobile games. Your experience helps to demonstrate your superior quantitative analytical skill and a scientific thought process. Your expertise paves the way for working with our game team to optimize every facet of player retention and monetization to ensure the continued success of our games. Large datasets are your playground and you can’t wait to join the fun!

Sound like a match? Kabam Vancouver is looking for a Data Analyst to join us!We don’t just make games, we play and love them too.

You will contribute by:

Providing support to cross-functional teams across the organization to understand overall business goals, improve reporting, and assist with larger scale projects as needed
Finding answers to business questions via hands-on exploration of data sets using SQL, dashboards, statistical analysis, and data visualizations
Generating and maintaining a suite of dashboards and reports for teams throughout the organization
Creating and managing multiple A/B tests to gain valuable insights on KPIs including retention, acquisition, and monetization
Measuring the success of product features after release and optimize their performance through rapid, data-driven iteration
Aiding in task prioritization and general project management within the data team
At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And that’s where you come in…

Your background includes:

2+ years of industry data analysis experience, with solid knowledge of statistical methods
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a STEM discipline
Expert SQL skills and experience querying very large data sets
Proven ability to thrive using multiple mixed, varied, and inconsistent data sources
Fundamental knowledge of project management methodologies
Comfort presenting complicated material to diverse audiences
It would be nice to have:

Experience with Google BigQuery, Tableau, JIRA and/or other project management software
Experience working for a social or mobile game developer
Understanding of game design concepts and principles
MBA or Master’s Degree
Joining a team of highly-motivated individuals inquisitive spirits who are always searching for the answers to hard questions. With an inquisitive spirit, you will provide meaningful insights into how Kabam’s games operate and contribute to setting them up for continued success.

Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us.

Together, we can create some of the best games ever made.

About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

Job Summary
Under general supervision, the Senior Business Systems Specialist is responsible for/involved in all aspects of the life of a specific system/application. May include: evaluation of system enhancement requests, requirements development and documentation, testing and implementation; production support/troubleshooting, maintenance of system documentation, training responding to customer concerns and communicating results. The Senior Business Systems Specialist is responsible to assess and communicate impacts of changes to the application or system domain. The Senior Business Systems Specialist possesses strong knowledge of a particular business capability, product or system domain. Utilizing knowledge of the business and the specific application(s), identifies system opportunities to support business needs. May specialize in a particular technology or skill. This job typically does not lead others., but may act as a team lead coordinating multiple change requests or large enhancements. The Senior Business Systems Specialist may provide limited coaching to less experienced team members.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Production support/troubleshooting: Facilitate troubleshooting and defect resolution. This includes requesting resources, migration through environments and ticket management. Effectively communicates status of enhancements, change requests and defects. May manage change, defect and enhancement request process and assignment of approved work. Documentation and Training: Maintains documentation of current state systems. Assists in development of training materials and business implementation/transition activities. Evaluates requests for projects and enhancements. May make recommendations for operational process improvements and/or system enhancements. Elicits documents and validates requirements for change requests and enhancements to capabilities, products or systems. May act as project manager for enhancements or new functionality. Helps identify appropriate subject matter experts and stakeholders to participate in requirements sessions. Utilizes business and system knowledge to support business needs. Applies knowledge of a particular business capability, product and/or system domain and communicates impact of changes to current state business process, products, data, feeds and systems. May provide input into departmental or divisional planning process. Provides subject matter expertise and capabilities to Business and IT Projects. Simultaneously support multiple projects as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned. Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or equivalent required. One year of experience supporting business technology systems required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree in Business, MIS, or other related field preferred. Three years of experience supporting business technology systems preferred.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Business Perspective (Intermediate): Uses knowledge of internal and external factors impacting the property casualty industry to make decisions. Technology (Intermediate): Uses, leverages and maintains proficiency with corporate and job specific technology as it evolves (e.g., hardware, software, business unit applications and systems tools). Analytical Thinking (Basic): Identifies current or future problems or opportunities, analyzes, synthesize and compares information to understand issues, identifies cause/effect relationships and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision making. Relationship Management (Basic): Seeks out, builds, fosters and maintains productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results. Communication (Basic): Demonstrates effective verbal, written, and listening communication skills. Facilitation (Basic): Uses and adjusts style and technique to assist group process and understanding. Teamwork (Intermediate): Works together in situations when actions are interdependent and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result. Conflict Management (Basic): Brings conflicts into the open and resolves them collaboratively. Change Management / Resilience (Basic): Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands. Risk Taking (Basic): Identifies, assesses, manages and takes intelligent risks to attain objectives.

Licensing or Certificates
None

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

Position Summary
The Analyst, Data Governance is responsible for establishing and ensuring adherence to an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices, both at the department and Business and Functional areas level, to achieve the required level of consistency and quality to meet overall business needs.
Do you have passion and curiosity for and about data? We are looking for a strong mix of skillsets, along with an attitude of relentless pursuit, problem solving and desire to learn!
What you will be doing:
Work with business subject matter experts and IT developers to gather business requirements for data definitions, and reference data.
Assist in the development, testing, and implementation of the associated data documentation, analysis, reporting, and process improvements
Assist in the roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Make sure regulatory data is accurate and work with data stewards to correct existing data.
Work with other project streams to make sure data governance is adhered when rolling out projects
Work with data stewards to correct existing data
Perform special projects as assigned
Other duties as required
What we are looking for:
Post secondary education in Statistics, Business or related field of study – degree preferred
Bachelor Degree in a field related to data management strongly preferred
Accounting experience a strong asset
Minimum of 3 - 5 years in Data Analysis
Experience in the property and casualty insurance industry required
Experience in Data Governance is a strong asset
Familiarity with/experience within the P&C insurance industry and regulatory reports preferred (IBC and GAA)
Strong working knowledge of business operations, operational procedures, workflow and processing functions
Basic to Intermediate proficiency in SAS, Dbase
Basic to Intermediate proficiency/experience with SQL Server along with Data Profiling Skills
Advanced proficiency with Excel; Intermediate proficiency with Word and PowerPoint
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Strong collaborative skills and an ability to build consensus
Team player, customer focused, adaptable/flexible
What sets you apart:
Ability to plan, organize, and manage multiple demands and changing priorities, and deliver results.
Ability to work successfully within functional and cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated proficiency and resourcefulness in identifying and analyzing relevant data and defining critical issues and alternatives within established guidelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated presentation, listening and coordination skills.
Ability to work in a dynamic, self-empowered environment and team atmosphere requiring minimal supervision.
Demonstrated track record in meeting deadlines, and effectively handling multiple assignments and tasks with accuracy while under tight time constraints.
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional and technical development.
What We Have to Offer:
Northbridge Cares program – volunteer day and donation matching
Generous paid time off, including personal days. Flexible work hours as well as early departure opportunities
Flexible Group Benefits Plan – medical, dental, insurances
Defined Contribution Pension Plan + Optional Group RRSP
Northbridge Employee Share Purchase Plan
Education Assistance Program
Employee Assistance plan
Staff Insurance - discount on home, automobile and pet insurance
Plus, the opportunity to contribute to the success of Northbridge through sharing your knowledge and experience while learning from others!

Key Role
The Industry Managed Solutions team requires a Solutions Analyst to assist in managing the ongoing growth and transformation of the team. The Analyst will play a critical role on the IMS team, helping to consolidate the various streams of data and information from throughout the organization. In addition, the Analyst will help create and maintain a comprehensive set of metrics and reports which will help describe the current state of the business, identify trends and measure key vendor performance. In addition to the data-oriented responsibilities, the Analyst will be required to conduct industry research, perform industry scans, partake in vendor reviews and assist in vendor selection.

In addition to these responsibilities, the Analyst will assist in the day-to-day operation of the department which will include managing the departments SharePoint site, assisting in budgeting, resource tracking and overall administration of the team.


Duties and Responsibilities
Develop and manage reports to identify trends and opportunities within key business areas
Collect, organize and maintain information from various sources throughout the organization (incl. subscriber feedback, business requirements, sector board feedback, etc) and deliver regular status updates regarding progress within various project assignments
Conduct industry research and communicate finding to leadership;
Manage departmental communication and document SharePoint site;
Act as a conduit between the Industry Managed Solutions team and other key stakeholder in the organization
Maintain key vendor information, and monitor reporting on vendor performance against service level agreements and Key Performance Indicators
Assist with budgeting, time tracking and general administration of the IMS team


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology or Engineering
2-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience with developing and managing reports, and conducting analysis to provide insights to team members and senior leadership
Strong analytical and statistical knowledge with an ability to combine quantitative and common-sense problem-solving skills
Ability to read, comprehend, summarize and report on various sources of information such as industry articles, websites, periodicals, etc. and present findings in a succinct and professional manner
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products; must have exceptional Excel skills and working knowledge of MS Access (or other database management system).
Understanding of simple programing languages (such as SQL, VBA, Python)
Ability to independently gain insight into and develop process / system changes and improvements.
Self-starter, able to manage and prioritize multiple complex tasks with minimum supervision and strong attention to detail
Desire to learn and succeed in a challenging fast-paced environment
Understanding of six sigma tools and methodologies would be an asset
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
Strong work ethic, a high respect for confidentiality and sound professional judgment

Vancouver, BCAbout the role

High quality data is core to the value proposition of Alloy and our teams work hard to monitor and maintain the quality of the data coming in. As we scale, our data operations needs will increase and will require ownership beyond the Engineering and Client Solutions teams.
In this role, you’ll be the expert in investigating and resolving issues with our trading partner data integrations. You will support customer onboarding and the development of new data integrations. You'll obtain expert knowledge about the data feeds that Alloy supports.

About You

You are naturally drawn to analytical work and are comfortable working with an engineering-oriented team towards common goals. You can naturally switch between detail-oriented execution, communication with all involved parties, and prioritization based on added value.
What You'll Do
Be a data expert at Alloy. Develop a deep understanding of the different data sources we support. Create systems to capture this knowledge and make it available to others.
Investigate and resolve data pipeline issues with partner integrations using internal Alloy tools. Work with our Client Solutions team to communicate technical details and business impacts of known data issues to our customers
Own data onboarding for new customers. Manage data feeds, establish file transfer connectivity, and review data for quality and completeness. Develop a streamlined, repeatable process for obtaining necessary onboarding details from customers
Support Client Solutions in creating value for customers by assisting with creating dashboards and identifying opportunities in the data
Work with Client Solutions and Engineering teams to provide expertise in partner-specific features and functionality necessary to support our customers' data needs
What We're Looking For
You have strong experience in analyzing data through spreadsheets (Excel) and/or databases (SQL).
You have a demonstrated ability to transform customer business needs into a set of concrete specifications and executing on those tasks.
You’re adaptable to a wide set of technologies and can find patterns across different data sources.
You are familiar with supply chain, retail, and logistics fundamentals (preferred)
You have basic experience writing scripts (e.g Python) to automate tasks or manipulate data (preferred)
You value empathetic and proactive communication, especially when confronted with issues.
About Alloy

Alloy is the modern analytics and planning software solution for consumer goods brands. We empower these companies, which make the items we use, wear and consume every day, to manage supply and demand with speed and agility.

Alloy is early-stage, well-funded by leading VCs, and growing. Our small team believes deeply in fostering individual ownership, iterative product development, and empathetic communication. There are many challenging problems to solve in this industry, and a huge opportunity for our software to make the global supply chain operate more effectively.

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst works closely with internal teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. BI Analyst understands how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Analyze and document business requirements and priorities to develop key performance indicators (KPI), and the business intelligence and data warehouse strategy
Educate and train internal staff on the use of data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new form and content
Work with and educate our business development, marketing, finance, and program teams to design and develop dashboards, reports and visualization of customer trends through quarterly presentations
Provide leadership and take initiatives to facilitate information gathering, structure documentation and presentation of findings to all levels of management
Establish processes and controls to store and maintain clean data records that can be used as source data for reporting
Make improvements to our data warehouse and ensure that data is managed in a way that is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems
Lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems
Provide subject matter expertise for key BI core functions
Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation
Troubleshoot issues quickly and to stay up-to-date on current and emerging technologies, standards and trends
Other duties as assigned


TRAINING:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
EXPERIENCE:


5+ years of experience as a business intelligence analyst designing and implementing data warehouses using enterprise business intelligence software such as Microsoft Power BI or equivalent as well as visualization tools such as Tableau
ESSENTIAL SKILLS:


In-depth experience with data warehouse design, modeling and data mining
In-depth knowledge of database management systems, online analytical processing and ETL processes
Experience using SQL/TSQL and Microsoft SSRS/SSIS/SSAS
Demonstrated problem solving and analysis skill set to map, report and analyze data trends


OTHER SKILLS:


Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Exceptional time management skills
Ability to deal with stressful situations with professionalism and to periodically work overtime and outside normal business hours

Reporting to the Manager, Health Informatics of the Communicable Disease Control (CDC) Directorate, the Senior Health Information Analyst will be responsible to support the migration and integration of CDC data sources into the Toronto Public Health Datamart Data Warehouse and to support operational, workload, and strategic reporting in the Directorate.

Participates in strategic and operational planning for issues related to CDC reporting/analytics of CDC-related information systems.
Provides feedback and makes recommendations specific to future data needs, design and delivery of analytical products, design of information delivery methods, designing of training and knowledge transfer activities.

Considerable experience in a public health or related agency.
Extensive experience using business intelligence software (e.g. Cognos) and familiarity using other software packages and programming languages currently used to collect, analyze and report population health data.
Considerable experience applying basic population health statistical methods.
Experience using Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access and other software packages relevant to the analysis and presentation of population health data.
You must also have:

Knowledge of database design and programming.
Familiarity with current public health issues, epidemiological concepts, trend analysis and forecasting techniques. Subject matter expertise in communicable disease reporting would be considered an asset.
