Toronto, ONSupply Chain Analyst

Role: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Toronto, ON

Company: Freshii HQ

Reports To: Manager, Supply Chain

The Supply Chain Analyst will act as a lead interface with partners, vendors, and distributors to provide support to the Freshii stores and to resolve supply issues relating to the supply of goods. This individual will manage internal data and analytics to make key decisions and works with our Franchise and DC community to provide daily supply chain support. The incumbent analyzes and monitors inventory levels and provides forecasts to ensure overall goals in service level, inventory investment, and purchasing compliance are achieved. Projects are technical, with a high degree of complexity across multiple teams, both internal and external, and across multiple platforms. The position utilizes continuous improvement principles to achieve key performance objectives in line with business growth expectation and drive the cost to service efficiencies. Supply Chain is a real-life environment where timely determination and execution of the appropriate response to change is daily work.

Responsibilities:

Own DC-level supply chain metrics and drive best practice to achieve KPIs such as case fill rate, delivery on time, forecast, and inventory obsolescence.

Proactively monitor and identify any gaps between supply and demand and create and execute timely solutions to avoid out of stocks (Medium to long term supply plans).

Reduce waste by managing inventory obsolescence.

Supplier Management, ensuring all forecast and supply flow requirements are executed to defined targets/standards

Work with suppliers on the availability of product, production planning and raw material lead times
Develop, execute and monitor the forecast and supply plan for new product launches, transitions, and promotions.

Liaise and communicate with DCs and partners regarding upcoming product launches, transitions, or product shortages.

Regularly monitor the orders of franchise partners to ensure 100% Supply Chain Compliance is maintained across the system.

Manage the listing of new vendors and items with DC’s

Build and maintain strong relations both with internal and external customers

Provide recommendations for the development and implementation of supply chain network changes and processes, which can enhance efficiencies, KPI’s and service for our partners.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or Supply Chain certificate (APICS or equivalent)

Knowledge of CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods), Retail or QSR Industry

2+ years of Supply Chain experience ( Supply Planning and/or Demand Forecasting, etc)

Lean Training preferred but not required


Competencies:

Strong customer orientation

Proven continuous improvement and project management skills

Demonstrated strong analytical skills

Have a good understanding of logistics and warehousing

Self-starter and driven for results

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams.

Attention to detail with a strong ability to multitask

Excellent Communication Skills (verbal and written)

Ability to deal with complexity and ambiguity

Proactive, persuasive, influential and flexible attitude


Technical Skills:

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Access and PowerPoint

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

This is a highly visible role across the organization that will challenge your ability to work with ambiguity, manage large amounts of data, turn insights into action, and make strong connections with business leaders. You will be working independently with category business managers, building relationships and Interpreting category, brand, and vendor strategies and their impact on price. You will have the opportunity to develop and implement new or existing frameworks that improve our customer’s price perception, while maximizing our categories profitability. In this role, you’ll work across a team of high performing individuals looking to make an impact at Canadian Tire.

What you’ll do

Work with Senior Pricing Analyst to become experts on the products they support and the pricing strategy applicable to their division. Use this knowledge to work with merchandising teams to help them understand how the strategies in place impact their business and find areas of opportunity

Use competitive insights, category framework, price optimization tool, reporting and other product specific knowledge to determine optimal pricing at a SKU level

Work with the Pricing Specialists to ensure SKU level changes are executed accurately and in a timely manner

Use competitive information compiled by shoppers and Pricing Specialists to maintain web scraping inputs and outputs for the SKUs within their division

Monitor competitive index for all SKUs within their division and work with senior analyst to determine best course of action to resolve any products that may stray from the desired index

Responsible for report generation and analysis for the team

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

1-3 years’ experience in an analytical role

Solid communication skills and problem-solving skills

Strong knowledge of MS Access, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint

Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced business environment

Merchandising and/ore retail experience is an asset

Knowledge of the automotive industry is an asset

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA!
The Eastern Townships, located at the very south of the province, shares a border with the United States over close to 300 km (186 mi). The charm comes on thick as you forge your way into this paradise of mountains, hills and valleys. The architectural heritage, evidence of the Anglo-Saxon legacy, has transformed the towns into the most picturesque of places. 80% of the territory is covered by forests. Come the fall season, an abundance of colour covers the branches. To the sheer delight of outdoor enthusiasts, four national parks, including Parc national du Mont-Orford, and many other natural areas provide their share of activities, no matter the season: hiking, biking, camping, skiing and so much more. A favourite vacation destination, the Eastern Townships offers a good selection of B&Bs and inns, not to mention spas and health centres. Agritourism completes the region’s circle of charm, with five different circuits exploring vineyards, orchards, country-style dining, terroir delights and sugar shacks. In fact, the region counts several vineyards, all very different from one another, such as the Vignoble Le Cep d’Argent where you can discover the pleasure of their palatable wine.

Description

PI ANALYST

REQUISITION NUMBER: TAME-CAKI01805052

At Bombardier Transportation, our trains and rail solutions move millions of people safely and reliably around the world, every single day. Join us, and you’ll be part of a global team, sharing knowledge, experience and ideas across countries and cultures, and boosting our reputation as a global leader in rail technology. Your work will have a truly human impact, connecting communities, cities and businesses, and helping people to get where they need to be. It’s all about progress.

Join us as a PI Analyst and you’ll be looking at a career-defining role based in Kingston.

As PI Analyst you will develop and maintain methods and take direct action to organize, analyze, exploit data gathered and generated by Product Introduction (PI) using BT standard information system tool foundation. You will also recommend and implement actions to mitigate risk and create value added on division’s activities. You will develop and implement in BT tools process for ease of execution and reporting. You will support execution, timely preparation and publishing of Product Introduction (PI) deliverables within budget and expected quality.

Your responsibilities will include:

Develop, implement and maintain methods in BT tools for execution and timely availability of deliverables;Organize, extract, analyze and synthesize data in exploitable form;Troubleshoot, investigate, resolve and recommend solution to issues;Communicate results and articulate, publish and implement improvements.

Qualifications

Knowledge of Maximo and Rational (DOORS, RQM, RTC) tools;Five (5) to ten (10) years of experience;Experience with data driven analysis;Experience in customer service, testing and engineering domains;Knowledge of metrics, key performance indicator methods and data driven facts representation;Understanding of technology and engineering domain.

It covers the full spectrum of solutions, ranging from trains to sub-systems and signalling to complete turnkey transport systems, e-mobility technology and data-driven maintenance services. Combining technology and performance with empathy, Bombardier Transportation continuously breaks new ground in sustainable mobility by providing integrated solutions that create substantial benefits for operators, passengers and the environment. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, Bombardier Transportation employs around 39,850 people and its products and services operate in over 60 countries.

P2 Energy Solutions is dedicated to providing a positive culture where the ability to learn, collaborate, and make a difference is rewarded. Minimum of 10 years of Land Administration experience (various disciplines)
Minimum of 5+ years of Qbyte CS Land application experience
Knowledge of current industry initiatives and trends
Experience gathering requirements, writing use cases, and documentation is preferred
Experience with Oil & Gas mid-stream and upstream land applications
Excellent problem solving, analytical, and written communication skills
Superior interpersonal skills

Belief In The P2 Way
Always be learning.

Create positive energy.
Think beyond…

Company:
Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Full-time Intermediate Data Analyst (Markham)
Job Description:
Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, this person will be a key contributor to Opta’s big data and AI expertise. The incumbent will be responsible for building, analyzing, and reporting on large and sample data assets. Using his/her strong statistical techniques, will apply the right analysis strategy to deliver insight, relationships and repeatable queries or processes. Working closely with the Professional Services team, the individual will be responsible for the fulfillment of customer requests. The individual will work closely with Business Analysts to articulate production system requirements for Opta’s data assets. In addition, the individual will be responsible for sourcing, evaluating, submitting recommendations on data sources that support Opta’s data driven strategies and financial objectives.
Accuracy and attention to detail is critically important. The incumbent will utilize multiple technical tools on a daily basis. Technologies that will be used include Access, Excel, SQL and other similar related data management tools, as well as tools to build on data-mining and predictive analytics logic. The incumbent must have the ability to create worksheets, databases, basic program scripts / macros / select criteria to accommodate requests and evolving needs. This person will work closely with the IT, Operational, Professional Services, and R&D teams to deliver and optimize analytical products and solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Review existing data and current techniques to ensure its integrity, identify new data management and translation methods resulting in data integration improvements.
Maintain and improve data integrity and accuracy of assets identifying ways to eliminate recurring data issues.
Working closely with the Opta’s Enterprise Data Architect, lead the maturity of the data governance process
Articulate data requirements for production systems
Load, validate, compile and analyze available data assets.
Produce reports based on business objectives and strategic requirements.
Engage with third parties in data acquisition and supporting sourcing decisions.
Aide in the setup, process improvement and maturing of an analytics practice with in the organization.
Prepare, coordinate and analyze customer data set and deliverables, working closely with the Professional Services team.
Work with stakeholders on strategic research and development of Opta’s product lines.
Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects.
Education, knowledge and experience required:
Written and oral fluency in English.
Completion of a post-secondary degree such as Math, Computer Science, Economics, Actuarial or Commerce and a minimum of 4 years of related work experience that includes developing database queries, statistical analysis and analytical tasks.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the capability to look for solutions outside existing boundaries.
Adept at statistical analysis, trending and very detail oriented.
Highly proficient in some of the following: MS Access, Excel, Access, SQL, R, SAS with a strong understanding of computer systems.
Familiarity with data mining techniques, ETL practice and solutions within a Data Warehouse environment.
Confident in creating and comprehending advanced spreadsheets, databases, data structures, etc.
Experience effectively identifying (non-technical) user requirements, develop and execute a plan to deliver those requirements.
Insurance industry knowledge would be an asset.
Environment/Work Conditions

SCM Insurance Services and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process.

Job Description Summary
The Data Analyst is responsible for data analysis, reporting and warehousing, in addition to being engaged in all aspects of the different business areas within STEMCELL. You will also be responsible for providing actionable data to operating departments and will be an integral part of helping establish and grow a new business intelligence platform.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities
Works with internal business areas to define business data modes and reporting requirements.
Perform complex data analysis that requires critical thinking and report development activities, such as the creation of SQL queries in order to extract data for reports.
Contributes to the development of the IT strategy via critical assessment of emerging data management technologies and gaining a deep understanding of STEMCELL’s business processes and tools.
Design and implement report templates using MS Excel and/or Google Sheets, including the ability to develop scripts for those tools.
Assist in the training, support, maintenance, and ongoing administration of reporting applications.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of delivery and operations within reporting and data warehousing.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience with business intelligence reporting tools - SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BusinessObjects (BOBJ) preferred.
Experience with data visualization and reporting software. Familiarity with Microsoft Access a plus.
Experience writing SQL statements for Oracle and MS-SQL.
Familiarity with the R scripting language.
Familiar with ERP and manufacturing systems - SAP preferred.
Familiar with issue tracking systems - JIRA preferred.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) both in one-on-one and in a group setting including presentation skills in front of development and business areas.
Excellent problem-solving with a keen attention to detail.
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Toronto, ONSENIOR DATA ANALYST
Our Business Intelligence and Analytics team integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics to all business units across the organization to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Senior Data Analyst in this team, the successful candidate will possess very strong analytical skills and the proven ability to gather, view and analyze all forms of information in detail. You will work directly with the business stakeholders. The ideal incumbent will have excellent familiarity of data analysis processes and systems and outstanding interpersonal skills. Previous experience in Microsoft BI technology such as SQL Server, Power BI and Azure is required. The candidate will need to identify the business needs and requirements, process data from multiple sources, and deliver analytical results. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make decisions by turning data into actionable insights. This position will be based out of our Toronto or Edmonton office.

We are looking for a highly motivated team player who is always able to deliver on time. Apply if you enjoy data and analytics, are innovative, love to advocate for change, and have the desire to develop strong working relationships with intelligent colleagues in a new and fast growing international organization!

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Collaborate in small groups to gather business information needs from various teams. Identify business objectives and process workflows, gather requirements from stakeholders, translate requirements into technical specification, create user stories.
Extract and merge data sets from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization with Microsoft BI technologies. Build on-demand reports using Microsoft SSRS. Build dashboards using Power BI and deploy to Power BI Service.
Support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s.
Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Participate in the Enterprise Data Warehouse development, enhancement and other projects as directed by the management. Support the team to design, build, test and deploy end-to-end, best in class BI solutions for self-serve reporting and data analysis.
Manage multiple project simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

A university degree or diploma in Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar disciplines plus 5+ years of work experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics.
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions. Very strong experience working with various data types.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft BI technologies including SQL Server, Power BI, Power Pivot and Azure environment. Excellent SQL skills to write complex queries involving multiple tables and develop stored procedures, triggers, user defined functions.
Proficiency in scripting and programming foundations. Knowledge of Python or R for statistical data analysis.
Knowledge of IaaS, PaaS or SaaS Cloud services such as Azure (preferred).
Experience with Google Analytics, ArcGIS.
Expert level skills in Excel and other MS Office tools.
Strong Agile project experience with proven ability to prioritize and manage time.
Demonstrated success with strategic analytical projects, working with various stakeholders across the business areas.
Demonstrated ability managing deadlines, workload, and multiple complex projects.

Aurora Cannabis Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Heart and Stroke is a special type of organization. We're a foundation, a place that values championing health and has a bias for action as we tackle heart disease and stroke. Our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We do so by raising funds to support critical research, and by helping people reduce their risk of heart disease, stroke, and vascular cognitive impairment through risk factor awareness, promoting healthy lifestyles and advocating for healthy public policy. Six core values unite us: Champion Health, Practice Humility, Embrace Change, Drive Impact, Learn & Grow and Be Heartfelt.
Who we need
Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. This is a chance to improve fundraising strategies, plan for future campaigns and forecast trends that will positively impact the lives of Canadians living with heart and brain disease. We need someone who is excited to develop a range of visual and text data outputs from ad-hoc queries and data exports as well as building standard reports which provide flexible program reporting, and campaign analysis to guide insights and decision making.
What's in it for you?
National impact. This is a chance to capitalize on over one million data points generated by our newly implemented CRM system that encompasses constituent and marketing campaign data from coast-to-coast.
Career development. This is an opportunity to build out your role and introduce processes and best practices for leveraging Business Intelligence tools and the data warehouse solution across a variety of Heart and Stroke data solutions. You will grow your collaborative skills working with portfolio managers to understand business requirements and how to best provide data reports that fulfill those needs.
Who you are
You want to bring your expertise in Business Intelligence to the nonprofit sector where you can make a tangible difference to the organization's success. You believe creating good management reports is exciting and you want a chance to leverage a vast amount of national data to answer the questions of a foundation. You want to be part of a team interacting with partners throughout the whole organization, bridging business and technology knowledge. You want an opportunity to help shape what business intelligence can offer to improve how the organization makes internal and external decisions.
How you will make an impact every day. You will focus on:
A Business Intelligence strategy and roadmap. You will:
Define and implement a plan based on intensive discussions with internal business groups; a deep understanding of data warehouse needs; the limits and strengths of the system; the vision and strategy of the foundation.
Work cross-functionally to establish priorities amongst multiple business partners and commitments.
Subject Matter Expertise. You will:
Develop close relationships across the foundation and position yourself as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert in the areas of business intelligence and data warehousing.
Work closely with Business Managers, Senior Business Analyst, Business Sponsors, IT/Apps Services and External Vendors to ensure accuracy and effectiveness of report delivery.
Translation and Integration. You will:
Translate high-level data requirements into solution architecture.
Produce technical and functional documentation.
Identify and analyze data sources and prospective data points for solution delivery.
Develop data services and frameworks to extract, load and transfer data into applications.
Automate procedures to streamline data integrations across the organization.
Report Development and Management. You will:
Design, develop and deploy new custom reports using MS Reporting Services or BI tools.
Evaluate current reports, modify and consolidate where appropriate.
Develop suitable outputs and formats such as extractions, reports, graphical, and pivots.
Perform quality control from unit testing, to end to end and user acceptance.
Develop Reports Catalogue from the end user perspective.
Data Warehouse Modifications and Maintenance. You will:
Support performance optimization and modification (cubes, dimensions, query objects) of BI data warehouse with the external provider.
Troubleshoot and support BI data warehouse environment with refresh procedures.
Assess and propose solutions to enhance the architecture of the selected BI solution.
What you bring:
The education. You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
The experience. You have 3-5 years of information management experience supporting large database environments encompassing data analytics, reporting, and metrics. You have:
Strong analytical skills and ability to review and synthesize information.
Expertise in producing analytical reports, data visualizations, summaries, and recommendations.
The communication skills. You can seek out, build and nurture internal and external relationships. You can:
Translate complex business intelligence and data warehouse concepts for a non-technical audience.
Disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Present your findings and recommendations to audiences at any level.
The technical skills. You have expertise with:
MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
SQL Server query development and stored procedures.
Data warehousing and OLAP reporting.
Apply now

BUILDING A WORLD CLASS TEAM STARTS WITH YOU

At the heart of CSA Group is a vision: making the world a better, safer, more sustainable place. It’s been part of our mission for nearly one hundred years: from the first engineering standard for railway bridges developed in 1919, to more than 3,500 standards, codes & related products today.

Headquartered in Canada, with a global footprint of more than 30 labs and offices across Europe, Asia and North America, CSA Group tests, inspects and certifies a wide range of products—from every day household items to leading edge technology-to meet exacting requirements for safety, performance and environmental impact.

Our employees take pride in making a difference in people’s lives through the work that we do. We’re looking for people like you to help make it happen.

Planification reliée aux tâches associées à l’analyse d’affaires et au cycle de développement des logiciels (en cascade, itératif, Agile)
Analyse des intervenants, conduite pour identifier les intervenants qui seront touchés par les changements et comprendront leur influence et leur niveau d’autorité.
Évaluation des risques utilisant des méthodes pour identifier les risques, probabilités et impacts et trouver comment atténuer ces risques.
Compétences en facilitationpour rencontrer la haute direction et les exigences de la planification et de la gestion des conférences. Être responsable du développement et du maintien des relations d’affaires.

Gérer les exigences pour comprendre les processus de changement et la traçabilité.
Exigences en communication impliquant l’usage de compétences en présentation et d’aptitudes à créer des gabarits de requis à tous les niveaux dont celui de la haute direction.

Utilisation de techniques de modélisation variées telles que la modélisation de processus, la modélisation de données, la modélisation de systèmes.

Expérience de l’usager, savoir comment une interface d’usager permet à l’usager d’effectuer une tâche avec succès, aussi désigné par le terme ergonomie.

Victoria, BCContract Evaluation Analyst
Administrative Officer R24
An eligibility list may be established.

A great opportunity to take the next step in your career
RoadSafetyBC is the lead provincial agency for road safety and is responsible for setting strategic direction and establishing a provincial approach to road safety throughout British Columbia. RoadSafetyBC regulates drivers and operates a number of programs to help regulate the safe and responsible operation of motor vehicles in B.C.
As Contract Evaluation Analyst, you will analyze and evaluate the performance of RoadSafetyBC’s service providers, including the Responsible Driver Program (RDP), the Ignition Interlock Program (IIP), and Impound Lot Operators (ILOs). You will ensure quality performance, contract compliance, and provide recommendations to Executive members for improvements. You will work with the service providers for the RDP (an education and counselling program) and the IIP (a driver monitoring program which, through the operation of an interlock device installed in drivers’ vehicles, ensures drivers do not drink and drive) as well as the Tow Companies/ILOs participating in the Vehicle Impoundment Program to ensure the Province’s program requirements are being met.
The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.
With over 200 different occupations available in 280 communities across the province, we offer exciting opportunities for your career. Come be a part of the BC Public Service, a Top 100 Employer that embraces diversity, health and career growth. For more information, please see What We Offer.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The BC Public Service is an inclusive and accessible employer. Please advise the hiring manager if any accommodations are required to assist you to ensure equitable participation.

LIFE AT BRP
At BRP, we have a visceral connection to our consumers, one created from a shared passion for the Ultimate Ride. Our teams have a unique ability to develop market-shaping products and services that move people physically and emotionally.
Distributed throughout more than 100 countries, our product line-up includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-doo watercraft, side-by-side all terrain vehicles, Can-Am Spyder roadsters, Evinrude marine propulsion systems, marine propulsion systems and motors for Rotax karts, motorcycles, and small planes, as well as a full line-up of parts, accessories, and clothing.
Our 10 000 employees make up a big family of diverse cultures who all share a common value: innovation. Our people are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve at the heart of an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.
www.brp.com.
Follow us on:
LinkedIn @BRP
Twitter@BRPnews
YouTube @CommunicationsBRP
The Marketing Data Quality Analyst is a new position within the Market Intelligence team. You will develop a deep understanding of all the marketing data we collect, perform effective data quality analysis, validation and troubleshooting, with the support of our partners. You will implement quality control measures, define and document best practices to reduce and resolve data anomalies, and maintain data integrity by proactively analyzing data to support organizational goals.
You will be highly involved in defining Consumer data governance rules and best practices, as part of the BRP Master Data Management Committee, as well as assist in reporting, dashboard creation and participate in the development and implementation of new projects involving Consumer Data.
Interested? We are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics and who demonstrates a willingness to go the extra mile, takes on the responsibility of doing what needs to be done, has a positive attitude and rolls with changes. This person will have a great opportunity to join a committed and talented team of data enthusiasts.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure data integrity, accuracy and consistency across Brands and Regions for both online and offline data through data quality analysis.
Prepare, manipulate and manage extensive databases.
Develop metrics and measures for quality control on an on-going basis through data visualization and manipulation tools.
Manage the testing and work on bug fixing or data improvements as needed.
Ensure scorecards and reports get accurately updated, review business rules, support the team with data connectivity and investigate discrepancies.
Promote productive relationships between stakeholders and external partners, providing clarity and ensuring processes are streamlined.
Be actively involved in the Enterprise data governance and develop data dictionaries that adhere to corporate data standards.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Four (4) to seven (7) years of related experience (SAP, SQL Server, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)
University degree in computer science, business intelligence or another related field
Technical experience with customer marketing technologies and tools is a huge plus
Knowledge of Power BI is a plus
Excellent communication (both verbal and written)
Strong analytical skills
Passion for data and flexible, creative approach to problem solving
Strong organization skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks with tight deadlines, changing priorities and occasional urgent matters while managing time efficiently and communicating to business and other stakeholders accordingly
Strong teamwork skills with ability to work in a matrix team environment with both internal and external counterparts
The selected candidate will work either in Montreal or Sherbrooke. He/She may have to travel occasionally to other BRP offices (Valcourt, Montreal or Sherbrooke offices - carpooling available).
AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA!
The Eastern Townships, located at the very south of the province, shares a border with the United States over close to 300 km (186 mi). The charm comes on thick as you forge your way into this paradise of mountains, hills and valleys. The architectural heritage, evidence of the Anglo-Saxon legacy, has transformed the towns into the most picturesque of places. 80% of the territory is covered by forests. Come the fall season, an abundance of colour covers the branches. To the sheer delight of outdoor enthusiasts, four national parks, including Parc national du Mont-Orford, and many other natural areas provide their share of activities, no matter the season: hiking, biking, camping, skiing and so much more. A favourite vacation destination, the Eastern Townships offers a good selection of B&Bs and inns, not to mention spas and health centres. Agritourism completes the region’s circle of charm, with five different circuits exploring vineyards, orchards, country-style dining, terroir delights and sugar shacks. In fact, the region counts several vineyards, all very different from one another, such as the Vignoble Le Cep d’Argent where you can discover the pleasure of their palatable wine.

People taking care of people. It’s that simple. Combining a legacy of nearly 80 years of unmatched experience with global capabilities and industry-leading technology, Crawford is at the forefront of change, while also staying firmly rooted to our commitment to putting people first.

The candidate will be a member of the SQL Server Client team within Data Management Services (DMS). The primary role on the team will be as a SQL Server Database Administrator supporting various client applications, but the individual may be asked to take on additional duties including infrastructure support and training on various emerging technologies related to Business Intelligence and Big Data solutions. The team has members in Canada, the US and India supporting a wide range of distributed and mainframe applications across many continents. The core hours for this position are 08:00 – 16:30 but are flexible within a range as long as there is proper coverage within the team. All team members must have the ability to handle 7X24 rotational on-call duties, after hour change support and disaster recovery support (will require cell phone, laptop and guaranteed coverage from home). To ensure proper training and support for this position, the candidate's desk space should be in close proximity to the rest of the DMS team members in the designated location.
Main Accountabilities can include:
Administrative support of SQL Server versions 2005, 2008, 2012, 2014 and 2016 including: Database Engine, Integration Services (DTS, SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS) and Reporting Services (SSRS)
Infrastructure support of SQL Server versions 2005, 2008, 2012, 2014 and 2016 including: server/instance installs (stand-alone and clustered), service-pack upgrades, hot fixes, client tool installs, readiness programs, new feature exploitation, research and development (as needed by Infrastructure manager)
Support of application and database upgrades from existing SQL versions to, SQL2012, SQL2014, SQL2016 and future supported releases
Pro-active and reactive performance analysis, monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of issues
Migration of database objects from development through production following documented standards, policies and procedures (Change Management Process)
Monitoring and support of nightly production batch cycles
Organizing and monitoring personal workload and escalating to manager when issues arise
Regular review of database maintenance and performance improvement procedures
Ensuring the proper setup and validation of backup and restore processes
Participation in a rotational on-call schedule
Occasional participation in after-hours and weekend support of production implementations, infrastructure activities, and various disaster recovery exercises
Regular database capacity planning related to database growth and system utilization; trend analysis
Working closely with other team members, technical/team leads, management, specialized IT areas and application support teams to ensure consistent delivery and quality of database services
Helping define, document and implement consistent standards and procedures across the team
Support of PowerShell, T-SQL stored procedures and functions to support internal processes and improve system performance
Maintaining up-to-date documentation and procedures for all supported applications and environments
Managing medium to large projects and participating in a variety of projects through the entire project lifecycle
Maintaining 99.99% availability for all production environments
Assisting clients with various issues related to connectivity, permissions, access
Evaluation of functionality and features with newer versions of the SQL Server DBMS
Sharing ideas for process improvement and innovative solutions to known problems
Qualification & Work Experience:
BE / B Tech /MCA / M Tech / Proven administration/analyst skills preferably with a degree in Computer Science or related technology degree/diploma, or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of SQL Server database administration experience handling medium to large databases
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with the Microsoft BI stack
Experience with on-call support and trouble-shooting
Strong T-SQL skills that include a thorough understanding of system tables, stored procedures, functions, triggers, and SQL tuning
SQL Server 2008, 2012, 2014 or 2016 certification (optional)
Hands-on experience with SQL Server installations and patching
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database tuning using Profiler, Index Tuning Wizard, Dynamic Management Views and Functions (DMVs), and other third-party tools
Strong knowledge of SQL Server Management Studio and Business Intelligence Development Studio
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database backup and recovery strategies
Strong knowledge of SQL Server replication, mirroring, log shipping, maintenance plans and DR recovery strategies
Experience with Sybase Power Designer
Experience with Redgate SQL Backup tools
Knowledge of data-mapping and logical and physical data modeling
Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle several tasks efficiently

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. job_title: Business Analyst II - Purchasing & Inventory Management
job_description:
Ready to create innovative solutions and best practices?

Join our team

Join a cutting edge Procurement and Inventory team responsible for getting the best from our vendors for our internal and external customers. We innovate by creating and executing initiatives that drive the best in class performance and practices for our vital infrastructure builds.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Create and implement vendor key performance indicators (KPIs) supporting 94+% on time material delivery of materials
Create and implement vendor KPIs supporting 80+% on price, to scope and on time delivery for services
Consolidate our vendor base for 4 categories
Increase purchasing policy compliance by 5%+ over previous year
Here's how
Analyze and update our category taxonomy in collaboration with team members and key stakeholders
Create and implement key performance indicators that drive improved performance by our vendors in both materials and services
Develop material rationalization, standardization and substitution strategies
Develop and automate tools and processes that support compliance with our purchasing policy
Implement supplier consolidation plans consistent with Procurement category playbooks
Maximise unit cost pricing by moving material demand between preferred suppliers
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Bachelor Degree or higher in Supply Chain, Procurement, Business or related discipline
3+ years progressive experience in similar role with strong understanding of supply chain management concepts and best practices
Experience with post-award materials and services administration (includes key performance indicators)
Ability to create and implement improvement projects
Intermediate to advanced Excel
Proven track record to meet deadlines while handling shifting priorities
Self-motivated and ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment
Be able to informally lead and manage teams built of cross-functional team members with conflicting priorities
Strong presentation skills with experience presenting at a Director level
Great-to-haves
Experience with data analytics tools such as Domo, Tableau or Mini-Tab
Experience with SAP
Experience with category management

Montréal, QCUnito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018 (https://betakit.com/10-montreal-tech-companies-to-watch-in-2018/). We're a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team. That person will work closely with the marketing, sales and product departments in order to instrument and analyze the data around every touch points of the customer journey, from the discovery of Unito to the platform's usage.
Her/his mission will be to leverage data to realize a cohesive customer journey and user experience. The Data Analyst will maintain, educate and enforce standard data terminology and best practices across the company.
What you will do
During your first few months at Unito, you will mainly focus on helping the marketing team improve conversion rates through data analysis with responsibilities like...
Identify missing data sets in the conversion funnel
Setup a signup funnel dashboard per traffic source with conversion rate goals
Perform website audit, compare it to previous websites, identify issues and opportunities to improve user engagement
Your other responsibilities will involve working with various departments. Here are some of the responsibilities you'll have:
Audit current product data sets
Identify missing data points to improve instrumentation
Identify Customer Journey KPIs with stakeholders
Work closely with dev team to improve tracking
Build dashboards to communicate about KPIs and unify terminology within the company
Provide insightful analysis to support recommendations for the Customer Journey
Refine taxonomy and build glossary
Participate in implementing customer research protocols
Implement product usage & usability dashboards
Level up the data analysis skills of everyone in the company
You are
B.Sc. in Management, Business Technology Management or equivalent
1-3 years experience in an operational role
Excellent knowledge of data analysis tools, from good old spreadsheets to query languages to modern data tools
Proven ability to develop flows and building new processes that simplify and facilitate the data journey
Solid ability to develop models for accurate reporting and analysis
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
Excellent time management and organization skills
Ability to work independently and drive towards an answer
Confidence with communication and presentation
Experience working with external stakeholders
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical techniques for analyzing datasets
It'd be nice if you
Have experience with Hubspot (or equivalent CRM system)
Have experience with analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, Amplitude, Keen, Segment)
Have experience in the B2B SaaS sector
Have experience mapping sales processes
Have experience in customer research
Are fluent in French
Who we are
We're taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs.
Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. We've acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 20 people, and connected 9 different applications together. We're on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and we've shown so far that we've got what it takes to succeed.
Culture
Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age (our founders span 3 decades), gender (almost at parity!), cultures, and backgrounds (11 countries). We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard.
Here at Unito, we're huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics or hiding mistakes, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, all company metrics, and learn from failures together as a team.
Our team operates through areas of of responsibility that make everyone own of a part of the business. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company.
Benefits
Dental, health and travel insurance
Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes
Gorgeous new downtown office space located by metro Champs de Mars and Berri UQAM, plus reserved parking
Join our groups of runners, walkers, hikers, soccer or basketball players
If this position sounds like a good fit, we'd love to hear from you!
To know more about our hiring process, here's a blog post (https://unito.io/blog/the-modern-guide-to-hiring-millennials/) detailing how we go about it and what to expect when you apply for a job at Unito.

This role reports to the Manager, Clinical Information Systems and IT Applications. The Application Specialist / Business Analyst plays an instrumental role in liaison with assigned user areas in regards to system optimization and project related work. The position also plays a key role in the implementation and ongoing development of an electronic medical record.

The incumbent is a key resource for the support of our Meditech Healthcare Information System that is used by staff and physicians across the organization. With the goal of supporting patient care, clinical and administrative processes, the Applications Specialist / Business Analyst will support and modify Meditech HIS modules. Key aspects of this role include providing advice on the impact of changes and liaising with our software vendors.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Job Description

The Legal Department has a newly created position of Junior Insurance Analyst, reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Insurance & Operational Risk.
The successful applicant will have strong analytical and communication skills. The position requires agile and independent thinking with a client service oriented approach. As an integral member of the Legal team, the successful applicant will be required to collaborate closely with multiple internal departments & external parties; manage tight deadlines and turn-around times for periodic reporting; and handle a variety of requests from our Canadian and US business units and other stakeholders.
The key areas of responsibilities of this position include:
Analyzing, manipulating, and presenting insurance data for internal and external clients
Maintain claims and loss tracking database and related reporting
Maintain an online filing system for claims management
Process and investigate reported occurrences for businesses in Canada and the US
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders including lawyers, adjusters, brokers and internal stakeholders, including those in the field
Coordinate and respond to undertaking requests from external counsel
Analyze insurance contracts and other documents (ex. leases, service agreements, contracts with insurance related provisions)
Partner with our broker and adjustor to manage insurance and claims programs, including renewal and midterm adjustments
Manage several ongoing projects simultaneously
Meet periodic deadlines for reporting and other requests
Understand contractual and compliance obligations
Fulfil requests for third party Certificate of Insurance
Identify and communicate potential risk/liability and other exposures
Conduct risk assessments and implement related risk control(s) to remedy or mitigate loss exposure
Identify potential risk improvement opportunities
Actively participate in preparation and analysis of renewal underwriting data as part of the insurance renewal process.
Complete ad hoc data requests and projects

Qualifications

A post-secondary education and 2-3 years of insurance or financial experience.
Solid analytical skills.
Excellent communication skills (both oral and written).
A strong understanding of Risk Assessment, Risk Control and/or Risk Financing.
Superior MS Office skills (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote).
Organized professional with an ability to multi-task and have exceptional time management skills.
Self-motivator with a positive attitude.
Fluency in French an asset, but not a requirement.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst
Department: Tech Delivery - Enterprise
Reports To: Manager, Technology

Purpose of Job

The Senior Business Analyst (BA) will facilitate the identification and documentation of detailed user stories (functional requirements), process and system flows and contribute to the overall user experience, technical solution, and acceptance criteria for the company’s core banking platforms and interfacing applications. The BA will facilitate communication between the business and IT, soliciting input and expertise from business subject matter experts and technology teams. The BA will support testing phases as well as assist with project implementation. The scope of most initiatives includes multiple business stakeholders, and downstream systems and vendors. The BA will be a core member within a cross-functional Pod that deliver initiatives using EQB’s hybrid-agile methodology and tools. The BA will work with stakeholder groups across Product Management, Operations, Fraud, AML, and multiple Technology teams and suppliers. EQB is using the latest suite of Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, and add-ons) for capturing epics, user stories, flows, technical design documents, testing, and sprint-based execution.

Main Activities:

Establish a plan for stakeholder workshops to capture and elaborate detailed user stories, by bundles of Themes and Epics.
Facilitate workshops to document customer / user needs, process / system flows, and end to end requirements as detailed user stories. User Stories will include key areas such as happy path experiences, alt/error flows, spec-by-example, acceptance criteria, and business value.
With cross-functional Pod and external supplier support, decompose user story and experience requirements by supplier. Establish and maintain traceability form the Bank’s overarching requirements to each supplier.
Drive and ensure sign-off of BA created artefacts across the Pod team and stakeholders.
Support cross-functional Pod and to create technical design documents, create acceptance criteria and testing artefacts, and story point estimation (where applicable).
Support ad hoc business and technical analysis requests to support main activities as required, such as API data maps.
Support daily stand-ups and project velocity reporting as required (ex: pace of writing & approving detailed user stories).
Work with Quality Assurance team by providing input into the test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements and supporting user validation
Communicate changes to the requirements effectively and on a timely basis to delivery leads, project managers and other necessary stakeholders

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

5 or more years of experience in delivering technology projects in a Business Analyst capacity or related role participating on full lifecycle project implementations
Deep understanding of Software Development Life Cycle concepts.
Experience with both waterfall and agile methodologies.
Business domain knowledge in Canadian Lending - Residential or Commercial, Term Deposits or Accounting and Finance is mandatory.
Good understanding of Compliance (FCAC) and Regulatory (OSFI, CDIC) regulations and policies
Extensive experience in web interface analysis and mapping documentation.
Good understanding of technology such as: online channels, real-time APIs, data storage / data bases, data domain models, UML, data mapping.
Proficient user of all Microsoft tools; Knowledgeable with Atlassian suite (JIRA & Confluence).
Post-Secondary education, preferably in Technology related fields
Additional desirable skills include:
Experience with OneSumX
Experience with mortgageHUB
Experience with Portfolio Plus

About Us:
SnapTravel is a conversational commerce (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOFWv4REqls) startup, allowing millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging.
We are working on complex problems within NLP (understanding and replying to ambiguous human messaging), Conversational Commerce (optimizing conversions and user behavior over chat) and Machine Learning (choosing the best hotel automatically from a large data set with complex market dynamics) to push the boundaries of tech and travel globally.
SnapTravel has a fast-moving & transparent environment where everyone works as a team with complete transparency. We value data-driven decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the team.
About the Role:
We are looking for a Financial Analyst to join our team and help SnapTravel scale to the next level! As a Financial Analyst you will be responsible for supporting our Finance team with all initiatives around financial reporting, planning and analysis for our core Hotels business, driving hundreds of millions of dollars in annual revenue. You will bring expert-level Excel skills and a strong foundation in Finance & Accounting to the team, and will work on high-impact projects around forecasting, month-end closes, and the preparation of financial materials for our Leadership team to make better decisions that will drive business growth.
Challenges You'll Solve:
Accounting & Bookkeeping: you will build and execute on all of our standard accounting processes, ensuring that our monthly financials are completed accurately and on-time; this includes high-volume vendor payments, settlements, posting transactions and all month-end close activities
Planning & Analysis: you will assist in the rigorous analysis, planning and reporting around our financial results to our Finance Manager and leadership team. This will include maintaining the integrity of our accounting systems, diving deep into data and performing ad-hoc analyses around financial results
Operational Excellence: you will use your incredible attention-to-detail and high degree of accuracy to be the single source of truth for all financial reporting; you will assist in the preparation of many different financial materials across the business
About You:
You have at least 1 year of experience in a Finance or Accounting role, ideally with a focus on analysis and reporting
You have incredible attention-to-detail, and can be relied upon to provide thorough, well-reasoned and accurate results
You can work with a high degree of self-direction and you have the ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment
You have expert proficiency in Excel, and ideally have worked with Tableau and Xero in the past
What To Expect:
After applying, you'll receive an email with all of this info. So feel free to skip it for now.
Review - you'll hear from us within 48 hours of applying
Phone Call - a quick call to learn who you are (resumes suck, we want to know the real you!)
Interview - a chance for you to chat with our Finance Manager, share your background and learn more about us
Onsite Interview - 90-120 min onsite with our Finance Manager and 1-2 other leaders to tackle a whiteboarding problem and work through some challenges collaboratively
Final Interview - connect with the rest of the team, more Q&A to ask us about SnapTravel; deeper dive into culture and team; meet the Cofounders
The Perks:
Compensation: top of market salaries and equity; full benefits package
Flexible Work Arrangements: work from home, work remotely, take vacation... do what makes sense for you. This includes a holistic Parental Leave policy.
Top Talent: work with the best in the world, including Engineers and Leadership from Google, Facebook, Wish, Twitter, Asana, YouTube, Uber and more.
Build Something Great: most importantly, build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership, have impact, and do great work.

job_title: Internship in Public Policy and Entrepreneurship
company_name: CFIB - Canadian Federation of Independent Business
job_location: Canadian Federation of Independent Business29 reviews
job_description:
$2,500 a monthPosting Job Description
The Canadian Federation of Independent Business (CFIB) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit advocacy group representing the interests of 110,000 small and medium-sized businesses in Canada for more than 47 years. It was born in reaction to a piece of public policy that, at the time, would have been devastating to the Canadian independent business sector.

In conjunction with Scotiabank, we are offering a four-month Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Internship in our Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax and Charlottetown offices (six positions). The positions will run from early May to late August.

CFIB has taken great care in developing a Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Intern Program that will not only advance our small business members’ priorities, but will also provide a meaningful and enriching opportunity for the intern.

Scope of Responsibility:
Reporting to a member of the legislative team, you will be responsible for the research, analysis and writing of a specific project relevant to our small business members. The project has been pre-selected based on its compatibility with the Intern Program and CFIB’s legislative agenda. We strongly encourage interested candidates to check out our research and advocacy work at www.cfib.ca. At the end of four months, the project may be considered a component of CFIB’s public advocacy work on these issues.

Highlights of Responsibilities:
In consultation with and direction from the local senior analyst, you will:
Refine the project plan and develop weekly completion targets
Meet agreed upon weekly completion targets
Gather relevant data from CFIB member surveys, government and other sources
Analyze data and write draft final report
Work collaboratively with other CFIB Public Policy and Entrepreneurship Interns and CFIB colleagues across Canada
Provide research assistance on other small business issues, as necessary
Provide office administrative help and assist small business members, as necessary
Qualifications:
Candidates must possess:
Desire to learn more about the small business sector and its role in the Canadian economy
Interest in government relations/politics/public policy
Strong research skills to undertake qualitative and quantitative analysis, check sources and facts, and develop key arguments
Superior written communication skills
Commitment to accuracy and thoroughness
Expertise in word processing, spreadsheets and graphs
Proven ability to work interdependently in a collaborative environment with colleagues in a small office environment
Ability to step in to help keep the office running (answer phone, administrative tasks), if necessary
Good interpersonal skills
Objectivity and non-partisanship
Fluency in English language is a requirement (written, oral and reading)
Notes:
Both active students and recent graduates of relevant post-secondary education are encouraged to apply. Preference will be given to those students able to complete the internship without interruptions.

Remuneration:
$2,500/month gross (paid bi-weekly, less statutory deductions)

Writing sample:
This application process requires a sample of written work you have completed. The writing sample should be a brief example of your research and writing abilities. The sample does not necessarily have to be related to small business issues. For example, you may want to use a portion of a paper that you submitted for a school course. Please keep your writing sample to two pages. If needed, further samples may be requested from short-listed candidates.

Note: CFIB will be reviewing applications as they are submitted. We encourage you to apply early. All applications will be acknowledged; however, please note that only those applicants that meet the criteria will be contacted for an interview.

Please ensure to apply for the job posted in the location of your choice and indicate in your cover letter, which city you are applying for.

CFIB is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities through the interview process and while employed. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Mississauga, ONSchedule : Monday to Friday

Provides advice and recommendations based on business/situational analysis that supports business objectives. We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. job_title: Senior Business Analyst (Data and Analytics - Cloud)
job_description:
The Senior Business Analyst for the Data and Analytics team will be focused on the cloud implementation and process for enabling the Cloud platform for the Data and Analytics team. They will work as a liaison with the a mix of technology, governance, infosecurity, end users and project delivery teams to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate information related to supporting the cloud enablement for all parties. Collaborating with the management team and various technology partners, the Senior Business Analyst collects, clarifies, and translates information into requirements that drive the delivery of the end product for our partners. A successful candidate will be the champion of the technology, and be able to bridge business usage and technical feasibility.



ACCOUNTABILITIES

Identifies sources of requirements, possible interfaces, and affected Lines of Business based on high-level process description or scenarios in order to understand stakeholder needs
Gathers users requirements and documents them in high level and detailed requirements documents
Builds, sustains, and leverages relationships with individuals within his/her area of immediate responsibility when gathering, validating, and approving requirements to establish a comfort level in managing relationships and understanding business needs and assurance that a quality result will be delivered
Identifies inconsistencies and gaps within a business process description and collaborates with stakeholders to clarify and simplify complex processes
Facilitates requirements gathering sessions, including leading discussions, managing group dynamics, and maintaining group focus, to work towards accomplishing the stated goal(s) of the session within the context of the project objectives
Creates a requirements management plan according to the recommended practices of the organization so that activities and milestones of the requirements management team can be measured against the goals of that plan
Obtains solid knowledge of business functionalities, runs data analytics and data mining to verify and derive requirements
Adheres to and ensures that others adhere to the organizations Requirements Management Process to support the organizational standards and ensure consistency of deliverables
Provides clarification of requirements to other project team members to assist them in the creation of their specific project deliverables (e.g., assists the testing team in the creation of the Testing Strategy and Testing Execution Plan; provides clarification for developers who would create Design Documents; etc.)
Authors and executes SIT cases and participates in defect resolution processes as defects are found
Collaborates with various teams to run cross impact analyses
Supports users in preparation for UAT testing and throughout execution of UAT
Finalises test phase finding via Final Reports and gathers approvals for all documentation, PPQA, implementation, etc.
Supports production related inquiries as needed
Takes ownership on assigned tasks to delivery high quality product in efficient way
Qualifications
Knowledge:

Possesses a university degree/college diploma and/or 4 to 6 years progressive business analysis experience, supporting smaller to medium size projects
Possesses solid business knowledge in the Finance/Banking industry
Background in reporting tools a bonus (Spotfire, Power BI)
Prior experience working on cloud native platform (Azure, AWS) preferred
Strong Word, PowerPoint, and Excel skills
Knowledge of project and defect tracking systems especially Jira or HP ALM would be an asset
Experience of fast tracked Agile project delivery
Understanding of Databases and basic SQL knowledge

Skills:

Very Strong Communication skills – communicates easily with varying stakeholders (high level executives, technology teams, end users, project delivery teams) in controlled situations (e.g., one-on-one interviews, formal requirements gathering sessions, etc.)
Demonstrates solid writing and documentation skills
Possesses solid problem-solving and analytical skills
Works well both independently and in teams, comfortable leading less experienced business analysts
Displays good interviewing and facilitation skills
Solid understanding and use of tools associated with the role: Spotfire, Power BI



We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. job_title: Senior HR Data Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions
job_description:
Richmond Hill, ONAs the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
The opportunity:
Reporting to the Senior Director, Corporate Development & Strategic Initiatives provides leadership the Senior HR Data Analyst, is responsible to provide support to the OpenText HR M&A group in analysis, research, due diligence and post-close activities to support existing and new corporate development initiatives.
You are great at:
Working closely with business units, functional leaders and senior management to provide analysis of acquisition opportunities -including but no limited to conducting research, compiling statistics and prepare analysisResponsible to set up standard report templates & cadence, working with stakeholders to establish needs based on specific acquisition etc.Providing analytical support and coordinating activities for conducting due diligence.Developing clear presentations summarizing analysis and recommendations for decision makers.Participating in monthly and quarterly reporting of financial results for past acquisitions.Assisting in development of HR strategy materialsAssisting in the research and/or analysis of ad-hoc requests.Synthesize and communicate due diligence findings; quantifying areas of risk, dependency and opportunity in partnership with HR COEs.
Collaborates effectively with HR functional area partners (Compensation, Benefits, HRIM, HRSS, HR Business Partners, OE and Learning) as well as other functions (Corporate Communications, VC team, Legal, Finance, Tax, IT, etc.) on all relevant aspects of M&A workEstablish and maintain credibility throughout the organization and ensure strict adherence to confidentiality and sensitivity in handling all aspects of private data across the HR teamContinually improve M&A process, maintain decision database and update M&A playbook as required
What it takes:
Minimum of seven years of industry experience in a data analyst role preferably in Corporate developmentExtensive financial and quantitative analysis knowledge and skills, along with expert-level financial modeling skillsFamiliarity with SAP-based financial planning tools to use them to extract/input data from/to corporate reporting/corporate planning toolsAbility to maneuver in an environment of uncertainty and make decisions with incomplete and sometimes contradictory dataHigh attention to detail, accuracy and presentation while delivering work in timely manner.Ability to research topics effectively.Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills and ability to work independently and influence othersAbility to travelMust be flexible to work extended hours, frequently evenings and weekends, to meet deadlines hours, frequently evenings and weekends, to meet deadlines.

Why join us?
At Oxford Properties, you will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers as genuine partners.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Responsible for managing the customer and market research initiatives for our retail assets and other real estate asset classes nationally including NPS, customer and leasing surveys.Continue to develop the adoption of the analytics platform within the retail portfolio.Work closely with asset management, leasing, marketing and operations to develop dashboards that generate data-driven insights, opportunities and tools to influence tenant transactions and improve efficiencies.Provide analytics and insights and innovative methodologies to the retail marketing teams to effectively target existing customers and measure the resultsUnderstand policy & procedure flow as it relates to approvals of projects/ analytics and insights
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingEducation – Master’s Degree in Spatial Analysis or similar program preferredSelf-motivated individual who is driven and demonstrates perpetual optimism.Strong skills in the following: relationship-building, sales, communication, presentation and problem solvingProficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesProficient using data analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL) and assetProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)The ability to work with a variety of diversified cultures, business owners and across different industries.Computer literacy in MS Office products.
Our story:
OMERS is one of Canada’s leading pension funds. We invest over $85 billion for more than 470,000 plan members and their families. Our investment professionals use a direct-drive, active management strategy to invest in public and private markets from our offices in Toronto, New York, London and Sydney. We are committed to earning superior returns by attracting world-class investors and by building a culture of excellence.

Established in 1960, Oxford Properties Group is the real estate arm of OMERS, one of Canada’s largest pension funds with over $85 billion in assets. Today, Oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with over 2,000 employees and over $45 billion of assets that it manages for OMERS and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Headquartered in Toronto, Oxford has regional offices in Calgary, New York, Boston, Washington, DC, Singapore, Sydney and London, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. For more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.
