McLean & Company a division of Info-Tech Research Group is an HR research and advisory firm providing practical solutions to human resources challenges by providing executable research, tools, diagnostics, and advisory services that have a clear and measureable impact on our members' businesses.

We systematically improve core HR capabilities of organizations with our data-driven solutions, which are developed by our Research Division and utilized by over 30,000 members globally.

McLean is a place where your voice will be heard – a place where you see the impact of your work on our members. It is a place where you will find community and collaboration, where you will work with diverse individuals with their own unique stories and experiences. McLean is a place where success is celebrated by the whole team – a place where you are encouraged to stretch and grow.
We are hiring for an HR Research Analyst for our Toronto office. As an HR Research Analyst you will spend your time consuming and distilling data, new ideas and member needs into practical resources and advice that our clients can actually use. Working as part of a collaborative research team, you will write and deliver practical, tactical guides to streamline client operations.

A career as an HR Research Analyst will allow you to:

 Conduct client-driven, practical best practice research projects
 Participate in interviews with industry leaders and executives
 Contribute to research agendas and develop project plans
 Gain exposure to client challenges and implementation of HR projects
 Develop subject matter expertise and grow your career
 Work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

 University degree required. Business, Psychology, HR or Adult Education would be an asset.
 Demonstrated academic achievement.
 Research experience (academic research).
 Exceptional written and verbal communication.
 Structured and logical thinking.
 Client-service disposition.
 Highly collaborative, able to work well in a team-based environment.
 Excellent time management and organizational skills.
 Demonstrated ability to provide, receive and action feedback.
 Facilitation experience is an asset.
 Must be eligible to attain a TN Visa.
Application Instructions & Other Details

 Please include a cover letter, CV and all post-secondary transcripts (to date). Unofficial and/or web reports are accepted.
 Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.
McLean & Company, a subsidiary of Info-Tech Research group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. With over 140 years of experience, Heartland Farm Mutual strives to be the preferred agribusiness and rural insurance specialist. We are courageous. Our team is talented and dedicated, challenging the norm and striving to be better every day.

People come first at Heartland. As a result, our focus is on relationships. It’s all about delivering genuine customer experience. We have a team of solution–oriented problem solvers providing expertise on our home, farm, commercial and auto products.

The successful candidate will have a desire to research and create innovative solutions, along with the drive to see the solutions through to implementation.

Research possible initiatives, documenting the Business Case and expected benefits of changing systems/processes, or the creation of new ones.
Using knowledge of the Property & Casualty Insurance industry Products, Rating, Underwriting & Claims processes, and Business Systems Applications, be responsible for developing solution designs and implementation options (Technology and Process).
Elicitation and documentation of business requirements. This includes detailed process mapping, documenting use cases, wireframes for User Interface design, User Experience design, data mapping, and data analysis.
Support the technical leads to ensure the technical design meets the business needs.
Responsible for Implementation tasks including planning, execution of the deliverables in to production and addressing post-implementation issues during the warranty period. This will necessitate working outside of standard office hours.
Process Analysis. This includes documentation of current processes, analysis to determine efficiency and efficacy gaps, and creation of future state processes.
Quality Assurance testing of implementations including the creation of the test strategy and test cases, execution of the testing plan, and defect management.
Project management by coordinating meetings, tracking project process, providing status updates and communications to project stakeholders.
Provide a process for monitoring changes once implemented.

Qualifications:

5 years' experience as a Business Systems Analyst.
3-5 years' experience working in the Property & Casualty Insurance Industry in any of the following capacities: Broker/Agent, Underwriting, Claims or Finance.
Quality Assurance, Process Analysis and/or Project Management skills and knowledge.
Proven ability to create and deliver insurance solutions.
Critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions.
Experience in both Agile and Waterfall project environments.
Strong communication and negotiation skills.

We Offer:

A company that truly values integrity, respect, professionalism, transparency, forward thinking, community and environment.
Ongoing skills development with subsidies for tuition and professional development and professional accreditation.
A defined Incentive Plan where commitment to excellence is financially rewarded.

A Place Where YOU Can Make a Difference! Proudly Canadian. Mutually Owned.

WHY ECONOMICAL?
Because a changing industry calls for a new way of doing things. In this role, you will:
work with the business to define, document and validate the requirements to support business objectives and capabilities
apply structured thinking and analysis to transform business objectives into a format that supports executable requirements
play an active role in projects and a support role for release and maintenance efforts
Your Responsibilities
Provide estimation of delivery work necessary to realize requirements through development lifecycle
Elicit, analyze, specify and communicate functional and non-functional business, system and implementation requirements

Ensure the requirements are unambiguous and understandable by both business users and solution delivery teams
Validate the correctness of delivered requirements in advance of the active business owner reviewing completed work

Collaborate with business owner and delivery team to define and deliver the project vision
Collaborate with the Scrum Master/Project Manager and the team to develop and maintain the project Kanban/Product backlog, and develop the iteration/sprint and release plan

Support the identification and resolution of risks/issues/blockers in collaboration with the project team

Support multiple concurrent projects
Support large scale initiatives with multiple BSAs

University degree or college diploma
3+ years of business analysis experience with a strong emphasis around software development
Agile experience is considered an asset
Experience with the following systems is considered an asset: JIRA, Confluence, Guidewire

At Economical, we all work together to come up with big ideas — then bring them to life. We focus on our customers first, we bring our best, and we’re stronger together. If you’ve got the passion and the desire to help us reinvent insurance, let’s talk.

Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with Clients and Valtech Project Teams to drive the project vision, objectives and take ultimate ownership for delivering impactful Ecommerce solutions with the project team.
The BA works and negotiates directly with the client stakeholders to analyze and transform business objectives into a backlog of prioritized user stories based on market data, internal needs and business value. He/she then guides and supports one or more cross-functional project teams by owning the vision for a release, deciding the priority and details of features to build, accepting features after implementation, and accepting the release.
The BA must have experience in delivering web-based solutions of varying complexity, and must deeply understand the nuances of complex technical, user experience-driven Ecommerce web projects within an iterative context. The BA must have a knowledge of data and content modeling.

Key Accountabilities :Be passionate and knowledgeable about our products and the possibilities in our market; specifically around:Ecommerce platformsThe online shopping experience, from cart to checkoutUser experience and customer experience managementMarketing optimization and automationGenerate ideas for how our solutions can make our customers more successful.The Business Analyst must have a knowledge of data and content modeling in a web context.Collaborate deeply with the Scrum Master/Project Manager to continually manage scope, budget and expectations. Maintaining an intimate knowledge of the budget/scope burndown and its impact on release expectations is mandatory.Works closely with the technical lead to define work for the developers via acceptance criteria on the user storiesWork with the client and project team to formulate a release vision and high-level epicsConstantly manage client expectations on release scopePresent and justify a product release to the project stakeholders.Participate in project process including Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Daily Scrum, and Sprint Review.Work with customers and stakeholders to understand their needs and manage expectations.Define and prioritize a backlog of work. Maintain a well-groomed product backlog at all times.Be the customer's voice and provide perspective on business value on a day-to-day basis.Continuously evaluate and prioritize user stories based on market data and business needs.Write user stories and acceptance criteria.

Qualifications

Must have experience having delivered implementations meeting typical web project success factors, including improved SEO, improved conversion and engagement, improved publishing workflow and internal visibility of ROI.Experience delivering an ecommerce project a plusPrefers working in a highly collaborative environment.Highly developed organization and time management skills.Excellent interpersonal and client-handling skills.Ability to contribute towards a team effort.Ability to work with ambiguity.Initiative and self-confidence, adaptable and able to cope with changing and evolving priorities while being able to identify new opportunities.Excellent presentation skills.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Understanding of Agile methodologies (preferably Scrum) and knowledge of the full project lifecycle.3+ years working on software projects following Agile methodologiesNice to have experience working with major commerce platforms such as Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Sitecore Commerce, or Episerver

Here’s what it’s like to work for us:

We’re advisors, visionaries, creative and techies…with an agency mindset. We believe in working together, and that the best results come when we pool our knowledge and brainstorm the right solution for our customers.

We embrace all things digital.
Our ambition is to become a global leader in the digital space. No more, no less. Our customers look to us to help them succeed in the digital landscape. We deliver work that makes them the leaders in their industries, based on a thorough understanding of their business and a close collaboration with their employees.
We talk to each other.
We work in an open environment, with business developers, web technologists, strategists and creatives sitting side-by-side, pooling their collective wisdom in order to come up with the best solution for our clients.
We have fun.
We don’t believe in boredom. We do work hard, and we put in the hours we need to get the job done, but we also have a vibrant, dynamic atmosphere with passionate colleagues who enjoy what they do.
We love our clients.
Seriously! They are the reason why we are here. And why wouldn’t we? We are working with some of the biggest and most interesting brands in the world, along with a lot of other companies that all have great ambition to succeed in the digital space.
We’re looking ahead.
We are driven by a visionary mindset, and that means there is plenty of room for initiative and for talented people to shape who we are tomorrow.
Up for the challenge?
Then we will be more than happy to hear from you. We have on-going interviews so send your application as soon as possible via the apply button.
Additional informationSome travel is required as part of this position.We offer a chance to work with an amazing team, global clients, competitive salary, medical and dental benefits, life and disability insurance, as well as work from home options.
Additional Information

We offer work from home options, great learning opportunities, and a collaborative team environment. If you are interested to join a growing company and have the skills we seek please apply today!

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

*** We do not accept unsolicited candidate profiles from recruiting firms***

Having rapid access to complete, up-to-date and accurate information puts health care providers in a better position to provide the best possible care and today more than 154,000 clinicians have access to important patient information like lab tests, diagnostic images, and hospital reports. We’re working closely with health care professionals, hospitals, community-based providers, Local Health Integration Networks, Canada Health Infoway and vendors to develop the best solutions for Ontario’s 14 million residents.

Mission: At eHealth Ontario, our mission is clear: We’re revolutionizing health care delivery in the province. Thinking big comes naturally to us. After all, we work with the most advanced technology available, and on some of the biggest and most challenging projects in Canada.
18 Month Contract

Reporting to the Manager, SWP and Analytics, the HR Analyst will act as a strategic advisor to the Human Resources Leadership Team and business. Through the construction and use of statistical models and data-driven analysis, the HR Analyst will deliver insights of the agency’s workforce to internal stakeholders within the business and to the HR team, enabling them to identify critical HR priorities and driving optimal decisions about our people.

This role will also support various HR functions in ensuring systems are built to effectively deliver information insights on a consistent basis and work closely with the broader Human Resources team in order to successfully deliver HR services and programs to all internal clients.
Your Chance to Shine:
Specific Accountabilities
HR Analytics and Data Insights
Provides advice and consultation to all levels of management and staff in response to inquiries regarding workforce demographics and employee lifecycle events.Builds, maintains and supports a variety of reports and/or queries using appropriate reporting tools. Assists the Senior HR Analyst in development of standard reports for internal customers.Contributes in the interpretation and analysis of workforce data and metrics using statistical techniques to provide reports that drive real-time actions and optimizations.Produces regular HR reports and analytics as requested by the business i.e. headcount reports, monthly unit end reports, salary information, recruitment reports, HR dashboards etc.Maintains data integrity in systems through pro-active means (audits, queries, etc.).Maintains the job hierarchy for the agency and updates the organization chart monthlyParticipates in benchmarking of trends in workforce planning and analytics.Develops standard user procedures, guidelines and documentation.Performs system maintenance including end to end user testing and implementation of HR system upgrades or updates. Collaborates with technical support team from vendors to coordinate application of upgrade or fix.Produces data, reports, presentations and materials as required for all Learning and Development initiatives using the learning management system.Provides analysis, metrics and reporting to monitor and measure the success of Talent Management programs.Analyzes employee engagement survey results and provides reports to the business.Supports HR’s client service goals by continuously improving HR metrics, reporting processes and the quality standards used within the HR team.Identifies opportunities for improved quality and efficiency in HR processes. Optimizes the use of technology and develops tools to minimize transactional HR activity.
Generalist Functions
Updates the Staff Incident line and manages the Emergency Response Notification SystemUpdates and maintains the annual business continuity plan for Human Resources and the HR Call treeSupports the L&D Specialist in monitoring and tracking mandatory trainingSupports the job evaluation process as and when required.Coordinates and provides support in the areas of policy interpretation/updates, employee engagement, learning and development and other activities/ special projects (for example, organizing logistics for learning activities and special events and organizational surveys)Assists the HR Specialist – Policies in policy governance as needed.Performs ad-hoc projects as required.
Your Skills Make the Difference:
Experience
Direct / indirect related work experience required for someone to perform this job competently is one to three years.
Technical Knowledge & Skills
Strong reporting and analytical skillsAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including Excel and VisioAbility to “tell a story” through visualization methods.Background in data extraction, manipulation of raw data, data relationships, data mining, ad-hoc analysis and metrics and preparing presentations on this dataStrong attention to detailExcellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.Excellent organizational skillsPrior experience with HR systems preferred
Education
The typical minimum level of education to perform this job competently is equivalent to high school graduation and completion of a diploma training program at a college or technical school. The person requires an ability to understand, utilize and communicate specialized information in speech and written text. This specialized training is often formalized and recognized by a specific certificate, diploma or license.

Position Description:
CGI is the World's 5th largest independent IT and business process services company. We provide high-end business and IT Consulting, Systems Integration and IT & Business Management services. CGI has over 100+ IP-based business solutions in 40 countries spanning Financial Services, Government, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecommunications, Utilities and Oil & Gas. We are a proven and demonstrated success, achieving an industry-leading track record of on-time, on-budget projects and innovative solutions.

This is a great opportunity to become an employee of CGI, based in Edmonton, to provide leading business and information technology consulting services to guide our client through their major business changes.

If you are a business consultant (or equivalent professional) with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for creating outstanding business results for clients, then CGI may be the place for you. We are looking for confident Intermediate Business Systems Analysts who have an understanding of how organizations function, perform and change, with broad skills in gathering and analyzing data, analyzing and solving complex business problems, writing and presenting, facilitating and coaching. Grounded in business, you are also fluent in technology – able to assess a client's current technical environment and develop technology requirements and conceptual solutions to meet business objectives. You are comfortable working with all levels of client organizations – from the executive suite to the front line.

Your future duties and responsibilities:

Liaison between information technology teams and business teams
Produce detailed requirements documents and requirements traceability matrices
Create and execute software test plans
Document current business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts, and propose business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts
Identify, validate, and prioritize clients' business needs and requirements
Participate in and/or lead requirements workshops/JAD sessions to identify business needs and requirements
Review and analyze existing application effectiveness and efficiency
Develop strategies for improving and leveraging systems

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Experience documenting business rules
Experience using advanced features of Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience using SQL to retrieve data to support fact based decisions
Experience using Microsoft SharePoint
Experience with business process re-engineering and business process modeling
Post-secondary education in relevant discipline or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst in related Information Technology / Information Systems environments

Attributes


Communicates ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Excellent listener with strong interpersonal skills
Good knowledge of the software development process
Self-motivated and directed
Excels in a high-pressure and fast paced environment
Quick learner
Problem solver
Team player

Nice to Have


Experience facilitating workshops and JAD sessions
Experience documenting data models, business cases and business case summaries
Experience with Microsoft platforms (.NET, SQL Server)
Experience with software quality assurance processes and/or software testing
Relevant certifications or training such as IIBA or PMP
Experience using COBIT and/or ITIL

#LI-AM1

What you can expect from us:
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

job_description:
Requisition ID: 55187
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose:
GCM Analytics is responsible a number of key initiatives across the Capital Markets footprint. Our team is looking for an energetic and results-oriented Business Analyst with a strong technical background. The successful candidate will be responsible for working within our Agile working group to help build out our Client Value System for Capital Markets and embed it into our CRM platform. To join our team you must be detail-oriented, proactive, demonstrate initiative, have an eagerness to learn and thrive on challenge.
Key Accountabilities:
Work with developers and business stakeholders to gather requirements, develop new data feeds and implement profitablity metrics
Provide acceptance testing and data reviews
Be the subject matter expert for the Capital Markets Client Value System
Functional Competencies:
A creative, self-starter, results-oriented, detail-oriented, proactive, high technical and highly motivated individual with excellent analytical skills and who possesses the ability to apply this knowledge to assist in the resolution of business problems.
Interpersonal and communication skills with good technical understanding in order to effectively liaise with business users and members of technical team with minimal assistance.
Effective time management and organization skills with the ability to self-manage and apply diplomacy, judgement, and persuasion to secure agreement and co-operation from business users and a dynamic project team.
Has the ability to process and absorb large volumes of information and knowledge quickly and turnaround to apply that knowledge in their work product.
Has an understanding of current IT practises and systems development techniques (Waterfall, Agile, etc.), including system specifications and testing methodologies.
Experience with ticket tracking applications such as JIRA or HPQC.
Ability to prepare concise business requirements / user storices with high level technical design for new data feeds from source trading systems.
Participate in daily huddles and scrum planning.
Experience must include strong working knowledge of SQL, Excel, data remidiation & analysis.
Capital Markets experience an asset.
Education and Experience:
University or college degree in a related discipline (Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Technology) or equivalent work experience
3+ years Business Anlayst experience
1+ years Capital Markets or Financial Services experience required
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Vancouver, BCImpark is one of the largest parking management companies in North America. We have 55 years of experience, and currently operate parking facilities in more than 240 cities across the United States and Canada. Our business continues to prosper and grow. As a result, we are looking for exceptional people to join our workforce. People who are committed, ambitious, and eager to learn. People like you.


Our continued success is driven by our core values, which are:


Be admirable: Always conduct yourself in an honest and professional manner.

Create positive energy: Choose optimism.

Be a trailblazer: Drive innovative ways to achieve growth.


These values guide our actions and keep us on the right path. At Impark, the most successful people are those individuals who integrate these beliefs into their actions at work, and incorporate them into everyday behavior.


Impark is currently looking for a full-time Business Analyst to work at our Vancouver, BC location.

The Business Analyst will be responsible for providing business consulting to the enterprise wide user community to help identify user needs, process improvement opportunities, and opportunities to leverage technology. The position will report to the Director, Business Solutions.

Toronto, ONTemporaryJob Details
Description
Dream Office Management Corporation is looking for a Data Analyst.

Are data privacy and data protection topics that you are passionate about? Are you focused on securing user and business data using a variety of tools and technologies? Do you enjoy architecting solutions and implementing changes that will have a positive effect on our business, users, and stakeholders? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.

Who are you?

You’ll be part of our Infrastructure & Technology Operations group, which is focused on providing top notch computing services to Dream’s 1,000 employees. Working with the security, network, communications and support teams, you will be responsible for supporting our data privacy initiatives at our Canadian and International offices. You are not afraid of change and serve as a change agent. You will explore ideas and are always driving forward rather than settling for the status quo. You’ve worked in fast-paced environments and understand how to juggle big-picture thinking with day-to-day deliverables. You have experience understanding and articulating technology risk in a business environment, and working with a team to remediate those risks. You are respectful of current operating processes, but look to develop new ideas to bring better results. Still interested? Read on!


Who are we?

Dream Unlimited Corp. is a real estate investment, development and management company that creates value at every stage of the real estate cycle. Since the business was created in 1994, Dream has grown substantially, becoming one of Canada’s leading and most consistently innovative real estate companies with over $14 billion of assets. Dream Office Management Corporation provides technology, human resources, and facilities support to the Dream group of companies, currently 5 publicly traded entities.

While on the surface we may not seem that different from our competitors, it’s our attitude and approach that truly set us apart. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit; we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.

We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work and have fun with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.


And the Infrastructure & Technology Operations team?

Our goal is to provide the best possible user experience by ensuring our users have the technical tools and infrastructure in place to perform their job functions efficiently. We are continually upgrading and driving our initiatives, processes and goals in order to respond to changes in our business needs and ensure that the appropriate infrastructure is in place to support the business.

We strive to stay at the cutting edge of technology to be prepared for Dream’s continued growth in the coming years. All we’re missing is an enthusiastic Data Protection Analyst – are you ready?

What will you do?

You will be responsible for the organization and privacy of data that our five business lines rely on every day. Here are some specifics of your role to give you some scope:

Work with the Manager, IT Security to oversee the ongoing development of the data protection strategy and implementation across all lines of business
Author and audit, privacy, security, and data protection policies
Implement technical standards / data protection frameworks such as GDPR, PIPEDA ,NIST, etc.
Translation of privacy legislation knowledge into technical solutions to protect the privacy of employee and customer data
Managing and auditing technology solutions that support data privacy
Conduct data and privacy risk assessments, and articulate the outcome as business risk
Perform data classification across a variety of system types and storage methods, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams in order to implement solutions and privacy controls
Monitor compliance of data privacy against best practices
Be available for inquiries from data subjects and business stakeholders relating to data protection practices, and data subject rights
Communicate effectively with all levels of the business
Create and maintain documentation that supports data and privacy activities
Be available after hours when needed to assist with incident response, should the need arise
Perform related duties and tasks as assigned by the Manager, IT Security


What type of experience do you have?

We’ve listed just a few select qualifications that we consider to be very important for this role. We can cover the rest when we chat.

Degree, diploma, or certificate in Information Security, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in an information security or audit role
Minimum 5 years’ experience with technologies that support data management (classification tools, Data Loss Prevention tools, data tagging tools)
Experience with implementation and use of data classification standards
Knowledge of organizational privacy controls
Experience with technical standards / data protection frameworks such as PIPEDA, GDPR, NIST, and ISO
Experience with both security and privacy risk assessments, with DPIA experience a plus
The ability to translate technology risk into business risk
A deep understanding of data classification, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
A strong track record of being able to interface and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to implement solutions and privacy controls
Experience authoring or auditing privacy, security, and data protection policies
Operational experience with incident response and breach notification processes
Experience in managing projects and large scale enterprise wide roll-outs.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Exceptional organization and time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Strong change management skills; change agent
With your manager and the security team, you set clear goals and objectives, and then you and the team deliver!
Knowledge in the following is considered a significant asset, so let us know what you know!

Data collection, storage, and processing privacy best practices
Information security or audit certifications, such as CISSP, CISA, SSCP, CIPM
Experience with frameworks, such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST SP 800-37,
Experience with cloud email technologies (Office 365, Mimecast) and filtering mechanisms
Experience with document management solutions leveraging OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Teams
McAfee endpoint DLP experience a plus
Palo Alto Networks firewalls / SSL decryption and data filtering
Management and implementation of access controls
When you come in to meet, we’ll want to hear about your previous security and privacy, but also about your business interaction experiences. What are your strengths? What areas are you looking to grow? We’ll also be asking you to demonstrate your knowledge given various real world scenarios.

This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.

Mississauga, ONImagine working in a place that offers great resources to help you achieve your greatest potential. At Foodbuy, our solutions strengthen supplier relationships, customize offerings, and lower purchasing and production costs. In turn, we can give our passionate employees ongoing opportunities to grow. Join us.
The purpose of this role is to analyze the business needs and product requirements of assigned sectors/ partners and units, and support the Field Implementation/ Account Managers in their implementation of programs and processes.
Why work with Foodbuy? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading foodservice and support services company. We extend our value-driven purchasing service model to external clients who benefit from our negotiated contracts with manufacturers that support food and beverage and facility management suppliers.

Now, if you were to come on board as one of our Business Analysts, Customer Finance, we’d ask you to do the following for us:
Analyze data and information from multiple sources (e.g., product details, supplier listings, sector financial results) to determine business needs and product requirements, and create reports for further analysis, in order to identify opportunities for revenue growth

Coordinate Foodbuy’s communications with the clients, including creating reports, managing distribution lists, and communicating relevant information (e.g. financials, program updates, recalls)
Assist various teams including Accounting, Category Development, Sourcing, and Foodbuy Member Development in ongoing projects, and in the development and implementation of new projects, to drive revenue for the business
Identify and rectify gaps in systems and communications content and recommend improvements to Foodbuy systems, strategies, programs, processes, system quality and compliance
Identify most appropriate and financially lucrative product solutions to resolve business challenges
Provide analytical support for other Foodbuy teams
Think you have what it takes to be a Business Analyst, Customer Finance? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you will be successful:

job_title: Business Analyst (Business Intelligence) – Information Technology Department
job_description:
YVR is made up of a team of diverse people who are working collaboratively to reach our goal of 29 million passengers by 2020! Safety is at the core of everything we do; we’re innovative, fun, and we invest in our people. We’re a BC Top Employer for 13 years standing, with high engagement scores, an abundance of learning and development opportunities, and a holistic approach to wellness! And we’re looking for someone to join our team.
We have an opportunity for a permanent, full-time Business Analyst in the Information Technology Department. Reporting to the Manager, Technology Services, the successful candidate will have a strong background in business intelligence (BI), reporting, data quality and data governance practices.
Key responsibilities include:
Provide subject matter expertise in core business intelligence functions (including but not limited to: process improvement, data mining, data gathering, data quality assessments, reporting, data governance, data stewardship, reporting and data visualization)
Manage and maintain all data governance related documentation such as data definitions, data models, business rules, security rules, and process maps
Coordinate with application business analysts and business owners to resolve of data integrity gaps and implement appropriate controls to mitigate future data issues
Build upon our newly established enterprise data governance implementation roadmap including delivery of strategic priorities for development of information-based capabilities
Roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets
Serve as a liaison between Business and Functional areas and technology to ensure that data related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined, communicated and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning
Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the enterprise
Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements
Identify opportunities for improvement within the system, including making recommendations on how users can best utilize our BI tools to accomplish their functional objectives; research and utilize new features of our BI application
Interface with functional users to define and document functional requirements for business intelligence and reporting needs
Coordinate and communicate status, functional requirements, project priorities, operational impacts
Developing and maintaining positive relationships with our internal and external customers
Key qualifications include:
5+ years of Business Analyst experience (intermediate to senior level) with demonstrated ability in analyzing business requirements, building business cases, managing change, and applying technology, supplemented by a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management/Business Information Systems or a related field; or an equivalent combination of training and experience
Demonstrated working knowledge of notable BI reporting tools, concepts and approaches
Knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices
Knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data protection
Strong project management skills, including proven on-time, on-budget delivery of medium scale projects
Ability to understand data and information and convert this into insight
Strong analytics manager which includes the ability to understand a business problem and determine the relevant data needed to derive the necessary information to make a recommendation or decision
Solid relationship building skills with all levels of an organization, both internally and externally
Motivated self-starter
This position is open to both Airport Authority employees and external candidates. Previous job performance will be taken into consideration for all internal candidates that apply for this position.
Vancouver Airport Authority welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at 604-303-3152 or careers@yvr.ca. We welcome the opportunity to discuss accommodation of your disability and ensure fairness in our hiring process.

Woodbridge, ONPurpose:
Manage retail inventory flow and create store-specific distribution strategies to maximize store sales and SKU productivity.
Key Accountabilities: include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Manage inventory flow by brand, district, store while taking into consideration store size, climate, seasonality, capacity, etc.
Proactively plan, react, communicate, and take appropriate action to meet and exceed sales and margin budgets.
Assist with the implementation and management of store assortments through a strong partnership with the buying team, using store clusters (to include store size, climate, seasonality, capacity, etc.) to maximize full-price sell thru and turns.
Analyze, monitor and recap core item performance and inventory levels on a weekly basis, minimize out of stocks.
Provide quantitative analysis to support planning, buying and store planning decisions both preseason and in-season.
Create and analyze item replenishment AR models to ensure appropriate stock to sales ratios based on selling patterns (sales trend, events, promotions etc.)
Analyze and monitor open to ship by department for each store.
Ensure that all product is shipped in compliance with product launch dates and new store opening dates.
Consistently update store capacity models through Weeks Of Stock (WOS) tool.
Create plans and forecasts that are consistent with the stores’ potential to sell.
Ensure recaps of sales performance on transitional merchandise, select store buys, test items, etc. are completed on a weekly basis.
Create and maintain smooth product flows by development of outbound flow from the DC on specific timelines.
Consolidate, analyse and communicate size and location based performance, including sales/inventory comparisons, seasonality and marketing impacts. Utilize analysis to identify profit opportunities.
Collaborate with operations, DC, planning and the BU to support strategy that aligns future financial and product opportunities.
React to in season trends by door to ensure that the models are being adjusted appropriately based on each stores performance.
Knowledge Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of and familiarity with Retail KPI’s.
Strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of retail math.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite and familiarity with merchandising systems/applications.
Advanced Excel skills, and a thorough understanding of macros, pivot tables, lookup formulas, formatting, etc.
Familiarity accessing data from a database structure.
SAP experience a plus.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Ability to communicate effectively with different levels of the business via phone, written and in-person communication.
Ability to understand and use financial data, such as fractions, percentages, ratios, gross margin, net sales, etc., to make decisions and influence outcomes.
Ability to manipulate large amounts of data and create reporting tools from data.
Ability to work on several projects simultaneously.
Ability to successfully multi-task and problem-solve.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to think strategically, synthesize data, identify trends and recommend viable solutions.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to work on a cross functional team and be a part of a team atmosphere.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university.
A minimum 3 years of planning or allocations experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with Merchandising preferred.

Whitby, ONPosition Title: FACILITIES SERVICES ANALYST

Organizational Relationship: Chief Facilities Officer


Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Facilities Officer and the Senior Manager of Facilities Services, responsible for the accumulation of School Condition Assessment data compilation/analysis, facilities efficiency and effectiveness analysis, maintenance of the School Facilities Inventory System, updating of the VFA system and eBase and providing accounting assistance for all areas within Facilities Services.


Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Provide leadership with the accumulation of School Condition Assessment information as well as continuing to develop improved methods of providing information to senior administration and stakeholders.

2. Liaise with departments throughout the Board to gather, synthesize and present accurate information.

3. Develop multi-year analysis of facility condition and improvement information to facilitate the identification of future funding requirements and expenditures.

4. Develop tracking and reporting structures that will provide management with trending information of productivity of the Facilities Services Department’s key performance indicators.

5. Through project review and accounting analysis, prepare on-going updates, as well as a final audit binder of construction and major projects. This would also include facilitating updates to the SFIS system as well as the VFA system (a Ministry coordination software program).

6. Coordinate and implement the necessary updating processes to the Ministry of Education’s School Facilities Inventory System and VFA, to ensure the accuracy of information.

7. Prepare, develop and co-ordinate monthly financial reporting of various departments within Facilities Services, including facilitating the Board’s year end accounting process.

8. Assist with the preparation of the annual budget of the Facilities Services Department; including revenue analysis.

9. Provide training and assistance to Facilities Services staff to ensure that the Board’s accounting procedures are followed.

10. Perform account(s) analysis and prepare reports (including feasibility studies) as required, such as costing of vandalism.
11. Maintain and update new construction and major projects data in eBase.

12. Perform VFA reporting required in conjunction with Ministry Financial reporting periods.

13. Prepare statistical information and reports for Senior Management and Trustees as required.

14. Perform other duties as required.


Qualifications:

1. Post-secondary degree/diploma in Business Administration/Accounting or equivalent, plus five years progressive experience including project leadership, or an equivalent combination of education and related experience.

2. Knowledge of building systems and facility management is an asset.

3. Technical understanding of Ministry of Education reporting requirements, funding models (including capital, school condition improvement and school renewal), and Capital Asset requirements.

4. Proficient with computerized financial systems, software applications and spreadsheets.

5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

6. Prior school board sector experience is preferred.

job_title: Intern Opportunity- Business Intelligence and Analytics Co-Op
job_description:
InternshipJob Field:
Facility/Property Management
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:
Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the Analytics West team, you will be engaged and ready to support the Senior Manager, Strategic Information with data collection, data mining and analysis tasks, and will support data managers and analysts.

The Analytics team’s role is to address complex business problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques. Artificial Intelligence is a rapidly expanding field which is critical in enabling companies to remain competitive, or to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Information and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models. A sample project may be supporting equipment behaviour overtime through work order analysis and predicting equipment failure. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the field of Data Science/Artificial Intelligence/Analytics post-graduation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal data systems and from external data sources, including sensor data
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify areas for deeper investigation using tools which can handle larger data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Access etc.)
Data Engineering – adding value to collected data by engineering features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management/ data governance
Highlight process improvement areas to enhance team productivity
Develop analyses to understand opportunity areas for further exploration, for example
Create dashboards for disseminate information to business audiences using tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support data managers and analysts with analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally

Senior Business Analyst

We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our Information Technology team. Your strong analytical skills make you a natural in leading key activities, such as: eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business needs. You have a strong ability to translate organizational requirements into IT operational requirements and related business rules. You have consistently determined the best solutions to meet client business needs, plans and objectives. You have always been a key player in the management and execution of the quality assurance process.

Reporting to the Associate Director, Information Technology, this is a full-time permanent position located in our Ottawa office and is available immediately.


Principal Duties

Manage third party vendors to ensure maximum utilization of resources by maintaining work plans and by controlling budgetary expenditures.
Conduct business analysis and end-user interviews to ensure requirements that will fulfill user needs and increase the efficiency and efficacy of system processes.
Support the Associate Director in preparing business cases in collaboration with business clients by documenting client requirements, leading development of optimized business
Process flows, validating the process, and defining high-level solution options.
Evaluate current processes and systems through the creation of objectives and corresponding KPI’s
Create documents to support the operational and technical requirements with clients and senior management.
Analyze the current state, define the desired future state and perform gap analysis to assess the risk associated with attaining the future state.
Develop and establish partnerships with lines of business in order to become fully knowledgeable with their business support systems, issues and processes.
Oversee, assist and participate in the QA process by ensuring test plans are created, evaluated and properly executed.
Commitment to producing high quality work and demonstrating professional values in all aspects of work and interactions with colleagues and customers.
Skills and Qualifications

Minimum of five years of relevant functional experience
A Bachelor’s degree in a related field, such as Business, Administration, Computer Science, or Engineering
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 FO and/or AX 2012
Minimum 3 years of experience working on an ERP, CRM and/or Financial Systems
Minimum 3 years of experience working with SQL Server or other databases, data warehouses, PowerBI
Strong project management skills with experience managing simultaneous projects
Demonstrated ability to tell a story using data and evidence
Knowledge of Microsoft Flow and/or Logic Apps
Excellent oral and written communication skills combined with strong interpersonal skills, including an ability to build and maintain relationships
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Sound organizational, analytical, judgement and decision-making skills with proven abilities in problem solving
Ability to juggle masterfully, build momentum, influence positive outcomes, facilitate cross-functional discussions and decisions
An IIBA competency-based certification is an asset
Experience with the Microsoft Suite tools (Powerapps, SharePoint, Teams, Yammer, etc) is an asset
Experience with a modern marketing technology stack, such as: Google marketing platform, Marketo, Salesforce, etc is an asset

Nomis is seeking a high calibre Business Analyst to serve our growing client base of retail banks in the US, Canada and worldwide, in the area of pricing optimization of their lending portfolios. You will contribute to our client pricing engagements from "kick-off to go-live", including business consulting, requirements gathering, analytical and technical solution design, data pipeline configuration and statistical modelling, testing and validation, user training, and supporting customer adoption and insight generation as they "put rates in market" leveraging our proprietary software. We are seeking a candidate to work from our Toronto or San Francisco Bay Area offices.

Who We Are & What We Build

We partner with Banks and FinTechs on their journey to best-in-class pricing technology and analytics so that they deliver more value to their customers, employees and shareholders. Our top-notch people, proven technology, and innovative analytics are tackling big data challenges at banks and lenders every day. We deliver market-leading cloud-based Pricing & Profitability Management solutions and insights for the Banking & Financial Services industry leveraging cutting-edge behavioral data science. We are a Blue Chip venture-backed company with the vision to transform the consumer banking landscape.

Who You Are

Intensely curious, collaborative, structured and detail-oriented, you are a strong and credible client-facing business consultant and project manager, as well as an experienced hands-on data analyst and model builder. You are equally comfortable thinking through and communicating the big picture and the technical/analytical details. You have a keen understanding of financial services and have a demonstrable track record of translating business user needs into transformational analytical solutions that yield real business value. You have experience and skill working and effectively communicating with a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders (both vendor and client side).

Responsibilities

Consulting


Elicit business requirements from clients in a structured, collaborative way and translate into analytical/technical solution design.
Coordinate project teams (including vendor and client stakeholders) to keep projects on-time and on-budget, with high quality and customer satisfaction/retention.
Create and deliver impactful presentations to influence clients and facilitate team communications
Communicate pricing recommendations clearly, concisely and confidently to clients

Data & Analytics


Develop data pipeline and modelling specifications based on customer requirements.
Build, adapt and validate data pipeline and customer response models leveraging strong SQL, R, and Excel skills.
Develop expertise regarding the Nomis Price Optimizer (NPO) and its various analytical and technical components; apply this expertise to effective and efficient solution design and configuration based on a given bank's requirements.

Solution Design


Design and implement A|B test programs to prove product and pricing recommendations in market
Collaborate with internal teams to translate requirements into solution design, modelling plan and execution, software configuration, and timelines
Design and develop Tableau dashboards and reports that drive informed business decisions and measure performance
Identify insights, features, and enhancements to be productized by the development team

Desired Skills & Background


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field
3+ years of experience in business and data analytics
Strong statistical skills and experience focused on business decision making and problem solving
Demonstrated skill and extended experience with R, SQL, Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint
Exceptional problem solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail
Strong communicator, persuasive presenter, fast on your feet, and innately organized
Ability to simplify complexity, in particular to communicate statistical and analytical concepts and findings to a wide range of business and technical audiences with appropriate levels of detail and emphasis
Sufficient interest and exposure to Java coding to engage with dedicated developers (be a good consumer of code)
Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time
Experience within banking and financial services sectors

What Is the Prescription For A Great Career?


At Rexall, we are community difference makers. Our hearts skip a beat when we meet talent who sees the bigger picture and wants to make an impact in our communities, our teams, and our business. This means finding even better ways to work, share ideas, and making a material difference in the Rexall journey.


We are leaders in health and wellness and a talent destination for over 7000+ Rexall team members. We are proud to be part of the McKesson family, ranked fifth in the fortune 500. Together, we are defining better health through innovation, service, and living the “ICARE” values. Talk about a dream team!


The road ahead is one of adventure and heart. Are you our next all star?


The Role: Pricing & Promotions Analyst


Reporting to the Manager, Pricing and Promotions, this role will be an integral member of a high-profile, cross functional-strategic initiative focused on optimizing the effectiveness of Rexall’s promotional activities. The Pricing & Promotions Analyst acts as consultants to key Category Management stakeholders, providing fact-based insights and recommendations to improve total sales, margin and overall promotions effectiveness.


Principal Responsibilities:

Will be responsible for accurately forecasting, tracking, and reporting the sales, margin, and promotional impact and effectiveness across a range of front of store categories (eg Cosmetics, Convenience, Beauty and Health etc).
Work directly with Category Managers and Directors to optimize promotional sales and make recommendations based on trends, targets, promotional strategies
Provide proactive recommendations on sales-, margin-, and basket-driving promotions
Monitors and analyzes promotional activities to determine effectiveness, accuracy, and performance relative to forecast and identify trends
Analyze data to calculate baseline sales and margin and estimate incremental sales and margin for promotional within a set of categories.
Own real-time consolidated forecast; measure and provide reporting relative to category targets and other metrics
Ad hoc analysis on promotional response to categories
Support the Manager, Pricing and Promotions to develop and implement product price strategies including segment strategies for the various markets and channels.
Download and organize baseline price information, analyze and report on inconsistencies, and identifies opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
Create various reports such as daily trend report, ad reports, period end reports, etc. for various customers in Merchandising.
Perform weekly updates to Ad Reporting Tool and develop promo reports on ad hoc basis.
Update monthly scorecard with new data and present results to team to show performance year over year.
Perform other duties as assigned including ad-hoc analysis on methods to optimize pricing and promotions through market and pricing strategies.
Perform other duties as assigned to support Rexall Pharmacy Group Ltd.

2-3 year College Diploma in a related discipline. University degree is preferred.
Analytical and detail-oriented including; exploring data, discovering patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
Excellent organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills.
Customer-focused and a demonstrated team player.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office software, specifically Excel. Access is preferred.

Saskatoon, SKFederated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) is a diverse business operating in the agriculture, food, energy and home and building sectors. Based in Saskatoon, Sask., FCL is owned by independent retail co-operatives from across Western Canada that are committed to local investment, community mindedness and lifetime membership benefits. FCL is involved in wholesaling and manufacturing, including refined fuels and lubricants. It also provides administrative and marketing support to its member-owners. For more information, visit www.fcl.crs.
The Co-operative Retailing System is a network composed of Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) and over 200 independent retail co-operatives that help build, feed and fuel individuals and communities in Western Canada. From Vancouver Island to northwestern Ontario and into the Arctic, retail co-ops serve 1.8 million active members and many more customers at 2,500 locations. FCL centrally supplies and supports these retail co-ops. By working together under the CO-OP® brand, we are all committed to local investment, community mindedness and lifetime membership benefits. For more information, visit www.coopconnection.ca.
FCL invites applications for the position of Business Analyst-Human Resources in our home office located in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.
As a systems subject matter expert, the Business Analyst – Human Resources is responsible for improving and maintaining operations, delivery of key projects, and plays a lead role in enabling the change management process for assigned business initiatives. This includes the review and analysis of current processes, business needs/requirements, and system capabilities, and providing recommended solutions. This position acts as the key liaison between the technology, application, and business support teams, Human Resources (HR), and retails.
Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Business Analysis Manager, responsibilities for this position include the following:
Provide system subject matter expertise in improving and maintaining operations, delivery of key projects and/or completing the project life cycle for assigned initiatives.
Plan, organize, and conduct business process improvement projects and/or management reviews of the HR Department.
Conduct business readiness assessments prior to implementation and plan/execute as per customer selected deployment work streams to generate specific deliverables.
Analyze and critically evaluate information from multiple sources and determine a solution for competing stakeholder views and needs.
Prepare impact analysis and analyze the feasibility of, and develop requirements for new systems/system enhancements to ensure the system design aligns with user needs.
Act as the key liaison for technology initiatives that impact HR processes and/or financial and management reporting.
Communicate with HR business unit leadership and team members about upcoming changes, project scope, schedule, issues, and recommendations and facilitate the delivery of decisions to evolve and move the business forward
Lead a review of existing HR business processes and develop “as is” and “to be “process models.
Lead and act as a change agent for assigned initiatives, including identifying and communicating change impact.
Develop end user training and education materials, and contribute to the development of webinars, eLearning, and manuals.
Provide leadership and guidance for training on new systems, including consolidating information into understandable correspondence.
Provide analysis, alternatives, and recommendations for required software customization.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

The successful candidate will have a Bachelor Degree in Business/Commerce, Computer Science, IT Mathematic of Finance. Additionally, a candidate with broad business acumen with 5-7 years of experience working with information technology and HRIS applications, including 1+ years of experience in data integration and analysis. A proficient knowledge in business process development and implementation as well as quality assurance processes is also required. IIBA certification or equivalent training and experience is considered an asset.
A combination of relevant education and experience may be considered.
Additional Information:

FCL offers a competitive salary, ongoing personal and professional development, and the opportunity to work with one of western Canada's most successful organizations.
You may be required to undergo a background and substance test in accordance with FCL policies.

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst drives player and revenue growth and improves decision making abilities through analysis, production of key insights, segmentation and reporting on enterprise data assets. The role may create individual strategies to manage gaming products, provide web analysis recommendations or target sections of our player base through data investigation, business knowledge and the application of complex quantitative analysis on a variety of software tools.

Accountabilities
Develops complex analysis/reporting by collaborating with stakeholder groups to recognize opportunities to grow revenue and optimize product selection and web experience decisions.
Enhances/maintains processes and standards in order to drive performance improvement.
Proactively provides solutions to performance issues through innovative and analytical thinking.
Develops analysis to provide insights supporting strategic initiatives and to help shape business plans.
Creates data standards, performs data profiling analysis to support the business intelligence team, and ensure adherence to those standards.
Designs/develops product, player, web, and enterprise reporting, including dashboards, scorecards and management reports. Identifies and recommends KPIs while ensuring integrity and accuracy of data.
May create conceptual, logical and physical data models for new solution development in support of business needs.
Consults/influences business stakeholders to proactively add value, understand their needs and to be able to communicate this direction to internal team members.
Provides communication to key stakeholders ensuring clarity and awareness of strategies and objectives for business intelligence analysis.

Minimum Required Qualifications
Education and Experience
A degree in a business discipline such as Business Analytics, Information Technology, Marketing, Business Analysis or Statistics;
3-5 years of related experience in leading the development of business intelligence solutions within a SQL based or SAS solution within a cross functional team, including a minimum of 3 years proven technical experience working within a complex business environment with the demonstrated ability to analyze business situations and develop innovative solutions to complex situations.
Experience with the following developing end-to-end analysis with limited guidance; data intelligence best practices; including disparate data source integration techniques, segmentation, core KPI development, promotion/campaign ROI analysis and post analysis; data analysis and designing reporting solutions including (but not limited to) dashboards, portals, and report objects; web analytics, including but not limited to java script tagging, web dashboard creation and conversion funnel analysis;

Technical Requirements

Understanding of data mining and database query tools.

Understanding of statistical analytics including the use of statistical software, the gathering of data and analysis to support predictive model generation;
Clear communication skills to explain complex information in an effective manner. Demonstrates strong presentation and data visualization skills; ability to convey complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience;
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to act on own initiative, exercise sound judgment and prioritize tasks with the experience and confidence to know when to ask for support;
Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.

POSITION: Distribution/Allocation Analyst
EMPLOYMENT STATUS: Exempt
REPORTS TO: Demand Planning & Distribution Manager
LOCATION: Sephora Field Support Center (FSC) – Toronto

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Distribution/Allocation Analyst works in partnership with the Category Merchant, Supply Chain, Operations, Merchandise Planning and Demand Planning Teams to achieve optimal store inventory levels while maximizing profitable sales and bottom line results. The Distribution/Allocation Analyst applies analytical skills to distribute product to multiple store formats across Canada.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determine optimal store allocation and replenishment based on the Merchant strategy, merchandising plan, store size and sales performance
Provide data and recommendations to influence the development of department/class level plans
Assist in the development of department/class level allocation strategies
Ensure allocations and replenishment is completed by the required timelines for DC processing to ensure product arrives to pre-defined store set-up dates.
Manage the inventory levels for product categories through analysis of trends, exceptions, rate of sale, minimum order quantities and minimum presentation quantities.
Store level in stock and sales analysis with the goal to increase in stocks
Maintain a well-balanced inventory in each assigned classification to maximize sales while minimizing obsolescence
Partner with Planning/ Merchandising team to identify and communicate sales and inventory trends or issues.
Monitors and manages store side forecasts for newness and core SKUs to ensure in stock targets are met.
Management of all Hotline Online Store Requests for respective brands.
Provide inventory analytics with information to maximize sales and profits
Share responsibility with the merchants, merchandise planning and demand planning team for Weeks of Supply, age of stock, and stock to sales (category and store) provide analysis and provide recommendations as required.
Analyze and report all in-season sell through results. Evaluate performance of promotions and key programs to extract learnings. Complete ad-hoc analysis or reports as required in a timely matter as it relates to allocations, sell-through, and inventory
Compile store grading analysis based on required timelines and liase with merchandising, merchandise planning and demand planning teams to review proposed store clusters/grades.
Collaborate with operations, districts store specialists, to ensure timely product allocations to new and/or renovated stores or any special store request or concerns.
Effectively communicate expected store delivery flow to DC Operations and Operations team and troubleshoot any issues
Provide feedback and recommendations for various processes and applications to improve efficiencies in everyday tasks and assigned projects.
Ad Hoc Analysis, Projects/ Reporting as requested.

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Analytic Skills: Ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data
Financial and Business Acumen: Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and translate data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
Problem Solving & Decision Quality: Able to use rigorous logic and methods to solve problems with effective solutions
Influencing & Negotiation: Can present ideas and directions that lead others to action
Systems and Tools Acumen: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and have aptitude to learn technical applications quickly
Collaboration: Able to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

REQUIREMENTS:

SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Knowledge and application of the Information Technology Information Library (ITIL) best practices an asset.Ability to gather information, diagnose and analyze a variety of technical and non-technical issues and provide information and/or solutions as required. Well-developed analytical, problem solving, organizational and time management skills. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing with clients, technical teams and other co-workers, work to schedules and adapt easily to changing priorities and business needs. Strong customer service and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on multiple projects in a team environment.

Overview

Reporting to the Director of Asset Management, the Analyst of Asset Management is responsible for assisting in valuation of assets and the development, implementation, monitoring and maintenance of key performance metrics and analytical models for Centurion Asset Management Inc. | Centurion Property Associates Inc.

Responsibilities

Relationship Development

Develop and foster positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders including Third-Party Appraisers, Consultants, Mortgage Brokers, Lenders and Lawyers.

Fair Value

Work with Third-Party Appraisers and internal departments to conduct the quarterly fair value calculation for each fund. Verify abnormal variances and identify non-recurring incidences to produce a normalized income for the fair value calculation. Prepare the quarterly fair value variance spreadsheet for Management review. Develop calculation models for fair value as needed. Ensure that all deadlines and critical dates are met.

Investment Analysis and Financial Modeling

Assist with the implementation and maintenance of the business analytics platform. Monitor trends for business insights and key performance indicators. Identify variances to help maintain business efficiency. Monitor quarterly rental rate movements for the Centurion Real Estate Investment Trust. Assist in the development and maintenance of financial and valuation models, assisting in calculation verification. Assist in the disposition processes. Assist with the completion of the internal rate of return calculations on realized investments. Assist various departments in implementation processes for financial platforms or systems. Work closely with the Executive Management team, providing key analytical data on a regular basis.
Operational Efficiencies

Assist with monitoring and identifying areas of operational inefficiencies or variances for all funds. Investigate, follow up on and resolve any issues that arise.
Refinancing

Assist with the refinancing process by reviewing commitment letters, preparing the refinancing packages and providing the Director of Asset Management with updates as required. Keep track of and maintain the internal mortgage schedule, ensuring that all maturing mortgages are addressed within the established timelines. Ensure all documentation is up to date and filed correctly. Complete other tasks as assigned by the Director of Asset Management and/or the President | CEO.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance or accounting;
3-5 years’ experience in asset management with experience in the real estate sector considered an asset;
Exceptional interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to present ideas effectively to both individuals and groups;
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills and a strong ability to multi-task;
Highly motivated and able to take the initiative required to excel in a deadline-oriented environment;
Strong follow-up skills with the ability to effectively resolve problems in a timely manner using relevant information, sound reasoning and common sense;
Excellent command of MS Office products: Excel, Word, Power Point; and
Pursuing the Chartered Financial Analyst designation considered an asset.
