If you’re looking for an exciting, challenging and dynamic career then we are looking for you!

The Digital Services Directorate (DSD) supports Canadians by providing easy, fast and convenient access to information and services online, as well as through phone operations (such as the 1 800 O-Canada service). The digital teams in DSD include the Principal Publisher that operates Canada.ca on behalf of Government of Canada (GC) departments, Secure Digital Solutions that manages My Service Canada Account and My Service Canada Business Account, and Portfolio Web that manages the internet and intranet for all of ESDC, Service Canada, and the Labour Program.

Located in downtown Gatineau, DSD is where passionate people come to make a difference. We offer an environment that is intellectually stimulating and supportive. We offer a wide range of exciting career opportunities that incorporate an array of benefits and flexible work arrangements that can help you easily balance your work and private life.
Intent of the process
The intent of the process is to staff three (3) positions:

Officer, Client ServicesWeb DeveloperBusiness Systems Analyst
A pool of partially or fully qualified candidates will be established through this process to staff future positions with various tenures, similar requirements, various language requirements and profiles, and various security requirements, depending on the position being staffed.
Positions to be filled: 3

Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
We will accept applications on-line only. Persons with disabilities preventing them from applying on-line are asked to communicate with the contact person identified on this poster.

Communication for this process will be sent via e-mail. Applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages). It is your responsibility to check both your jobs.gc.ca account and email account regularly to ensure that you do not miss any opportunities. Make sure to also check your junk mail folder. It is entirely your responsibility to inform us of any changes to your contact information. If you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.

You have the right to apply and be assessed in the official language of your choice.

A variety of assessment tools may be used in the assessment of candidates. Some assessment tools may be administered electronically, others, in-person.

Volume management strategies could be applied at any stage of the process to identify which applications will be given further consideration, for example asset qualifications, top-down and/or random selection.

Candidates must provide proof of their education during the assessment phase. Original diplomas, degrees or certified transcripts may be required and must be presented upon request. Failure to produce required documents will result in your application not being considered. If you went to school outside of Canada, you must have your certificates and/or diplomas assessed against Canadian education standards. Read more on Degree equivalency or visit the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials (CICIC) at: https://www.cicic.ca.

TRAVEL RELATED TO THE SELECTION OR APPOINTMENT PROCESS: Please note that candidates (including employees of the Public Service) will not be considered to be in travel status or on government business and that travel costs or travel expenses will not be reimbursed. Consequently, candidates will be responsible for travel costs.

As this process may be used to fill other departmental vacancies, your application (e.g. resume, assessments, results) could be shared with other hiring managers in order for the department to make optimal use of our pools.

No informal discussions will be held.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Edmonton, AB$72,444 - $94,964 a yearThe Policy Analyst is responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing policy options required to develop the Department of Energy's upstream mines and minerals policies. The position plays a critical role in ensuring that policy options are well thought, relevant data are analyzed, all stakeholders are engaged, and research is properly conducted for policy and regulation development. The work environment is complex and the position must consider a wide variety of energy and non-energy issues affecting Alberta's mines and minerals royalty and tenure systems. This position leads and/or coordinates in-depth policy development processes and works with multidisciplinary teams.


This position will require strong verbal and written communication skills in producing briefings, presentations, cabinet reports, and communications materials on a broad range of energy-related issues. Your highly developed consultation/engagement, facilitation and interpersonal skills will help you coordinate working groups; liaise extensively with operations, legal, agencies and policy representatives; and participate on departmental, cross ministry, and industry committees related to energy development. The work undertaken by the Policy Analyst ranges from well-organized work plans to exploratory, emergent research and strategy development in the fields of energy information, policy, program, and regulations. Since the work covers the full range of Crown-owned mines and minerals, curiosity, mental flexibility, and interpersonal skills are fundamental attributes for the position. Communication, teamwork, and building relationships are essential for success. Having strong analytical and data processing skills are also a critical asset for this position.


The competencies that are critical for success in this role are:

Drive for Results - Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Creative Problem Solving - Advanced problem solving and critical thinking skills are required to develop recommendations for management, founded on excellent research and analysis skills and the input of multiple stakeholders and/or data sources.

Systems Thinking - Ability to map and synthesize knowledge of Alberta Government business goals, economic and environmental policies, challenges, and potential roles for the Alberta Government and other jurisdictions to address these challenges.

Agility - Demonstrated ability to develop creative and durable recommendations to address complex issues involving multiple stakeholders with various responsibilities and areas of influence. Ability to work with minimal supervision is required


Qualifications

University degree in a related field (e.g., law, business, economics, finance, political science, engineering, or natural resources sciences) plus 4 years of progressively responsible related experience is required. Demonstrated experience with policy development and implementation OR demonstrated understanding of Canadian and global energy industries and systems is required. Project management experience and a related master?s degree will be considered as assets. Additional assets include a master's degree. Equivalencies will be considered.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly
($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta.


How to Apply

Online applications are preferred. Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file. Please ensure that this document is saved using the following naming convention (Last name, First name_Job ID Number). Applicants who apply online will be able to track the status of this competition.

It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.


Closing Statement

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting, please call (780) 427-2111. If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check http://www.jobs.alberta.ca for a listing of current career opportunities with the Government of Alberta.

Please follow us on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/government-of-alberta

job_title: Senior IT Analyst, Operational Services and Improvements
job_description:
Job Description

OSI (Operations, Services & Improvements) is recruiting for a Senior IT Analyst in CPPIB’s Information Technology group.
The successful candidate will focus supporting and enhancing enterprise data and reporting applications. These two application areas are mission-critical in providing services for day-to-day measurement and optimization of CPPIB’s $300B+ diversified asset portfolio. The successful candidate will bring to OSI significant, diversified IT experience from the areas of enterprise data management, vendor data processing, data warehousing, BI reporting, ETL, and related IT practices . These skills need to be complemented with strong communication and business skills. OSI is business-facing, highly dynamic environment which provides a right candidate with a number of learning and growth opportunities. Primary job responsibilities include providing technical/business application support, identifying and driving improvements and working with the broader OSI team to mature and advance our operating procedures.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Proactively identifying, troubleshooting, tracking, managing, and resolving reported issues
Ensuring application systems are operating according to established service levels agreements
Applying analytical, technical, and business skills to investigate day-to-day system and process issues, determine the root cause and deliver viable solutions
Demonstrate technical leadership by proposing advancements with tangible business benefits to CPPIB’s IT portfolio
Partnering with Application Development team and other CPPIB groups to create synergies and advance CPPIB’s technology portfolio
Defining and collecting metrics to understand trends in systems performance; develop and execute plans to mitigate symptoms
Providing disciplined tracking and reporting of various activities according to CPPIB/OSI standards
Provide a dedicated rotational weekend/overnight support as required
Effectively liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and database analysts to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems.
Work closely with the management team to mature OSI’s operational practices

Qualifications

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
5+ years’ experience working in IT department of a significant financial institution with exposure to both support and development functions
Experience building data and/or reporting capabilities, related best practices, and their roles in a large financial intuition
Good understanding of institutional investing business processes – Order Management, PnL/Performance, Settlements, Regulatory Reporting, Risk Management, and similar
Proactive, detail oriented and well organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent business acumen, written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable communicating effectively with colleagues across the organization at varying levels of seniority
Strong experience in data warehousing processes and best practices
Experience sourcing, cataloguing, and distributing vendor data such as Bloomberg, MarkIT, RIMES, and similar
ETL tools and principles, experience with Informatica or DataStage is an asset
Experience with Webfocus or similar industry-standard BI platform
Strong knowledge of relational databases (data modeling, SQL, performance tuning), emphasis on Oracle and SQL Server
Experience with an enterprise-level job scheduler such as Tidal, AutoSys or JAMS in a large-scale deployment
Experience with MQ or similar real-time message delivery technologies
Solid overall understanding of operating systems, networks, virtualization, monitoring, and large capacity storage systems
Strong understanding of ITIL, ITSM practices and platforms like Service Now
Understanding of new technology trends in data (e.g. Big Data, Blockchain, AWS, Visualisation tools like Tableau etc)
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-BG1
At CPP Investment Board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

CPP Investment Board will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

About Us: MASS Engines drives revenue growth for B2B companies by building best-in-class lead management systems. We map and automate the customer journey to increase deal velocity and closure, enabling enterprise organizations to optimize lead flow and transform their funnel. Our unique change management philosophy drives system adoption and delivers measurable results.
Our Mission: Apply scientific principles to the art of revenue creation.
Our Vision: Revenue creation is a systematic process, well understood and fully controlled.
Our Values: Team/ Ownership / Quality / Integrity / Hard Work
Role Summary: The Marketing Data Analyst has a client-facing role. The position combines digital marketing expertise with data collection and analytic techniques to provide valuable insights for our client initiatives. You will be required to solve complex business challenges by means of analysis, strategic thinking and creativity. You must be experienced in applying data-driven insights to inform business and marketing decisions. You must be highly adaptable to work place demands and an effective communicator.
Responsibilities
Lead data analysis functions on projects of varying sizes and complexity including: requirements gathering, tool implementation, data mining, ad hoc analysis, split testing, data visualization, report automation and documentation
Work with clients, team members and senior leadership to provide data and insights to inform business decisions
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets and provide insights
Ensure the integrity of project solutions by implementing policies for data governance
Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods to perform analysis for testing and targeting
Regularly provide and present reports that link data interpretation results to key client objectives
Develop models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on customer and benchmark data

Skills and Experience
2 to 3 years in a Data Analyst role
Independent, highly organized and detail-oriented individual
Ability to deliver results in a timely manner with minimal supervision
Experience with reporting and data visualization solutions
Proficiency with statistical analysis and data mining technology
Knowledge of requirements analysis, problem solving, documentation writing, database management, data standardization, data maintenance and documentation writing
Detailed knowledge of Excel, VB and Macros, SQL, and Python
Capable of multitasking within a fast-paced environment
Basic knowledge of marketing automation and CRM an asset

UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 23 leading financial services clients representing over 14,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors.

UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of Univeris' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The Data Specialist will engage with cross-functional stakeholders to advance the Univeris Data Steward and Data Conversion Solutions, optimizing the use of technology and automation. This self-starting leader will be able to collect, prioritize, and analyze data and data management requirements across each of data integrity, data scrubbing, and complex data conversion. This specialist will have extensive experience in data management, transfer, integrity management, including expertise in modern technologies (ETL) to build, implement, and optimize the conversion process. This individual will be responsible for cultivating working relationships with clients in order to identify needs and deliver high-quality data conversion projects, seeing the client through the inquiry, planning, analysis, development, testing, execution and go-live support stages of the data conversion process. This position is part of the Customer Success COE and reports directly to the VP of IT Services and Customer Success.


SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to implement ETL (Pentaho or similar) technology to renovate and optimize data conversion initiatives

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to optimize the Data Integrity tools

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes existing documented processes, protocols, procedures to optimally commoditize Data Conversion and Integrity documentation

Leads data conversion projects following the Univeris Data Conversion Framework, analyzing opportunities for optimization and automation - including implementing new technologies.

Develops strong relationships with all cross-functional team members including Delivery Managers, Product Managers, Release Management, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts, Systems Analysts, Developers, IT staff and Clients

Evaluates and implements ETL tools and software packages
Liaises as required with internal Subject Matter Experts and IT support staff and provides input to sizing and configuring the production and conversion environments.

Leverages SaaS, Infrastructure, DevOps, Architecture (enterprise and data), and Technology groups to advance the Data Steward practice

Acts as a technical expert and provides guidance and training to clients and staff on data conversion and application use.

Provides input to data conversion project plan, estimates, timelines, risk management plan and communication plan

Requirements gathering, analysis and documenting the system-to-system data mapping, data validation, data enrichment and data transformation rules

Analyzes the client operating model and data, and identifies potential functional and data gaps.

Creates conversion specifications based upon client’s current platform and the desired organizational model, delivering an ETL package and operational model.

Imports, maps, transforms, analyzes, validates, corrects, loads, audits and reconciles client data between the source system, the Univeris EWMS platform and other data sources

Guides the client to execute data integrity verification programs and to correct data issues.

Works closely with the client to set realistic targets and manages expectations and timelines.

Provides support to the client before, during and after the conversion, identifying areas of risk and creating solutions to prevent or mitigate risk.

Works with and leads outsourced resources as required.

Accountable for the overall success of the data conversion projects and for the client's ability to operate on the Univeris EWMS platform with the converted data

Develops effective relationships with clients, working with the client from initial inquiry, through design, development, system installation, data conversion and support stages.

Works with client to explain the data conversion methodology, explaining the benefits of the Univeris EWMS platform, and providing accurate resolutions and solutions to Client problems related to data conversion.

In the installation and support stages works with client to build and deliver the ETL tool and operational model.

Works with the client to establish accurate and realistic timelines for test and production conversions.

Develops and delivers client training for the operation of data cleanup utilities that are part of the Univeris EWMS platform, customizing the training delivery based on client need, knowledge and skill level.

Provides on-going support to the client following the production conversion to ensure operational fitness using the converted data.

Creates and maintains Data Conversion and/or System Implementation documentation specific to each project based on the Univeris Data Conversion and System Implementation frameworks.

Engages in communities of practice, meetups, to advance the Univeris Data Strategy best practices and technology innovations

Proactively identifies own training needs.


DESIRED SKILLS & EDUCATION


Education

Engineering, Science or Computer Science undergraduate degree/diploma, or equivalent work experience.


Experience & Knowledge

Over 7 years of experience in data steward/conversion and systems analysis, preferably in the financial services industry.

Demonstrated experience with ETL and Enterprise Level conversion using standardized tools (Pentaho Data Integration, Informatica PowerCenter, etc.)

Strong knowledge of data conversion best practices

Ability to prioritize and work independently on multiple concurrent projects.

Solid practical experience with MS SQL Server and PostgreSQL databases, and ability to code (T-SQL, etc.)

Demonstrated verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and experienced in delivering client-facing presentations.

Good understanding of investment products and related processes.


Personal Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build business relationships.

Technical and process leadership of project teams that include client and Univeris's resources.

Ability to interact effectively with peers and all levels of management, including all Lines of Business and external stakeholders.

Clear and concise writing and verbal skills are crucial to the ability to obtain and disseminate information.

Excellent facilitation and organizational skills and ability to balance multiple concurrent assignments.

Ability to summarize data into high-level themes.

Collaborates with others both internal staff and clients with consideration and respect.

Provides timely feedback and responses to all, especially clients.

Represents Univeris in a professional and positive manner.

Roadmunk is a high growth start-up in a fast moving and highly competitive market. What sets us apart is our deep understanding of our users psychology and our ability to produce simple solutions to complex problems.
Roadmunk was inspired by a problem our founders experienced personally: there was no simple way for product managers to build and share roadmaps. So, we built an app to help companies create roadmaps of all shapes, sizes and types. Our goal is to make strategic roadmapping quick, effective and collaborative.
The most forward-thinking product teams (we’re talking in the thousands here) from top companies like Amazon, Disney and eBay are using Roadmunk to align all of their stakeholders and execs using beautiful, crystal-clear roadmaps.
From day one, we’ve built our app, business and culture around our people-first values. These values are the driving force behind everything we do:
Start with empathy
Driven to succeed
Trust through transparency
Build with balance
Always learning
Fun together
We’re really proud of the culture that we’ve created together. At Roadmunk, you'll be joining a welcoming, supportive and fun team that will make sure you have all the things you need to be successful in your role.
Requirements
Roadmunk is looking for a Database Administrator or Architect to design and develop data systems to help business analysts and business stakeholders gain insights from our data. This person would usher Roadmunk into becoming a data-centric organization and foster the democratization of knowledge. As our DBA, you will be the responsible building and updating the underlying data infrastructure, while maintaining its accuracy and availability. This role will need to work with closely with many functional teams within the business including software development, finance, customer support, sales, and marketing. Location: Toronto HQ, with occasional travel to Kitchener office.

What you’ll do:
Data advocacy & education
Work with business leaders to understand data goals and requirements, help set priorities and workflows to achieve them
Advocate for data-centric initiatives as priorities in the larger organization
Educate and empower the team to use the available data to drive insights for the business
Database development
Extract large amounts of data from a variety of source-systems to one central data repository
Apply data modeling, data design and implementation to support business requirements and drive the organization forward
Develop, document, and monitor scheduled jobs and other processes including database backups, restores, and disaster recovery plans
Maintain the availability of the databases, database schemas, and the reporting tools,such that the data is available for analysis
Data architecture
Contribute to the continued growth and development of Roadmunk’s back-end data architecture
Delight our business stakeholders by developing the data systems to allow analysts & business users to have access to accurate, normalized, well-governed & documented data
Reporting and analysis
Data analysis, produce ad hoc queries and develop reports to support business needs
Work closely with analysts to build out analysis to solve various business problems to help the company scale

REQUIREMENTS
Experience: 2+ years in database design, development, and implementation, with significant experience in designing and administering a large complex SQL environment
Analytical Skill: you are able to execute data analysis and basic modelling directly and with expediency with relevant tools (Excel, BI tools, visualizations, etc.)
Critical Thinking: you don’t just follow the common wisdom, but can think critically to determine which tactics, ideas and objectives are right for our data operations to scale
Technical Skill: Expert in SQL; Designing database models; Knowledge in Redshift, Hadoop, Spark a plus; Being able to speak technically with engineers on data structure a must
Strong communicator: ability to communicate and educate business leaders on data initiatives, data strategy, and business reporting
And most importantly, a positive attitude; lots of hustle; friendly, and fun to work with
Benefits
We know we’re not alone in boasting things like flexible working hours, on-site snacks, monthly team social events, and the occasional dog in the office. That has become table stakes in this job market.
But just in case we need to be specific...
Full health benefits package from day one
Competitive salary and stock options
Free snacks and drinks
Monthly social events
Annual health & wellness allowance
Flexible working hours
Diverse projects, cutting-edge tools and freedom to experiment

Roadmunk is an equal opportunity employer. We thrive on diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, experiences, and skills.

Completed Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, IT, or related field, OR 2+ years of Amazon experience3+ years’ procurement experience1+ years’ experience using Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and analytical platforms, including but not limited to the ability to analyze data using pivots and v-lookups.1+ years of people management experience1+ years of experience in supply chain operationsExperience understanding process flow and suggest improvements to deliver cost savings, inventory reduction, or other benefits to the site.
Supplier/ vendor relationship management experience

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

As a Procurement Operations Analyst for the Amazon Fulfillment Center team, you will own the site’s indirect procurement operation responsibilities, including forecasting, inventory management, purchase order management and Vendor management of 3rd party service providers. You will lead supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, and work with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas. You will provide procurement leadership and align with the building leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at the site(s).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
In partnership with the Procurement Operations Manager, provide procurement operations support for the fulfillment center, including: forecasting of non-inventory products, inventory management, non-inventory flow and space models, cycle counts, supplier management, procurement transaction and expediting supportLead team of non-inventory receivers to ensure building has adequate resources and is set up for successDevelop deep knowledge of non-inventory items and align with like buildings to drive best practicesManage KPI to measure, control and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for the Operations networkDevelop relationship across the building and network to ensure best practices are being shared and implementedAlign with internal customers, Finance and Procurement Operations to understand budgetary targets by building and develop methods of measuring and defining savings, value and other category metricsUsing input from the category team, build the category metrics model to track and monitor performance in relationship to the category strategyMeasure actual vs planned savings; as savings trends are identified, own action plans to meet goals and develop solutionsWork in partnership both internally and with suppliers to develop innovative solutions to provide Procurement support to the Operations networkDevelop and implement ways to measure suppliers to drive continuous performance improvement on behalf of AmazonCoordinate the demand identification, procurement, and inventory management of all non-merchandise items required for building operation. This includes corrugate, packing materials, labor and janitorial services, etc.Partner with Category team to manage and maintain supplier scorecards
. Partner with AP, Suppliers and various internal teams to ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues
Support the procurement operations and category management teamsWork is done in a warehouse environment that requires frequent walking around the building. You should feel comfortable working in an environment with varying temperatures as many buildings have dock doors that open throughout shifts.

Experience in Coupa or other financial management/procurement softwareExperience with cost accounting and procurementLean / Six-Sigma knowledgeMust be highly self-motivated and customer-centricAbility to work with ambiguityProvide a positive customer internally and external
Amazon offers competitive packages including comprehensive health care, 401(k), restricted stock units, growth potential and a challenging and exciting work environment.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

ContractGreat Canadian is currently accepting applications for our next GREAT colleague to join us as a Business Analyst - Operations for our Property Development team. This contract opportunity extends until approximately July 2020.


Under the direction of the Executive Director, Design & Construction Management, this position responsible for identifying, developing, analyzing and preparing property development reports, Executive Summaries and recommendations to support the organization’s operational planning, project management and decision-making processes.


Duties and responsibilities for our next Business Analyst will include:

Conducting business process analysis to improve business management and project management efficiency
Developing, implementing and maintaining effective data stewardship; identifying, prioritizing and resolving business and technical issues; identifying and evaluating potential business sources
Developing and maintaining business data reporting, producing timely and accurate reports and analysis for designated decision makers as directed, documenting business requirements, recommending appropriate scope of technical requirements and functional priorities, coordinating report prototype reviews and incorporating feedback
Drafting, developing and maintaining procedure manuals, project manuals and project specifications
Developing monthly project management reports for executives
Administering the construction management software; managing system configuration and functionality; organizing continuous and proper training sessions for users; troubleshooting any technical issues; liaising with IT department for software evaluation; translating project management requirements into system specifications
Helping to manage, track and consolidate project budget; providing accurate and timely budget report for development projects
Producing ad hoc reports and analyze for executives, senior management and operations managers in a timely fashion
Acting as a Development BA Subject Matter Expert (SME) and supporting internal teams in the production and troubleshooting of various reports
Administering project information; making sure project teams follows project documentation rules
Developing and cultivating strong working relationships with all stakeholders
Ensuring compliance with all company information handling and reporting policies
Complying with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
Performing other duties as assigned or directed
Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

The drive to represent Great Canadian’s values in action - Integrity, Team Engagement, Drive to Succeed, Service Excellence and Citizenship
A passion for providing Great Experiences and Memories to our internal and external guests in support of our goal to achieve Service Excellence
Post-secondary education in Commerce, Economics, or Business Analytics

Toronto, ONPosted: 12/7/2018 12:04:45 PM

We currently have a temporary full time (1 year) opportunity for a Data Manager – Hematology Disease Site Group in our Clinical Research Programme, Odette Cancer Centre in the Sunnybrook Research Institute.
The Clinical Research Programme at the Odette Cancer Center (OCC) is part of Sunnybrook Research Institute’s (SRI) ongoing commitment to participate in innovative and high quality clinical research. Within OCC Clinical Research, the Medical Director, Manager and Business Analyst, work with 35+ physicians actively participating in clinical research and 33 OCC clinical research staff. Our programme is comprised of 10 disease site groups; Breast, CNS, GI, GU, Gynecology, Head & Neck, Hematology, Lung, Melanoma and Palliative.
Under the direction of the Disease Site Group Leader and Program Supervisor, the goal of this position is to support the Hematology Disease Site Group with the management of trials and patient-specific responsibilities. Primary responsibilities include obtaining and processing biologic specimens and the collection and entry of data into each trials data entry system. Additional responsibilities may include screening, review of the informed consent form with patients, assessment of eligibility, registration/randomization, collection and submission of patient data, monitoring / compliance, maintenance of a system to ensure effective data flow, monitoring of patients, collection of adverse events and communication of patient information to investigators in a timely fashion. The Data Manager (DM) will also liaise with clinical trial, institutional and study sponsor staff to respond to queries and facilitate monitoring and close out visits. Must be able to recognize adverse events (AEs), communicate AEs promptly to investigators and respond appropriately to protocol/patient focused care including reporting to appropriate parties. Overall responsibilities involve aspects of study activation, maintenance and closure.
Qualifications/Skills:
Requires the successful minimum completion of a Community College Diploma/ Certificate
Practical clinical trial experience an asset
Well-developed organizational and time management skills
In-depth knowledge of ICH guidelines and Good Clinical Practice an asset
Proven experience in processing and shipping blood samples an asset
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated accurate and efficient work habits with close attention to detail
Familiarity with medical terminology

Edmonton, ABYOU KNOW HOW TO BE flexible.
YOU KNOW HOW TO BE agile.
Posted: 2019-02-01

Closing: When Filled

Location: Edmonton South
ABOUT YOU
The Alberta Motor Association (AMA) is on the lookout for a passionate, resourceful Product Owner who is a great communicator, negotiator, and facilitator. You will be a part of the agile delivery team, responsible for gathering requirements from stakeholders, refining vision into clear functional requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria, rationalizing, planning, prioritizing and monitoring the acceptability of stories in a timely manner using the AMA Agile Framework and tools.
If you can focus on the objectives and functionality to be delivered for a feature and within a sprint, then we want to talk to you. You might just be the person we're looking for to join our team.
WHAT MOVES YOU
You're a spirited team player who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on challenge.
You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Prioritizing, planning and organizing is part of your DNA.
You strongly believe there's no such thing as an insignificant detail — you keep at it until every 'i' is dotted and every 't' is crossed.
You have the natural ability to reduce a complex concept or task into something that is manageable and can be clearly understood and communicated.
You have an inquisitive mind and love coming up with new ways to tackle a challenge and digging deeper to find the perfect solution to increase value for your customers.
You never sweat deadlines — you've got mad time management skills, so you always deliver on time.
You work well on your own but also enjoy being part of a team.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Product Owner Team Lead.
Develop relationships with Business partners to understand their business and provide recommendations and enhancements to solve their strategic and operational needs.
Plan and prioritize stories within a sprint plan.
Participate in daily triage/scrum meetings to resolve issues, addresses changes and report on progress.
Work with scrum team members to ensure the sprints content produces a functional package to leadership and key stakeholders.
Communicate with other agile team members to resolve any issues before escalating to the Product Manager.
Decompose the features into user stories to support priority business value delivery.
Provide and analyze data for the Product Manager to make informed decisions, mitigate risks, or take other actions.
Evaluate a problem/opportunity from both a business and consumer perspective to determine the best resolution approach.
Gather business/user requirements to support the functional or business solution by conducting interviews, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process description, document analysis, uses cases, tasks, and workflow analysis.
Report sprint metrics to the Product Manager to identify any major issues by keeping the AMA tracking tool up-to-date and running metric reports required for regular status cadence meetings.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have post-secondary education/certification, or you are actively pursuing it in an applicable functional or business designation for the specified content area of management.
You have minimum 3 years of industry/functional experience.
You have minimum 3 years' experience under your belt in participating on multiple teams.
You have a firm understanding of agile project delivery methodologies and a certification would be an asset.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Overview:

This opportunity is for an analyst that is dynamic and inquisitive and who is self-reliant but also able to benefit from the mentoring of senior colleagues. The successful candidate for this role will work with national caliber clients and business partners in the automotive leasing and remarketing sectors.


The Company:

Canadian Dealer Lease Services, Inc. (CDLSI) is an acknowledged leader in the Canadian automotive leasing service sector and is the exclusive leasing partner for several top automotive brands in Canada. CDLSI manages the Customer Service, Accounting, and End of Term (EOT) operations for our partner brands. Our EOT Remarketing group is exclusively responsible for the remarketing of vehicles returned by lessees at the end of their leases and works to get the best value for our supported OEMs and banking partner for these returned vehicles.


Description:

The open position will specialize in providing the business information and analytics for management to actively manage the end-to-end vehicle remarketing process. This will include quantification of key aspects of the vehicle return and inspection process, segmentation of on-line and physical auction results, and other associated processes. Solid analytic experience is a must for this role.

The successful candidate will work with several external partner companies and internal stakeholders. Large amounts of data will need to be intelligently processed to derive key business information in a timely enough manner to support active remarketing decisions by senior staff or the needs of other internal and external stakeholders. The best candidates for this role will have the ability to improve, if warranted, current internal processes and data stores and representations and also be able to work with external partners to improve their data and processes.


Skills & Experience:

The successful candidate will need to have practical understanding of analytic tools and underlying statistics involved. Experience can come from a combination of education plus exposure in a work environment. A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience can come from a combination of academia, the civil service, or the private sector for transportation, banking, engineering and other business driven markets.


Tools utilized should include at least a few Excel, MS ACCESS, VBA, and other related applications. Ability to work with SQL queries is desirable but not essential. Strong communication skills (written and verbal) are a must.


Reporting Analyst Task Areas:
 Producing monthly, weekly, and ad hoc reports plus some daily reports
 Lessee and vehicle segmentation reports
 Early termination metrics
 Profit/Loss reporting to OEM
 Operational process reporting
 Input for database maintenance

· Various other types of proprietary reporting
 Contributing to ongoing improvements to reports, processes, and systems


CDLSI welcomes and encourages applicants from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Toronto, ONPermanentWhat is the opportunity?
As a Digital Insight Analyst you will work closely with Product Owners and development teams, to promote the growth and continuous improvement of RBC’s digital channels through in-depth analytics. Ranked among the top digital experience across North America, RBC is always looking for ways to delight and improve the user experience through improved use of analytics at the point of client interaction.

In this role you will work alongside a RBC product owner, and be responsible for analyzing the digital behavior of clients and providing modeling and execution support to assist in personalizing experiences. Digital Insight Analysts will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to help drive optimization across products KPIs (i.e increased usage and sales recommendations). The person in this role will build critical understanding of our customers and how they use our products and help the team be a strong internal voice for the power of analytics as a driver of business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications (Public websites, Online Banking, Mobile apps).

What will you do?
Analyze large data sets and representing the behavior of digital product users to provide insights about user actions that help owners optimize on KPIs (i.e. conversions, attribution models, path analysis, cohort analysis, conversion analytics, etc.)
Consult with digital team leaders to understand goals and identify potential analytics projects or solutions to further the objectives of the Digital Product teams
Support Multivariate and A/B testing by exposing core insights from the data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b/c tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site experience.
Responsible for managing and developing business relationships with Digital product owners and key partners, including conducting regular monthly business reviews
Deliver clear, concise and timely analysis with team members and stakeholders identifying trends, issues and opportunities, performance analysis, dashboards, benchmarking, sales reports, customer profile/segmentation, etc.
Work closely with developers to dynamically modify digital content based on business rules and models


Prepares and delivers presentations to Digital product owners and Senior Leaders

What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have
4+ years' experience in related digital product development or data mining role
BA/BSc or above in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field
Advanced knowledge of R, Python, SQL or SAS
Understanding of marketing analytics, data mining, experimentation and measurement
Knowledge of web and mobile development processes
Ability to multi-task and prioritize/complete projects in a timely manner
Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
Excellent verbal, written, communication and presentation skills
Highly detail oriented and comfortable with large amounts of data
Proven analytics and problem solving skills
Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

Nice-to-have
Familiar with online tools such as Google Analytics Premium and Tableau,
Knowledge of graph analytics (Neo4j, DataStax, Neptune)
Experience with the deployment of APIs and services for front-end personalization
Ability to code in Scala
Knowledge of statistical modeling and forecasting

DAI

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. We currently have an opportunity for a Regular Full-time Analyst, Imaging Informatics position inthe Medical Imaging department located at our Bayview Campus.
Summary of Duties
The Informatics team within the Department of Medical Imaging at Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre provides technical and analytical support to operational and clinical areas of the hospital. The focus of the Informatics team is to systematically support evidence-based process decisions and performance monitoring for the service provision of all our imaging modalities (including but not limited to ultrasound, X-ray, CT, MRI, PET, nuclear medicine etc). Informatics team also supports the medical imaging team with any IT related needs including managing PACS, RIS and other ancillary applications. The Clinical Analyst will report to the Manger of Informatics.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Perform and present data analysis on multiple data sources for analytical and modeling purposes and evaluates key performance metrics and trends.
Develop models including data visualizations.
Perform data mining, such as anomaly detection, classification, regression, clustering, and summarization/recommendation analysis.
Identify opportunities and solutions to better meet business needs to drive performance and optimization
Validate the implementation of improvement solutions via data collection and analysis
Effectively communicate the findings and benefits to present to various stakeholders.
Provide support to the technical team to ensure daily operations in the department run smoothly
Qualifications/Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Data Sciences or Healthcare Informatics
Preference for Master’s Degree in Engineering, Healthcare Informatics
Healthcare and/or clinical imaging experience is an asset
Familiar with informatics applications including PACS and RIS
Experience working with data related to LHIN, MOHLTC, CCO, ATC
Experience with languages; Python, PHP, Java
Experience with relational databases SQL, MySQL, Postgres
Knowledge of statistical modeling tools (e.g., SAS, R), experience with BI tools
Proficient with HL7 data exchange
Experience using simulation software (Simio, SIMUL8 or equivalent)
Experience with MS Office (specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Strong project management, quality improvement and change management skills
Strong communication skills to deal effectively with stakeholders and the ability to work collaboratively in a team as well as independently

Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.
This position is with IQVIA’s Privacy Analytics team in the heart of downtown Ottawa, Canada.

Our Professional Services team is growing. We’re hiring Clinical Trials Data Anonymization Analysts to support an expanding line of business. In this role you’ll be end-to-end responsible for client anonymization projects. Using our tools you will analyze and mitigate the risk of re-identification for trial participants whose data appears in clinical trials documentation. As an ideal candidate you learn quickly and can produce extremely accurate, precise work within tight timelines. You’re familiar with medical or scientific language, and your excellent communication skills are complemented by strong technical acumen and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

Responsibilities:
Develop familiarity with our de-identification methodology.
Own assigned projects or project tasks and deliver such on time and with the required quality, providing timely and transparent status updates and managing client expectations.
Configure our in-house software tools, to process clients’ clinical trials documents and data.
Core responsibilities include: Pre-processing documents, analyzing lengthy, technical / medical documents (Clinical Study Reports) against established standards, including noting sections which may or may not be clearly identified, checking the quality of automated document processing steps and manually securing patient and commercial information where required
and / or:
Identify and classify direct and indirect identifiers, measure and mitigate re-identification risk, determine and apply required transformations.
Facilitate the creation of anonymization reports and other client deliverables.
Collaborate closely with other team members, ensuring that all work meets established quality standards and is completed on time. Participate in peer-reviews of work products.
Identify and communicate tool enhancements/refinements and relate defect documentation to developers and researchers.
Skill for pre-processing datasets (importing from client formats, converting data as required), analyzing complex and complicated statistical clinical trial data structures, transforming data using SAS scripts and SQL would be an asset but are not essential.
Qualifications:
Ability to understand policy documents and apply this understanding in a variety of contexts; an educational background in health sciences may be beneficial.
Ability to learn our methodology and develop a thorough understanding of how directly and indirectly identifying information contributes to the risk of re-identification. This is generally demonstrated through experience and comfort with scientific and quantitative disciplines for example, clinical research, STEM fields, etc.
Exceptional detail-orientation.
Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.
The drive to meet exacting deadlines and the flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality.
Medical writing and/or clinical trials experience is an asset.
Familiarity with ICH guidelines for clinical trial documents and EMA Policy 0070 are valuable assets.
Experience with Adobe PDF and MS Office products (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) required.
1-2 years working experience with SQL (MS SQL server), SAS, R, and statistical analysis of clinical or healthcare data would be a great asset, but are not a requirement for all positions.
Experience configuring and working with Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools would be a great asset, but are not a requirement for all positions.

job_title: Senior Portfolio Analyst - Toronto, ON 1832 Asset Management

job_description:
Toronto, ONClickInsight is seeking a Digital Analyst.

Interested in going beyond just “pulling metrics”? Do you enjoy solving puzzles? Are you always looking for opportunities to change things for the better and kick performance up to the next level? That’s what our Digital Analysts do for our clients.

ClickInsight is a leading specialist in digital analytics and online marketing optimization. We are a Google Marketing Platform Certified Company, with product certifications in Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Optimize, and Data Studio, headquartered in Toronto.

We help marketers and entrepreneurs innovatively grow their businesses through the smart use of data. To that end, we provide consulting, training, and auditing services to ensure web analytics data is correct and acquisitions campaigns are efficient and effective.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Reporting to the Managing Director, the Digital Analyst will support our efforts through the following actions:

Assess analytics implementation completeness and ensure alignment with client’s business goals and target future.
Identify gaps and recommend revisions to processes, analytics tool configuration and custom tagging solutions following internal standard processes and best practices.
Identify KPIs and define most appropriate tagging strategy.
Co-ordinate and assist with coding, testing, and debugging custom analytics tracking code and tagging implementations.
Prepare audit, insight delivery and training presentations.
Configure analytics tools and troubleshoot web analytics data problems.
Create technical and non-technical instructions for client internal technical staff.
Analyze and produce deliverables based web analytics and offline data.
Build and maintain select analytics reports and dashboards.
Support and deliver client training and assist with other related projects.
CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

Must have:

3+ years of relevant work experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, math, statistics, business, finance, economics, engineering, or other field that uses quantitative analysis skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Referenceable ability to gather business requirements, think critically, create best-fit solutions to meet clients’ needs and produce documentation, presentations and business cases for internal and client use.
Demonstrated ability to design and perform robust quality control tests and to prepare usable technical documentation.
Familiarity with different web development platforms and programming languages.
Web analytics knowledge, experience and regular usage with at least one web analytics tool for a minimum of two years.
Great communication and presentation skills.
The following technical skills are desirable:

Digital marketing knowledge and consulting experience.
Experience with multiple web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe/SiteCatalyst, Webtrends)
Knowledge of data extraction and visualization tools (such as Analytics Canvas, Next Analytics, Excel macros and pivot tables, Tableau, among others)
Good knowledge of statistics and modeling.
Familiarity with SQL and general database concepts.
Basic understanding of networking (TCP/IP, firewalls).
Good grasp of common web protocols (HTTP, FTP), CMS and web architecture.
Familiarity with mobile, desktop and web server operating systems.
Familiarity with JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Coding skills and web analytics knowledge are not mandatory but valuable. Training will be provided and continuous learning and development from both technical and personal growth perspectives are encouraged and supported.

PROFILE:

We are looking for a team player with:

Unmatched attention to detail, accuracy and precision.
Passion for continuous improvement.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities.
Innate curiosity and interest in continuous life-long learning.
Strong relationship-building skills.
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Unquestionable integrity.
Share knowledge to help others grow (clients, peers, community).
Position Reports To: Managing Director
Location: 3280 Bloor Street West (Connected to Islington & Bloor Subway)
Travel: Minimal – Occasional client meetings around the GTA or for training
Office Environment: Open concept, business casual, flexible hours, telecommuting possible

Job Type: Full-time staff position, 6 months probation period.

How to Apply:
Interested candidates should submit their cover letter and resume to:
Hiring Manager – Digital Analyst

Candidates who pass the first level interview process will be asked to complete a Kolbe A profile — please see www.Kolbe.com for more details. If you have already completed one, please submit it with your resume.

Who we are:

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

As a Replenishment Analyst you will work in partnership with the Category Management and Forecasting teams to introduce exciting new products while maintaining and developing our existing product assortments. At the intersection of Supply Chain and Merchandising, this role is a cross-functional opportunity that is integral to the organization due to the high level of accountability and the critical impact of outcomes to the bottom line.

All analysts hired into the program will participate in a comprehensive two-week education and training program to gain exposure to key components of Canadian Tire’s Supply Chain and Merchandising practices as well as the foundational tasks required to succeed in the role.

What you’ll do

Successful candidates will be responsible for managing the replenishment of specific product lines within the Canadian Tire assortment. Analysts will focus on managing and optimizing replenishment plans in support of regular, promotional and seasonal dealer ordering patterns, and will act as the single point of contact between Category Management teams and Supply Chain.

All analysts in the program manage relationships with suppliers from North America and offshore by planning demand cycles and smoothing channel operations to manage the flow of inventory. You will work closely with several cross-functional groups within Canadian Tire to ensure visibility to forecasted demand and timely flow of goods from suppliers, into our Distribution Centres, and out to our stores. Success will be measured by the ongoing improvement of key metrics in your line such as inventory management, receipt management, and service level to our stores. Other responsibilities may include:

Negotiation with suppliers for additional manufacturing capacity/inventory and shorter lead times

Supporting merchandising initiatives by ensuring that supply chain solutions are in place to effectively service our customers

Collaboration with key stakeholders such as Buying Teams, Suppliers, Marketing, Associate Stores and Distribution

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

University degree in Industrial Engineering, Math, Retail Management, Business or Commerce

3-5 years of experience in an analytical role

Proficiency in modeling processes to determine the financial implications of alternatives

Strong tactical negotiation and process management skills

Exceptional analytical/data mining skills

Solid communication skills and problem solving skills

Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage conflicting priorities

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

Toronto, ONPosition Overview:
Jack of all trades, and master of many? In this newly created role, you bring a wealth of technical and business acumen to the table. Your reporting, research and analytical skills are second to none. This role is split into two parts – reporting and research and analysis.

In the Reporting portion (primary focus), you will create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, Scorecards, SOX (Sarbanes Oxley Act) compliance dashboards and any other reporting required by the IT Group.

In the Research & Analysis portion (secondary focus), you will use your deep understanding of the IT realm to perform research and build business cases for Technology and Related projects.

And lastly, to keep the role dynamic, you will participate on special projects as required.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, SOX compliance reports, Scorecards and any other reporting required by the IT Group:
Gather required data from systems, vendors, and required sources in various formats (raw, formatted, etc.) in order to aggregate in a presentable manner
Setup a framework to allow for pulling and reporting data in the required cadence (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, etc.)
Setup process and policy to measure variances to agreed SLA’s, KPI’s
Adapt presentations based on audience level (e.g., board-level vs. department-level)
Revise/maintain SLA’s in partnership with the business
Other kinds of compliance reporting as required
Research and build Business Cases for Technology and related projects:
Research various solutions and create compelling business cases reviewing options in an unbiased manner
Create TCO and ROI models to support recommendations
Participate in evaluation of technology and value
Work independently, hands-on, and through others as needed
Work with various lines of business and stakeholders, ensuring all business requirements are captured
Stay abreast of new metrics for Governance (including SOX), KPI, SLA reporting for IT Organizations
Stay abreast of emerging technologies that would benefit the business
Assist in special projects, departmental invoicing, and perform other duties as required
Work with minimal supervision
In building business cases, you will gather requirements, create competitive analysis, solution comparison, RFPs, RFQs, and any other work required to complete the business case(s).
Education, Qualifications and Experience
A post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration and/or relevant experience
Gathering, analyzing, documenting and reporting data related to IT internal control processes over financial reporting
Coordinating efforts across multiple IT functions and departments to ensure SOX compliance requirements are met within required deadlines
Responsible for identifying internal control deficiencies and ensuring the timely implementation of corrective actions
Sarbanes Oxley Compliance testing on IT controls and documentation
Significant interaction with key business process managers and IT management
Interaction with IT third-party vendors managing and/or supporting the company’s internal controls
Completing GAP assessments on IT controlled environments involving SOX Controls
Reviewing external service providers through SSAE18/SOC reports and Complimentary End User Controls
Performing deficiency assessments of SOX IT controls and preparing reporting
Reviewing and documenting with management exceptions identified during walkthroughs or testing of controls
Maintaining an inventory of all SOX IT deficiencies
Working with process owners to develop management action plans for SOX IT deficiencies, monitoring the status, and testing for completion by the due date
Supporting business partners with remediation activities of SOX deficiencies
Supporting Internal and External Audit testing of SOX IT controls
5+ years working in an IT Analyst role performing similar Responsibilities (preference given to candidates that are strong in the Reporting portion)
5+ years experience with creating executive-level presentations, dashboards, scorecards, and reports to various levels of an organization focused on IT
5+ years experience with enterprise reporting platforms (SSRS, Tableau, etc.)
5+ years hands-on experience with various application and technology stacks
Possess high organizational and planning skills
Works effectively and independently in a dynamic environment
Responsible, takes ownership of work, and follows through to completion
Possess a high attention to detail and highly analytical
Able to learn new technologies quickly with minimal supervision, self-starter
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate and document business requirements, designs, installation plans, etc.
Ability to maintain productive business relationships
Personable; Tactful; Collaborative
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes
Working knowledge on SOX Compliance and COSO (or similar) internal controls framework
Strong working knowledge of business processes and controls, including IT Change Management, User Access Management, End User Computing and Entity Level Controls
Experience in auditing/reviewing the work of external service providers including working knowledge of SSAE18/SOC reports and Complimentary End User Controls
Adapting to Change: Have the ability to anticipate change, is open to new ideas, processes, product lines, and technologies. Treat these changes as opportunities for learning. Is able to view potential changes from a bigger picture and different angles to gain a more complete understanding of its possible impacts.

Regularly seeks and applies feedback as part of personal and professional growth. Encourages others to learn and continually looks for ways to improve the business.

Montréal, QCAbout Hopper

At Hopper, we're on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world's fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world's most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 35 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple's App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!

The Role

A stellar opportunity to have massive impact: join the rapidly growing company continually redefining how people travel. As a Fraud Analyst, you will be helping fight against fraudsters from all over the world. In order to fight the good fight, you'll be using a variety of fraud-prevention and air-travel related systems, such as GDSs and payment processing gateways. You'll be working closely with our Traveler Experience team as a resource for fraud-related customer interactions, potentially taking over interactions by email, chat, or phone. You are quick-thinking, analytical, creative, and very fond of efficient research. You are constantly on the lookout for suspicious behaviour, but are able to behave diplomatically when interacting with suspected fraudsters.

In this role you will:

Minimize losses resulting from fraudulent transactions by analyzing potentially-fraudulent Air and Hotel bookings and deciding the fraud risk associated with bookings
Analyze chargeback data and user activity to assess risk level and provide recommendations to improve fraud detection and prevention
Take over fraud-related Traveler Experience interactions and resolve them efficiently and diplomatically
Independently resolve problems that require in-depth investigation

A perfect candidate has:

The ability to be friendly and courteous to users while being on the lookout for suspicious behaviour
An extremely keen eye and remarkable attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills as well as the ability to be a team player
A Self-starter attitude: energetic with a strong sense of initiative and creativity
A willingness to work a flexible and demanding schedule. We are currently looking for analysts to work our evening shift, 2:30pm - 10:30pm EST and applicants must be available to work both weekdays and weekends.

Benefits


Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options.
Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business.
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans.
Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal).
Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass.
IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry.
Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy).
Team lunches, off-site activities and much more!
In Cambridge, work in a historic factory building near Kendall Square; in Montreal, work in an artist's loft in the Mile End.

Inter Pipeline is a major petroleum transportation, storage and natural gas liquids processing business that ranks among the largest energy infrastructure companies in Canada. We are proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top 70 Employers, which recognizes Alberta businesses that lead their industries by being exceptional places to work.
Located out of our Calgary office, the Oil Movements Analyst role reports to the Supervisor of Volumetric Accounting and is a key member of Inter Pipeline’s Oil Movements department.
The Oil Movements Analyst is responsible for the volumetric accounting, analysis and reporting requirements for Inter Pipeline’s conventional and oil sands pipeline systems. In addition, this position provides ongoing management of Shipper Balances, producer statements and equalization statements.
Key Activities and Responsibilities:
Validate data to ensure accuracy and completeness of crude oil account information, while interacting frequently with pipeline schedulers
Calculate volumetric information from gauge reports, truck tickets, pipeline tickets, and other measurement reports that are gathered from the operators, business units and delivery systems
Enter ticket information for the Oil Sands pipelines, ensuring accuracy and completeness for month end reporting
Enter production splits, prepare equalization statements for customers on a monthly basis
Collaborate with administrators in field offices to ensure tickets, volume adjustments and other deadlines are completed
Compile and send Production Activity Reports, along with Petrinex reporting on a monthly basis
Monitor pipeline quality information as it comes in to ensure it meets the pipeline specifications and ensure testing methods meet the industry standards
Liaise with the Measurement department to ensure the accuracy of quality information used for Equalization
Liaise with the accounting department to ensure automatic, manual and miscellaneous invoicing is accurate
Liaise with the Business Development department ensuring required tariff changes and new implementations are completed accurately
Liaise with the Midstream Marketing department to ensure all reporting requirements are accurate on a monthly basis
Ensure customer queries are handled professionally and timely
Education, Skills and Experience:
Two to four years of related industry experience with University degree or diploma, Business-related preferred
Attention to detail is critical; demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Advanced level for MS Office; strong excel skills will be an asset
Demonstrates ability to interpret and communicate business analytics
Proven experience working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Well-developed interpersonal, team, customer service and communication skills, both written and verbal
Have an understanding of the Industry practices such as COLC Calendar and the Equalization Procedure Guidelines
Experience working with Petrinex for government reporting

About the Role


The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst supports the development, analysis, implementation, and security of the L3 ISR Segment business intelligence and analytical solutions. The individual will support the business by performing ad hoc data discovery, analysis, and reporting as required.


About L3 ISR Segment

L3’s ISR Systems segment provides a broad range of multi-domain intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance mission solutions, including space avionics and payloads, soldier systems, airborne sensors and aircraft, mission command & control, intelligence solutions, modeling & simulation and life-cycle support.
L3’s ISR Systems Segment is an amalgamation of eight complimentary business sectors that support the development of fully integrated solutions that intersect our 5 primary domains. These Sectors include Surveillance and Strike Systems, Advanced C2ISR Systems, Integrated Land Systems, Space and Sensors, Special Programs, Reconnaissance Mission Systems, Intelligence & Mission Systems and Tactical Mission Systems.

L3 Technologies is a prime contractor in Command, Control, Communications, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C3ISR) systems market and a leading provider of a broad range of electronic systems used on both military and commercial platforms.
