Waterloo, ONJob Description

The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment is currently recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Research & Insights. The Research & Analytics team is a highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! We are seeking a talented, enthusiastic and client-focused Senior Data Analyst to join our team.
The Senior Data Analyst oversees and conducts the conversion of data into insights that will lead to informed business decisions. As the Analytics team is small but efficient, he/she will work autonomously with Cineplex Digital Media’s top management and executives to present strategic insights that build a stronger company. The Senior Data Analyst will handle multiple simultaneous tasks and will be expected to remain effective and functional under pressure and aggressive timelines.
In this role you will apply your analytical talent to our rich data environment in order to build intuitive dashboards and insightful business reports. You’ll be an expert problem-solver, delivering insights about the business to a variety of audiences and answering tough questions in an intuitive and understandable way.

Qualifications

Education and technical skills:
Master’s degree in a technical discipline, such as Mathematics/Analytics
Relevant discipline in an undergraduate degree
Experience:
Technical fluency with SQL is mandatory, intermediate Python/R for data modelling is required
2+ years of B2C analytics and business intelligence experience
Superior quantitative analysis ability and experience including campaign design, measurement, data mining and predictive analytics
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and/or Tableau
Strengths:
Must be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player who can influence across and up without reporting line authority.
Intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining it for insights
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage own workload while multi-tasking in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to create and deliver impactful presentations for different levels of audience across the organization
Key Responsibilities:
Be the Subject Matter Expert on all things analytics for CDM, own and be knowledgeable on CDM’s and Cineplex corporate’s database schemas and ways to manipulate this data to benefit our clients
Work alongside the technical support and operations team to drive operational efficiency and improve data quality
Design dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights
Work with internal resources or vendors to conduct market research to augment insights drawn from the customer database.
Work on ad-hoc projects as specified by the Analytics team’s road map and its application to the Product team
Additional Information

Interested applicants please apply today.
While we appreciate all interest, only those candidate selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.
No Agency Calls Please

L3 WESCAM Service Operations team is looking for a new member to drive the development and delivery of process and technical solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the leadership of projects to develop and/or implement new tools and processes to improve the management of customer repairs and material forecasting. About L3 WESCAM
At L3 WESCAM, we develop the most advanced and complex optical and sensor systems for global defense and military sectors, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement. From long-range covert surveillance missions to search and rescue operations, our MX-series systems, and the mission systems solutions they are a part of, produce stabilized high-magnification electro-optical and infrared images from airborne, marine and ground based platforms, enabling our customers to see farther and react quicker.

L3 WESCAM offers a culture of true innovation and collaboration, and above all - work that you can be proud to be a part of. What we do protects and saves lives around the world. To experience more, go to http://www.WESCAM.com

Position:

Supervisor, Data Governance


Reports To:

Sr. Manager – Data Governance & Analysis


Tier:

Supervisor/Team Lead


Department:

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Permanent, Full Time


Job Number:

1434



Keys To The Role

Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Governance & Analysis, the Team Lead, Data Governance will spearhead a team of Analysts to manage organization-wide data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and maintaining the integrity of subscriber data and information assets. In addition, they will assist in defining indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements that aid in increasing cost recovery.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will manage day-to-day activities and workflows by monitoring timelines, allocating resources and ensuring all deliverables are met. This may involve addressing escalations and negotiating deadlines. Data is our asset and thus ensuring Analysts are conducting thorough review of policies and procedures is critical for this role. While being adaptable and responsive to changing priorities, the Lead will also contribute operationally where and when required.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will possess solid understanding of GS1 Canada’s data content across various platforms and will develop and maintain strong relationships with SMEs across the organization to develop this knowledge. The incumbent will be a champion in establishing best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the team can emulate, and the business can rely on. They will work closely with the Team Lead, Data Analysis to ensure standard operating procedures are clearly documented and reviewed regularly, processes are mapped, and protocols are followed.


Core Responsibilities
Lead day-to-day data governance operations of 2 or more analysts within the GS1 Data Governance & Service Optimization umbrella
Analyze and oversee strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies and complications
Propose and/or establish the policies, standards, rules, processes and technologies to effectively manage GS1 Canada’s data assets.
Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization
Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical data assets.
Have a key role in guiding and influencing various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the enterprise data governance and enterprise data management strategies.
Coach Analysts in validating and modeling data with the purpose of defining clear governance protocols.
Triages requests from the business using workflow management tools, prioritize and delegate tasks. Follow-up daily/weekly on request status and ensuring progress is being made and deadlines are met.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Analysts to prioritize development efforts.
Create process maps which succinctly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps.
Closely monitor project resources, tasks, risks and milestones. Bring forward blockers and make recommendations on course corrections when necessary. Act as a point of contact to resolve policy, procedure, or technical issues within the scope of Data Governance Team’s responsibilities and ensuring prompt escalation to Sr. Manager or Sr. Director for critical or time sensitive issues.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Develop data remediation plans: Monitor and track quality issues, identify gaps, and build action plans to remediate gaps
Lead and develop team members in technical proficiencies required for them to succeed in their roles
Assist with screening, interviewing new staff and conducting onboarding/training as required
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business, science, mathematics or a related area of study; or combination of skills and experience in working in high performing teams
A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience, preferably in data management, governance, reporting and/or analysis
Preferred minimum of 1-year team management experience in supervisory or team lead capacity, or senior analyst with proven ability to lead.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired
Demonstrated ability to coach and guide others through both technical and situational problem solving
Works with passion and promotes optimism; fosters respect and builds trust; exhibits confidence in self and develops in others
Takes pride in the team’s work and celebrates their success
Validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness; follows-up promptly
Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and courteous manner
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively influence others; communicate with a negotiating standard
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset

Business Process Analyst

Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology(VPIT), the Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying and improving the outcomes of operational processes to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction as well as reducing cost. The candidate will also be responsible for leading continuous improvement initiatives for all departments in the organization, as well as evaluating, planning and implementing the improvements in the business processes and practices. Other aspects of the job include group facilitation, compiling and tracking data,preparing training materials and documenting processes.

The Business Process Analyst must be prepared to explain and defend any proposed changes to the current system.

Responsibilities
Identify, plan and implement key projects to improve quality, reduce cost, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, scrap, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.
Identify and facilitate process improvement projects, training/workshops to drive cultural change
Drive value stream mapping to define “As-Is Analysis” and the transition to Future State
Develop and conduct compliance audits, program evaluations and reviews to drive results with the fortitude to ensure change is permanent
Provide executive management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
Receives input and coordination of information from various parties, and prepares and presents such information for management review.
Strong understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, principles and practices.
Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Support/change management plans and training plans to ensure new processes are implemented in an optimal fashion, supporting the organization through the various stages of change.
Work with the training department to develop training programs for the broader team related to the tools and solutions created.
Participate in training facilitation of key process enhancements where applicable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering from an accredited University
3+ years’ experience in process improvements, cross-functional collaboration and workflow generation
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong leadership skills, ability to learn and apply new concepts and overcome obstacles with change
Strong work ethic that is able to work independently but also works well in team environment
Results driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience in Six Sigma, Reengineering or other Continuous improvement methodologies would be an asset
Technical Competencies
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft word, excel ,Visio and ERP applications
Lean Six Sigma Organizational training and certification would be an asset.

What can you expect at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group :

Competitive Salary, full benefit plan, RRSP, reduced gym membership, free parking,
and a great dynamic team!

Saint John, NBJob Description

To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for Business Analysts for upcoming full-time and contract opportunities for our clients in New Brunswick. The Senior Business Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
Major Responsibilities:
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements
Documentation of current and future state process mapping
Prepare Business Requirements Documents, including functional/non-functional requirements
Collaborate in the development of test plans and test cases
define reporting and alerting requirements
Prepare integration plans for deployment of system changes into existing environments
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Change and support process management for new technology delivery
Facilitate stakeholder sessions, interviews, and analysis to identify areas for process and systems improvement
Communicate key insights and findings to client team

Qualifications

University degree or a combination of Community College and experience is required
8+ years of progressive corporate experience functioning as an IT Business Analyst/Functional Analyst
CBAP certification or willing to obtain
Demonstrated success with business requirements analysis, group facilitation, gap analysis and process mapping and design as part of a business transformation
Experience in working in a formal systems development lifecycle methodology environment involving such artifacts as functional and detail design documents, business use cases, and requirements traceability
Demonstrated skill in building consensus among process stakeholders
Exceptional communication skills and experience in working with business experts at all levels and technical subject matter experts

Specific reference-able project experience in one or more of the following areas highly desirable: data management, analytics, asset management, GIS, data center, AMI, ERP, CRM
Experience in Public sector/Government is an asset
Additional Information

Why Mariner Partners?
We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work – our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development.
We are proud to have been recognized by Progress magazine as one of Atlantic Canada’s TOP 101 companies, ranking #46 on 2015’s list, up from #62 in 2014.
We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the world’s largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations.
We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers.
Join our growing team!

job_title: Operational Business Systems Analyst - 9 month Contract
job_description:
TemporaryAbout the role:
In this 9 month Contract role, you will work independently on various projects and operational initiatives in support of Investment Management business. You will work closely with the business and Investment Operations team to deliver solutions involving various Investment Management systems, including Eagle Investment systems, Trade Order Management, Analytics and Fund/Investment Accounting systems, and any other interfacing systems.
Your Responsibilities
Facilitate with the elicitation, planning and documentation of (but not limited to) the following deliverables:
Current state analysis including full documentation of the current application state and operational workflow, file transfer processes and interfaces to third parties.
Recommendations on future state.
Detailed business and reporting requirements.
Functional specifications as a hand-off for development, including data mapping and interface requirements
Test strategy, test plan and test cases.
Scope documents and project objectives: based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems, technology, and industry requirements.
Major features of the business systems from the perspective of the business owners and sponsors and in terms that are meaningful to business people.
Risk and risk mitigation plans.
Deployment to production plans, including change management procedures, SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and support documentation.
Facilitate the following activities:
Liaising and co-ordinating activities between the business areas, Investment Operations and external vendors to help translate requirements into specifications.
Translate specifications to define test plans and test scripts.
Execute testing across several environments, and work with users and development teams on issue identification and resolution.
Co-ordinate assigned project activities, provide accurate estimates in order to consistently meet the project deadlines with the expected quality.
Facilitate and lead sessions to gather and document functional and non-functional requirements
Analyzing and mapping of existing processes to future "to-be" processes
Working with vendors to provide appropriate requirements, use cases and specifications
Identifying areas of opportunity that distinguish this business and represent its core competencies. Some of these processes may represent opportunities for competitive advantage
Your Qualifications
Must have undergraduate degree
Preferable to have post graduate training in financial markets or investments, Canadian Securities Course, CFA, etc.
Must have a minimum of 7 years working as a Business Analyst
Must have Investment Management business knowledge
Working knowledge of General Accounting practices in particular Fund Accounting processes and methodology
Experience with Eagle Investment systems (Eagle PACE, Eagle Star and Eagle Datamart).
Must have experience with various systems supporting the Investment Management business, such as Bloomberg AIM, Market Data and Fund/Investment Accounting systems
Experience in writing SQL queries (selects, joins, groupings etc.).
Strong data knowledge, specifically in Financial Industry Security Master Data / Analytics Data.
Thorough understanding of security types, including derivatives, and associated data.
Able to work effectively with minimal supervision & adapt quickly to changing requirements.
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven documentation skills.

Heart and Stroke is a special type of organization. We’re a foundation, a place that values championing health and has a bias for action as we tackle heart disease and stroke. Our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We do so by raising funds to support critical research, and by helping people reduce their risk of heart disease, stroke, and vascular cognitive impairment through risk factor awareness, promoting healthy lifestyles and advocating for healthy public policy. Six core values unite us: Champion Health, Practice Humility, Embrace Change, Drive Impact, Learn & Grow and Be Heartfelt.

Who we need
Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Reporting Developer to join our Information Management team. This is a chance to improve fundraising strategies, plan for future campaigns and forecast trends that will positively impact the lives of Canadians living with heart and brain disease. We need someone who is excited to develop a range of visual and text data outputs from ad-hoc queries and data exports as well as building standard reports which provide flexible program reporting, and campaign analysis to guide insights and decision making.

What’s in it for you?
National impact. This is a chance to capitalize on over one million data points generated by our newly implemented CRM system that encompasses constituent and marketing campaign data from coast-to-coast.

Career development. This is an opportunity to build out your role and introduce processes and best practices for leveraging Business Intelligence tools and the data warehouse solution across a variety of Heart and Stroke data solutions. You will grow your collaborative skills working with portfolio managers to understand business requirements and how to best provide data reports that fulfill those needs.

Who you are
You want to bring your expertise in Business Intelligence to the nonprofit sector where you can make a tangible difference to the organization’s success. You believe creating good management reports is exciting and you want a chance to leverage a vast amount of national data to answer the questions of a foundation. You want to be part of a team interacting with partners throughout the whole organization, bridging business and technology knowledge. You want an opportunity to help shape what business intelligence can offer to improve how the organization makes internal and external decisions.

How you will make an impact every day. You will focus on:
A Business Intelligence strategy and roadmap. You will:
Define and implement a plan based on intensive discussions with internal business groups; a deep understanding of data warehouse needs; the limits and strengths of the system; the vision and strategy of the foundation.
Work cross-functionally to establish priorities amongst multiple business partners and commitments.
Subject Matter Expertise. You will:
Develop close relationships across the foundation and position yourself as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert in the areas of business intelligence and data warehousing.
Work closely with Business Managers, Senior Business Analyst, Business Sponsors, IT/Apps Services and External Vendors to ensure accuracy and effectiveness of report delivery.
Translation and Integration. You will:
Translate high-level data requirements into solution architecture.
Produce technical and functional documentation.
Identify and analyze data sources and prospective data points for solution delivery.
Develop data services and frameworks to extract, load and transfer data into applications.
Automate procedures to streamline data integrations across the organization.
Report Development and Management. You will:
Design, develop and deploy new custom reports using MS Reporting Services or BI tools.
Evaluate current reports, modify and consolidate where appropriate.
Develop suitable outputs and formats such as extractions, reports, graphical, and pivots.
Perform quality control from unit testing, to end to end and user acceptance.
Develop Reports Catalogue from the end user perspective.
Data Warehouse Modifications and Maintenance. You will:
Support performance optimization and modification (cubes, dimensions, query objects) of BI data warehouse with the external provider.
Troubleshoot and support BI data warehouse environment with refresh procedures.
Assess and propose solutions to enhance the architecture of the selected BI solution.
What you bring:
The education. You have a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
The experience. You have 3-5 years of information management experience supporting large database environments encompassing data analytics, reporting, and metrics. You have:
Strong analytical skills and ability to review and synthesize information.
Expertise in producing analytical reports, data visualizations, summaries, and recommendations.
The communication skills. You can seek out, build and nurture internal and external relationships. You can:
Translate complex business intelligence and data warehouse concepts for a non-technical audience.
Disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Present your findings and recommendations to audiences at any level.
The technical skills. You have expertise with:
MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
SQL Server query development and stored procedures.
Data warehousing and OLAP reporting.
Apply now
If you want to join the fight against heart disease and stroke while building an engaged and giving community, apply here.

To learn more about our mission, our values and the difference our foundation makes in the lives of Canadians at every age, visit our website or check out our latest posts on Twitter.

Calgary, ABABOUT TRIOVEST
Triovest is an entrepreneurial leader in institutional real estate creating sustainable places that enhance communities and enrich relationships. We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Our platform offers advisory and investment management services with over $10 billion in assets under management and $2 billion in development. From offices in each major market across Canada, Triovest combines local intelligence with deep expertise to drive superior returns.

The successful candidate will be expected to consistently conduct themselves in alignment with Triovest Core Values of:

Teamwork
We communicate and work together to offer excellent service to our investors, clients, tenants, colleagues and shareholders to achieve our goals. We do not let individual roles and responsibilities get in the way of team spirit and collaboration.

Results
We get the job done efficiently and take pride in the quality of the work we produce. We embrace service excellence, agility and innovation to deliver results and create value for our investors, clients, tenants, colleagues and shareholders. We respond to change in a positive way.

Integrity
We always do the right thing. We are impeccable with our word and communicate with honesty, respect and courtesy. We operate in an environment of transparency and professionalism.

Own It
We take responsibility for our actions and are willing to be held accountable. We will apply discipline and reason to every decision. We provide those around us with clear and constructive feedback. We learn from our experiences and search for continuous improvement.


Our Vision
Triovest will be recognized as the entrepreneurial leader in institutional real estate driving superior returns by combining local intelligence with deep expertise.

Our Mission
We create sustainable places that enhance communities and enrich relationships.


POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Information Technology, the successful candidate will fill the full-time position of Business Systems Analyst in our Toronto or Calgary office. Working in a team environment, the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) works closely with the business to understand their needs, opportunities and issues related to information technology, and delivers appropriate business solutions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Ensuring processes and controls are in place for data management and maintenance.
Liaise with end users on business application support requests and enhancements.
Coordinate with third-party vendors to address system issues and implement fixes or enhancements.
Work with a collaborative team to identify solutions and best practices for continuous improvement, automation, and efficiencies.
Lead and facilitate business and system requirements sessions for company projects.
Contribute to project success by identifying and resolving issues, mitigating risks, developing change management approaches, and ensuring a successful adoption of new business applications.
Plan and support training activities for business applications and processes.
QUALIFICATIONS/ATTRIBUTES

Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance, Management Information Systems or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Experience in the commercial real estate industry is considered an asset.
Experience with providing support to users and implementing systems conversions or upgrades as they occur (e.g. Yardi Voyager, JD Edwards, SAP, etc.).
Demonstrated abilities in Microsoft applications and Visio for purposes of documentation, process mapping, and project management.
Excellence in the following competencies: information seeking, listening, understanding and responding, analytical thinking, organizational skills, relationship management and time management.
Driven, resourceful and adaptable with an ability to build strong internal client relationships.
A dedication to providing exceptional service, every day.
The ability to adapt to change in a positive way and deliver successful results within a given time frame.
A team-oriented approach to meeting goals and objectives.
A willingness to admit mistakes and easily digest constructive feedback, using it as a learning opportunity.
The ability to perform with exceptional integrity, always striving to do the right thing and help to create an environment built on trust, honesty and respect.
Accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process is available.

Triovest is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment, where everyone feels valued and respected.

Education
Preferred

LG Electronics Inc. is looking for a candidate to fill a position in our Business Intelligence and Operations Division. As a successful candidate, you will be responsible for preparing historic sales reports, maintaining pricing system, tracking market behavior and compiling reports on market environment. Leading interactions and communications with Regional Sales Managers in terms of forecasting, planning and promotional activity.

Assist in preparation and execution of new product launch processes

Track competitor’s behavior and identify trends and opportunities.
Analyze industry trends and identify areas of opportunity.
Analyze and track retailer behavior and compliance on print and web advertising.

Run model to model comparisons between LG models and competitors and present findings.

Maintain tools that will enable the sales team forecast and track promotional activity.
Manage communication of promotional pricing activity to the different stake holders / channels,

Collaborate with other areas to develop improve and operate tools to enhance our sales capabilities

Business or Engineering bachelor’s degree
1-2 yr. experience in sales administration / customer service / logistics / sales account management / demand planner.
Sales Analytical experience is a plus.

Knowledge and skills (general and technical)
Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Power Point and especially Excel).
Excellent multitasking and communication skills
Apt to work under time pressure
Superior customer service orientation
Acute sense of urgency and personal responsibility
Ability to establish and foster relationships with customers
Korean language would be a plus

job_title: Pension Specialist, Member Services and Pension Analyst, Data and Employer Services
job_description:
The Alberta Teachers' Retirement Fund Board (ATRF) is an organization that takes pride in our outstanding investment management and exceptional plan member services, resulting in more than $16 billion of assets under management on behalf of more than 80,000 plan members.
As a growing and diverse organization, we're building for the future and require the skills and talents of people like you. Join our team in Edmonton, Alberta and be part of a high-performing, collaborative group that shares a purpose and a commitment to excellence.
Opportunity
In 2018, ATRF has embarked into a multi-year initiative called Project Lantern to ensure we continuously meet our evolving clients' expectations. Project Lantern is about assessing and modernizing how we deliver services to our members and employers for years to come. It is about understanding how our clients want to consume services, interact and transact with us in the future, while building on our existing solid foundation and service attributes that our clients appreciate. Enhanced experience for members, employers and ATRF staff is at the heart of this project.
We are seeking enthusiastic Pension Specialists in Member Services and Pension Analysts in Data and Employer Services to continue delivering exceptional Pension Services operations and allow resources to be allocated to Project Lantern. These permanent positions are members of the Pension Services team which has a broad responsibility in all aspects of the delivery of high quality pension services at ATRF.
Stakeholders
The Pension Specialists and Pension Analysts will partner with key individuals in various departments across the organization and will interact on a day-to-day basis with plan members, beneficiaries, other representatives and employers.
Responsibilities
As a Pension Specialist, Member Services you would be responsible for:
Ensuring accurate and timely processing of all member transactions including retirement, termination, death, reciprocal transfers and service purchases.
Processing and peer reviewing benefit payments and other transactions.
Providing excellent customer service by communicating with plan members and beneficiaries about their pension entitlements and responding to their questions and requests verbally and in writing.
As a Pension Analyst in Data and Employer Services, you would be responsible for:
Ensuring timely and complete reporting of employer data by fostering relationships, including providing training to employers on the reporting software and reporting processes.
Conducting reconciliations of the employer data and ensuring all required data for the administration of the plan are accurately reported and available for the benefit transactions.
Data management, analytics and reporting.
Qualifications and Experience
A post-graduate diploma in business or other relevant field, plus at least two years of experience in pension administration or related experience.
A Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) or Pension Plan Administration Certificate (PPAC) designation or equivalent would be an asset.
Exceptional customer service. Have an interest in working directly with plan members and employers in a professional and highly regulated industry.
Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Being fluent in both French and English would be an asset.
Self-motivated with strong organizational and time management skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask and prioritize.
The ability to work efficiently and effectively in a team environment with minimal supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a strong aptitude for math.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office as well as the adaptability to learn in-house systems.
The ability to identify inefficiencies with processes and recommend improvements.
As one of Alberta's Top Employers for the last three consecutive years we offer a competitive compensation package which includes:
100% employer paid benefits, defined benefit pension plan, health & wellness spending accounts, paid volunteer time and much more.
Excellent opportunities for professional growth and career development.
Learning and development supported through ATRF's education reimbursement program.
An engaging, inclusive culture where you can be you!
At ATRF, diversity is one of our core strengths. We are an organization that takes pride in ensuring the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background, and experience.
For a detailed job profile for the Pension Specialist position, click here. For a detailed job profile for the Pension Analyst position, click here.
To apply, submit resume and cover letter to resumes@atrf.com. Attention: Carrine Willocks, Recruitment Specialist.

Toronto, ONWho We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment

What This Position Is All About:
As a QA Analyst, you will be responsible for the verification and validation of new features, functionalities, and enhancements, POS, back-end and internal applications. You will create test scenarios, develop and execute test cases, analyze test results, detect and document defects, and validate bug fixes. You will apply techniques and creativity in solving moderate to complex problems.

Who You Are:
You possess Business acumen and analyze business requirements, create and execute test cases/scripts
You effectively communicate issues to proper team members and track to resolution Strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
You collaborate with cross-functional teams and contribute to process improvement
Possess confidence in making judgment calls in resolving problems
You are customer focused and results driven
You Also Have:
At least 4 years of cumulative manual and/or automation testing and analyzing business requirements and use cases experience
Minimum 4 year experience with integration testing (batch, real time, ETL, message queues)
Experience in HR QA is preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or any related field of study
Software testing certifications and QA/testing tool training preferred
Ability to estimate test effort and identify and track defects
Ability to monitor/measure testing progress
Proficient in software testing methodologies and software development life cycle process
Good understanding of the various testing techniques and ability to document well
Familiarity with Windows devices
Working knowledge of one or more programming or scripting languages, Unix preferred
Experience with relational and document-oriented databases
Experience with testing business enterprise applications
Experience with testing Financial, HR or Sales Audit applications will be an asset
Understanding of cloud application architecture and concepts
Experience with test automation using Selenium and/or related automation framework, preferred
As The QA Analyst, You Will:
Perform functional testing at various levels (component, system, system integration, E2E, user acceptance) utilizing techniques such as exploratory, black box, white box, browser compatibility, parallel testing
Perform regression testing
Develop and document test cases based on business requirements, functional and technical requirements, user stories and business use cases
Identify test approach for business, functional and technical requirements
Participate in developing test strategy and use test management applications/tools
Troubleshoot and triage issues, make judgment calls in solving problems
Identify, prioritize, document and track defects and Provide defects reports, test status updates and QA signoffs
Work with database queries, parse data, read log files
Collaborate with cross functional teams
Provide QA support for scheduled deployments/releases
Your Life and Career at HBC:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount

SUMMARY/SCOPE:
The HRIS Analyst is responsible for all HR information systems, content management systems and electronic data management initiatives, including the planning and directing continual improvements of the HRIS to support organizational, operational and HR objectives.
The incumbent is responsible for resolving user and vendor issues, developing and maintaining user training, ensuring consistent methodology is employed for data transfers and creation, and auditing of system configuration and data. This position will also support the configuration and implementation of systems, modules, data feeds, and on-going technology enhancements. They are responsible for the accuracy of the data housed in the system and ensure access to reporting and analysis of the HR data. They coach and develop the HRIS team to ensure a high quality of experience for end users of the system.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Operates as a subject matter expert in HRIS/Payroll system functionality and the business practices and procedures that drive system configuration and processes
Maintains knowledge of system settings and their impact to all users of the system and identifies inter-dependencies with other tasks / applications
Delivers stable day-to-day operations with a high level of customer satisfaction
Provides assistance to users experiencing technical issues or needing additional guidance and responds to all system inquiries.
Develops and provides training to all administrative and employee users on existing and new systems/ modules/ functionality
Implements all HRIS/Payroll system notifications, reminders, workflows, configuration updates, custom xml forms, etc.
Prioritizes issues and works to resolve them via system updates, training, process adjustments, etc., based on an understanding of the business needs
Works directly with vendor partners to implement enhancements, troubleshoot errors, identify areas of improvement, increase functionality, etc.
Assists in the evaluation of new functionality and participates in the implementation of additional systems/modules
Documents all processes, workflows, and related system activities. Publishes documentation on Share Point site.
Performs other duties as required
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
A minimum of 2 years of HRIS experience is required
A Bachelors degree or equivalent experience is required
Coding experience is strongly preferred
Reporting experience is essential; crystal reporting is preferred
Experience with an implementation of an HRIS is preferred
Candidate should be able to train cross functionally stakeholders in the various divisions
Ability to prioritize, handle multiple priorities and maintain the highest level of confidentiality
Strong time management and communication skills coupled with the ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously
Must be able to work cross-functionally with the various divisions
Must be detail-oriented & able to work independently as well as within a team
Strong Administrative is essential
Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
APPLY NOWInterested candidates should send their resume with a cover letter to Nadine Kruse, nkruse@airbossofamerica.com

Who We AreThe Canadian Research Knowledge Network (CRKN) is a partnership of Canadian universities dedicated to expanding digital content for the academic research and teaching enterprise in Canada. Through the coordinated leadership of librarians, researchers, administrators and other stakeholders in the research community, CRKN undertakes large-scale content acquisition and licensing initiatives in order to build knowledge infrastructure and research and teaching capacity in Canada’s universities. On April 1st, 2018 CRKN merged with Canadiana.org which has allowed our teams to cohesively pursue a united and coordinated strategy to leverage Canadian heritage and scholarly content. As a merged organization, CRKN will continue its core licensing activities for scholarly journal content, while expanding support for the digitization, access and preservation of Canadian heritage content through the services of Canadiana.The RoleThe Metadata Analyst serves as a subject matter expert for CRKN’s metadata needs. Through engagement with the galleries, libraries, archives and museums (GLAM) community, the Metadata Analyst ensures a high quality of metadata for the Canadiana collections and coordinates metadata enhancement projects. With the goal of enhancing discoverability of the Canadiana collections, the Metadata Analyst works with the CRKN digitization, platform, and communications team to update metadata standards and implement evolving best practices and standards. Through active involvement in national and international communities of practice, the Metadata Analyst ensures that CRKN participates in the ongoing development of metadata standards and practices.Reporting to the Manager, Member and Metadata Services, the Metadata Analyst identifies current and future functional metadata requirements; selects and adopts appropriate technical standards and practices; and in close coordination with the platform team develops mappings, crosswalks, scripts and other tools to validate, normalize, convert and migrate metadata into required formats.Duties and Responsibilities1. Research and planning (45%)Maintain in-depth knowledge of evolving metadata standards and practices in the GLAM and other relevant communities and identify their relevance to CRKN and its activitiesEvaluate CRKN’s metadata standards and practices to ensure they remain consistent with evolving community standards and practices and take advantage of emerging technologiesMonitor and participate in the development of emerging linked open data (LOD) standards and practices and develop LOD strategies and capabilities for the organizationDevelop and maintain metadata profiles, templates, guides, and best practices documentation, and train and support staff in their adoption and application2. Partnership building and collaboration (35%)Engage in national and international collaborative initiatives to ensure that CRKN is involved in the development of national metadata strategies and policies, and ensure that CRKN comes to be recognized as a centre of excellence in this areaIdentify and develop partnerships with institutions, organizations, researchers and other parties for the creation, linking and enrichment of metadataIn close collaboration with the Director, Marketing and Stakeholder Engagement, and in partnership with other national organizations who work with Indigenous people, develop metadata standards that reflect Indigenous cultural understandings3. Development (15%)Analyze business requirements for creating, capturing, transforming and normalizing metadata for the Canadiana collections and third-party clients and determine technical solutionsDevelop mappings and crosswalks to convert and migrate between different standards and formatsProvide subject expert guidance to the platform team and assist in the development of scripts, tools and workflows for parsing, extending, normalizing and transforming metadata records, and other related operations4. Other (5%)Provide governance and administrative support as needed, particularly in preparation of committee documentation.In a small team environment each individual is expected to work towards overall CRKN goals and at times a team effort is required that may involve taking on tasks outside the normal or expected scope of their role. Other duties may be assigned as required.QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have a master’s degree in information science, library and information studies or archival studies, and at least five years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. The ideal candidate will be eligible for Reliability Status from PWGSC. Other relevant and desirable education, skills and experience include:Knowledge of open source frameworks, standards, models and applications for digital preservationTechnical knowledge of metadata standards used in the GLAM (galleries, libraries, archives museums) sectorKnowledge of digital preservation standards and practices within libraries and archivesKnowledge of and involvement with the digital preservation and linked open data communities in Canada and internationallyStrong written and oral communications abilitiesExperience presenting to a variety of audiencesExcellent interpersonal skillsKnowledge of linked open data (LOD) principles and LOD modeling experienceExperience in transforming data sets into LOD triples and implementing LOD platforms and discovery layersExperience with different digital preservation repository systems and toolsKnowledge of XML standards and toolsProgramming experience with scripting languages, especially for normalizing and transforming data sets will be considered an asset.Database development and data modeling experience will be considered an assetAn understanding of Indigenous cultures and traditional knowledge will be considered an assetStrong research abilitiesTermFull-time, PermanentLocationOttawa, OntarioBenefitsCRKN offers a generous benefits package including vacation, health and dental benefits and pension match.We thank all applicants for their interest in CRKN, however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CRKN is an equal opportunity employer, with policies and practices intended to build an inclusive and accessible work environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please include in your cover letter when applying for the position and all efforts to provide the appropriate accommodation will be put into place.Qui nous sommes Le Réseau canadien de documentation pour la recherche (RCDR) est un partenariat d’universités qui se consacre à élargir l’accès au contenu numérique pour la recherche universitaire et l’enseignement au Canada. Avec l’aide de bibliothécaires, chercheurs, administrateurs et représentants de la communauté de recherche, le RCDR entreprend des initiatives de licence et d’acquisition à grande échelle pour bâtir une infrastructure de savoir, de recherche et d’enseignement pour les universités canadiennes. Le 1er avril 2018, le RCDR a fusionné avec Canadiana.org, ce qui a permis à nos équipes respectives de poursuivre une stratégie unie et coordonnée pour mettre à profit le patrimoine documentaire canadien et le contenu savant. À titre d’organisation combinée, le RCDR poursuivra ses activités principales de licences de publications savantes, tout en élargissant ses activités relatives à la numérisation, l’accès et la préservation du patrimoine documentaire canadien par le biais des services de Canadiana.PosteL’analyste des métadonnées agira à titre d’expert pour répondre aux besoins du RCDR dans ce domaine. En mobilisant les galeries, bibliothèques, archives et musées (GLAM), la personne retenue pour ce poste pourra produire des métadonnées de très haute qualité pour les collections de Canadiana et coordonner les projets de mise en valeur des métadonnées. Pour accroître la découvrabilité des collections de Canadiana, le candidat choisi devra travailler avec l’équipe de numérisation, plateforme et communication du RCDR afin de mettre à jour les normes de métadonnées, en plus de s’adapter à l’évolution des pratiques optimales et des normes. En participant activement aux communautés de pratique nationales et internationales, l’analyste de métadonnées permettra au RCDR de contribuer à l’élaboration de normes et pratiques en métadonnées.Relevant du directeur des services aux membres et des services de métadonnées, cet analyste doit répondre aux besoins futurs et actuels de l’organisation en métadonnées; choisir et adopter les normes et pratiques techniques appropriées; élaborer, en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe de plateforme, des configurations, correspondances, scripts et autres outils pour valider, normaliser, convertir et assurer la migration de métadonnées vers les formats requis.Rôles et responsabilités1. Recherche et planification (45%)Connaissance approfondie des normes et pratiques changeantes concernant les métadonnées utilisées par les GLAM et autres communautés; déterminer si ces normes et pratiques sont pertinentes pour le RCDR et ses activitésÉvaluer les normes et pratiques en métadonnées du RCDR pour s’assurer qu’elles soient adaptées à l’évolution des normes et pratiques dans la communauté; tirer profit des technologies émergentesSuivre l’évolution et contribuer à la création de normes et pratiques concernant les données liées ouvertes (DLO) émergentes; élaborer des stratégies pour les DLO et approfondir les capacités organisationnellesCréer et maintenir des profiles, modèles et guides de métadonnées, ainsi que des pratiques optimales en documentation, en plus de former et soutenir le personnel dans l’adoption et la mise en oeuvre de ces pratiques2. Collaboration et création de partenariat (35%)Participer aux initiatives de collaboration nationales et internationales pour que le RCDR s’inscrive activement dans le développement de politiques et stratégies nationales de métadonnées, en plus d’être reconnu comme centre d’excellenceRepérer et approfondir les occasions de partenariat avec des établissements, organisations, chercheurs et autres parties qui contribuent à la création, mise en corrélation et enrichissement de métadonnéesTravailler en étroite collaboration avec la directrice du marketing et de la mobilisation des intervenants; établir des partenariats avec d’autres organisations nationales qui travaillent auprès de populations autochtones et développent des normes de métadonnées qui reflètent la culture autochtone3. Développement (15%)Analyser les besoins de l’organisation en créant, capturant, transformant et normalisant des métadonnées pour les collections de Canadiana et clients externes, en plus de trouver des solutions techniquesDévelopper des configurations et correspondances pour la conversion et la migration entre divers formatset normesServir d’expert auprès de l’équipe de plateforme et participer au développement de scripts, d’outils et de flux de travail pour l’analyse, l’extension, la normalisation et la transformation de métadonnées, ainsi que pour d’autres opérations connexes4. Autre (5%)Assurer la gouvernance et fournir le soutien administratif nécessaire, surtout dans la préparation de documents de comités.En travaillant dans une petite équipe, chaque membre doit tendre vers les objectifs du RCDR, contribuer aux efforts collectifs et donc parfois entreprendre des tâches qui vont au-delà de ses fonctions habituelles. D’autres tâches pourraient être assignées à la personne retenue de temps à autre.CompétencesLe ou la candidate idéale doit avoir une maîtrise en science de l’information, bibliothéconomie ou archivistique et au moins cinq ans d’expérience, ou l’équivalent en éducation et expérience. Infotech, an IT professional services company specializing in SharePoint, Information Management and Web Portal solutions is looking to recruit talented, passionate IT professionals for our growing team. This is your opportunity to:
Work with a diverse and talented team to build, deploy and manage engaging business systems, solutions and applications.
Gain valuable industry experience working with various mid-market and enterprise clients and partners.
Gain deep hands-on experience working with some of the best in industry through company-sponsored training and mentorship programs.
Be part of something great, your input can help to influence big decisions.
Job Role and Responsibilities
The Senior Business Analyst plays a key-role on Infotech project teams. This person is often the first-point of interaction with the customer and obtains a realistic perspective of the problem situation. He or she has to perform content, system and process related analyses in order to research and document data flows, business processes and technical solutions. Some of the typical functions of a Senior Business Analyst at Infotech include:
Gather, analyze and document business and system requirements
Coordinate and conduct requirements gathering workshops
Develop recommendations and prepare presentations from business analysis findings
Contribute to the conceptual design of the end solution
Work closely with the development team during design and development phases; identify functional and process gaps, where required; recommend and implement solutions to gaps
Write detailed Business Proposals
Coordinate the Proof-of-concept
Provide high-level estimates on time-lines and budgets
Contribute to QA function in test design and execution phases
Help to write technical content in response to RFP, RFI and RFQ’s
Develop and conduct small to medium group training sessions related to solutions
Key Qualifications
5+ Years of IT Business Analyst experience
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong customer focus and understanding of Business Value Add
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong facilitation and presentation skills
Ability to balance strategic design goals against immediate business objectives
Excellent leadership skills
Experience writing use cases and test cases
Experience writing functional specifications
Experience developing methodology and best practices
Experience developing/writing technical content and responses to RFP’s.
Additional Recommended Qualifications
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint
ITIL Certification
Post Secondary Degree (preferably in Business Administration or Computer Science)
Business Analysis Certification (IIBA recognized program)
Experience developing methodology and best practices
Familiarity with Unified Process Development Methodology
Familiarity in Unified Modelling Language (UML)
Service Oriented Architecture and User-Centered Design experience is a plus
Experience with User Experience Design techniques (Personas, Focus Groups, Scenarios & Prototypes, etcetera)
Ability to conduct heuristic and competitive evaluations
Ability to lead participatory design sessions; knowledge and experience with Wire-framing techniques (Visio, prototyping, etcetera)
Experience creating Process Flows

Markham, ONRetail Engagement Senior Business Analyst - 31376
Operations - Canada Markham, Ontario
The Retailer Engagement Senior Business Analyst retains and grows relationships with Retailers to improve data quality within assigned region. In the role you will maximize Retailer interaction in order to maintain communications with Retailers, developing strong relationships and creating strategic short and long term plans to improve the quality of the data, on-time delivery and data input.

Other Responsibilities Include:

1. Driving Retailer Quality KPIs and building improvement processes and technology solutions that can be leveraged globally.
2. Working as a strong team player with various internal teams to establish an interaction process with Retailers
3. Retention and penetration activities with existing Retailers and improvement of Retailer data quality including - monitoring dashboards; contacting Retailers; providing training; maintaining strategic plans for each Retailer; new Retailer On-Boarding and Retailer Interaction Monthly reporting
4. Identifying and suggesting best practices to regional and/or global internal leaders and teams
5. Special projects - reporting, meeting targets and being accountable for the results
6. Communicating with Retailer IT departments (at all levels) on an ongoing basis regarding input-data quality and changes. Conducting all data investigations where the issue is traced back to retailer input and working with Retailer and internal teams to correct input errors.
7. Strong internal and external relationship building
Supporting the on boarding and deployment to Retailers
9. Reviewing Retailer cooperation agreements to identify compliance/non-compliance with the data and information provided to Nielsen. Develop/implement a plan to correct non-compliant situations that allows for a timely resolution.
Required Skills:
Post Secondary Bachelor's Degree
Extensive Retail knowledge and experience specifically in Point of Sales/Supply Chain
Extensive IT Systems Analysis or Business Analysis, all phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) /System Development Life Cycle, translating business requirements into a detailed system specifications
Strong client relationship building and client service skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong business acumen, ability to drive for results, meet targets and be successful in an environment of continuous improvement
Exhibit high energy and resilience and be able to learn quickly
Strong organizational and priority setting skills
Ability to work cross functionally
Nielsen Technical knowledge an asset
About Nielsen:
Nielsen N.V. (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers Watch and Buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio, and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement.
By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com

Mississauga, ONJob Title: Senior Business Analyst
Location: Mississauga, ON
Reports to: SVP, Commercial Excellence
Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent
Responsibilities:
Identify data and reporting tools necessary to/and perform business, financial and data analysis. Communicate the results of the business, financial and data analysis to various stakeholders. Plan and prepare financial and operational analysis resulting in information used in planning and decision making.
Work in a cross-functional setting with other groups in the organization to provide intermediate and advanced level analysis and reporting as necessary.
Develop and analyze scorecards, providing insight into trends or unusual performance.
Organize plans and recommend analysis and reports consistent with continuous improvement of processes and procedures. Recommend, develop, create and implement standard reporting for routine business reports as well as ad hoc reports as business conditions necessitate.
Synthesize current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action. Identify and/or monitor current and potential customers, using business intelligence tools.
Monitor for data accuracy, timeliness and integrity in data used in analysis and reporting. Communicate to appropriate personnel if data inaccuracies exist.
Ensure follow-up so that analysis and reporting outcomes are reviewed and implemented. Support new business projects with due diligence and transition activities and assist in developing and executing related project plans.
Develop BRD (Business Requirement Document) and SOW (Statement of Work) as required.
Design, create, manage, and maintain business process/workflow diagrams and documentation.
Facilitate workshops to document As Is and To Be work process flows.
Support all business units to generate, analyze, and present relevant data that correlates with the business units' requirements.
Perform impact analysis on changes to existing systems and processes.
Measure the performance of various business processes by conducting time studies and other assessments.
Maintain an action item tracking system, drive completion of activities, and document resolution of action items.
Verify data for testing is complete and ready for use by the development team.
Design and develop training modules and documentation.
Participate in conversion, pilot, and implementation discussions and tasks.
Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, Mathematics, or Applied Statistics.
A minimum of 5 years of related experience, and/or combination of experience and education.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project and Microsoft Visio required.
Experience in financial analysis and data reporting.
Ability to successfully apply standard financial, accounting and business problem-solving skills to business problems with multiple variables.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, volume.
Ability to apply concepts of algebra and business statistics.
Ability to work both independently and collaborate with others in cross-functional settings.
Highly organized, with ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong interpersonal skills (both written and verbal), with ability to communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Highly inquisitive by nature, with strong analytical skills and a keen eye for details.
Bilingual (English and French) preferred.

job_title: Performance Measurement Analyst, 1832 Asset Management (Toronto, ON)

job_description:
Toronto, ONLocation:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
Join a locally owned and operated store to help deliver health, beauty and convenience services in your community, and keep the customer at the centre of everything you do.


Why this role is important?
Overview
Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Supply Chain Replenishment, the incumbent provides analytical support for purchasing, expediting and maintenance aspects of the Distribution Centre (DC) operations. The incumbent analyzes and monitors inventory levels and provides forecasts to ensure overall goals in service level, inventory investment, DC sales and purchasing revenue are achieved.
What You'll Do:
Monitors various inventory related systems to ensure accuracy of data and updates as necessary.
Creates, monitors and adjusts all necessary forecast fluctuations to ensure proper stock at the Distribution Centers. Maintains accurate forecasts to achieve service level goals.
Identifies inventory inaccuracies to provide effective resolutions including; closing purchase orders due to shortages, damages, long term unavailability and items no longer available due to product being discontinued.
Contacts vendors to obtain updated information on items currently on backorder to provide the stores an accurate availability date.
Reviews promotional orders, taking into account current on hand inventory and the required vendor lead times to ensure goods are received on a timely basis for distribution to all stores.
Manages the process of ramping down inventory levels of future de-listed items.
Analyzes sales and inventory data to determine optimum purchasing multiples and recommend highest cost efficient purchasing strategies.
Defines appropriate delivery dates for special events purchasing, along with multiple truckload orders, to facilitate smooth inventory flow into the Distribution Centers to meet required timelines.
What You'll Need:
This position requires a demonstrated level of initiative and judgment in order to organize and prioritize tasks, workload and projects. Courtesy, tact and diplomacy are required in dealing with colleagues in every day working relationships.
Capacity to follow directives and fulfill requests with minimal supervision and takes limited discretionary action as required.
Professional manner, tact, diplomacy and discretion in dealing with others.
Ability to identify problems and draw upon a range of choices to formulate solutions.
Adaptable to set and prioritize work with occasional exceptions. Able to work with diverse personalities and styles.
Communicates with clarity, verbally in one on one or group situations, or via email.
Computer skills to maintain databases and spreadsheets and produce accurate reports and documents.
Post-secondary education with preferred study in Business, Economics, Engineering, Applied Math/Science
Related experience and/or certificate in Supply Chain discipline a definite asset
Why work in a Shoppers Drug Mart store?
Each store has an Associate-Owner, so you will work for a local business owner while having the support of a national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, flexible and varied schedules, competitive pay and online learning through SDMU.
Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your patients, co-workers, customers and community.
Associate Owners in the Shoppers Drug Mart network recognize Canada's diversity as an opportunity to better serve their communities, and strive to reflect the nation’s evolving diversity in the products they sell, the people they hire, and the culture they create in their stores. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Toronto, ONThis is a permanent, full time role located at 4100 Gordon Baker Rd. (Scarborough) or 50 Reid Dr. (Barrie)(candidate's choice). The Technology Analyst Specialist – DevOps Deployment is accountable for the following:
Key Accountabilities:
Support the team in driving DevOps initiatives within Deployment Services.
Implements deployments for bank applications, in support of DevOps initiatives
Provides guidance and assists in the setup and configuration of highly complex server based environments, including hardware setup, operating system and infrastructure component configuration, and application installation
Verifies that regular maintenance activities (patches, service packs, upgrades) are carried out
Provides planned off-hour support for the supported systems and services
Gathers requirements and documents these requirements for use within the project life cycle.
Anticipates and reduces complexity for others.
Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities, and recommends solutions to enable the organization to meet its goals
Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders
Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meets essential quality standards
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs.
Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products.
Ensures system specifications meet the business unit expectations/ requirements, and negotiate solutions.
Understands and communicates technical and architectural complexities of a technical solution so that project stakeholders can easily understand.
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency
Supports the execution of key improvement initiatives using data-driven insights to deliver positive financial and customer outcomes.

Qualifications
Knowledge:
Possesses a university degree/college diploma in Computer Science or equivalent work experience, and/or 5+ years experience of manual and automated DevOps deployment
Demonstrate knowledge of DevOps tool chain like Ansible (Must Have) Jira, Confluence, Bamboo, Artifactory, Bitbucket
Nice to have Python and/or Powershell
Proficient at MS Windows administration with Linux administration as a nice to have.
Familiar with Agile/Scrum methodology, ServiceNow
Displays sound knowledge of infrastructure applications (Websphere, Windows Sharepoint/Portal Services etc.)
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem solving techniques
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills.
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support
We’re here to help

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 full-time

 03/25/19
