 Ongoing

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Portfolio Systems Analyst (PSA) will work within a matrix to support the day-to-day functions and activities of the Croesus portfolio management system. They will work with the team Supervisor to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the department. The incumbent will work in conjunction with the Croesus Project team under the Senior Manager and will assist with documentation and procedures as required.

The PSA Team supports the Croesus portfolio management system that is used by Wood Gundy Investment Advisors, branch staff, and ISI. The role is to provide assistance, guidance and knowledge to resolve difficult and complex problems.
How You’ll Succeed
Investigate and Resolve Client Issues - Provide guidance and assistance to the team towards the resolution of difficult and complex problems. Identify problems, extract information and perform detailed analysis.Assist with any issues or situations requiring intervention by either the business and/or technology division and ensure issues are tracked and managed until resolved.
Project Support – Perform pre/post implementation testing of application fixes/enhancements to ensure resolution and user satisfaction following Croesus (Vendor) bundle releases. Assist with projects, initiatives and act as a testing resource as required. Assume a SME role on the Croesus portfolio system and participate as SME when required during training and development sessions.
Administration Support – Prepare and maintain documentation on procedures/processes for the PSA manual. Review and provide statistical reporting to the Supervisor. Develop and maintain communication opportunities with other Operations departments to assure data is accurate (e.g. BFS, CID, Re-organization, RRSP, Entitlements, ICS, Training and Development etc). Monitor and develop methods to improve and enhance SLA measurements. Identify, correct issues related to Broadridge data, resolve portfolio management issues and assist the Supervisor with capacity planning.

Who You Are
You have a post-secondary degree/diploma in business and/or information technology systems (or equivalent work experience).
You are a certified professional. Completion of Canadian Securities Course (CSC) or experience in the Brokerage industry.
You have knowledge of CIBC WG branch structure.
You have advanced computer skills with an excellent working knowledge of Excel.
You have knowledge of financial markets including Stock, Option, Fixed Income and Mutual Funds.
You have working knowledge of financial product concepts and calculations (bond amortization, accrued income, expected income, yields).
It’s an asset if: you are bilingual in French and English.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
This is a full-time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week, you may be required occasionally work outside of business hours.

Job Title: Production Support Analyst
Reports To: Director of Technology Services
Department: Technology Services

_____________________________________________________________________

Job Summary:
The Production Support Analyst is responsible for the first level triaging and investigation of D2D Production incidents utilizing the ticketing system Maximo and applying resolution. If the incident cannot be resolved by the first level then coordinates the efforts with the second level teams. This individual should have experience in Ticket resolution system, ability to analyze issues and resolve within the specified SLA’s and providing root cause analysis with recommendations for improvements.

Troubleshoot failed jobs and output data, remediating issues
Monitoring for production errors, working with operations and customer service
Working with Development team and Level 3 support to resolve D2D issues
Identifying repeated challenges and finding permanent solutions
To manage production incident tickets effectively and efficiently
Act as a subject matter expert investigate and resolve complex incidents/issues
If assistance from other teams is needed, coordinate efforts for reassessment and quick resolution, Monitor, Support and troubleshoot problems in the production application environment.
Conduct root cause analysis of application incidents and implement recommendations to improve the situation (focusing on permanent solutions).
Manage the resolutions of day to day issues escalated to Production Support, Respond to stakeholder with the agreed SLA’s
Ensuring the production issues are resolved on time
Ensures this procedure is followed as required within Production Support
Coordinates any training requirements for personnel within their department and ensures Training Record is documented
Maintaining technical documentation and tracking challenges
Troubleshooting Data Communication and Printing Issues
Attend daily Production Support meetings
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

College diploma in an IT field is required (Computer Science is an asset)
Experience (min 2 years) object-oriented programming languages is required (C++), (C#), .NET
Intermediate knowledge of MS SQL is required (stored procs, functions, queries)
Excellent understanding of various file formats is required (XML, CSV, TXT, MIME)
Experience in Operating systems such as Windows and Linux
Excellent verbal and written communication skills is required
Ability to work well across many teams and environment is required
Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects is required
Highly detailed and organized, Ability to work in a fast pace dynamic environment.
Ability to work in Production Support Environment, with problem solving and investigative skills

Working Conditions:

At times, may be required to wear a smock and safety shoes when visiting the production floor
Sitting for extended periods of time
Providing 8 hour coverage between 7AM to 7PM
At times, may be required to work evening or weekends
Ability to stay behind to ensure production issues are resolved to meet SLA

Ottawa, ONJoin Canada’s lifeline!


We’re seeking a Business Support Specialist, Stem Cells to join our team.


Be part of a dynamic, innovative, collaborative, diverse and caring organization committed to saving and improving the lives of Canadians. We are the connection between the sincere generosity of donors, and the heartfelt appreciation of recipients. Thousands of Canadians depend on our programs every day for reliable access to safe blood, plasma, stem cells, organs and tissues.


In this role you will oversee all activities related to the management of, and relationships with, committees and working groups within the stem cell program. You will develop and produce comprehensive data and analysis required for reporting at various levels of the organization. You will also develop and produce stem cell specific products for external customers, and provide business document management expertise, development and support for the Planning & Development group as well as Stem Cell Operations.


Are you ready to embark on a meaningful and inspiring journey, where what you do matters? Be part of Canada’s lifeline. Because we can all be the reason, the connection, that keeps Canadians living.


Responsibilities include:

Oversees all aspects of stakeholder relationships and committee management within the stem cells program.

Conducts regular environmental and horizon scans to identify, assess and inform the program leadership of emerging issues, practices, and risks that may impact the stem cells program.
Builds strong working relationships with international colleagues to have on-going conversations and information exchanges to gain information on changes in transplant practice, including emerging therapies; this may include attendance at international conferences and/or participation on WMDA working groups.
In collaboration with the Data Analyst, will synthesize/analyze industry-specific, qualitative information to report findings to Stem Cells leadership on a regular basis and incorporate relevant information into annual reports and horizon scans to inform and advance the stem cells strategy.

Strong attention to detail.

job_title: SAP Business Systems Analyst III - Time
job_description:
Ottawa, ONJoin Canada’s lifeline!


Be part of a dynamic, innovative, collaborative, diverse and caring organization committed to saving and improving the lives of Canadians. We are the connection between the sincere generosity of donors, and the heartfelt appreciation of recipients. Thousands of Canadians depend on our programs every day for reliable access to safe blood, plasma, stem cells, organs and tissues.


We are currently seeking an SAP Business Systems Analyst III - Time to join our IT SAP & Registry Solutions team in Ottawa.


The SAP Business Analyst will be responsible for their respective functional area, Time Management & Time Evaluation, ensuring appropriate levels of integration and information sharing between the team members on the SAP Support Group. Also, responsible for supporting the use of SAP and its various platforms at Canadian Blood Services. This includes supporting SAP end users, using SAP information to conduct analysis, resolve user-related issues, modifying existing functionality and adding new capabilities.


Are you ready to embark on a meaningful and inspiring journey, where what you do matters? Be part of Canada’s lifeline. Because we can all be the reason, the connection, that keeps Canadians living.


Responsibilities include:


Receives and promptly responds to SAP end-user requests for third-level support (which includes detailed analysis of SAP time cluster and pay cluster results)
Analyzes SAP issues, identifies potential solution(s) and completes/directs resolution
Provides resolution for unexpected transaction results, master data and reporting issues
Assesses client requirements, participates in requirement review meetings, led by the business representatives
Determines possible solutions and plans the SAP development, including prototypes and demos
Itemizes benefits and risks with associated solutions, calculates return on investment
Provides input to and maintains the SAP configuration, master data, and reports
Develops documentation for change request and new functionality as per Canadian Blood Services requirements (includes change management documentation, IMG documentation, technical documentation, user guides, quick reference material, knowledge transfer material)
Develops test plans and scripts which includes all phases of testing as appropriate to the change: unit, integration, user acceptance, regression, load testing
Works with clients to share knowledge and best practices regarding the design and use of SAP information and supporting processes
Researches, investigates and stays informed about SAP, SuccessFactors suite and associated 3rd party solutions for the business processes supported, including solutions deployed by other blood agencies and pharmaceutical companies.
Ensures regulated systems and documentation meet regulatory compliance standards
Executes functional tasks for SAP system refreshes
Understands SAP current offerings and future development
Logs issues with SAP Global Support
Provides input into the SAP Support Pack Strategy and other upgrades and conduct system testing for their functional area


Required Skills
Education, Training and Experience:

Your stakeholder management skills, as much as your knowledge of Information Technology (IT) policy best practices in the IT and government sectors, and project methodology, will drive your success in this permanent, full-time position as a Senior Policy Analyst, with the City of Toronto.


Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Policy and Issues Management, you will play a lead role in developing and delivering the corporate IT policy program for the City of Toronto. As a Senior Policy Analyst, IT, you will use a best practices approach in providing leadership and coordination in the design, development, implementation, management, monitoring and evaluation of the divisional IT policy program.


Major Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibilities as Senior Policy Analyst-IT will be varied. Specifically, you will:

Implements detailed plans and recommend policies and procedures regarding program-specific requirements.
Manages the day-to-day operation of all assigned staff on a project basis, including supervising, motivating and training staff, as well as encouraging and ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and innovation.
Manages the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of IT policies.
Secures compliance with sensitive legislation such as privacy laws and with general information and technology “best practices” and strategies in knowledge and information management through the appropriate research, analysis and development of policies, standards and procedures.
Provides advice on complex and possible controversial positions to senior management and Council through the development of papers, briefing notes and staff reports.
Manages IT Policy processes in conjunction with Information Technology Subject Matter Experts across the City.
Plans and implements the City’s corporate IT Policy program based on “best practices” in the IT and government sectors.
Conducts “best practices” research on topical IT Policies and emerging trends and related issues affecting the City of Toronto’s architecture.
Provides professional IT consulting and advisory services to the City’s business divisions and other Information & Technology (IT) work groups, as well as eCity projects.
Provides advice to senior management through the development of position papers, strategies, briefing notes, presentations and staff reports.
Facilitates and negotiates agreement between and among various parties and stakeholders to achieve common goals for delivery of IT Policy processes across the organization.
Manages the relationship with internal and external stakeholders in order to benchmark the City’s standards, including standards and practices against external organizations, as well as to achieve internal consensus where needed.
Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Senior Policy Analyst, should describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Business Administration or a related discipline and/or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience with relevant information technology or business systems experience.
Considerable experience providing strategic advice, policy/program development, research and evaluation in a large scale public or private organization.
Considerable experience consulting and establishing effective working relationships with all stakeholders including clients, management and staff at all levels.
Considerable experience in the development and deployment of research methodology, and policy particularly in the analysis and assessment of a broad range of IT issues, trends and directions.
Considerable experience in project leadership by mediating, negotiating and facilitating projects and work teams.
Strong stakeholder management, partnership and relationship-building skills to initiate and nurture strong working relationships with colleagues throughout the IT Division, corporation and external community, to achieve mutual goals and objectives. Highly developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated proficiency in conflict resolution in complex, multi-stakeholder situations.
Strong oral and written communication skills to prepare and present detailed research proposals, methodologies, standards, project plans, and reports.
Superior project management and team leadership skills to provide project planning and leadership on concurrent standards development projects and to manage deadlines and competing priorities
Excellent strategic, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Strong analytical thinking skills to apply several analytical techniques to break apart complex problems into component parts, identify several solutions, and weigh the value of each.
Technical skills to operate various software programs to prepare own materials.
Ability to be strategic to understand and assess the external impact of trends and issues on internal standards and planning.
Knowledge and understanding of: Project methodology, IT governance structure, decision-making processes and service management (including COBIT and ITIL).
Knowledge of the City's legislative framework and decision-making processes would be an asset.
Knowledge and understanding of: IT standards (hardware, software, telecommunication, security, data, ISO, ANSI, IEC, IEEE, ISACC, INCITS, etc.) would be an asset.
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:
The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.


Accommodation:

If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, due to disability under the Ontario Human Rights Code, please email us at application.accomodation3@toronto.ca, quoting job ID #2320757 and the job title. The City is committed to providing Code-protected accommodation throughout its hiring process. Please visit Hiring Policies and Statements for further details.

Markham, ONJOB DESCRIPTION
Primary Function:
This role assumes responsibility for the execution of online tactics designed to optimize and enrich the representation of products on acklandsgrainger.com. The Online Content Analyst will report directly to the Online Search & Merchandising Manager and is an affiliated team member of the Acklands Grainger eCommerce department. This role will work closely with our Online Search & Merchandising Manager, to execute the day to day operations of online merchandising and taxonomy management. This role is a full-time position based out of our NSC at 123 Commerce Valley Drive East suite 700.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
This role is responsible for the execution of the strategies and tactics associated with optimizing the way product categories are presented and merchandised online. Responsibilities include:
Maintaining and optimizing the online product hierarchy as part of the NPI workflow.
Ensuring online hierarchy efforts are aligned with efforts from several key internal business partners, including the Online Merchandising, Product Management and STEP/hierarchy teams
Determining the optimal way to group and merchandise like products for display online; executing and maintaining the online grouping strategy
Partnering with product management team members to enforce the consistency of the online product representation, focusing on but not limited to:
Product descriptions
Product Hierarchy and categorization
Technical attribute selection & population
Category product images
Additional product meta data
Develop and maintain promotional and seasonal product hierarchies.
Benchmarking the acklandsgrainger.com online shopping experience versus its competitors; translating findings into strategic action.
Assisting in the testing and integration of new online and offline features and functionality
Collaborating with our Product Management French translation resource will maintain the French hierarchy and product movement changes
Pull extracts for web and merchandising product data and hierarchy data based on ad hoc requests to support team members of the eCommerce team.
Preferred Education & Experience
Must have 2-3 years of experience in large, multi-channel organizations with:
2-3 years of related eCommerce, product merchandising, or product management experience
Proven success working in teams with dynamic, analytics-driven, multi-channel work environments
Understanding of Product Information Management systems and product data management methodologies; experience with Stibo Systems (STEP) is an asset.
Experience collecting and managing product-related digital assets (product imagery, PDF documentation, etc.)
Experience with faceted on-site search engines; Endeca or Solr a plus.
Experience with the interpretation and analysis of web analytics
High attention to detail / proven organizational skills
Familiarity with product taxonomy research; demonstrated ability to translate research into tactical actions
Strong communication skills, detail orientation and business acumen
High-level knowledge of the MRO (Maintenance, Repair, and Operations) industry and industrial products a strong plus
Adept at prioritization and multitasking
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Strong systemic thinking and problem solving skills
Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship building skills
Strong Microsoft Office skills

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Group Customer Technology
job_description:
The Senior Business Analyst, Group Customer Technology, is responsible for end-to-end analysis of issues that affect business processes and systems.
This role will respond to issues reported by users and customers that could not be resolved by first level support areas such as the Contact Centre. Initial triage, recommendations and subsequent reporting fall within the incumbent’s scope of responsibility and influence. Having a strong business knowledge contributes to business planning, enhancing the current systems and a decrease in production support issues.
The key measures of success are:
a) focused and quick response to and remediation of reported issues
b) effect support for system enhancements and projects
c) being an effective point of contact who provides timely reporting

Experience using JIRA and Confluence
Experience using other defect tracking and requirements management tools

Demonstrated excellent analytical and problem solving skills in computer software and hardware

Consistent ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure where required
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Detail-Orientated

Your future duties and responsibilities

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Build strong relationship directly with the client. Understand the client's business and how that relates to the service management solution. Offer guidance and support to the client;
Work with the Project and Delivery teams during all project phases to ensure the solution meets the requirements of the client;
Create and execute Client Acceptance testing within the service management solution ensuring the project receives client sign off on the deliverables;
Assist in Bids or with Bid work when required;
Provide assistance during post production normalization period as required.

5+ years experience in system configuration or SQL

Works well under pressure and capable of managing priorities
Dynamic Team Player

Excellent English language skills (bilingual an added benefit)
Self-learner

Process improvement mindset.

Dorval, QCIt’s an exciting time at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group. For more than 50 years, we have provided a full range of services for business and commercial aviation customers. Today, we are transforming and growing to meet the demand of OEMs, business aviation customers and airlines. We are a premier Canadian aviation company with an international presence!

If you’re looking for an opportunity to join and grow with a dynamic company, you will thrive at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group!

Business Process Analyst

Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology(VPIT), the Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying and improving the outcomes of operational processes to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction as well as reducing cost. The candidate will also be responsible for leading continuous improvement initiatives for all departments in the organization, as well as evaluating, planning and implementing the improvements in the business processes and practices. Other aspects of the job include group facilitation, compiling and tracking data,preparing training materials and documenting processes.

The Business Process Analyst must be prepared to explain and defend any proposed changes to the current system.

Responsibilities
Identify, plan and implement key projects to improve quality, reduce cost, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, scrap, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.
Identify and facilitate process improvement projects, training/workshops to drive cultural change
Drive value stream mapping to define “As-Is Analysis” and the transition to Future State
Develop and conduct compliance audits, program evaluations and reviews to drive results with the fortitude to ensure change is permanent
Provide executive management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
Receives input and coordination of information from various parties, and prepares and presents such information for management review.
Strong understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, principles and practices.
Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Support/change management plans and training plans to ensure new processes are implemented in an optimal fashion, supporting the organization through the various stages of change.
Work with the training department to develop training programs for the broader team related to the tools and solutions created.
Participate in training facilitation of key process enhancements where applicable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering from an accredited University
3+ years’ experience in process improvements, cross-functional collaboration and workflow generation
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong leadership skills, ability to learn and apply new concepts and overcome obstacles with change
Strong work ethic that is able to work independently but also works well in team environment
Results driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience in Six Sigma, Reengineering or other Continuous improvement methodologies would be an asset
Technical Competencies
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft word, excel ,Visio and ERP applications
Lean Six Sigma Organizational training and certification would be an asset.

Burnaby, BC$68,530 - $78,227 a yearSenior Wholesale Business Systems Analyst
Information Systems R27
Vancouver, Regular, Full Time

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.
The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) leads the analysis and provides consulting services to plan on-going business and technology needs consistent with BC Liquor Distribution Branch’s strategic plans.
Serves as a liaison between lines of business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Analyses lines of business operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. Negotiates agreements and commitments to business partners by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to supported business units to improve operations and enhance the LDB’s competitive edge. May make recommendations for buy versus build decision.
This position evaluates business systems varying in complexity and business significance and ensures clients requirements and priorities are understood and met throughout the systems development life cycle. This position is responsible to know and understand industry best practices and approaches to business challenges and their relation to systems solution. The position is responsible for completing detailed end-to-end business analysis, obtaining clear definition of business requirements and translating them into functional specifications, developing cost-benefit/alternative analysis, risk assessments, recommendations, and preparing branch standard documentation. The position also identifies time frames, resources/ budget requirements and presents findings to both IT and Business Leaders.
To be considered for this opportunity, applicants must submit a cover letter and resume clearly identifying how they meet the qualifications necessary for this position. This information will be used as part of the selection process.

For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Hector Wong, Manager, Wholesale Systems by phone at 604 252-2976. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

An eligibility list for temporary or permanent future opportunities may be established. A criminal record check is required.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.
Only applications submitted using the BC Public Service Recruitment System on this website will be accepted.
Visit Careers at: www.bcldb.com
Qualifications
Education and Experience
Degree or diploma in a related discipline and/or certification in business analysis (e.g. Certified Business Analysis Professional, Certified Competency in Business Analysis) combined with a minimum of six years of recent, related experience*. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

Recent, related experience must include:
Business analysis including working with business users and subject matter experts to produce requirement, gap analysis, business process design, business rules and other analysis work products.
Experience with each phase of the project management life cycle and systems development life cycle.
Experience with several of the following business systems and processes are required:

Wholesale - Demand Planning, Forecasting, Warehouse Management System, Transport Management Systems, Labour Management, Replenishment, Inventory Management, Customs, Excise.
Experience with one or more of the following business systems and process is preferred:
Retail - POS, Inventory, Pricing, Markup/Promotions, Marketing, Merchandising, Replenishment, Workforce Management, Space Planning, Assortment Planning.
Corporate - Finance (A/R, A/P, G/L, Data Management, Audit, Purchasing), HR (Recruitment, Payroll, Training & Learning, Labour Relations, Occupational Health & Safety).
Knowledge
Expert knowledge of the following tools: MS Office, MS Project, VISIO
Knowledge of the software development lifecycle process and methodologies.
Knowledge of IT systems and trends in information technology
Knowledge of business modeling tools and techniques
Knowledge of cost-benefit analysis methodology
Preference may be given to those candidates with knowledge of:
Branch and Government business systems and processes (i.e. RFP, Budgeting) preferred.
Skills/Abilities
Strong time management and organizational skills to manage concurrent activities and meet timelines.
Strong negotiation and interpersonal /relationship management skills to gain acceptance from all levels within the organization of planning strategies, recommended solutions and getting agreement on priorities and requirements.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to communicate complex information effectively at all levels within an organization.
Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking skills and analysis/problem solving skills to make appropriate business recommendations.
Strong ability to produce detailed written documentation.
Working Conditions
Travel may be required to visit BC LDB Distribution Centre’s in Richmond, Delta, Kamloops.

Edmonton, AB$72,444 - $94,964 a yearDo you enjoy working with data? Are you ready to expand your knowledge and skills for transforming data into high quality information enabling health system evidence-based decision making? If so, the Analytics and Performance Reporting (APR) Branch in the Health System Quality and Performance (HSQP) Division has an exciting opportunity for you!

APR responds to internal and external requests for analytic information and reporting to support informed decision making, business planning, health system monitoring, evaluation, performance management, and policy development.


In this role you will be working independently or leading project teams, preparing analytic information and reports, creating data cubes, data marts and data visualizations, and providing analytics support to the Ministry and other health system stakeholders.


You will employ your analytical and research skills to select the most appropriate methodologies, define the research problems, collect, transform and analyze data, write computer programs in SAS/R/Python, and use data science and machine learning algorithms as deemed necessary. You will be expected to conduct literature review, research on methodology, write qualitative and quantitate results in plain language for reporting purpose, apply your technical knowledge about managing very large databases for complex analytics initiatives and data management.

To be successful in this role, you need to be self-directed and have the knowledge, skills and abilities to engage in collaborative relationships with clients requesting analytic information products and seeking analytic support.

The following APS Competencies are critical to this role:

Drive for Results: The ability to manage a number of projects in a timely and cost effective manner so they follow provincial government and industry best practices.

Develop Self and Others: The job revolves around complex projects with the goal of producing high quality work within tight time constraints. The candidate must be skillful in identifying options and implementing contingency plans as well as having the ability to quickly shift priorities.

Build Collaborative Environments: By providing advice on information products and issues and also advise on areas of expertise to a range of stakeholders.


Qualifications

A University degree (Master's preferred) in statistics, computer science, public health/administration, biostatistics, economics, finance, or equivalents, plus a minimum of 4 years of directly related experience is required. Must have SAS programming skills (Classic or Enterprise Guide). Experience in SQL (Structured Query Language), R, or Python are desired. Project management experience is beneficial. Experience with health-related and/or large datasets is an asset. Research and professional writing skills will also be considered an asset. Equivalencies will be considered.

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. Ottawa, ONBusiness Operations Analyst (Inventory)

Job Summary
Who we are:

CIHR is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to support a healthier Canada by leading investment in innovative and collaborative research and helping to solve our health care challenges today and in the future.

Why work for the Canadian Institutes of Health Research?

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is dedicated to creating a healthy and stimulating work environment; promoting synergies and a collaborative culture across the organization, including with its institutes and external stakeholders.

CIHR is located in the heart of downtown Ottawa at 160 Elgin Street, close to transit and many shops and restaurants.

Intent of Process:

The intent of this process is to staff various term and indeterminate positions by creating a pool of pre-qualified qualified candidates to also staff future similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate), various security clearance levels and bilingual linguistic profiles.

Job Summary:

Reporting directly to the Project Lead, the incumbent is responsible for supporting the business operations of an assigned set of funding related business systems and business processes; as well as supporting integrated projects to design, test, and assess the impact of business system changes.

The incumbent will be required to be collaborative while consulting extensively with multiple internal and external stakeholders, to achieve consensus. The outcome will be developing project work plans, documenting business needs, identifying issues and risks, and proposing mitigations to keep the project on track. Additionally, the incumbent will support and maintain change control procedures and makes recommendations to continuously improve processes and tools.

Our ideal candidate will be able to build relationships, manage multiple requests, and be innovative while working with our team to support the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of CIHR’s funding-related business systems and business processes that support the delivery of CIHR’s core programs and services.

Essential Qualifications
EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university or a combination of education, training and experience.

EXPERIENCE (generally acquired through a minimum of 2 years experience):

liaising with different stakeholders to support the planning, design, development, and testing of business system and process enhancementspreparing project plans, reports, briefing notes, and presentations that were widely distributed and/or presented to a variety of audiences and/or used to support organizational decision-making.with business process mapping as well as capturing, scripting, and managing business requirements
KNOWLEDGE
Expert knowledge of business analysis, requirements capture and management, and requirements scripting and change control.Expert knowledge of process design and management principles.
COMPETENCIES
Communication (Written and Oral)Working with others (Collaborating, Relationship Management)AdaptabilityPlanning and OrganizingInitiativeCritical ThinkingJudgement
Asset Qualifications
EDUCATION:
A graduate degree in either: the life/health sciences or in business.Business Analyst training and/or certification.
EXPERIENCE:
manipulating and analyzing data and information.health research.using data visualization techniques and tools.project management (using tools, methodologies and best practices).
Language Requirements
Various Linguistic Profiles (BBB/BBB, English Essential)

Important Notes
1) The intent of this selection process is to establish a pool of pre-qualified candidates to staff future identical positions or similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate)

2) Application must be received through the ATS (process number: J0219-0647)

3) Acknowledgement of receipt of applications will not be sent; we would like to thank all candidates who apply. Only those selected for an exam/interview will be contacted.

4) An interview will be held. A written examination may be administered.

5) CIHR is committed to the values and principles of employment equity. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, please inform us of accommodations (i.e., an alternative method of assessment, a technical aid, accessibility requirements, etc.) required at any stage of the assessment process, so that we can take the appropriate measures to facilitate your full participation.

6) From amongst those candidates that meet the essential criteria of education and experiences; CIHR may select a certain number of candidates that most closely meet the position requirements to participate in the next selection phase.

7) CIHR is a federal agency (separate employer) and does not fall under the Public Service Employment Act.

CIHR
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to create new scientific knowledge and to enable its translation into improved health, more effective health services and products, and a strengthened health care system for Canadians. Composed of 13 Institutes, CIHR provides leadership and support to more than 13,000 health researchers and trainees across Canada.

Special posting considerations
You must provide a cover letter that clearly expresses the basis of your professional and personal interest in the position of Business Analyst. Your letter should also provide concrete and detailed examples that clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience criteria listed under the Essential and Asset Qualifications. Failure to provide a detailed cover letter and CV will result in the elimination of your application from this process.


Analyste des activités opérationnelles (Inventaire)

Résumé du poste
Notre organisation :

Les Instituts de recherche en santé du Canada (IRSC) sont l’organisme du gouvernement du Canada chargé d’investir dans la recherche en santé. Ils ont pour mission de veiller à la santé de la population canadienne par des investissements dans la recherche innovante et collaborative qui permettra de relever les défis actuels et à venir en matière de soins de santé.

Pourquoi travailler aux IRSC?

Les IRSC ont à cœur de créer un climat de travail sain et stimulant, ainsi qu’à promouvoir les synergies et une culture de collaboration dans l’ensemble de l’organisation, y compris dans leurs instituts et dans leurs relations avec les parties prenantes externes.

Les bureaux des IRSC sont situés au cœur du centre-ville d’Ottawa, au 160, rue Elgin, à proximité du transport en commun, des boutiques et des restaurants.

Objectif du concours:

Ce concours vise à doter divers postes termes et indéterminés, en créant un bassin de candidats préqualifiés pouvant servir à pourvoir des postes similaires aux IRSC, mais dont la durée (affectation, poste de durée déterminée ou indéterminée), la cote de sécurité et le profil linguistique varient.

Résumé des fonctions:

Le titulaire du poste, qui relève directement du chef de projet, est chargé de soutenir les activités d’un ensemble de processus et de systèmes opérationnels liés au financement, ainsi que des projets intégrés visant à concevoir et à tester des changements aux systèmes opérationnels et à en évaluer l’impact.


Le titulaire devra avoir un esprit de collaboration et interagir régulièrement avec diverses parties internes et externes afin d’en arriver à un consensus. Leurs fonctions consisteront à élaborer des plans de travail, à définir les besoins opérationnels, à cerner les enjeux et les risques, et à proposer des mesures d’atténuation pour mener à bien les projets. Le titulaire devra aussi établir et tenir à jour les procédures de contrôle du changement et faire des recommandations par souci de constamment améliorer les processus et les outils.

Le candidat idéal sera apte à établir des relations, à gérer de multiples demandes et à faire preuve d’innovation en travaillant avec notre équipe afin de contribuer à la conception, à la mise en œuvre et à l’amélioration continue des systèmes et processus opérationnels liés au financement des IRSC, lesquels soutiennent l’exécution et la prestation des programmes et services de base de l’organisation.

Qualifications essentielles
ÉTUDES
Baccalauréat d’une université reconnue ou combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et d’expérience.
EXPÉRIENCE (acquise sur au moins 2 ans)
travailler en liaison avec diverses parties prenantes à la planification, à la conception, au développement et à l’essai de systèmes opérationnels, ainsi qu’à l’amélioration des processuspréparer des plans de projet, des rapports, des notes d’information et des exposés qui ont été largement diffusés ou présentés à divers auditoires, ou utilisés pour soutenir la prise de décision organisationnelleconnaissance pratique de la mise en correspondance des processus opérationnels, ainsi que du recensement, de la définition et de la gestion des exigences opérationnelles

CONNAISSANCES
Connaissance approfondie de l’analyse opérationnelle, du recensement et de la gestion des besoins, de la définition des exigences et du contrôle des changements nécessaires.Connaissance approfondie des principes de conception et de gestion des processus.
COMPÉTENCES
Savoir communiquer (oralement et par écrit)Capacité de travailler avec les autres (collaborer, gérer des relations)Faculté d’adaptationSens de la planification et de l’organisationInitiativePensée critiqueJugement
Qualifications constituant un atout
ÉTUDES
Diplôme d’études supérieures en administration ou en sciences de la vie ou de la santé.Formation ou accréditation d’analyste de gestion.
EXPÉRIENCE
manipulation et analyse de données et de renseignements
recherche en santéutilisation d’outils et de techniques de visualisation des donnéesgestion de projet (recours à des outils, à des méthodes et aux meilleures pratiques).
Exigences linguistiques
Divers profils linguistiques (BBB/BBB, anglais essentiel)

Notes importantes
1) Ce processus de sélection vise la constitution d’un bassin de candidats préqualifiés afin de doter de futurs postes identiques ou similaires aux IRSC. Ces postes pourraient prendre différentes formes (affectations, postes de durée déterminée ou de durée indéterminée).

2) Les demandes doivent être présentées par l’entremise du système de suivi des candidats (SSC) (numéro du processus de sélection : J0219-0647).

3) Aucun accusé de réception ne sera envoyé. Nous remercions à l’avance tous ceux et celles qui auront soumis leur candidature, mais nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour l’examen ou l’entrevue.

4) Les candidats devront passer une entrevue, et peut-être aussi un examen écrit.

5) Les IRSC souscrivent aux valeurs et aux principes d’équité en matière d’emploi. Si l'on communique avec vous concernant une occasion d’emploi ou un examen, veuillez nous informer de tout accommodement requis (c.-à-d. autre méthode d’évaluation, aide technique, aide à l’accès, etc.) à n’importe quelle étape du processus d’évaluation, afin que nous puissions prendre les mesures nécessaires pour faciliter votre participation pleine et entière.

6) Parmi les candidats répondant aux exigences essentielles quant aux études et à l’expérience, les IRSC pourront retenir les mieux classés et leur permettre ainsi de passer à la prochaine étape du processus de sélection.

7) Veuillez noter que les IRSC sont un organisme fédéral (employeur distinct) qui n’est pas régi par la Loi sur l’emploi dans la fonction publique.

IRSC
Les Instituts de recherche en santé du Canada (IRSC) sont l'organisme du gouvernement du Canada chargé d'investir dans la recherche en santé. L'objectif des IRSC est de créer de nouvelles connaissances scientifiques et d'en favoriser l'application en vue d'améliorer la santé, d'offrir de meilleurs produits et services de santé, et de renforcer le système de soins de santé au Canada. Composés de 13 instituts, les IRSC offrent leadership et soutien à plus de 13 000 chercheurs et stagiaires en santé dans tout le Canada.

Considérations particulières
Vous devez joindre une lettre de présentation qui illustre clairement vos intérêts professionnels et personnels quant au poste d’analyste des activités opérationnelles. Votre lettre doit également présenter des exemples concrets et détaillés qui montrent explicitement que vous respectez les critères d’études et d’expérience énoncés sous les rubriques « Qualifications essentielles » et « Qualifications constituant un atout ». À défaut de fournir une lettre de présentation détaillée et un CV, votre candidature sera retirée du concours.

The Quality Assurance Analyst is accountable for maintaining data and software quality within the organization. This includes writing and executing test scenarios to fully test issues, enhancements, applications and corresponding data to make sure the results are reliable, fully functional, and user-friendly. Additionally, the QA analyst is responsible for daily system administration, configuration and maintenance.

Responsibilities
Job Duties
May include but not limited to:
Technical expert and end user support for customer information systems, advanced metering systems, bill design applications, payment transfer processes, field tools and reporting tools.
Configuration, administration and maintenance of all systems based on business and regulatory requirements.
Analyze vendor-driven release notes, feature specs and upgrade change lists and create/execute custom test scripts with an understanding of impact to business.
Responsible for troubleshooting, analysis, issue reproduction, issue logging, testing and validation of fixes and enhancements for all systems.
Perform bill print quality assurance for production issues, enhancements or as a result of project work.
 Collaborate with business, product and development teams to determine what to test for production issues, enhancements and projects. Create, execute, validate and document tests for reported issues and enhancements.
Recommend and perform batch updates to ensure data integrity.
Responsible for all data mapping efforts including analysis and documentation.
Other duties as assigned.

Requirements
Special Skill Requirements
Excellent written and verbal communications skills to properly document issues/enhancements and work directly with both the business and IT for resolution.
Excellent prioritization skills, focusing on the most important / time sensitive tasks.
Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task deadline-driven tasks.
Strong investigation and analytical skills, utilizing both black and grey box testing.
Strong attention to detail with focus on ensuring the delivery of high quality accurate and reliable data.

Knowledge and Experience Requirements
Graduation from a recognized post-secondary institution in computer science, quality assurance or software-related diploma and 2 years’ experience with testing including test strategies, executions of tests and issues tracking or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proficient with computer systems and related programs including Microsoft Office, Access and Visio.
Demonstrated knowledge of customer information systems, advanced metering systems, bill design applications, payment transfer processes, field tools and reporting tools.
Understanding of change control and auditing standards.
Understanding of querying using SQL an asset.

This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage team and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude.
Responsibilities:
Support Hotels & Hospitality team members in securing listings, marketing and closing of real estate transactions.
Input financial data from P&L statements into valuation models.
Under supervision of senior team members, develop pro forma financial projections.
Under supervision of senior team members, complete preliminary asset valuations using discounted cash flow, income capitalization, leveraged IRR, comparable sales and construction cost techniques.
Gather, compile and present economic and demographic data in formats pertinent to real estate transactions.
Assist in all aspects of preparing presentations, offering materials and miscellaneous reports.
Abstracting legal documents.
Communicating with and coordinating work of third-party vendors (graphic and web designers) in connection with preparation of offering materials and presentations.
Under the supervision of senior project team members, facilitate transaction due diligence process.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Finance, Hotel Administration and/or Real Estate Finance
Strong record of academic achievement
Demonstrated quantitative skills
Hospitality-industry specific work experience, preferably in valuations or general consulting
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to work independently while also maintaining rapport with a team
Ability to work within formal reporting relationships
Strong computer skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign) considered a definite asset
Flexibility to work after normal business hours and on weekends as needed
What you can expect from us
We’re an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe. We believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.
Apply today!

job_title: Data Governance Solution Analyst and Data Architect
job_description:
Mississauga, ONRequisition ID: 16925
Job Category: Information Technology

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Hatch is currently seeking a Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst for our Hatch Digital group covering Hatch’s business systems. This opportunity will be based out of our Mississauga office.
Hatch has a number of business systems. The iPas TF Team in Hatch Digital configures, programs, and maintains the SAP enterprise applications including SAP ECC (modules include HCM, Time, FI, CO, SD, PS, CPM and Readsoft), SuccessFactors, C4C, Fiori and Fiori LaunchPad, Business Warehouse, Business Objects as well as some other cloud-based HR solutions.
Agile development teams in Hatch Digital deploy other off-the-shelf systems and develop and maintain custom, Hatch-specific systems.
The complete business systems architecture covers all of these systems with many integrations between them.
The Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst will proactively work with business owners, business representatives, other systems team members, SAP functional consultants, the technical teams and the reporting team to understand business and governance requirements around master data and other key data, and to implement solutions to address these requirements.
You are a team player, yet an independent thinker, comfortable with sharing and accepting ideas in an open manner. You are a hard worker, able to take on demanding and time-constrained tasks.

Duties and Responsibilities
Ensure quality of master data and key data in SAP and the other business systems.
Work with the Business data owners to document data definitions and business rules
Develop or facilitate the development of documentation covering master and key data flows and transformations between systems, including the business rules applied to the data.
Participate in all team initiatives to review early data model designs, integration data flows, data uploads and transformation designs and participate in testing.
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems.
Develop processes and procedures for data ownership, data management, integration, replication and uploads to support ongoing data maintenance and data integrity.
Collaborate with the reporting team and understand the design of the data warehouse.
Work with business representatives to gather and understand functional requirements, develop complex queries and provide reports.
Respond to auditors concerning data management processes, improvements and information requests.
Design and implement systems solutions in collaboration with other team members, provide advice to management and stakeholders, recommend a course of action for required solutions: solution scoping, requirements analysis, gap analysis, feasibility, functional design, application configuration, technical specification, testing, production deployment, support and training.
Conduct / facilitate data cleaning to remove old, unused data.
Implement an archiving solution for SAP data.
Provide escalated production support if needed.

Skills / Qualifications
B.Sc. or Business degree or equivalent
4+ years of experience in elements of data governance: quality, analysis, administration, architecture
Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Experience with or understanding of taxonomy management
Experience using modelling tools to convey concepts, architectures and designs
Superior attention to detail
Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
Ability to compare technologies and make recommendations to senior members of the team.
Experience in establishing a project plan and facilitating the setting of priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent inter-personal skills
Results-oriented, self-starter, capable of working independently and within a team environment to meet deadlines
Willing to work outside of normal business hours as part of a global team and to travel if required

Nice to have
Qualification in information science, data management, computer science
Experience working with information security practices and security software
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations
Experience with software development
Experience with SAP Master Data Management

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Responsibilities:
Architecture, design and code applications, with the ability to balance long-term goals with short-term and immediate business needs
Review and enhance existing high volume online transaction processing systems using .NET and SQL Server, with significant experience in designing the persistence layer.
Conduct data modeling, SQL queries, stored procedures and optimization for performance.
Manage database migration planning and validation.
Ensure effective integration of software across products, platforms and environments
Analyze existing applications to determine where problems occur and develop possible solutions
Create documentation of designs and solutions
Maintain data integrity and security in applications
Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (preferred) in Computer Science or equivalent.
Expertise in understanding, analyzing, designing and developing solutions for complex business needs.
Sstrong understanding of SQL Server including transaction processing, stored procedure and user defined function development
5+ years design and development experience of .NET / C#
Experience using and consuming Web APIs from both C# and JS
Experience in building high performance, highly scalable and fault-tolerant systems
Experience with Payroll and timesheet systems is a plus
Fluency in tools and techniques for analyzing and benchmarking performance of the database as a component of a complex enterprise software system.
Experience with application servers (IIS, Apache Tomcat or WebLogic).
Responsive, positive attitude with ability to thrive in a high-performance work group.
Strong time-management and organizational skills
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).
Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

Purpose of the Job:

This permanent, full-time position will be responsible for assisting our Relationship Managers, Commercial Services through direct member contact. You will be a part of our team to grow the size and profitability of the commercial book while minimizing loan risk and maximizing product penetration. You enjoy a fast-paced exciting environment with a commitment to achieving results.

The successful candidate will have experience in analyzing lending proposals in medium to large real estate & Construction Financing, lending in Hospitality industry and General Industry (working capital financing). A fast-paced and exciting environment in a high growth segment of our business will challenge successful candidates.

Key Responsibilities:

•Supporting our Relationship Managers, Commercial Services through analysis of financial and account operating data, and recommending appropriate courses of action for credit related matters.
Understanding member needs after discussions with the Relationship Manager and being capable of independently writing a lending proposal detaining both the financial and non-financial parameters important to decision making.Managing many of the routine account operating issues encountered by our commercial members, anticipating/recognizing members’ needs, and proactively making product and service recommendations.Liaising with other MCU staff and outside product/service suppliers to meet the needs of our members.Establishing personal goals and action plans to support CBC and Retail branch business objectives, with some community involvement required.Demonstrating an ongoing willingness to assume higher degrees of accountability and responsibility, leading to assumption of a position as a Relationship Manager, Commercial Services.
Actively monitors and manages the profitability of Meridian’s relationship with a member in order to retain and maintain business.
Keeps abreast of changes within diverse industry sectors and proactively identifies opportunities to improve the growth and development of the assigned portfolio by analysing member needs, trends, and competitor offerings.


Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

•Demonstrates organizational values through leadership and personal behaviors.
Post-secondary education or related job training, with detailed knowledge of financial accounting and lending principles.Strong personal commitment to professional development.Good knowledge of banking system and business account operating procedures.Excellent communication/presentation, interpersonal and team skills.Ability to work independently with confidence and strong commitment to member service.Willingness to work flexible hours, and train both on/off the job to improve general business and lending skills.Demonstrates a high capacity for increasingly complex workloads.

Experience the Difference!

We are a global team of 6,000 visionaries, doers, and makers. Our portfolio of over 25 brands touches lives in more than 50 countries. Together, we reimagine good mornings and endless summers, beauty and bonding, confidence and determination.

The Supply Chain Analyst role is designed to enhance the customer collaboration and inventory insights through the use of analytics that will identify opportunities to improve customer-vendor supply chain efficiencies. Manage and oversee the Customer’s inventory / service level expectations for replenishment and promotional activities at the Retailer’s DC and Store level with key collaboration between the Sales Team, Buyers, and Customer Inventory Analysts.

Through the CPFR/Vendor Managed Order Process, the Supply Chain Analyst will manage the customer business requirements and align with the expectations of the Sales plans at Edgewell in determining the inventory needs by account through analyses of point of sale information, current on-hand inventory and expected demands. The output from these analyses would include order creation and collaboration on product availability in accordance with the customer’s defined metrics and internal supply chain initiatives. This individual would work closely with Commercial Team functions and report to the Customer Service Supply Chain Manager.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Utilize Vendor Management Inventory and/or Collaborative Planning, Forecasting and Replenishment business requirements that are aligned with customer expectations.
Drive decision analytics to decouple upstream and downstream implications that range in order fluctuations, forecast inaccuracies, and other variations in consumption and supply
Manage the Retailer’s Inventory levels at DC / Store Shelf.
Partners with the Customer Replenishment/Inventory Personal
Analyzes supply chain performance in conjunction with VMI/CPFR customers’ systems/expectations to improve the joint supply chain metrics.
Prepare comprehensive inventory optimization opportunities designed to maximize shelf presence, growth, and new opportunities.
Conduct on-going business analyses including account specific reports, business reviews, new item tracking, pricing reports (ie. promo vs. non-promo pricing swings), internal metric tracking (ie. shipments, profit, supply chain, and forecasting), and other account score-carding requirements (ie. Ad activity tracking).
Analyze inventory optimization strategies and identify trends to improve growth and profitability
Conduct consumption driven analytics to improve sales strategies and inventory projections. Providing insight and understanding.
Ability to retrieve and analyze POS data to provide sales trends.
Works closely with Internal Cross Functional Teams/Demand Teams to align on forecasts needs.
Leads improvement initiatives that deliver enhanced supply chain performance and alignment with Cost to Serve strategies.
Lead collaboration processes to align on joint strategic businesses initiatives with Customers.
Exhibits proficiency in all key Customer systems and processes.

CORE COMPETENCIES
Achieving results – Set personal standards and goals that consistently exceed expectations
Initiative – Proactive problem solving, takes action, reacts quickly to opportunity
Building internal partnerships – Sought after for guidance and assistance. Key groups – Sales, Distribution, Demand and Supply Planning and Marketing
Influencing for results
Maintaining focus and accountability
Team Work – working well with others, respected by others, supports group decisions, and shares information.

Key Performance Indicators:
Customer Engagement
Customer Scorecard and Service Level Performance
Inventory Turns
Minimal Store Outs / Days of Supply
Forecast / Demand Consumption
Inventory Optimization Goals
Cost To Serve Analytics and Savings
Non Trade Related Fines Reduction / Exemption

Works with
Sales / Commercial Team
Customers’ Replenishment personnel
Demand and Supply Planning Teams
Information Technology Team
Distribution
Sales Planning
Finance

Undergraduate degree required
Analytically driven/proficiency
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Must be self actuated and have the ability to adapt to change.
Computer literate. Knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook and Webex
Must have working knowledge of basic accounting functions/skills.
Willing to occasionally travel

Lockheed Martin Canada RMS Configuration and Data Management (CMDM) team is seeking Junior Configuration Data Management Analyst. This position will provide Configuration Management (CM) and Data Management support to multi programs. The Data Management (DM) discipline ensures the Contract Data Requirement List / Subcontract Data Requirement List (CDRL/SDRL) requirements are identified, recorded, assigned to appropriate disciplines, and tracked in accordance with DM Standards (Formal Data Management).

DM creates and monitors the CDRL/SDRL submittal schedule. DM resolves data issues, distributes schedule notices for pending data submittals to ensure on-time delivery and creates status reports for management review and action. DM reviews the deliverable program data to determine completeness and submits to the customer as specified in the contract.

The Configuration Management (CM) discipline works closely with the program execution and engineering teams to manage the technical baseline. CM tasking in this role will include the use of CM tools for configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, configuration verification and audits, product release and delivery and provide solutions to a variety of CM technical challenges.

Daily responsibilities include establishing and maintaining program CM systems, including the program documents and managing configuration baselines, ensuring all required process steps have been completed prior to release and documenting released configurations. Position requires great attention to detail with respect to managing hardware development environments and program technical data, understanding of ITAR processes and strong presentation skills. Candidate must be an advocate of continuous process improvements.

Employee TypeFull Time
Business Environment
Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 98,000 people worldwide, including nearly 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 75 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of major programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities.
Clearance required for roleNato Secret
Required skills, qualifications and experience
Bachelor’s Degree, Library Information Science / College Degree in Information and Library Technologies related field or equivalent combination of related experience and education (each two years of related experience can substitute for one year of education)
2+ years of related experience in Data Management or Configuration Management
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Products, specifically: Excel, Word, Access
Experience with Windchill or PLM/ PDM environment is an asset
Above average oral and written communication skills
Clearance Requirement: A clearance is not required upon hire, but the position will require the candidate to obtain and maintain a minimum of a NATO/SECRET clearance.
Desired skills, qualifications and experience
Self-Starter, willing to learn new tools and work with a variety of technical and non-technical disciplines
Ability to pro-actively interface with team members
Data Management and/or Configuration Management Experience
Experience working in an Engineering design environment, interfacing with Hardware, Systems, Software and Test Engineers
Proficient in use and administration of Windchill PDM
Understands principles, standards and processes, such as described in EIA-649B, Configuration Management Standard
Demonstrated ability to support multiple ongoing projects and parallel release activities
Equal Opportunity Statement
Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.
