job_title: Supply Chain Analyst - SD Key User
job_description:
CanadaOur purpose is simple and compelling: To release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.
ROCKWOOL products save energy and water and reduce CO2 emissions, protect buildings from the spread of fire; reduce waste; improve acoustic comfort, building performance and aesthetics; and enhance Precision Growing, thereby improving the efficiency of fresh food production.
While the stone we use may be millions of years old, what we do with it is cutting-edge. Every day, ROCKWOOL colleagues are developing and applying new technologies to release yet more potential of stone wool to enrich modern life.
Would you also be proud to enrich society like we do? now to join us as we improve modern living conditions for millions of people worldwide.
POSITION: Supply Chain Analyst
The ROCKWOOL Group’s main business area is building insulation, providing thermal comfort along with fire safety and acoustical comfort for all types of buildings.
This is the Role:
Responsible for gathering data and conducting analysis with the goal of improving the organizations’ s supply chain
operations.
Sets and or, works within the guidelines of decision authority
Respects, listens, learns and challenges others thinking in a constructive manner to help all to improve in everything that we do.
Produces solutions to various challenges and problems, and able to connect one issue with the bigger picture.
Analyses and structures information and communications to meet audience’s needs.
Seeks new opportunities and ways to improve.
Develops innovative products, processes, ideas and solutions.
Utilize computer systems and software in order to research, analyze and document failures and inefficiencies in the supply chain in order to improve overall supply chain effectiveness.
Supply Chain Reporting – Create and generate reports as required by Supply Chain Management using Business Warehouse and Rockbis queries.
Maintain Price records in SAP
Coordinate Online Price List updates.
Maintain external Customer data bases.
Generate monthly Claims report
Analyse Customer issues to develop tools and process to improve customer satisfaction.
Execute SD related projects, including testing, documentation, and analysis
Provide EDI support for SD and LES Modules – including but not limited to, new customer set ups, new carrier set ups, changes to current accounts, trouble shooting and problem solving
Liaise with GRIT EDI support team, perform system testing
Create and maintain documentation relating to EDI functions
Maintain SD Master Data (SAP)– new accounts, customer hierarchy, pricing and discounts
Create templates for uploads as required
Support Customer Service and Accounts Receivable staff with Master data issues
Liaise with Marketing Company to ensure price list data and format is correct
MM Master Data – Assist Optimization Manager with MM master data duties when necessary (vacation, sickness, projects)
Provide efficient and accurate data entry into business system
This is what you offer:
Accredited University / College Degree, Appropriate College or Trade Accreditation, or equivalent experience.
Computer literate (Word, Excel)
5+ years’ experience in a related functional area
Knowledge of SAP
Drive, commitment, self-motivation and high energy.
Ability to work under pressure,
Good communication skills,
Passionate and values driven and will embrace the company’s core values including integrity, honesty and trust
Problem solving abilities
Practical business sense
Ability to successfully manage multiple priorities and meet established deadlines in a fact paced environment
Interested?
If you recognize yourself in this opportunity, please apply, sending an English version of your resume.
ABOUT ROCKWOOL North America
At the ROCKWOOL Group, we are committed to enriching the lives of everyone who comes into contact with our solutions. Our expertise is perfectly suited to tackle many of today’s biggest sustainability and development challenges, from energy consumption and noise pollution to fire resilience, water scarcity and flooding. Our range of products reflects the diversity of the world’s needs, while supporting our stakeholders in reducing their own carbon footprint. Stone wool is a versatile material and forms the basis of all our businesses. With approx. 10,500 passionate colleagues in 38 countries, we are the world leader in stone wool solutions, from building insulation to acoustic ceilings, external cladding systems to horticultural solutions, engineered fibres for industrial use to insulation for the process industry and marine & offshore. We encourage you to join our team!

Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. About EPL
At EPL, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.

We help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. Our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in Canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.

We have built our reputation on doing things really well. We have a bright, talented, and engaging team with a lot of passion for what we do: helping large energy users across North America reduce their energy/carbon footprints and quantifying energy costs.

The Role
Recent and projected growth has led us to search for a high energy professional to join the Building Analytics Team in our Toronto office. The person will join us at a time where we are experiencing outstanding company growth. A steep learning curve is anticipated. Key aspects of the role:

o Drive down energy use intensity at large commercial properties as part of our Building Analytics Team, ideally while enhancing the livability and health of these same facilities.
o Energy conservation studies and audits at large commercial buildings.
o Measurement and Verification (M&V) of energy and demand savings projects.
o Sub-metering system design and specifications.
o Studies/analysis related to sub-meter cost allocation and data analytics.

About You
We seek an intelligent person with strong problem-solving skills capable of handling a wide variety of technical challenges. High energy levels and a team-based approach are of great value; just as important is a determination to overcome obstacles. Above all, this person should look to establish and maintain a reputation for integrity over the long term.

Nominally, we seek an engineering graduate. Applicants in Engineering Physics, Math and Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering will be given special consideration.

2-4 years of consulting experience delivering a range of energy conservation and building optimization services to large commercial properties. Services include; energy audits and feasibility studies, building performance optimization ( incl. commissioning and retro-commissioning), and M&V plans/verification.

Demonstrated experience as a valued member of a successful team is beneficial.

It is important that the applicant can communicate clearly and efficiently'

What to expect
People are the most important part of our company.

We have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. The success of our people drives the success of our company. Each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.

EPL team members also:

Unlimited Vacation & Flexible Work Hours (you own your time)
Vibrant workplace & regular team fun (events & activities)
Work with super smart and nice people!

Toronto, ONTemporaryDream Office Management Corporation is looking for a Data Analyst.
Are data privacy and data protection topics that you are passionate about? Are you focused on securing user and business data using a variety of tools and technologies? Do you enjoy architecting solutions and implementing changes that will have a positive effect on our business, users, and stakeholders? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.
Who are you?
You’ll be part of our Infrastructure & Technology Operations group, which is focused on providing top notch computing services to Dream’s 1,000 employees. Working with the security, network, communications and support teams, you will be responsible for supporting our data privacy initiatives at our Canadian and International offices. You are not afraid of change and serve as a change agent. You will explore ideas and are always driving forward rather than settling for the status quo. You’ve worked in fast-paced environments and understand how to juggle big-picture thinking with day-to-day deliverables. You have experience understanding and articulating technology risk in a business environment, and working with a team to remediate those risks. You are respectful of current operating processes, but look to develop new ideas to bring better results. Still interested? Read on!

Who are we?
Dream Unlimited Corp. is a real estate investment, development and management company that creates value at every stage of the real estate cycle. Since the business was created in 1994, Dream has grown substantially, becoming one of Canada’s leading and most consistently innovative real estate companies with over $14 billion of assets. Dream Office Management Corporation provides technology, human resources, and facilities support to the Dream group of companies, currently 5 publicly traded entities.
While on the surface we may not seem that different from our competitors, it’s our attitude and approach that truly set us apart. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit; we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.
We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work and have fun with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.

And the Infrastructure & Technology Operations team?
Our goal is to provide the best possible user experience by ensuring our users have the technical tools and infrastructure in place to perform their job functions efficiently. We are continually upgrading and driving our initiatives, processes and goals in order to respond to changes in our business needs and ensure that the appropriate infrastructure is in place to support the business.
We strive to stay at the cutting edge of technology to be prepared for Dream’s continued growth in the coming years. All we’re missing is an enthusiastic Data Protection Analyst – are you ready?

What will you do?
You will be responsible for the organization and privacy of data that our five business lines rely on every day. Here are some specifics of your role to give you some scope:
Work with the Manager, IT Security to oversee the ongoing development of the data protection strategy and implementation across all lines of business
Author and audit, privacy, security, and data protection policies
Implement technical standards / data protection frameworks such as GDPR, PIPEDA ,NIST, etc.
Translation of privacy legislation knowledge into technical solutions to protect the privacy of employee and customer data
Managing and auditing technology solutions that support data privacy
Conduct data and privacy risk assessments, and articulate the outcome as business risk
Perform data classification across a variety of system types and storage methods, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams in order to implement solutions and privacy controls
Monitor compliance of data privacy against best practices
Be available for inquiries from data subjects and business stakeholders relating to data protection practices, and data subject rights
Communicate effectively with all levels of the business
Create and maintain documentation that supports data and privacy activities
Be available after hours when needed to assist with incident response, should the need arise
Perform related duties and tasks as assigned by the Manager, IT Security

What type of experience do you have?
We’ve listed just a few select qualifications that we consider to be very important for this role. We can cover the rest when we chat.
Degree, diploma, or certificate in Information Security, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in an information security or audit role
Minimum 5 years’ experience with technologies that support data management (classification tools, Data Loss Prevention tools, data tagging tools)
Experience with implementation and use of data classification standards
Knowledge of organizational privacy controls
Experience with technical standards / data protection frameworks such as PIPEDA, GDPR, NIST, and ISO
Experience with both security and privacy risk assessments, with DPIA experience a plus
The ability to translate technology risk into business risk
A deep understanding of data classification, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
A strong track record of being able to interface and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to implement solutions and privacy controls
Experience authoring or auditing privacy, security, and data protection policies
Operational experience with incident response and breach notification processes
Experience in managing projects and large scale enterprise wide roll-outs.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Exceptional organization and time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Strong change management skills; change agent
With your manager and the security team, you set clear goals and objectives, and then you and the team deliver!
Knowledge in the following is considered a significant asset, so let us know what you know!
Data collection, storage, and processing privacy best practices
Information security or audit certifications, such as CISSP, CISA, SSCP, CIPM
Experience with frameworks, such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST SP 800-37,
Experience with cloud email technologies (Office 365, Mimecast) and filtering mechanisms
Experience with document management solutions leveraging OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Teams
McAfee endpoint DLP experience a plus
Palo Alto Networks firewalls / SSL decryption and data filtering
Management and implementation of access controls
When you come in to meet, we’ll want to hear about your previous security and privacy, but also about your business interaction experiences. What are your strengths? What areas are you looking to grow? We’ll also be asking you to demonstrate your knowledge given various real world scenarios.
This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.

job_title: Business Analyst - for on-demand transit system
job_description:
Role:

This is an opportunity in the exciting and fast-growing transportation technology industry. Public transit is being transformed from a system of static, scheduled fixed-routes, to a dynamic on-demand network, and you’ll be one of the pioneers shaping this transformation.

As Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for analyzing transportation operations data, performing service design, running simulations, assessing key performance indicators, supporting new service launches, driving operational improvements, and providing technical systems support. You will develop a deep understanding of urban mobility challenges faced by transit operators. You will become an expert on RideCo’s technology platform and data-driven design and operation of transportation services. As a key technical and analytics resource for operations managers, you’ll have a vital role in shaping the design, performance, and success of our clients’ next-generation on-demand transportation services. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

Generate and analyze operational performance reports: Build comprehensive performance analysis reports spanning rider user-experience, driver user-experience, marketing, operating efficiency, and unit economics. Compare the performance against goals, evaluate trends, and identify areas for improvement. Review the performance reports with stakeholders and client operations team to generate insights and actions.
Design new transportation services: Analyze urban area (density, road network etc.), travel patterns, user-profiles, demand data, client requirements, and design an on-demand transit services that are superior to existing transportation options. Configure the RideCo technology platform reflective of your envisioned service model.
Run simulations and optimize service design: Perform simulations to analyze performance and operational KPIs. Iterate on the service model by tuning and optimizing dozens of parameters such as dynamic routing engine settings, vehicle count and mix, supply positioning, service frequency, location and density of potential stops, and demand models. Collaborate with the client, operations managers and other key stakeholders throughout this process. Support the client in setting targets and KPIs for the service prior to launch.
Support new service launch: Support operations managers during the launch process, including monitoring KPIs on launch week and making system changes as needed.
Provide systems support: Provide ongoing technical systems and analytics support to operations managers. Advise them on using the system’s dashboards and interpreting the data. Perform system configuration changes based on feedback from operations staff, drivers, and passengers.
Drive continuous improvement: Collaboratively develop weekly/monthly actions to drive continuous improvements, and to achieve the service’s objectives (e.g. user experience, ridership, operating efficiency, financials etc.). Work with the client, operations managers, and other stakeholders to execute on initiatives.
Improve internal processes and tooling: Identify ways to further automate and systematize our internal processes, including with new analysis and visualization tools. Share your ideas with team members and collaboratively champion internal process/tooling improvements.
Support product improvements: Expand your knowledge of the transportation industry, understand clients’ pain points and identify gaps/opportunities in the product. Share your insights with the product team and assist the product manager in designing new features/improvements to RideCo’s platform.
Educate: Continuously expand the collective knowledge-base of the company through multi-disciplinary learning and knowledge sharing.


Who we are

http://www.rideco.com

RideCo builds the best on-demand transit systems in the world. Fleet operators and public transit agencies in North America and Asia use RideCo’s cloud-based software platform to provide on-demand shared rides in dynamically routed buses, vans, and cars.

Have you experienced getting frustrated with public buses and switched to driving a car? What about being stuck in traffic while commuting to work solo-driving your car? Have you seen buses drive around in residential areas with very few passengers on-board and wondered how inefficient that seems to be? You’re likely aware of the first & last mile access challenges faced by transit hubs. We are solving these problems by re-imagining shared mobility. Imagine a world where vehicles have dynamic routes responsive to real-time trip demand. This ‘dynamic shuttle’ (or van /sedan) would pick you up, on-demand, at or near your doorstep and take you to your destination or transit hub. Along the way, it may pick-up other passengers going in your direction. Your experience will be seamless: less waiting, less walking, fewer transfers, shorter travel time, and timely pickups and drop-offs. RideCo’s ‘dynamic shuttle’ platform enables this seamless experience and low-cost shared rides for vehicle fleet operators and their passengers. By seamlessly moving more people in fewer vehicles we are catalyzing a generational shift in how people get around cities and towns. This means commuters spend less time in transit and more time doing what they enjoy.

Our clients include some of the world's largest fleet operators such as Grab and Los Angeles Metro. RideCo powers a diverse range of use cases today including residential/suburban travel, first-mile-last-mile for train stations, long-distance commuters, university campus, military base, corporate employee transport, and international airport. We are investing to scale up and capture the growing demand for on-demand shared rides solutions.


Requirements:

Education: Undergraduate degree in Applied Mathematics / Statistics / Finance / Management Engineering, or related discipline.
Data wizard: Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office tools. Experience working with business intelligence or visualization tools such as Tableau / SAS / Cognos. Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL is an asset.
Experience in data modeling/analysis or engineering role(s).
Top notch communicator: Strong written/oral communication and presentation skills. Experience preparing reports for management.
Location: Based in Waterloo, Ontario or willing to relocate.
Willing to travel approximately 15%, as needed.


Compensation

Base salary: $70K - $100K, commensurate with qualifications / experience + performance-based bonus or stock options


Contact

Email your resume (or link to your LinkedIn profile) and cover letter to:

resume@rideco.com

Email Subject: “Business Analyst”

Disassemble and reassemble computer hardware and peripherals using a variety of hand tools and power tools.
Handle minuscule and delicate components when repairing equipment which requires accurate placement and removal.
Ensure users receive information on systems updates, errors and features.
Remain current with frequent developments in the field of information technology.

Supervision
Provide direction to others in how to carry out work tasks.
Ensure adherence to quality standards and procedures for short-term staff.

Qualifications
3 year Community College diploma in Information Technology or related field of study.
Requires 3 years of relevant experience.

Effort

Physical Effort:
A typical work day consists of greater than 3.5 hours of low physical effort for activities such as:
Intermittent periods of keyboarding to process documents, enter data into databases, and maintain accurate records.
A typical work day occasionally requires moderate physical effort for activities such as:
Lifting and moving heavy or awkward objects such as computer equipment and peripherals.
Working in awkward or constrained physical positions or spaces while repairing and installing equipment.
Elements of high physical effort are not a regular feature of this job.

Mental Effort:
A typical work day consists of up to 2 hours of routine mental effort for activities such as:
Collecting routine information, word processing routine documents such as correspondence and reports, and inputting data in databases and spreadsheets.
A typical work day consists of greater than 3.5 hours of moderate mental effort for activities such as:
Providing expertise and practical assistance in delivering services that comply with established standards.
Identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing problems and complaints to ensure that inquiries are successfully resolved.
Eliciting additional information from users to accurately diagnose problems.
Implementing non-standard solutions and work-arounds.
Evaluating hardware, software, and transmission service alternatives as business requirements change.
A typical work day consists of up to 2 hours of high mental effort for activities such as:
Carrying out investigative work on a variety of requirements, information flow, and processes.

Working Conditions

Physical Environment:
Occasionally exposed to dust and dirt when assembling, disassembling, repairing, and installing equipment.
Occasionally required to work in confined spaces when installing and repairing equipment.

Psychological Environment:
Occasionally interacts with individuals who may be rude or upset.
Frequently handles competing requests from multiple sources.

Health & Safety:
Disassemble and reassemble computer hardware and peripherals using a variety of hand tools and power tools.

How To Apply

To apply for this job, please submit your application online.

Victoria, BCThe Research Analyst reports to the local Market Research Director or Senior Research Analyst. The Research Analyst is responsible for supporting the development of local research output and thought leadership. Specifically, this position provides support for gathering and analyzing local market data and interpreting this information to identify trends in the market. Output of the analysis is used to produce research deliverables to be included in pitch and/or proposal materials and reflects opinions of various market dynamics. The Research Analyst is also accountable for accurate and proactive maintenance of third party and proprietary databases with local market data, as well as pulling data from said systems to support thought leadership and forecast development. This position is not specific to a service line, but may specialize by property type.
Job Description

Key responsibilities include:
Conduct property level analytics or retrieve comps

Receive requests and collect all input and documentation
Create and analyze market data spreadsheets
Utilize inputs provided to develop market comps
Review analysis with Research Supervisor
Participate in development of local requests for research information for pitch and/or proposal materials with Research Director and Marketing

Receive requests for data and/or analysis from Research Senior Analyst, fee-earner, or marketing team
Perform research analysis for pitch and/or proposal materials to develop pitch and/or proposal materials
Consolidate information for pitch and/or proposal material content
Work with Senior Research Analyst and Marketing to organize data for presentations
Support Research Supervisor in creation of market analysis and work with Marketing Specialist to publicize market analysis to social media platforms and website
Manage research databases

Proactively reach out to fee-earners, Managing Principal, and regional research teams to actively update and maintain databases within a defined frequency
Routinely cleanse databases and update with new information
Work with Project Coordinators to update databases after deal closes with deal terms and transaction information
Work with Senior Research Analysts to accurately cleanse data in databases
Generate and maintain statistical reports
Reporting relationship

Role will report to the following:
Solid line reporting to Managing Principal
Dotted line reporting to Regional Research Director
Metrics

Role will be evaluated on the following:
Quality of written market narrative
Service Delivery: Request Turnaround Time and Quality
Data quality
Pursuits supported
Center of Excellence reporting/participation
BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

Demonstrated experience should include:
Bachelor’s degree required
Professional acumen, demonstrated interest in real estate leasing and capital markets business
Economically versed
Experience in data entry/data management and time series analysis/forecasting
1-3 years’ experience in real estate or business for other positions
Competencies
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to successfully resolve problems with minimal direction
Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills
Ability to plan, organize and manage processes
Knowledge of statistical calculations involved in correctly reporting vacancy rates, absorption, construction, rental rates, leasing, sales activity, renovation and proposed activity
Strong knowledge of economic data and analytical tools

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

The IT Developer is responsible for supporting, designing, testing and providing regular updates & maintenance to both new & existing custom software and data models. The IT Developer works collaboratively with Data Analysts, IT staff and other key stakeholders to gather clinical and business needs, perform workflow analysis, process design, testing, ongoing support, training and general maintenance of customized applications. The IT Developer also helps to align clinical, administrative & financial systems with the organizational objectives and strategies and provides recommendations regarding the potential use of various information systems.


JOB DUTIES:
Works collaboratively to identify user requirements and prepare business and technical specifications; and where indicated translates requirements, specifications and rules into data models or customized software applications;Reviews new and existing custom applications, features, functionalities and workflows and identifies any gaps, risks and/or opportunities for enhancement;Works collaboratively with Data Analysts & IT staff across the organization;Support and maintenance of SQL databases;Develop and maintain ETLs for data transfer to SQL;Creation of data reports through a variety of tools;Prepares and delivers training and materials to support newly developed IT systems and enhancements to existing systems;Manages, monitors, and troubleshoots operational issues and requests using the ticket tracking system;Prepares and maintains support and troubleshooting documentation for the team;Participate as a resource for IT projects;Assist in the evaluation, selection and implementation of new technology;Coordinate with external vendors for required support on software tools;Escalates issues to managers as required;On-Call responsibilities on a rotational basis (based on need);Performs other position related duties as required;

REQUIREMENTS:
Diploma or Degree in Software Development or equivalent;Strong verbal, written communication, customer service skills, with the ability to communicate technical items in a user friendly way that non-technical persons can understand;Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities;Proven knowledge and experience working with Visual Studio including VB, .NET, HTML 5, JavaScript and CSS;Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL 2012 and above relational databases, SSIS and SSRS reporting;Knowledge and experience with Microsoft BI tools and Data Cube development, MDX/DAX;Data modeling and warehouse experience;Experience with Meditech Magic is an asset (specifically Meditech Data Repository);Experience in Healthcare is an asset;Demonstrated commitment to our core values of Compassion, Innovation, Courage and Trust;Demonstrated understanding of, and commitment to, Lakeridge Health's comprehensive safety program and practices, including staff, patient and environmental safety, and participation in regular in-service education; and,Proven good attendance record, with the capability of maintaining the same standard.

This position is open to all qualified staff throughout Lakeridge Health.

The terms and conditions of employment are in accordance with Lakeridge Health's policies and procedures.

Kelowna, BCImagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Toronto, ONLimelight is looking for a talented and motivated student to join the team as Junior QA Analyst to help us continue to develop our industry leading experience marketing software. Reporting to a QA Lead, the role will be part of Limelight’s QA team who will work closely day-to-day with developers and product managers to ensure software deliveries are smooth, high-quality, and reliable.

If you’ve got that spark and want to be a part of a dynamic team building something great, we look forward to hearing from you!

What You’ll Be Responsible For

Plan, design, and execute manual (black box) testing for web-based SaaS application and mobile (iPad) application
Report & write the necessary documentation to report test results
Provide support to your colleagues across departments (development, product, client services)
Ability to understand business goals and perform requirement analysis.
Maintain & update existing documentations & test cases
Tools we are using: JIRA, Confluence, and TestRail

What You’ll Be Bringing

1+ year of manual testing experience in a product / web application space (coop / internship included)
Education background in programs geared towards Software Development such as Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, etc.
General understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and the importance of testing process in ensuring quality and reliable releases
Familiarity with common tools & processes such as JIRA, browser’s developer tools, Agile/Scrum.
Ability to quickly learn and become familiar with the software product being tested - ability to understand the business domain & customers’ needs is a plus.
Understand feature requirements to define & implement test cases / plans
Strong writing & communication skills - ability to clearly articulate verbally & in writing bugs that were encountered and steps to reproduce them.
Work closely with product & development team through design reviews & kick-off meetings to ensure a consistent understanding of the features / bugs being resolved.
Familiarity working with multiple browsers / Operating Systems (Chrome, Firefox, IE, Safari) and multiple devices (desktop, iPad, AppleTV)

Our Tech Stack
Our platform: Java-based application (Java 8), with Spring Framework (Spring 5) and supporting Spring Boot-based microservices (Spring Boot 2) with Docker. We use PostgreSQL as our database. On the front-end, our legacy application is built with JSP, jQuery, and AngularJS - while our new portal UI is built with Angular 6, RxJS, D3.js, SCSS.

We are using AWS as our hosting infrastructure. The platform can be built, tested, and deployed with a single click through Jenkins. While we got the “CI” (Continuous Integration) part down, we are still in the process of building our full automation test suite to get to the “CD” (Continuous Delivery) part.

Our Culture
At Limelight, we strive to make everyday a fun, valuable work experience, where team members are encouraged, supported, and given the chance to do work that is meaningful to them.

We Offer You

The opportunity to create a more connected world, one experience at a time;
The chance to have an impact in an early-stage, well-funded company that is growing quickly;
Being part of a team of hard-working, ambitious and caring individuals who will help you learn and grow professionally;
We have all the perks: great downtown location, snacks, flex work hours, work from home days, team-driven personal development plans, just to mention a few.
The big thing at Limelight is very simple: we treat each and every team member the way we want to be treated.
As a company, we believe in giving you a work experience that you enjoy, that you excel at, and that you can balance with the rest of your life.

About Limelight
Limelight’s technology and team turn branded experiences into the results brands and agencies need. We partner with some of the world’s leading brands to create amazing consumer experiences and dramatically better results, all backed by data and analytics.
A Silicon Valley venture backed company, Limelight boasts more than 25 Fortune 500 brands as customers and is growing every month. For more information, please visit:
www.limelightplatform.com [http://www.limelightplatform.com].

Next Steps
Please include a cover letter and résumé with your application. We thank everyone for applying, however, only those candidates who have been selected will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Visit www.limelightplatform.com to learn more about us.

A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Limelight’s values. We are an equal opportunity employer; a company of people of varied backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Limelight welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We thank you for your interest in Limelight.

Montréal, QCAt Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Who we are

We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company, we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate.

Rogers Digital team is seeking a Sr. Business Systems Analyst to work on project definition, documentation and delivery for the Rogers and Fido front end delivery teams. Reporting to the Sr. Manager BSA, the successful candidate will add significant value to the delivery of effective Digital solutions for high profile Rogers & Fido initiatives that enhance both consumer and business customer experience.

This position involves the following primary responsibilities:

Document internal business user and functional specification requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, and task and workflow analysis in moderate to highly complex environments.
Prepare documentation on expected benefits, use cases, current/proposed process, workflows, data flows, process re-engineering studies, functional specifications, risk integration, end-user adoption plans/ guides and organization structures.
Interact with the users of the functional applications to understand their needs and to anticipate ways in which technological solutions can enhance the business processes.
Collaborate with Product Owners, Design and Delivery teams to achieve a holistic solution
Provide excellent cross-organizational communications and subject matter expertise.
Review the technical design, development and implementation plan and vendor statement of work for assigned projects.
Represent project stakeholders throughout project delivery.
Preparation of system documentation including T-shirt sizing, Requirements Matrix, PS1, PS2, Solution Design Specifications and testing guidelines following the IT System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Conduct project review sessions, obtain sign offs, and coordinate acceptance tests to ensure timely delivery of requirements.
Interact with Systems Analyst/Programmers to ensure that questions and discrepancies about specifications are resolved during the solution development process.
Conduct Gap Analysis.
Provide implementation support and assist with post implementation support

Qualifications, Skills and Attributes:
Undergraduate degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
Must be Bilingual in English and French (Oral, Writing, Reading)
5 - 8 years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst preferably with knowledge of Telecommunications products.
3 to 5 years’ experience using Rogers systems preferred and/or an asset
Experience with a variety of Project Management, Business Process Management and Software Development Lifecycle methodologies (Waterfall and Agile).
Demonstrated success working with internal and external business teams to understand and gather requirements and working with project teams to meet expectations.
Ability to quickly grasp new ideas and solutions, and communicate effectively with colleagues (business and technical staff) and end users.
Excellent decision-making, verbal and written communication skills; interpersonal and organizational skills.
Ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization.
Experience working with external vendors.
Core Competencies: Customer service orientation; teamwork and collaboration; adaptability; initiative; analytical thinking.
Role-Specific Competencies: Business Analysis; innovative design skills, problem solving; work-flow analysis; project management.
Ability to express ideas and facts in a clear and understandable manner, tailoring communication to the intended audience.
Demonstrated problem solving skills.
Highly developed analytical and logical reasoning skills.
Excellent time management and priority management skills.
Proactive, responsive and focused.

North York, ON**Description**

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe.

We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

Pearson is constantly looking to add to our AMAZING team! We are actively searching for a detailed and highly organized **Principal Analyst** for our Sales Ops, Reporting and Analytics (R&A) CANADA team. One must not only thoroughly understand data, but can visualize how it all comes together for the business and effectively provide your expertise.

The overall responsibility of this role is to design, develop, implement, test, deploy and maintain business intelligence tools, reports, and dashboards. You will support all standard reporting, ad-hoc reporting, statistical analysis and benchmarking, forecasting, predictive modeling, and influence of operational optimization, transforming business reporting requirements into meaningful visualizations, KPIs and dashboards. You will be responsible for an efficient and effective communication stream within the team with minimum supervision.

**The opportunity will be located at our Toronto, CANADA office.**

**Essential Responsibilities: **

+ Gather requirements for reports and interactive dashboards

+ Develop, and support the development of reports and visualizations that address business needs

+ Perform data analysis to ensure on-going data integrity, quality and operational efficiency

+ Analyzing data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing summary of data analyses

+ Adherences to publication approval standards for dashboard release reviews and provide feedback to help with process improvement

+ Disseminate information regarding tools, reports, or metadata enhancements

+ Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards, or other tools

+ Maintain catalog of reports, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets

+ Discusses reporting, or information needs with stakeholders, strategic and business partners, and teams

+ Participate in ongoing decisions concerning data collections, data design, methodology, and data analysis

+ Works together with BI Mgr. that design and build data models and internal ETL-processes

**Qualifications**

**Required Knowledge and Experience: **

+ In-depth experience in data reporting & analytics tools, process, methodologies and best practices

+ Knowledge and wide application of principles, theories, and concepts, and working knowledge of other related fields

+ Expert knowledge of Tableau development required; data management & reading code-huge plus!

+ Solid experience in building reports and dashboards with Tableau Desktop and administering Tableau Server – critical!

+ Strong, successful storytelling with data, data visualization design and visualization best practices

+ Knowledge in designing data models for optimal use for analytics

+ High-level analytical and problem-solving skills

+ Solid time management skills - including ability to work well under a fast-paced high-pressure business environment, plan, set priorities, adapt to change, and meet established timelines

+ Ability to manage team deliverables in close alignment with overall departmental and corporate objectives

+ BA in Business Administration or related discipline, or equivalent combination of education/work experience

Pearson is an international media company with world-leading businesses in education, business information and consumer publishing. Pearson fuels the growing demand for effective education and high-quality information in the global knowledge economy, and share a common goal: to help people get on in their lives through education.

Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together

The Senior Business Analyst – Purchasing and Inventory Management will play a critical role in leading and developing process improvement projects which will lead to improved customer experience while making our operations more effective and efficient.

job_title: Supply Chain & Logistics Analyst (1 yr Contract)
job_description:
Temporary, ContractLocation:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Overview
Reporting directly to the Supply Chain and Logistics Director, the incumbent provides analytical support for all aspects for the Distribution Centre (DC) operations. The incumbent analyzes and monitors the inbound and outbound flow of all products in to the DC, out of the DC and in to the stores.
Primary Responsibilities
 Develops, prepares and monitors event import and replenishment purchase orders including container plans, letters of credit, transfer payments, load booking reports, amendments, customs clearance and seasonal schedules to ensure each program event is planned accordingly and to avoid delays. Completes all necessary documents and distributes to appropriate key stakeholders.
 Monitors shipment status and event tracking reports to liaise between Category Management, Global Procurement, DC’s and vendors and ensure products are received in time for event releases.
 Reviews and monitors DC activities through various inventory systems to provide status, adjustment and no ship reports etc. as required.
 Reviews, enters and prepares invoices for payment to ensure appropriate signing authority is obtained prior to submitting invoices to accounting for payment.
 Monitors and responds to email and telephone inquiries to resolve issues or concerns such as event releases, shipment status, inventory management systems and transportation etc.
 Reviews and monitors excess inventory from seasonal event stock to ensure DC’s maintain a pick accuracy of 99.7%, identify excess inventory and arrange overstock to be shipped to appropriate stores promptly.
 Reviews events and orders for new or closing stores with Operations and Retail Concepts to ensure stock is transferred and cancelled accordingly.
 Compiles data to review and prepare various reports for internal and external review.
 Monitors and responds to Marketing Call Centre inquiries and concerns
 Review of claims submitted by stores in the Store DC claims.
Skills, Experience & Education
Skills
This position requires a demonstrated level of initiative and judgment in order to organize and prioritize tasks, workload and projects. Courtesy, tact and diplomacy are required in dealing with colleagues in every day working relationships.
 Requires an understanding of basic duties and tasks to carry out straight forward procedures.
 Capacity to follow directives and fulfill requests with minimal supervision and takes limited discretionary action as required.
 Professional manner, tact, diplomacy and discretion in dealing with others.
 Ability to identify problems and draw upon a range of choices to formulate solutions.
 Adaptable to set and prioritize work with occasional exceptions. Able to work with diverse personalities and styles.
 Communicates with clarity, verbally and in one on one or group situations, or over the telephone.
 Computer skills to maintain databases and spreadsheets and produce accurate reports and documents.
 Knowledge of inventory management software and systems and logistical procedures such as customs clearance, shipping and tracking.
Experience
Greater than two years, but less than or equal, to three years logistics or equivalent experience.
Education
Post secondary education equivalent to a college diploma in business, supply chain, or related field.
Certificates, Licenses or Registration
N/A
Working Conditions
* Incumbents are required to exert the following physical effort; however, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Effort
Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with the frequent opportunity to stand or move about. The incumbent may be required to occasionally kneel, reach, bend, or stretch and carry light objects consistent with usual office materials such as, paper, files and other office supplies.
Physical Environment
Work is mainly performed in a comfortable office environment where there is minimal exposure to dust, fumes, temperature variance and other sensory attributes. Level of noise at any given time is mild to moderate and may experience frequent interruptions
Sensory Concentration
There is a frequent need to give close attention, much of the time requiring the use of two or more senses simultaneously.
Mental Stress
The incumbent may be exposed to situations which may cause mild mental stress. There are some pressures from meeting deadlines, multitasking, or producing accurate work. The stress levels felt would not be noticeably disruptive to the work nor would the unpleasant reaction be strong or persistent
Note: This job profile indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. The incumbent may be asked to perform other duties which may be assigned from time to time.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Temporary with Benefits (Fixed Term)
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Mississauga, ONCompany Description
“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder
Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.

Organic Growth – Expeditors promotes from within. As a shining example, our CEO started as an entry level employee in our San Francisco office 31 years ago.
15,000 trained professionals
250+ locations worldwide
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems

Job Description
Enterprise Data & Analytics is responsible for providing Districts and Customers with exceptional data analytics support for planning, root cause analysis and process improvement activities that accelerate Expeditors’ business. The Data Analyst position is a broad-spectrum analytics role responsible for leveraging all available data and has a wide range of responsibilities including the collection, cleansing, analysis, reporting, interpretation and presentation of data. Data Analysts have the ability to develop end-to-end data solutions.
Key Responsibilities:

Scope, plan, develop and deploy impactful data-driven solutions for our Districts and Customers
Adhere to a defined analytics development procedure and fully document solutions
Participate in project requirements gathering and solution design
Complete projects on-time and provide frequent progress updates to project stakeholders
Prepare, cleanse and augment data in preparation for analysis and usage
Develop meaningful and intuitive reports, summaries and dashboards
Provide support for data and reporting infrastructure such as scheduling and access
Leverage advanced analytics tools and techniques to extracts insights from data
Share solutions and collaborate with other analysts in the network
Manage projects, tasks, time and timelines within our standard project management tools
Provide ongoing training to Districts on available reporting and self-service analytics tools
Cross-train team members on new tools and analytics procedures
Support our District as a subject matter expert on our data, tools and environments
Ensure solutions are built to scale and use enterprise approved technologies
Qualifications
Process Engineering: Meetings with business owners to understand ideas to improve their processes, determine opportunities and solutions for improvement, mapping out the process
Data & Statistical Analysis: Build dashboards using various BI tools as well as conducting data analysis. (all forms of statistical analysis including building dynamic models and dashboards)
Programming: Creating databases (SQL), application development (SQL backend and various
front end technologies), automating processes in internal systems through scripting
Presenting: Derive conclusions and present findings to Management and Executives, demonstrate how you arrived at your conclusion/solution
Learning: Ability to learn new programing languages, techniques, technologies, as well as the logistics industry
Ability to clearly communicate and present to small and large groups

Expeditors offers excellent benefits

Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time

RRSP Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program

Warehouse Analyst – Canada Cartage System

Reports to: Director, Enterprise Applications and PMO Department: Information Technology
Location: Mississauga, Ontario

Job Summary:
The individual in this position will play a key role in supporting Canada Cartage’s Applications, with a focus on warehousing/logistics. This portfolio currently encompasses the 3PL/Warehouse Management System, Customer Web Portal, Shipping Platforms and smaller Ancillary Systems. The applications are a mix of 3rd party systems with some customizations and internally built applications.

The individual will administer the 3PL/Warehouse systems while ensuring day to day issues on these systems are supported in a timely manner. They will also act as a Subject Matter Expert for all internal initiatives relating to these applications. This is a key role in ensuring the ongoing smooth operation of the business and becomes the natural go-to person for both resources within the technical team and the business community.

Job Responsibilities:

Application Support
Log, prioritize, troubleshoot, route and monitor all support incidents or questions relating to the applications supported. The applications could be COTS vendor applications or internal applications.
Assist internal teams with troubleshooting, technical support and other issues relating to the applications supported.
Perform root cause analysis to determine the cause of recurring issues and either fix or provide recommendations toward solutions.
Mentor L1 staff or Super Users within the Business departments on activities they support in the systems.
Manage the upkeep of the application. Ensure that the application is updated routinely and functioning at an acceptable performance level. This would involve working with the Infrastructure team to ensure sufficient resources are provisioned.
Continually drive improvements within the support processes by identifying opportunities for automation or transforming processes into something simpler. You may have the opportunity to then drive those as small projects.
Subject Matter Expertise
Be a Subject Matter Expert for the Applications being supported. Progressively understand the current functionality, keep up with future enhancements on the product roadmap, and assess capabilities in competing applications within the same domain.
Provide feedback into various projects’ Solution/Design phases that involve the application portfolio. Assist the team members by providing system requirements and/or test cases for initiatives concerning the applications.
Prepare training documentation/SOPs and train both users and other trainers on system use.
Support process mapping and SOP building for business processes undertaken using the application set.
May participate in testing activities within the supported applications by preparing test plans and test cases, managing or executing the tests, capturing results and ensuring defects are raised to the Project Manager or Vendor.

Relationships & Communication
Use effective communication and listening skills with internal customers, external customers, vendors, and team members within the IT department while troubleshooting system issues.
Professional communication with current and new customers.
Be flexible and astute in tailoring communication to different audiences. Example: Technical/vendor vs every day users
Build and maintain strong relationships with key day-to-day users of the system such that you can reinforce proper use of the system and become a change agent during project rollouts.
Manage the relationship with the Application vendors. This will involve routine touchpoints to ensure open issues are being addressed promptly and escalated for further attention as required.

Experience & Skills:

Must haves:
Experience working within the Supply Chain along with a good understanding of the business lifecycle managed within the Applications supporting it.
Strong analytical & prioritization skills
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening and presentation).
Keen to learn and understand new technologies and their applicability
Ability to work with minimal supervision and also the work well with a cross-functional team to achieve organizations goals.
Active person who shows initiative and enjoys a challenge
Able to handle multiple initiatives in parallel but recognizes the importance of prioritization
Completion of Post-secondary degree in an analytical specialization (Engineering, Sciences or Business with IT concentration preferred).
Technically competent with Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
4 or more years working in the capacity of an Application, Systems, Technical or Business Analyst
Proficient within HighJump 3PL System or other Warehouse Management Systems including RF functionality
Understanding of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) within Warehousing standards
Nice to haves:
Competence using SQL to query tables within 3PL database
IT industry certifications
Experience working with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI
Project Management skills
Logistics industry certifications

Working Hours and Location:

Weekend and afterhours support is required based on production issues and project timelines
Flexibility to travel between multiple facilities in the Mississauga area
Some out of province travel may be required if involved in a project. Supply chain WMS Inventory

job_title: Treasury Analyst, Derivative and Collateral Management
job_description:
$61,605 - $86,604 a yearReporting to the Director, Debt Operations and Corporate Finance, the Treasury Analyst, Derivative and Collateral Management is a middle-office position responsible for providing technical expertise in the areas of financial trade support, derivative evaluation, collateral settlement and risk reporting. This position is vital for ensuring that all derivative transactions are recorded and confirmed accurately. This role will evaluate, transact and monitor all daily collateral flow requirements between the Province, its provincial corporations and financial counterparties under existing Credit Support Annex (CSA) trade agreements, using current and future-state treasury system applications. Additional responsibilities include managing the trade confirmation process, completing calculations for net credit exposure and managing collateral positions, responding to and initiating collateral calls, recording and reconciling collateral trades, developing and enhancing related reporting, and acting as the subject matter expert for derivative administration and collateral operations.

To be successful in this role, you will posses a strong understanding of debt markets, financial derivatives, credit/counterparty risk management, portfolio theory and basic accounting principles. Experience in a capital markets, treasury and/or banking environments and/or knowledge of proper banking procedures (particularly with respect to security and payment settlements) would be beneficial. Exceptional interpersonal skills would be valuable as this role interacts with a variety of subject matter experts, many of which may have highly technical backgrounds and/or non-financial professional roles.


Qualifications

A university degree in Commerce or Business with a specialization in Finance or a degree in a related field plus three years related experience in a banking, capital market and/or treasury role is required.

Proven experience in developing financial valuation models is preferred.
Experience using an integrated treasury management system (software or platform) and/or working with electronic payment and financial data systems (such as Bloomberg), or other software solutions pertaining to collateral, asset or risk management operations, would be an asset.

Enrolment in or completion of the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or Certified Treasury Professional (CTP), or similar professional designation is an asset.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:


http://www.psc.alberta.ca/Practitioners/?file=learning/apscompetencies/titlepage&cf=9

Agility: Ability to anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, maintain resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.

Drive for Results: Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Develop Self and Others: A commitment to lifelong learning, and the desire to invest in the development of the long-term capability of yourself and others.

Build Collaborative Environments: Leads and contributes to the conditions and environments that allow people to work collaboratively and productively to achieve outcomes.

Develop Networks: Proactively building networks, connecting, and building trust in relationships with different stakeholders.

Systems Thinking: The work done within the APS is part of a larger integrated and inter-related environment. It is important to know that work done in one part of the APS impacts a variety of other groups/projects inside and outside the APS. Systems Thinking allows us to keep broader impacts and connections in mind.

Creative Problem Solving: Ability to assess options and implications in new ways to achieve outcomes and solutions.


Salary

$2,360.34 to $3,241.54 bi-weekly ($61,605 to $86,604 annually)


Notes

The Alberta Public Service is a great place to work!

What we offer:
Comprehensive benefits plan: http://www.psc.alberta.ca/employees/DocList134.cfmPension plan: http://www.pspp.ca/Professional learning and developmentPositive workplace culture and work-life balanceAccessible career consulting services
Tips on Applying on Alberta Government Jobs see here: https://www.jobs.alberta.ca/applying/index.html

Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file. Please ensure that this document is saved using the following naming convention (Last name, First name_Job ID Number).
