At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:
Sun Life has launched an ambitious journey to deploy data as a foundational pillar and strategy across the whole business. Be a part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by becoming part of the analytics community helping to accelerate the growth and application of data science capabilities.
As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Individual Insurance & Wealth (IIW) management business helping the team by, but not limited to, mining data for business insights, analyzing and interpreting trends using statistical tools and techniques, reporting on business performance, and triaging code and data-related issues.
Within SLF Canada, IIW is one of the largest business units, with over 1,700 employees. Individual accounts for approximately 20% of worldwide earnings in the overall Sun Life Financial group of companies, and over 45% of Canadian earnings. We manufacture and distribute leading-edge life insurance, health insurance and wealth management products and solutions for over two million individual customers.
This role sits in the client experience insights team within IIW, a team focused on using data and analytics to understand our clients and how our business can best support them in achieving their goals of lifetime financial security and living healthier lives. The team supports the IIW marketing team, but this role will be focused on short to medium term special projects, tackling the most pressing business issues using data and analytics to change decisions and the way we do business.
Sun Life views success in this role related to 4 key characteristics:
Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. Understanding business. We’ve got a lot of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into insights, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data analysts don’t just spin data and give numbers, they solve the problem. Technical skills. How to wrangle structured data is a must (i.e., SQL) with strong SAS skills needed currently and the opportunity to move to other analytical tools (R, Python etc) as our data environment matures.
Accountabilities:
Analyze and interpret data to identify key insights and opportunities to better understand advisor and client behaviour through data mining client databases and other information systems, including analysis of CRM data, web and mobile applications to enhance the advisor and client experience
Help tackle key business problems via analytical work, from requirements specification, data gathering, analyst and statistical model building to presentations and adoption
Work closely with stakeholders across Sun Life as a subject matter expert in the individual client data and to understand their business problems and how data can be best leveraged to inform decisions
Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together business recommendations.
Put together effective presentations of findings and desire to present to multiple levels of stakeholders
Leverage internal training, peers and other sources to continue to grow capabilities
An active contributing member to the analytics academy to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
5+ years working with data (i.e., quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports)
Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
Experience with building predictive and prescriptive models in a business setting (i.e., regression, decision trees, deep learning etc.)
Expert using SAS to work with data, including macros
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau to aid in effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication
Ability to work as a team to help deliver multiple projects with courage in managing expectations of team leaders
Demonstrated business acumen and ability to translate knowledge of audience insights into marketing strategies
Proven track record of successfully operating in a matrix environment with cross-function team participation successes
Strong partnering approach with a commitment to meeting internal and external business partners' unique needs and expectations
BSc in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Nice to haves:
Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, re-insurance and casualty insurance)
MSc preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
Additional statistical programming languages (i.e., Python/R)
Experience working with unstructured data
Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.

Respond with the first honest answer that comes to your mind. The best part about completing the assessment is that once you are done you will see a summary of your top five traits. We believe this information will not only help you in your career search with Sun Life but also be useful for your own personal development and growth.

In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Job description

Role: Strategic Sourcing Analyst

Reports to: Procurement Manager

Company: Freshii

We are looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated, Strategic Sourcing Analyst to join the Freshii team. The Strategic Sourcing Analyst works as a negotiation and data-analytics expert in supporting the Procurement Manager in negotiating best-in-class contracts in diverse food and non-food categories, including produce, protein, packaging, ingredients, bases, dressings and ingredients. Join our growing supply chain team and support our 100’s of Freshii locations in getting their most important product – fresh(ii) and health(ii) food! If you’re interested in joining our mission of helping individuals live healthier and more fun lives by making healthy food convenient and affordable then keep reading!

What this role entails

Identify and assess savings opportunities
Research supply markets, supply chain dynamics and industry trends and benchmarks as they relate to sourcing activities
Develop and conduct supplier evaluation
Perform comparative analysis of pricing proposals, quotations and bids
Build and maintain excellent relationship with trust worthy suppliers, ensure that vendors are knowledgeable and abide by policies set forth by Freshii.

Toronto, ONOVERVIEW:
 ITG is looking for an attentive, fast-paced Market Data Support Analyst to join our Trade Support team.

Here at ITG, technology is our middle name. Literally. With nearly half of our staff working in technology roles, our technologists empower our business to provide best-in-class service to our clients around the world. From conceptualizing ideas to bringing them to market, ITG engineers work alongside our business units to build technology for institutional traders that enables them to improve returns for investors.
WE'LL TRUST YOU TO:
Troubleshoot Market Data issues and Trading System issues, determine sources of problems, and identify solutions for internal and external clients
Interact with Market Data providers to trouble shoot issues
Perform morning and evening system health checks, representing the team in daily production status call
Participate in test, document, release, and provide support for Market Data Systems and Trading Systems
Test and implement new software releases and configurations from both internal and external developers
Liaise regularly with Product Managers and ensure awareness of system issues
Provide dedicated hotline and face to face support to internal and external clients
Create and run ad-hoc custom reports for business analysts and internal clients
Communicate with multiple departments on closure of escalated support calls as well as key business users and managers regarding day-to-day support
Interact regularly with members of the development team and product team to produce software solutions that address operational needs and requirements
WHAT YOU BRING WITH YOU:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Finance, Accounting or equivalent Market Data Support role with 2 – 5 years’ experience in a Systems Support role or Market Data role
Proven knowledge of operation and job control under a mixed UNIX/Linux operations environment
Technical knowledge of Market Data, Monitoring Tools (ITRS, Splunk, Corvil) Direct Market Access systems, Electronic Communication Networks, Exchanges, FIX messaging, FIX protocol, OTC Equity Securities, Trading Rules and Regulations
Experience with Sybase ASE, SQL, MS Windows Server, Perl Scripting, and Shell Scripting
Demonstrated ability to work successfully in a cross-functional environment including development, networking, operating systems, database, application servers and web serving
A team oriented attitude with excellent communication skills (verbal and written), great interpersonal skills, and ability to work in high pressured environments
Previous experience in financial/trading operations support role under various platforms is a plus
Experience with Scheduling Software and JIRA
YOU'RE JUST RIGHT FOR ITG IF YOU WANT:
Exposure to different technologies, such as C++, Linux, low latency, kernel bypass, machine learning, cloud and high-performance storage
Projects with quick life cycles, from concept to client in three months
A smaller team environment with 3-8 developers
A great place for upward and geographic mobility
Direct exposure to the decision makers and senior leaders on the business side
A company that’s investing a sizable amount in its technology department
Teams that are passionate about continually learning, improving and raising the bar
A community that values hard work as well as work-life balance
A company that is committed to giving back to surrounding communities, from LA to Hong Kong and Sydney and the 11 locations in between

The GRM Corporate Insurance Risk Team is responsible for providing advice and placement of RBC’s global insurance program and risk management activities.

The Analyst, Property & Casualty will support the team in the effective execution of the corporate insurance risk management programs ensuring accuracy of analytics and insights for management decision making. What will you do?
Support the strategy, culture and activities that enable the team to operate as an integrated organization. Support a culture of integrity and behaviors that align to RBC’s Code of Conduct and professional standards
Execute and maintain policies, standards, processes and tools for one or more corporate insurance risk management programs
Conduct research into areas of perceived elevated or emerging operational risk. Build detailed risk assessments and investigate risk events to assess for potential systemic weaknesses

Provide subject matter expertise to support management to colleagues and management in understanding corporate insurance risk policies and procedures within a domain or event
Support the team in independent, thematic reviews and/or emerging risk assessments to increase awareness of risk exposure

1+ years of experience in risk management (1LOD or 2LOD) or related field, knowledge of financial services products, processes, and regulatory environment

Experience working across multi-functional teams

College degree. Preferred Undergraduate degree, with a designation associated with risk management

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

Opportunities to do challenging work

job_title: Digital Healthcare Strategist – Toronto or Chicago
job_description:
Toronto, ONI’m Cam and I head up the Strategy and Analytics teams here at Klick Health. These teams work with our clients to help define solutions to their marketing challenges and bring them ideas that can grow their business. We work with our creative and user experience teams to bring these solutions to life. Then we measure the results of the work to make sure it is delivering value to our clients’ business and develop insights and recommendations to optimize it and continually improve how, when and where info is accessed and messages are conveyed.
As a Strategist at Klick Health, you’ll work under a VP who will lead the overall strategy work for the assigned group of clients or brands you support. You’re an expert at showing clients how to connect directly with consumers and indirectly through key influencers. You’ll need to feel comfortable standing in front of a group of clients leading a discussion (could be anything from brainstorming to a pitch) on integrated digital marketing solutions. You’ll need to feel equally at home living into the preparation of specific recommendations and tactical plans. This could include any or all of: media, CRM, website, social, SEM.
Responsibilities
Be a thought-leader
– Understand and stay up-to-date with:
– Digital technology, especially digital health and digital marketing
– Healthcare challenges and opportunities
– Brands and accounts for which you’re responsible
– Communicate effectively through writing, oral presentation and saying nothing at all
– Ask probing, thoughtful questions

Solve healthcare business problems
– Understand healthcare challenges, particularly those faced by US pharmaceutical companies
– Apply and develop experience methodically addressing business problems with evidence-based solutions; know what’s proven to work, what has potential to work, and what is an opportunity to innovate
– Strive to know brands and accounts for which you’re responsible inside and out; maintain documentation on key aspects of your brands and accounts, including their market and marketing
– Provide direction for strategy, tactics and measurement

Guide your vision through execution
– Provide leadership, direction and clear, compelling briefs to colleagues including designers, developers, media planners and analysts
– Review produced assets to ensure they fulfill your vision, are strategically aligned and address your briefs

Analyze and optimize results
– Treat every client dollar as if it were your own
– Know what to measure, what not to measure, and how often to measure
– Turn data into insights
– Identify opportunities for improvement
– Propose experiments to explore those opportunities
Skills and Experience
University Degree, focus in business or Science; MBA preferred
At least five years experience in digital marketing strategy development (pharma/biotech preferred)
Passion for technology
Strong presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to see the big picture and know how to influence it with the smallest details
Creative problem solving skills with a passion for innovation
Proven ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment
Bonus: An understanding of marketing communications and regulations of the pharmaceutical/healthcare industry in the US

Toronto, ONJob Description
Compensation Analyst
This new role in our Human Resources team will play a key role in analyzing, administering and implementing compensation programs. This role will provide reporting and data analytics to support the various Fidelity Canada businesses.
This is the right role for you if you …
Love data
Are an avid learner and enjoy being the analytics “go to” person
Enjoy finding better ways to do things
Like putting details together to understand the big picture
Enjoy analyzing large volumes of data to find trends, validate or negate hypothesis and make recommendations based on the data and trends
Work well under pressure with have strong attention to detail
Are confident in your ability to explore, recommend and learn new analytics methods and technologies
Are an Excel superuser with the ability to use other analytics, databases and statistical tools
Have knowledge of the following terms: pay philosophy, pay strategy, variable pay, compa-ratio, range penetration, compression, benchmarks, market-ratio and more
Have worked in a compensation or analytical related role for at least 2 years
Have a university degree, ideally in a finance or statistics related field
What will you do?
Compensation plans design, implementation and execution
Provide pro-active analysis of existing programs and practices
Provide support in variable compensation plan modelling and commission payment processes
Maintain the market compensation database, including conducting market analysis to support compensation recommendations
Reporting
Lead HR reporting function and serve as the subject matter expert for all HR data needs.
Maintain and enhance current reporting deliverables while exploring new and innovative ways to report and examine HR data.
Investigate, recommend and implement people reporting synergies within the HR function
People Analytics
Act as the analytics problem solver by developing world class people analytics collection and analysis strategies used to influence key decisions
Assist in the identification of key drivers that will retain and reward employees, drive performance and lead to a positive bottom line
Mine existing databases for insights that can be used to make business decisions.
Establish, maintain and continuously build credibility and knowledge of people analytics

We’re a network of collaborative, curious, tech-savvy leaders working at the forefront of Financial Services and FinTech transformation, enabling ATB to become more than a bank.

If you’re excited about AI and machine learning, big data, blockchain, robotics, compelling CX, digital development, IT, innovation and more and you’re looking for an award-winning organization where you can use your talents to roll out world leading platforms and products… well, we can’t wait to meet you!

THE OPPORTUNITY:
The Automation Analyst is responsible for delivering E2E Intelligent Process Automation (IPA). The Automation Analyst obtains a deep understanding of the target business process, builds high-quality and innovative solutions that comply with standards, and develops the necessary supporting documentation. The Automation Analyst tests developed automations and provides operational support to maintain and/or enhance functionality.
What you get to do:
Designing, development, testing and implementation of Intelligent Process Automation (IPA)
Understand and document the business processes to the level of detail required for automation
Design automated process solutions in accordance with standard
automation design principles using codeless and configurable business process automation software
Configure new processes and objects using core workflow principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand.
Create and maintain solution documentation.
Create User Acceptance Testing (UAT) documentation including test procedures, process scenarios and expected outcomes.
Operations support
Problem solve issues that arise in day to day running of automated processes and provide timely responses and solutions as required.
Provide ongoing operational support including upgrades, defect fixes and any process change activities.
Automation Governance
Participate in the established agile ceremonies
Follow established best practices
Job Requirements
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Good written skills with the ability to produce clear, detailed and accurate documentation
Strong communication skills
Ability to work with a structured and methodical approach, combined with an inquiring mind
Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting, with a proven record of success
Demonstrated analytical, research, and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to use workflow based logic. The ability to understand a business process from a workflow diagram and to conceptualize it as an automated solution
Ability to work independently
Bachelor’s Degree (Business, Engineering or Computer Science) or equivalent professional experience.
Experience working with process automation software (i.e. Blue Prism) is considered an asset.
Technology experience (analysis and modeling tools, simulation, optimization, excel macros, or basic computer programming) is considered an asset
Experience in the financial services industry is considered an asset.
Experience with agile delivery methodologies is considered an asset.
Experience in working with codeless configuration platforms such as sales force or BPM applications is considered an asset.
Lean Methodology or Six Sigma certification is considered an asset.
ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:
You focus on impact over hard work: tangible, measurable results and creating value for team members and customers alike are our goals
You love to solve tough problems, together: no one said transforming banking was going to be easy. Collaboration is key and we’re collectively reimagining it as a team
You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn: like any top tech company, agile frameworks and applied lean methodologies are mindsets we apply to our daily. We love data and KPIs. We move fast, we embrace mistakes, and we learn and grow as a result.
You’re an exponential thinker, focused on 10X: if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing
You do it with passion: you’re inspired by purpose and by our shared vision and mission
As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:
Each day will be different! We’re learning, iterating and taking big steps toward our vision of transforming an entire industry, every day
The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your unique voice

Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.

Greater Toronto Area, ONWho We Are



At Vale, we believe in innovation as a foundation for our development as we pursue our vision of becoming the leading natural resources company in the world.
Operating in Canada for more than 115 years, we are a leading producer of iron-ore, copper, cobalt and precious metals and the world’s largest nickel mining company. We aim to grow profitably but only as a safe, high-quality and sustainable mining company.
Our Vale Marketing Department is currently seeking an:

Analyst, Supply

The Opportunity
The supply analyst will provide industry analysis and insights on technology trends and competitor strategy on all commodities for Vale’s base metals business globally. The incumbent will coordinate with other teams in a multi-disciplinary, interdepartmental , and cross-company framework and will be accountable for the output to monitor and assess industry developments and to provide an opinion on long term supply trends as well as incentive pricing for projects and emerging processing technologies. He/ She will participate in appropriate discussions around industry opportunities and challenges to enable short-term and long-term business and strategic planning

This position is based in Toronto, Ontario.
Accountabilities:
Conducts research and prepare analyses and presentations on the industry supply trends for commodities for Vale base metals operations and predicts impacts of emerging trends
Designs and implements appropriate reporting tools to continuously track industry KPIs and to help the business making informed decisions
Provides In-depth analysis of competitive trends in commodity production, competitor strategy and performance, trade flows and government policies impacting supply
Maintains comprehensive models to track industry KPIs and keep a track of historic data and projects future supply by producer/operation

What is the role?
The Retail Demand Planner & Allocation Analyst will report to the VP, of Merchandise Planning & Allocation and provide support by proactively partnering with the Merchandising and Operations Management Team to provide in-depth insight into business performance, help drive the business and provide planning and analysis insights, supporting better decision making.
What will you be doing?
Create processes and methods to gather merchandise planning and allocation data
Track critical KPI's (fill rates, stock outs, etc.) and report on the planning team's performance
Reports on the financial success of products by meeting sales, gross margin, gross margin ROI and inventory turn goals
Analyze historical data and current store-level sales trends to identify risks and opportunities by store layout, business unit, and product class
Collaborate with Manager to build actionable strategies around risks and opportunities identified in the business
Will become SME of critical planning systems (MFP, JDA, etc)
Responsible for maintaining basic service levels and in stock positioning across markets
Recap and analyze actual sales results to plan
Effectively utilize inventory management systems to execute allocation strategies to support ongoing replenishment and seasonal assortment needs
Review buy plans/strategies and ensure plans meet financial targets
Through analysis will identify and interpret changing trends, convert those findings into new allocation strategies, effectively communicate proposed strategy changes to cross-functional team members, which will help drive the business in the future
Continuously identify and reports on international assortment changes based on analysis, product trends, best sellers and productivity, and measures impact of new trends
Creates and distributes weekly reporting to measure the health of the stores and DC inventory
Collaborate with merchants, the promotional team, and store operations to determine appropriate product mix and display quantities. Raises any concerns before the initial allocation is complete
Undertake ad hoc projects as requested and as curiosity and business requires

Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor's degree/College diploma in Business/Retail Admin
Experience:
3 to 5 years of allocation analysis and planning experience in a retail environment
Expert knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint
Knowledge of Microsoft NAV and Symphony Gold is considered an asset

Selected candidates will participate in testing to confirm proficiency in the above skills.

Job Description
The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Operations Analyst for our Freight division in Hartland, NB.

Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.

As an Operations Analyst, you are the owner of data collection, analysis and presentation for the Operations Team. It is your responsibility to ensure your work is completed in an accurate and timely format.

This position is all about data collection, analysis and presentation to support improvement initiatives.
To be successful in this position, you will be able to do the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities):
Own the collection and analysis of operations KPI.
Identify potentially inaccurate points within the data, validate source of data and confirm accuracy to ensure understanding of the data.
Create awareness, identify issues, problems, opportunities.
Use a data analysis method to support the determination of root cause solution as related to gaps in performance measures. The data analysis prepared will be used to impact efficiency and improvement, therefore accuracy and presentation becomes a key component.
Recommend solutions when it comes to the measurement process and collection of data. Bases decision on how their actions impact by understanding the impact that data they are presenting plays within business decisions.
Prepares all dash-board reports and display in a user friendly format. Presentation of data to department with explanation to support findings. Quality based on mutual respect, friendly, customer focused.
Provides accurate data/presentation and translates the relevant data to achieve business objectives.
Provides support with change initiatives by providing relevant data to the team to demonstrate the requirement for change.

To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:
Computer skills – accuracy, MS products, data and statistical analysis, exposure to Operations Management techniques is preferred
Advanced communication skills (written and verbal)
Superior time management skills
Manage multiple tasks with the ability to focus and work independently on projects with appropriate guidance
Deadline driven environment
Team player focused
Results focused
Education – University or technical training with a focus on data analysis
Previous experience in similar data analysis roles required; within the transportation industry an asset

Please apply directly on our website at www.dayandrosscareers.com or send your resume to yourcareer@dayandrossinc.ca and note the job title and location in the subject line.

Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

We thank you for your application, but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
With a focus on quality customer service that extends to our valued employees, Day & Ross has been continuously recognized as an honored recipient of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2005. We offer our full-time employees a generous Benefits package and a company matched Pension plan.
As a federally regulated employer, The Day & Ross Transportation Group fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.

Purpose of Job
The candidate will be responsible for supporting the Exchange Traded Derivatives (ETD) business initiatives of Scotiabank’s Global Banking & Markets within the Confirmations Utility of the Global Wholesale Operations Division.
The candidate will ensure daily processes are followed, implemented and reported in a timely and accurate manner. in addition, the candidate will provide support to other departments in respect to margining, reporting, balancing, reconciliation and other product lifecycle control activities.
The incumbent will be expected to develop subject matter expertise, providing guidance and counsel to co-workers, partner areas, trading desks, Middle Office, Risk Management, Fund Accounting, Finance and various other functional units within the Bank for all topics related to the Exchange Traded Derivatives / Confirmations business.
Contribute to the Bank’s initiative to maintain self-clearing memberships on the North American and European derivative Exchanges, including, but not limited to documenting workflows, operations policy and procedures, preparation for and the execution of user acceptance testing, etc.
Accountabilities
Due to binding deadlines, effective and efficient execution of daily responsibilities is vital.

The incumbent will be expected to adhere to and implement appropriate levels of control to ensure the production support of the derivatives confirmations group, such as effective trade capture & management, reconciliation of all settlement needs and to assist in the accurate and timely delivery of daily position reporting externally to Exchanges, and total equity reporting to Scotia internal partners.
Contribution to the protection of the Bank from exposure to loss by ensuring compliance with Bank policies, procedures and limit controls.
Ensuring the prompt and efficient investigation of all exceptions and ad-hoc inquiries are brought to the group’s attention and effectively communicated to areas such as: Front Office, Execution / Clearing Brokers, Exchanges, Technology groups and downstream users of relevant source data.
Ensuring the ETD team responsibilities are completed on a timely basis and that open issues are properly escalated.
Develop a full understanding of the functions of a Futures Clearing Merchant work-flow model, including, but not limited to: Trade Management, Reconciliation, Control, Data Integrity and Regulatory Reporting.
Provide production back-up for other colleagues due to absences and / or interim increases in transaction volumes.
Other duties as assigned may include, but are not limited to, providing back up for other colleagues within the team due to absences and/or interim increases in transaction volumes and participation in on-going process re-engineering, project work and cross-training within other GWO Utility functions.
Skills, Experience and Functional Competencies
2-7 years minimum Exchange Traded Derivatives experience (or similar capital markets asset class)
Working understanding of capital markets, Exchanges, settlement and regulatory requirements is an asset.
Understanding of accounting principles and practices related to Exchange Traded Derivatives a plus
Strong experience with at least one of the major asset platforms from a “Books and Records” perspective – GMI, RISC, ADP, Broadridge, etc.
Ability to work within and maintain a strong team environment and develop working relationships with partner areas
Education and other Requirements
University degree in accounting, business or finance and / or comparable work experience is preferred.
CSC Securities course completion or similar studies and / or licenses an asset.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Your expertise is well supported by a degree or diploma in Information Technology or Computer Science, and 4+ years’ experience encompassing the following areas: small-to-medium projects, interacting with project managers, business analysts and technical resources such as application development team members and users; operational reporting application design and development; and complete lifecycle data warehouse development projects. Experience in enterprise reporting, BI toolsets, and data integration, preferred.
Well-rounded and hands-on BI design and development skills, and data modelling and data analysis skills.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly analytic models.
Self-starting disposition with the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a larger team of business users and analysts.
Ability to take ownership of tasks and drive them through to completion.
Ability and experience working under pressure to meet changing deadlines due to shifting priorities.
Strong systems analysis, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, describe and resolve technical issues.
Excellent verbal communication skills and ability to present information effectively during presentations, demonstrations and project meetings.
Excellent technical writing skills to effectively complete requirements, design and operational documents.
A broad understanding of BI architecture, and full lifecycle BI and integration development.
Working familiarity with the following software and languages:

BI Tools – SSRS, SSAS, WebFOCUS, InfoAssist, Power BI
Windows
Integration Tools – SSIS, DataMigrator, Oracle SOA Suite, iWay Service Manager, BPEL, Web Services, SOAP UI
Languages:
Database, e.g. DDL, DML, SQL, PL/SQL
Web Standards/Specifications, e.g. XML, XSD, SOAP, REST, WSDL
 Good interpersonal, organizational and project leadership skills
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Ability to deal with confidential information using judgment and discretion.

ADP is hiring a Workforce Forecast Analyst I . In this role you will be responsible for developing accurate forecasts (long, mid & short) for multiple client channels including but not limited to Inbound, Outbound, Email and Chat, as well as, back office workload. In addition, you will be responsible for developing accurate long-range forecasts to determine overall staffing capacity requirements. In addition, you will develop staffing capacity requirements to support GlobalView and all migration efforts. This person will also develop accurate mid-range forecasts to allow for accurate planning of associate development, coaching and training needs. He/She works closely with Service Management Project Teams to assess the impact of the project on the forecast and the ability to deliver on associate initiatives. The Workforce Forecast Analyst works with Sr. Leadership and Finance during the fiscal planning process to ensure that planned FTE headcount supports the Associate and Client Experience goals of GlobalView.


At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.

We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Oversees and maintains the Workforce Management platform (configurations for skills, call & multi-channel routing, associates, historical trends, anomalies, etc.) Multi-channel includes calls (Inbound & Outbound), Email and Chat.
Conducts weekly/monthly meetings focused on reviewing forecasts, capacity planning, shrinkage review, KPI results, etc. throughout all levels of leadership in SBS.
Establishes a statistical baseline for call volume forecasts for SBS enterprise. Provides clear communication of the forecasted workload, changes, assumptions, inputs, etc to leadership team.
Establishes a statistical baseline for multi-channel (calls, email & chat) and back office forecasts for SBS enterprise. Provides clear communication of the forecasted workload, changes, assumptions, inputs, etc to leadership team.
Analyze multi-routing result of call volumes, call patterns, call trends and staff productivity for assigned call centers; use this information to build, coordinate, and accurately maintain employee long-term schedules
Maintains events calendar on behalf of Region (meetings, trainings, 1:1 sessions, etc) and ensure that impacts to business are captured, analyzed and recommendations on staffing supporting the associate experience are delivered in a timely manner
Identifies and researches Region -wide service level risks for problem resolution and management notification
Creates business process/workflow for agents across SBS to use self-serve functionality in workforce management scheduling
Responsible for updating statistical info into WFM modeling software
Responsible for assisting WFM Director/Manager in training and supporting new WFM team members. This includes training of the WFM platform, policy and procedures and all additional related systems
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

Bachelor's Degree-is an asset with Major Area of Concentration in Math, Business, Statistics, Technology or related field.
3 -5 years experience.
Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:

Proven workforce management experience and strong knowledge of call center operations
Proven experience forecasting with WFM applications Genesys (preferred), Aspect, Verint, Pipkins, IEX
Solid understanding of call routing strategies (CentreVu, Meridian, etc..)

Ability to prioritize, organize and summarize data
Strong Excel skills, and solid working knowledge of Word, PowerPoint

Mississauga, ONJob Description
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Position: Senior Analyst
File#: 2019- 13219
Status: Full Time
Department: Public Affairs & Strategic Partnerships
Hours of Work/Shift: Monday to Friday
Posted: March 14 2019
Internal Deadline: March 28 2019
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Trillium Health Partners (THP) is one of the largest community-based acute care facilities in Canada. Comprised of the Credit Valley Hospital, the Mississauga Hospital and the Queensway Health Centre, Trillium Health Partners serves the growing and diverse populations of Mississauga, West Toronto and surrounding communities and is a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto.
Our Mission: A New Kind of Health Care for a Healthier Community
When we set out to build our vision and future, we connected with our community - patients, families, visitors, physicians, staff and volunteers. The foundational goals of our new strategic plan - quality, access and sustainability - anchor everything we do. Our mission for a new kind of health care is built on an inter-connected system of care organized around patients - inside and outside the hospital.
At THP, we are relentless in providing high quality, compassionate care to our communities and take great pride in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment and we are all accountable for contributing to a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing and promoting excellence in patient care though advancing patient and staff safety. If you are passionate about what you do, motivated to improve the health of the community, committed to excellence, quality and patient safety we would like you to join our Better Together team!
Job Description:

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Partnership Projects team within the Strategy, People and Corporate Affairs Division to support Project Zero (PZ). PZ is a cross-sector mental health initiative aimed at eliminating death by suicide for children and youth through improved prevention and care delivery across Mississauga. Preliminary partners include Peel District School Board, Peel Children’s Centre, Peel Public Health, Trillium Health Partners, the Dufferin Peel District Catholic School Board, and the Mississauga Halton LHIN. As a member of the team, the ideal candidate will support the Senior Project Manager and Director to drive forward this strategic partnership project to improve the mental health of children, youth, and families in our community.
Here’s what you will get to do:
Participate in the planning, coordination, communications and engagement processes for core partners, affiliate partners, project committees and working groups, and children, youth, and families;
Support a project team and leadership through all aspects of the various phases within the project;
Contribute to the development of materials such as reports, presentations, briefing notes, requests for proposals, data analyses and communications throughout all levels of project governance structure;
Support project research, literature reviews and data / information gathering to enhance subject-matter knowledge relevant to the project;
Engage in data analytics, reporting and critical thinking to support project deliverables and planning;
Contribute to the development and dissemination of project control documents, including status reports, risk / issue analyses, and project plans, and;
Monitor and report on progress, problems and solutions of the project to project management team and escalate issues as appropriate.

Accountabilities:
Engage with external project partners, affiliates, and supports as appropriate;
Support key committees working groups that are integral to the success of the project as required including meeting scheduling and coordination with multiple project partners;
Support the Senior Project Manager in the planning, development and coordination of complex project work plans, timelines, and deliverables related to project mission;
Engage and communicate with stakeholders and project partners on an ongoing basis and ensure changing resource and project requirements are met and understood;
Liaise with project partners to ensure the successful completion of project deliverables; and
Other duties assigned, as required to meet timelines and deliverables.

Qualifications:
All candidates must have an undergraduate degree.
Masters degree in public, business administration, or healthcare administration or equivalent experience considered an asset.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a healthcare or partnership environment working with complex and dynamic teams.
Excellent organizational, time management and project management skills.
Strong understanding of Trillium Health Partners strategic plan.
A strong understanding of Health, Education, Community and Social Service sectors is an asset.
Strong analytical, problem solving and systems-thinking abilities.
Strong adaptability, collaboration, and relationship building skills are essential for this role.
Experience effectively engaging with and managing third-party partners and delivery partners required.
Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines.
Demonstrated effectiveness at working with teams as well as working independently.
Experience in human-centred design thinking, planning, and engagement is an asset.
Superior writing and PowerPoint design skills.
High proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Suite is a must.

Internal Candidates who believe they possess the necessary qualifications and experience for this position and who have been in their current position for at least six (6) months are encouraged to apply.

To pursue this career opportunity, please visit our website: www.trilliumhealthpartners.ca

Trillium Health Partners is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing, based on our values compassion, excellence and courage. To be Better Together, we commit to fostering a respectful workplace culture that promotes a safe and supportive environment for everyone who provides care, supports caregiving, receives care or visits the hospital.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code Trillium Health Partners will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.
All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Trillium Health Partners is identified under the French Language Services Act.

Edmonton, AB$67,547 - $88,601 a yearReporting to the OHS Informatics Lead within the Occupational Disease and Injury Prevention unit, the OHS Informatics Analyst provides support services in data management, data analysis, data visualization and analytics reporting to a variety of stakeholders. The OHS Informatics produces and delivers OHS information products as summary files, statistics tables, graphs and maps to supports the use of clear and defensible evidence in the process of policy development and program delivery.

The successful candidate performs data extractions and analysis of data collected from various information systems to enable the production of statistical reports for the business area. Having an understanding of service delivery and customer relationship management principles enable the job incumbent to respond to information requests in a timely and professional manner. Knowledge of data quality assurance processes complemented by proven project management aptitudes aid the successful candidate conduct quality assessments of information databases and balances a number of concurrent projects. The job incumbent plays pivotal role in managing OHS data and information assets.

If this sounds like a workplace that interests you, send us your resume!


Qualifications

A university degree in a related field such as but not limited to Biostatistics, Health Information, Public Health or Administration and 2 years of working experience in a related field is required. Demonstrated experience in advanced analytical software such as SAS (Statistics Analysis System), SPSS, Access and SQL Programming is also required.

Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:
Knowledge of data quality assurance processes
Knowledge of Business Intelligence
Demonstrated project management experience

Equivalencies will be considered on a 1 year of related education for 1 year of related experience or 1 year of related experience for 1 year of related education.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans, and the foundation for our talent management programs, including hiring decisions. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. In this role, you will contribute to our team by demonstrating the following behavioral competencies:

Systems Thinking: The successful candidate displays the ability to consider and assess the inter-relationships among different aspects of an approach and the linkages from data analysis to complex OHS issues / questions.

Agility: The ideal candidate will possess the ability to balance a number of complex, concurrent projects while producing a high quality of work within tight time constraints. You will possess the skills to identify options and implement realistic contingency plans.

Drive for Results: The successful candidate will have the ability to proactively decide which results are important so time and resources are used effectively. You will have the skills to provide input on information products and issues including collecting and refining customer requirements, performing testing and quality assurance and developing optimization techniques.

Creative Problem Solving: The successful candidate will have the ability to identify ways to improve program/service delivery and develop pros and cons list when evaluating alternatives. You will have the skills to develop new ideas and solutions to problems, clearly present them to the management as well as taking appropriate actions to implement them.

Join our team

TELUS is committed to changing the way healthcare in Canada works for you, your family, and your loved ones. What part might you play?

We collectively need to find solutions that will benefit all Canadians to meet the challenge of unsustainable rising costs, long wait times and an increasingly older population. Make no mistake, our journey to address Canada’s greatest social challenge of this generation, healthcare, will be long and challenging, but the chance to have an impact on all Canadians and build a new business for TELUS will be worth it!

The TELUS Consumer Health team is focused on empowering Canadians to take control of their health and the health of their loved ones with the right information, tools and support they need to live healthier and happier lives. As a global telecommunications leader and one of the largest Information Technology (IT) healthcare providers in Canada, we are well positioned to play a leadership role in bringing new services to market to address this significant challenge.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You will join a small high performing Consumer Health team, and utilize your strong analytical skills to build and evolve the centralized reporting capabilities for our portfolio. This will enable us to make well-informed decisions to continuously grow our business. Your ability to actively assess situations, take initiative and assume ownership of what needs to be done, and prioritize work in a dynamic and high profile environment, will make you a strong addition to our team. You will use your relationship building skills, to collaborate with various partners within the team and across TELUS.

We are looking for someone who is a true utility player and can wear many hats as data expert, project manager, and creative thinker. You have a ‘can-do’ attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done. But most importantly, you have the passion to help transform healthcare for every Canadian and take our business and your career to the next level.

Here’s how
Collaborate with internal partners to identify, assess and prioritize data analysis and reporting requirements and improve reporting capabilities
Develop and iterate reporting and business intelligence solutions
Monitor critical metrics and performance against targets to actively recommend improvement and suggest corrective actions as situations arise
Assist in forecast and outlook analysis to identify risks and build mitigation plans
Contribute in building and evolving reporting and dashboard roadmap
Support ad-hoc analysis and reporting requests and other strategic priorities when needed
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Recognized for your ambitious spirit, and drive you are passionate about using data to inform decisions
With proven critical thinking abilities, you use your problem solving and data analysis skills to find opportunities and recommend improvements for the business
Known for your data analytics experience, you are fluent in using data analytics tools, excel, and tools such as Domo and Tableau to build reports and visualization
With a knack for adapting to a changing environment, you thrive in an ambiguous environment and can pivot when needed and handle conflicting priorities
Great-to-haves
Experience with database, SQL and VBA scripting
Experience in sales, marketing and/or product management environment
Experience in working with data sources from TELUS systems or other complex systems
A bachelor’s degree in business or related field and 3 years of experience in business analysis or similar role

job_title: Business Support Analyst - Functional Business Systems
job_description:
Vancouver, BCWork Site: Finance Offices - West 8th Avenue

Status: Regular Full Time

Reference#: 112268-ale


JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Process Integration & Support and Regional Business System (RBS) Sustainment, you will be responsible for ensuring functional business system issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manner and continually looking for opportunities to maximize usage of the system to ensure on-going business process improvement.

As the primary point of contact for designated business area users across Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) and Providence Health Care (PHC), you will work with stakeholders to streamline and standardize processes and implement best practices as well as troubleshoot system problems, test system solutions, establish clear lines of communication and ensure clear visibility of critical functional issues.

The Business Support Analyst:
Provides expert functional RBS support to ensure that business needs are met and to ensure the application is used to its full potential.
Champions RBS and builds relationships with stakeholders that enable the sharing of knowledge and information and encourage collaboration on issues.
Identifies opportunities and makes recommendations for further engagement of RBS by ensuring system enhancements are developed, tested, deployed and function according to agreed upon requirements.
Maintains up to date knowledge regarding new and upcoming system functionality.
Works closely with key stakeholders in the determination and implementation of best practices including participating in the preparation of business cases, process re-engineering, and improvement initiatives.
Represents the department at system meetings, establishing and maintaining clear lines of communications between user department and technical IMITS team members.
Configures system changes and prepares related documentation for changes impacting on system processing, other RBS modules including changes to common data elements across shared modules, non-RBS applications, and any changes requiring use of the Application Designer tools.
Provides technical guidance and direction to Analysts and/or other team members in all aspects of reporting, auditing and testing. Assigns project priorities to ensure overall timelines are met.
Develops and maintains training materials and reference documentation related to new systems/processes to ensure knowledge transfer and consistent usage by users. Coordinates and facilitates training sessions, drives train-the-trainer activities, and provides one-on-one guidance.
Writes queries to customize reports to meet user needs and conducts system audits to ensure data integrity.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERTISE:

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related discipline supplemented by related Information Systems courses
A minimum of five (5) years’ recent related experience within a large organization with an emphasis on business systems and reporting , health care or information management or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Extensive experience with complex ERP systems, project planning and control.
Experience supporting PeopleSoft’s HCM (Timekeeping, Human Resource, Payroll) module and/or expert knowledge in these areas will be an asset.
Expertise:
Expert ability to apply knowledge of RBS modules relating to the designated business area (Human Resources, Timekeeping, Payroll) and maintain an understanding of interdependencies with other modules.
A solid understanding of business functions and processes in order to enhance business processes and create efficiencies through enterprise application systems.
A strong sense of ownership and a results-oriented attitude to continually improve processes and systems, enhance efficiency and contribute to overall organizational success.
Strong communication skills and the ability to establish and maintain strong communication channels with stakeholders.
Solid technical and troubleshooting abilities in the provision of RBS support.
Strong initiative, self-direction and problem solving abilities to identity gaps and opportunities for improvement.
A strong ability to keep abreast of technological changes, anticipate opportunities and ensure readiness for future technology changes and enhancements.
Superior analytical skills for data, documentation and workflows, including the ability to comprehend, analyze and resolve complex issues and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Highly developed business writing and verbal communication skills with the ability to document work appropriately.
Knowledge of project structures; business case development; contract management; documentation of workflows; health care setting and analytical tools.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the staffpostings.vch.ca site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

job_title: Supply Chain Analyst, Materials Management Department
job_description:
Toronto, ONAPPLICATIONS ARE INVITED FOR THE POSITION OF

SUPPLY CHAIN ANALYST

MATERIALS MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT

Non-Union Level 10 - $59,143 - $73,928


CRITERIA FOR AN INTERVIEW ARE AS FOLLOWS:

Three-year College Diploma in Business Administration, Finance or Material Management, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Minimum two (2) years of related experience in a complex public purchasing and/or accounting environment
Certified Supply Chain Management Professional (CSCMP) designation and/or Certified Purchasing Card Professional (CPCP)
Experience with data analysis and research
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and advance level computer skills in spreadsheets and computerized financial/purchasing systems
Strong personal and communication (oral and written) skills
Knowledge of SAP Materials Management Module an asset


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Reporting to and under the direction of the Manager of Purchasing, the Supply Chain Analyst will develop data reporting and financial analysis in identifying cost savings opportunities and streamlining processes. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Research best buying practices and recommend innovative approaches to the acquisition of goods and services
Evaluate and monitor vendor performance system/vendor score card to identify cost savings opportunities
Review and oversee the procure to pay process of all card programs
Evaluate the P-card process and recommend changes to optimize the effectiveness of the card and rebate programs
Develop metrics program to report Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and statistical reporting
Analyze transactions, data, and reports to ensure compliance to policies and procedures
Analyze reports on spending trends, leading to recommendations on future program improvements
Provide functional expertise in investigating system issues and processes and recommending changes
Analyze SAP purchasing/financial data to inform system contract needs for the organization
Analyze purchasing data of existing system contracts to determine utilization, compliance and necessary changes to contracts
Analyze and inform contract process for cost savings
Proactively solicit supply trend data from business sources and prepare analysis
Tender/Purchase approvals for up to $5,000.00
Requesting/assigning staff to perform MIGO/reverse MIGO and authorizing as required
Perform other duties as required or assigned

Barrier-Free Recruitment

Applications are to be submitted online through Apply To Education.


We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.


Please note, candidates selected for an interview will be required to provide original applicable education documents.

Greater Toronto Area, ONJob Description
Reporting to the Supply Chain Team Leader, the main responsibility as Supply Chain Analyst will be to analyze order patterns by customer, product categories, seasonality, etc. to generate the Sales Forecast that will be the starting point for the Sales and Operations Planning process.
Primary Responsibilities
Analyze ordering patterns for all finished goods to produce a Sales Forecast
Analyze the performance of the Sales Forecast to understand the deviations and improve the forecasting model
Participate in various improvement projects in the Supply Chain area
Manage the IREP program for the organization
Responsible to track KPIs for the Supply Chain Department
Required Experience
Post-secondary education in Business, preferable with focus on Supply Chain
Strong analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Advanced Excel is a must
VBA, R or any other language for statistical computing and data visualization would be a strength
Some ERP experience required
Core Competencies
Customer and Product Centricity - Responds to the needs of both internal and external customers in a timely and courteous manner, showing a sense of urgency; always keeping our products front and centre.
Flexibility, Agility, Adaptability - Adapts to changes; changes strategy in response to new information; responds appropriately and quickly without having all parameters defined; demonstrate tolerance for speed and uncertainty.
Team Work and Collaboration - Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and methods of communication to gain agreement or acceptance of a plan or activity. Is effective in building constructive relationships; uses tact; interacts with others in an open, friendly manner, encourages collaboration.
Passion for Excellence – Always looks for ways to improve effectiveness or efficiency, making recommendation to increase productivity in quality of work; develops innovative solutions, challenges the status quo. To be the best, never compromising.
Drives Execution - Takes risks, learn from their mistakes, builds trust and is a role model to others. Has a “hands-on” style; is aggressive in achieving desired results.

Toronto, ONAt Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

This position enables Rogers to meet its television objectives set out by the CRTC. As a Compliance Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for driving the reporting process by accurately planning, forecasting and reporting against those objectives.

 What you will be doing:

Accurately forecasting, reporting on and maintain CRTC Conditions of License obligations for 4 TV stations
Compiling statistical content analysis reports weekly, monthly and annually.

Toronto, ONPermanentThe Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) helps people overcome workplace injuries and illnesses and helps business owners make their workplaces safe and healthy. Our people are at the heart of what we do. Bring your enthusiasm and expertise to the WSIB, and we'll help you achieve your personal and professional goals through meaningful work, development opportunities and a culture of compassion, integrity and teamwork.

We are the WSIB. And we're here to help.

What can I expect to do in this role?
Senior Workforce Analyst
Manage and maintain service levels and customer satisfaction in a multi-channel environment when scheduling and developing forecasting models.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Data analysis
Conduct extensive data analysis to identify work volume variances, call drivers, customer behaviour and call types.Analyze and report upon historical data and trends in order to develop forecast models and ensure that service levels are metMaintain call and email trackers for all staffing groups in order to analyze and identify trends to create accurate forecasts.Provide forecasts based on historical trends, emerging business events, yearly/monthly/weekly/daily.
2. Capacity planning
Develop and maintain a detailed staffing plan that incorporates all resourcing inputs (shrink, workload, attrition, etc.) for use by Workforce Schedulers in the creation of schedules.Provide detailed analysis to business partners with recommendations for maintaining appropriate staffing levels by increasing or decreasing staffing.Assist in the budget planning process to provide input and recommendations on budget and resourcing requirements.Maintain capacity plan up to 2 years in advance to be used for branch budgeting and resource allocation. This plan will drive decision around FTE requirements/allocation.
3. Identify staff metrics
Identify staff not meeting individual performance standards based on metrics reported by the Customer Experience Office. E.g.: occupancy / shrink / conformance / average handle time.
4. Liaise with business partners
Liaise with business partners on scheduling and forecasting proceduresLead the vacation planning process. Create vacation allotments for each day within the 6 month bidding period.Provide knowledge of best practices to lead forecasting/planning activities with each business partner.

How do I qualify?
Mandatory
PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
1. Education (Level and Specialty / Discipline):
Some post-secondary education training to support the analytical/problem solving nature of the role.
2. Experience (Years of Related Experience and Type of Experience):
3 years in a senior workforce management role with expert knowledge in scheduling/real time management/forecasting.
3. Technical or Professional Qualifications or Certifications / Designations:
Experience with Workforce Management technologies (ACD, WFM Software).Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge

How to Apply
As a precondition of employment, the WSIB will require a prospective candidate to undergo a criminal records name check prior to or at any time following hire.

To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date noted above on our Job Opportunities page: Job Opportunities page.

We appreciate the interest of all candidates. Due to the volumes of applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates that are selected to move forward in the recruitment process. The WSIB is an equal opportunity employer.

The WSIB is an equal opportunity employer and provides accommodation for job applicants in accordance with the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you are an individual with a disability and you need accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca. If you are invited to participate in the assessment process, please provide your accommodation needs at that time. Please be advised that you may be required to provide medical documentation to the WSIB's Corporate Health Department so that appropriate accommodation can be provided to you throughout the recruitment process.

Employees of the WSIB have important ethical responsibilities, including the obligation to place the public interest above personal interests. Job applicants are therefore required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. These may include: political activity, directorship or other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with existing WSIB employees, clients and/or stakeholders). Please contact TAC if you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/ or how to make a disclosure.

Privacy Statement
Personal information will be collected from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997 and will be used by the Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties to assess/validate your qualifications and/or determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, contact the WSIB Privacy Office, 200 Front Street West, Toronto, ON, M5V 3J1 or 416-344-5323 or 1-800-387-0750 extension 5323. Mississauga, ONDescription
As our company slogan states, the Staples’ Supply Chain is Making Things Happen for our customers every day through our network of more than 10 warehouses, 300 stores, and hundreds of delivery trucks. And even though we already operate the best supply chain in our industry, we need talented individuals like you to help us leverage advanced analytics and optimization algorithms to achieve breakthrough performance levels.

Position Summary
The Operations Research Analyst (Supply Chain) is responsible for applying analytical methods to improve decision-making across the Staples’ Supply Chain
Using mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization, the individual will play an important role in the tactical execution of optimal or near-optimal solutions to complex decision-making problems
These problems will come from all parts of the Staples’ Supply Chain and will include challenges like:
Developing inventory management procurement strategies that minimize Staples’ investment in inventory while achieving or exceeding service-level targets
Refining the Staples’ logistics network strategy to ensure facility locations and store / customer assignments are optimized to minimize variable costs
Enhancing and implementing product profitability / cost-to-serve models to ensure the right products are being stocked in the right locations
Primary Responsibilities:
Apply analytical methods to solve complex, data-driven business problems that will ultimately have a direct impact on the Staple’s bottom-line
Communicate results to management as needed
Research, design, and implement data models and innovative algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to realize actionable results
This role will be directly or indirectly supporting all functional areas within the Staples’ Supply Chain

Qualifications
Qualifications
Basic:
MS in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field plus 1-3 years industry experience.
PhD in Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related (no industry experience required)
Experience with data mining, mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and mathematical optimization tools, including linear programming, integer programming, mixed-integer programming, Markov decision processes, and multivariate analysis
Demonstrated analytical thinking, strategic problem-solving capabilities
Preferred:
Knowledge and experience using major statistical analysis tools such as R, Matlab, or SAS
Experience working with development toolsets such as Hadoop, MYSQL, Teradata, NOSQL, etc.
Experience with financial modelling
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner with both technical and non-technical customers

Staples is committed to providing accommodation to people with disabilities throughout the job application and interview process to the point of undue hardship. If you require an accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact a Customer Care Representative at 1-866-782-7537.


Staples is an equal opportunity employer and an accommodation will be provided during the hiring process if requested.

We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose.

JOB NUMBER: 27797

Why you should join us:
Are you passionate about analyzing data and do you enjoy conducting root cause assessments? Reporting to the Reliability Engineer Lead, you will work closely with the maintenance group to provide Condition Based Monitoring (CBM), mechanical engineering and equipment reliability support for our base plant haul truck and grader fleets.
You will use your expertise to:
Conduct CBM and data analysis using health monitoring real-time applications and create notifications for maintenance execution
Conduct event driven and predictive maintenance (PdM) analysis
Liaise with maintenance planning and execution to optimize maintenance scheduling for haul trucks and graders
Support or lead health monitoring projects while working closely with the PdM team and vendors to optimize programs
Collaborate with maintenance and reliability engineers on event and trend analysis and conduct and/or support equipment failure investigation and root cause assessment
Analyze maintenance history and track component hours
Manage, assess and action fleet oil analysis program
Employ equipment health monitoring tools to develop CBM alarm thresholds, trends, establish technical operating envelopes and work with equipment vendors as required
Develop equipment strategies and preventive maintenance programs for our haul truck and grader fleets
Track and report on CBM data and key performance indicators, and assess business case/savings achieved by the program
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Five years of experience in condition based/ health monitoring for mobile mining or heavy equipment or similar relevant industry
Experience and a deep understanding of oil analysis
Experience in real-time health monitoring system application usage such as Minecare
A Mechanical Engineering degree, or a Heavy Equipment Technician Journeyperson certificate
A valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office suite
A strong safety mindset and display a creative and continuous improvement approach to your work
Well-developed critical thinking skills, with an ability to apply logic and challenge assumptions
Strong analytical skills with the ability to make decisions with integrity in order to achieve the best results and deliver the most value
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
A highly motivated self-starter who collaborates with others and builds positive relationships across different teams within an organization
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
Working knowledge of SAP
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Base Plant Mine in Fort McMurray, Alberta
If you reside outside of Fort McMurray, relocation of your primary residence to within 60 km of Fort McMurray is mandatory. Relocation support will be provided; we offer highly competitive housing assistance to eligible individuals
The shift schedule is a seven days on / seven days off rotation
Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future. Learn about our mission, vision and values.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary, compensation programs, and an annual incentive program
Flexible benefits package
Rewarding pension and savings plans

Saint John, NBWyndham Hotels & Resorts is now seeking a Systems Analyst, HTCS to join our team at Saint John in Saint John, New Brunswick.
Job Summary
We currently have an opportunity for a Systems Analyst within the Hotel Technology Client Support department, located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

The Systems Analyst will be responsible on developing and creating automated business processes using Kryon Studio. Using compiled data they will provide strategies to achieve a reduction in call volume through Change Requests to Software, Hardware, and Network.  An asset in your background includes:

Headquartered in Parsippany, N.J. with offices around the globe in London, Shanghai, Buenos Aires, Dubai and more, Wyndham Hotels & Resorts employs approximately 15,000 team members worldwide.

Software Asset Management Analyst - (IIT001Q)
