Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario and its goal is to create a transportation network that enhances the prosperity, sustainability and quality of life for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area. It leads the planning in the region with its Regional Transportation Plan that guides the work and investments of the organization. It builds light transit, bus rapid transit and Regional Express Rail and operates GO Transit, UP Express and PRESTO.
Our I&IT Service Desk, EUC & Service Management Office is looking for a Software Asset Management Analyst to manage the lifecycle planning of software licenses including the acquisition, compliance, costing and renewals of software licenses used across Metrolinx. The Analyst will also coordinate the development and implementation of Software Asset Management processes, policies and practices for the I&IT organization by working with I&IT stakeholders, Metrolinx business units and external vendor
Key Responsibilities

Organizes, analyzes and maintains software license information to establish an accurate and complete software/application license repository and to track software assets throughout their lifetime;Analyses and reports on license usage when contracts are nearing completion to determine if licenses should be renewed; Toronto, ONTemporaryTindall Associates, Inc., known as TAI (pronounced as T.A.I.), was founded in the mid-1970s and later incorporated as a privately held 'C' Corporation. The initial business was general insurance consulting.
In early 2018, TAI's parent company, LOGiQ3 Group was acquired by RGAx. RGAx is the transformation engine and a wholly owned subsidiary of Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA). A Fortune 500 company, RGA is among the leading global providers of life reinsurance and financial solutions. Today, TAI is the premier provider of life reinsurance solutions in North American, with the capability of expanding to international markets. Reinsurance is global business, and TAI's base system is flexible and can be customized to meet the needs of these new markets. TAI offers a complete software solution for the life companies to self-report all their reinsurance information; assumed, ceded or retroceded in an electronic format to share with their partners on a cost-effective basis.
The Reinsurance Analyst (RA) is an entry level position in which the candidate will independently execute upon established processes within the reinsurance administration outsourcing team with a high degree of effectiveness and quality. These functions usually entail maintaining policy or cession records on administrative systems, preparing and reviewing billing statements and reports, and handling client or reinsurance company inquiries. Often these functions are more complex in nature and will require more detailed review and analysis. This role builds upon established reinsurance administration expertise to ensure efficient delivery of quality output to reinsurers and clients.
This role provides opportunities for continued career advancement as an individual contributor for analytical problem solvers, or those who aspire to develop subject matter and/or leadership expertise in reinsurance operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Review and analyze complex reinsurance administration tasks, including processing and tracking reinsurance claims, premium billing and payment, and reinsurance treaty review and maintenance.
Maintain SLAs with client
Ensure data quality and compliance on administration systems.
Execute a variety of reinsurance processes utilizing the TAI system, MS Access databases and MS Excel worksheet processes.
Participate in projects as required including data analysis and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc internal, reinsurer, and client requests.
REQUIREMENTS
College or University Degree.
Proven knowledge of insurance and accounting concepts.
A self-starter with a passion to be curious
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word, experience with using database structures.
Strong communications skills (both verbal and written), with the ability to clearly summarize complex topics
Detail oriented with an ability to manage a variety of tasks and deadlines
Team player with a client focus
Ability to manage and execute business processes to completion, while demonstrating best practices, evidenced controls, and quality outcomes.
Effective communication skills with clients and reinsurers.
Creativity, curiosity, and a professional demeanor.
Ensure quality work in a timely manner meeting established service level agreements and timelines.
Independent thinker who is adaptable to a fast-paced and constantly evolving work environment.
Aptitude toward mathematics.
Effective collaboration skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Quick learner of new processes and technology.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
University degree in computer science, actuarial science, finance, or accounting.
Previous insurance operations or financial reporting experience.
Proficiency in MS Access, SQL, or TAI.
Ability to work with large data sets to recognize systemic trending issues and/or data anomalies.
Understanding of various life insurance products written in the North American market.
Pursuing a FLMI/ACS or ARA designation from LOMA.
Developed client service skills.

Using a variety of facilitation and interview techniques, the Business Analyst will guide business stakeholders through the discovery, identification and documentation of business outcomes, process design, and business & functional requirements for new systems or functionality.
A service-oriented leader and an expert communicator , the Business Analyst has a strong bias for detail, team collaboration and implementing systems that ensure strong user adoption and business outcomes.
Duties/Accountabilities
Develop sustainable, repeatable and quantifiable business process improvements.
Collect and analyze process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on increased productivity, reduced cost and enhanced customer service.
Gather, analyze, and document business, functional, reporting and technical requirements using techniques such as interviews, site visits, surveys, document analysis, workshops, process analysis.
Facilitate the chartering of new initiatives by working with business leaders to help them articulate their objectives and desired business outcomes, and to define scope.
Develop artifacts such as Business Requirements Document, Functional Requirements, Technical Requirements, Process Flow Diagrams, Gap Analysis, and Use Cases to effectively convey requirements.
Work with Business Stakeholders, Operations Teams, Technical SMEs, External Vendors and Leadership to ensure that the solution provided align with the business requirements and business objectives.
Perform process and gap analysis to ensure compatibility and interoperability of processes and systems.
Manage relationships with stakeholders to achieve project goals and provide continued best practice support to leaders to ensure successful adaptation of the initiative.
Lead the user acceptance testing and facilitate the feedback to External Vendor as part of the iterative solution development process.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.
Provide orientation and inputs into process and system training material.
Perform continued evaluations of end user adoption and work with end users to identify opportunities for business process improvements.
Education and Experience
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or completion of a Post-secondary Diploma in Computer Science.
A minimum of 6-8 years related work experience (systems analyst, business analyst, design, application development and/or technical support) with proven ability to lead a business team through a process and systems change.
Demonstrated experience in eliciting requirements for at least one core operations process such as order to invoice, procure to pay, product lifecycle management, material resource planning, or manufacturing.
Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies
As a natural leader, fosters a friendly, team-oriented workplace where employees work safely and productively together.
An expert communicator with strength in collaboration and relationship building, maintains a healthy, open and trusting workplace, with integrity and accountability.
With a passion for service excellence and business enablement, proven ability to deliver on work products that provide measureable business benefit.
A detailed understanding of how business works, and continually develops business acumen through learning and training.
Proven skills in the development of business requirements, functional requirements, technical requirements, process flows, gap analyses and use cases. Formal methodology training in these areas is an asset.

Are you passionate about getting high quality data into the hands of business leaders? Does test automation make you excited to get up in the morning?


We’re looking for a Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst based in Burnaby, BC.
Reporting to the Data Management Program Manager, the Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst develops, establishes, and enforces quality assurance standards and measures for the Data Management Group. One of the primary responsibilities of this position is to develop, execute, and report on test cases from specified project requirements. Additionally, the incumbent is responsible for the coordination, execution and verification of testing procedures against Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) & Data Lake solutions. The incumbent ensures that all benchmarks are being met and reported accurately to the Program Manager.

The Opportunity:
Develop & Execute Test Cases and document results for data-oriented solutions (EDW, Data Lake, etc) including presentation layers (SSRS, SSAS, Tableau, etc)
Develop automated test scripts
Participate in work planning including calculation of testing estimates
Lead the development, establishment, and enforcement of quality assurance processes, measures and testing standards, providing QA expertise and support to developers and other QAs on team

Here’s What You Bring
Undergraduate degree in business, computer science or equivalent
5 years quality assurance experience in a data-oriented environment, including direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, automated testing tools, and reporting software.
2 years working directly with relational databases and SQL, including the ability to write queries to validate data accuracy and quality. SQL Server experience would be an asset.
Tableau experience an asset


What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
Base salary + paid overtime
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
RRSP and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.
A multi-award winning LEED gold certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring:
A subsidized, multi-award winning childcare centre.
A subsidized cafeteria, car washing and dry cleaning services, and free parking.
A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs.
Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.

Blacks Harbour, NBFinancial Business Analyst

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

The Role:

As a result of our robust growth we are seeking a Financial Business Analyst for our Seawater Office in Blacks Harbour, NB. You will lead the forecasting process, working with management employees from our seawater operations to streamline the periodic forecasting and modelling process. You will prepare fixed asset budgeting, update projections and aide with the consolidation of information for senior executive. You will support the overall Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) function for the seawater group of companies. Additionally, you will be required to perform cost of production and key performance indicator analysis and will be assigned to specific projects as required.

You will have a minimum of 3 years of financial analysis experience, a professional designation considered an asset, and have finely tuned organizational and detail management skills.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter that thrives in a very dynamic work and data driven environment and will be proficient with Excel.

The Opportunity:

The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to stretch, to work within the parameters of the role but stretch to your fullest potential. We are a team that counts performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of the fastest growing company in New Brunswick and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth, and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

The Why:

Why Cooke…simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

job_title: Business Operations Analyst / Analyste opérations d'affaire
job_description:
The Monetization Business Operations team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, measuring the impact of our strategies against the plan, and executing on strategic initiatives. We are looking for an analytical, communicative, and intellectually curious Business Operations Analyst to join our BizOps team in Montreal. Your day-to-day will involve modeling our business deals, building dashboards to track the performance of our deals, supporting month-end revenue reporting/closing, and collaborating with the sales team to handle ad hoc requests from publishers.

Responsibilities


Formulate deal strategy and create solid models to help Unity sign informed impactful business deals
Build dashboards to monitor deal performance and ensure accurate payments
Be the go-to data expert around our network's performance and assist the sales team in answering our publisher's ad hoc questions
Develop a keen sense of mobile monetization and our data to help our business leaders make strategic and sustainable decisions
Question the status quo and seek new ways of improving processes that extend out cross-functionally

Requirements


A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent attention to detail
Skilled with SQL (required) and Excel (required)

Bonus points


Adtech dealmaking background
Ability to work with teams across multiple time-zones
Love of gaming is a plus

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#LI-WM1 #SEN

L'équipe des opérations commerciales de monétisation chez Unity joue un rôle primordial dans la prise de décisions axée sur les données, la comparaison de l'incidence de nos stratégies avec notre plan et l'exécution d'initiatives stratégiques. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un ou d'une analyste des opérations commerciales possédant une curiosité intellectuelle et des compétences en analyse ainsi qu'en communication qui se joindra à notre équipe BizOps à Montréal. Les activités quotidiennes liées au poste comprennent la modélisation de nos ententes commerciales, l'établissement de tableaux de bord pour effectuer le suivi du rendement de nos ententes, la prise en charge des rapports financiers et de la fermeture des comptes à la fin du mois ainsi que la collaboration avec l'équipe des ventes pour la gestion des demandes ponctuelles provenant d'éditeurs.

Responsabilités


Établir des stratégies d'entente et bâtir des modèles solides afin d'aider Unity à établir des ententes commerciales importantes de façon éclairée
Mettre en place des tableaux de bord afin d'effectuer le suivi du rendement des ententes et de s'assurer de l'exactitude des paiements
Être l'expert des données à qui s'adresser en ce qui a trait au rendement de notre réseau et aider l'équipe des ventes à répondre aux questions ponctuelles de nos éditeurs
Développer un sens aigu de la monétisation mobile et de nos données afin d'aider nos responsables des opérations à prendre des décisions stratégiques et durables
Remettre en question le statu quo et chercher de nouvelles façons d'améliorer les processus pour étendre notre portée interfonctionnelle

Compétences


Passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
Solides compétences interpersonnelles et en communication
Grand souci du détail
Compétences avec SQL (requis) et Excel (requis)

Atouts


Expérience en conclusion d'ententes avec les technologies publicitaires (adtech)
Capacité de travailler avec plusieurs équipes selon différents fuseaux horaires
Passion pour les jeux vidéo un atout

Qui sommes-nous

Nous sommes une entreprise orientée vers le produit, nous sommes curieux et créatifs. Afin de permettre à Unity d'évoluer avec les progrès, d'être plus conviviale et d'élargir ses marchés, nous réinvestissons continuellement dans le développement. Avec plus d'un milliard d'installations par mois, Unity rejoint autant les joueurs que les amateurs. En plus de nos jeux vidéo, nos logiciels sont utilisés dans des secteurs aussi variés que la médecine, la visualisation et le commerce. Ces logiciels contribuent à démocratiser le développement des jeux, permettent de résoudre des problèmes et favorisent la réussite d'un grand nombre de développeurs à l'échelle mondiale.

Aujourd'hui, Unity compte plus de 15 succursales dans le monde et ses employés sont répartis dans 23 pays. Les employés de Unity Technologies sont passionnés et dynamiques, il ne suffit plus de savoir faire le travail, nous sommes à la recherche de candidats qui souhaitent se dépasser, surmonter des obstacles et qui ont de grands rêves!

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs que nous pouvons faire pour vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. L'unité ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

#LI-WM1 #SEN

Crowdlinker is an end-to-end digital product studio based in Toronto with a relentless focus on our customers. We connect people through technology by being the strongest link between companies, their ideas, and their clients. We do so by excelling at digital strategy, creative design, full-stack development of websites & web/mobile apps, and digital marketing (SEO, SEM, PPC, Marketing Automation). Our clients include large startups like Freshbooks, PostBeyond, League, and TopHat, as well as enterprises like Unilever, Nestlé and DHX Media. We create cutting-edge applications using the latest technologies and design them with an exceptional user-experience.

As a QA Intern Analyst, you will work closely with developers, product managers, and designers to define test plans, test cases, and test procedures to validate requirements against developed software. Ideally, you will have an understanding of mobile design (iOS and Android) as well as desktop. You will assist with functional, integration, and regression testing. Communicate bugs to development teams and track them to completion. You will identify trends, problems, inconsistencies, and actively research and resolve issues. You understand that shipping a product is not the end of a project while sharing our healthy obsession for quality.

We are growing quickly, which means there are always new and exciting challenges at Crowdlinker. This is the exact opposite of a slow, boring enterprise job. We are looking for someone who is comfortable taking risks and solving burning problems. We embrace change, see challenges as opportunities and focus on solutions. We hope you can join us to push the boundaries of what’s possible.

Quality Assurance is not a one-fits-all job. Please only apply if you have a passion for the software industry and fit the job description.

Requirements
Must Haves:
Enrolled in co-op or internship program for Computer Science, Computer Math, Systems Eng, Software Eng, etc.
An understanding of the product development lifecycle and QA methodologies
Solid knowledge of a variety of testing methodologies and technologies (i.e. Regression testing, Load/Stress, Black/White box testing, Acceptance, Performance etc.)
Understands IT standards, methodologies, SDLC
Strong familiarity with Android and iOS hardware, operating systems, and testing environments
Expertise with the nuances of cross-platform testing on mobile
Detail oriented, resourceful, creative, and must possess strong logical and analytical skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously
Passionate about testing, quality, technology, and excellence
You have excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and can clearly articulate your product decisions (You will be in client meetings presenting your work)
You have empathy and passion.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and bounce ideas off others - you understand that giving/receiving feedback is crucial in your development and growth
Experience with an iterative design and software development process: incorporating feedback, launching quickly, and testing hypotheses in an agile environment.
Strong work ethic with the ability to meet deadlines.
Nice to Haves:
Past experience working in a software development agency or tech startup.
Experience coding in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and WordPress is a plus.
Experience with writing and creating test cases in various test suites.
Thirst for more, we are a growing company we want people who are driving and hungry to take on challenging projects.
Responsibilities
Perform manual end-to-end testing on new features.
Perform manual regression tests in an agile development environment.
Find, reproduce, isolate, identify, report, and track issues/bugs/inconsistencies/defects to Product Managers
Participate in engineering and product planning to make sure new code is written with testing in mind.
Author functional test cases for product enhancements and modifications (test scenarios, conditions and data) and assist with maintaining and improving existing test cases.
Work closely with product, UX, and engineering teams to ensure newly delivered features meet customer needs and are consistent across the product.
What’s in it for you?
Learn and implement the latest and greatest in product methodologies
Learn faster by working on a variety of client projects throughout the internship.
Join an experienced team of developers, designers, business leaders, and digital marketers.
An excellent opportunity to do something you are passionate about while having a direct impact on how users interact with your products.
A strong culture of excellence, mutual mentorship, and transparency.
Duration of the role
This is a paid 4 month internship in collaboration with your college or university. 35-40 hours per week (full-time hours) is required for a co-op work term.

How to apply
In your application, please include:

A link to your GitHub profile if you have one.
A link to your LinkedIn profile if you have one.
A link to your portfolio of work if you have one.
A summary of how you would be able to make a difference on our team.
Please include a traditional resume, a cover letter is optional.

company_name: Victorian Order of Nurses for Canada
job_description:
TemporaryRequisition Details:


Employment Status: Temporary, Full Time (1.0 FTE)
Program Name: Information Technology & Systems

Number of Hours Bi-Weekly: 75
Work Schedule: Days
On Call: No
Travel: Yes

Job Summary:
The Business Systems Analyst, Home Health Applications is responsible for supporting implementation as well as the maintenance of mobile solution, back office applications, integration with other systems and its successful adoption by front line service providers.
Key Responsibilities:
Leads system lifecycle processes for the implementation of a mobile application solution including but not limited to; the gathering of requirements, systems configuration and testing/validation of functions.
Develops detailed application documentation including; test cases, business process documentation and work breakdown structures.
Conducts problem-solving and troubleshooting of the scheduling and clinical applications systems interoperability, configurations and user interfaces.
Acts as a liaison among clients, IS/IT resources, and technical solution providers in order to configure and deliver a system which meets operational needs.
Considers user/client needs, technical solution providers, and budget to design and deliver solutions throughout the life of a solution which meet user’s needs.
Performs new user account administration, as well as configure and maintain mobile application test environments.
Participates with other team members to identity and implement business process changes/improvements as well as to identify and implement the change management steps needed within the project.
Prepares and presents recurring reporting in order to understand the effectiveness of the solution, as well as the level of successful adoption of the mobile application technology.
Works closely with and provides support to the application trainer throughout implementation of the project.
Troubleshoots and analyzes issues that staff are having during the adoption of the mobile application, processes, systems or technology in order to identify corrective action.
Reviews help desk tickets and resolve issues related to Procura / CellTrak.
Monitors user entry data and guides data maintenance methods.
Makes changes and implements system configurations.
Supports users for organizational changes.
Conducts on-going reviews of functional specifications and processes, providing recommendations for process/technology improvements in line with current and growing business needs.
Designs system process and maintains up-to-date documents on current and future developments.
Produces/reviews functional specifications and processes for enhancements.
Conducts unit testing and integration testing initiatives with IT/ IS and user community.
Supports UAT testing and promotion to Production environment.
Creates & maintains application reports as required by users.
Develops & maintains detailed application documentation.
Builds and manages relationships with key stakeholders and proactively manages expectations.
Actively participates with fellow teammates in improving methods, tools and techniques as well providing, coaching and mentoring in areas of expertise.
Assists in development of user training documentation as required.
Participates in gathering client requirements as required. Facilitate meetings and deliver effective presentations as required.
External and Internal Relationships
Builds and manages relationships with cross-functional team members, users/clients, and key stakeholders.
Works with vendors and outsourced support to identify opportunities for application of existing technological solutions to current issues.
Education, Designations and Experience:

Post-Secondary degree in Computer Science or Business Administration.
Minimum five (5) years of recent experience in a business system analyst role.
Superior understanding and minimum of two (2) years of experience with the Android based operating system, mobile device configuration and core mobile applications.
Previous experience supporting implementation of one (1) or more successful mobile application projects in an environment with >500 staff.
Understanding of staff scheduling, time management, resource planning and/or workforce management systems.
Experience in a community healthcare setting is an asset.
Experience with Home Healthcare (Procura) and / or Mobile Care Delivery Solutions (CellTrak) is preferable.
Experience with business process redesign and the principles of organizational change management.
Skill Requirements:
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal and presentation).
An adept facilitator and competent in relationship building.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively with team members in order to identify business requirements, suitability of application solutions, and change management processes needed to achieve goals.
Demonstrated ability to write clear requirement statements, test plans, application usage guides and business process documentation.
Solid analytical problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.
Advanced skills with MS Office productivity suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and proficient in MS Project.
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to balance multiple priorities and to manage time effectively.
Ability to provide end users with options and advise on implementing major/minor/critical enhancements.
Ability to develop clear and concise documentation that users and other functional consultants/partners/users will be able to utilize.
Strong problem-solving, analytical, time management, decision-making, and influencing skills.
Excellent interpersonal and application support skills.
Other:
Must have personal vehicle and possess both a current driver’s license and proof of vehicle insurance.
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.
A current and original copy of a satisfactory Criminal Records Check is required.
A Vulnerable Sector Search and/or Child Abuse Registry Check may be required
Ability to speak French is an asset.

Monitors agent adherence/compliance to schedule and escalates to Team leader for investigation.
Ensure all required data is tracked and trended on a continuous basis and Re-allocates changes in staffing levels
Makes recommendations and routing changes based on observations
Interface with business unit management as needed for escalation of service-impacting issues
Manages special conditions within the framework of an Emergency Action Plan (i.e. Fire, Power failures, etc.)
Analyzes schedule efficiency measurements as well as key indicators such as service level, for continuous improvement
Tracks and trends contact centre data for long and short terms forecasting (E.g., contact centre work volume, agent productivity, vacations, attendance, attrition levels, etc.)
Develops yearly vacation schedule queue allotments
Receives and monitors quality of information sources from sales, account management and operations/re-forecast as required
Ensures accuracy and timeliness of data stream for forecasting
Develops forecasts for long term (12 months) and short term (1-4 months) to determine optimum staffing levels
Performs consolidated gap analysis on initial forecasted plan to actual
Develops employee schedules to match planning and forecasting outputs, as well as planning input from operations management
Utilizes effective methods for managing scheduling practices such as the schedule bid process
Organized and completes bids and communications for respective LOB
Manages and optimizes Team Leader schedules to best align with respective agents schedules – contributes to TL/Agent relationship to building
Schedules new employee training and orientation
Schedules for planned absences; schedules changes, such as vacation and breaks
Retains training and special events schedules
Develops input to budget planning process
Uses accuracy of forecast and schedule accuracy measurements for continuous improvement
Works closely with client contacts to adjust staffing expectations based on validated data
Conducts root cause analysis as required, and provides business solutions to Manager/Client
Trouble shoots system and process issues, engages supplier and or client for quick resolution
Works closely with Operations Team Managers to ensure respective lines of business are in line with requirements
Makes adjustments based on pertinent feedback
Mitigates business deliverable risk by closely maintaining all short and long term staffing requirements
Remains ‘right staffed’ to ensure continued profitability
Creates plans to better increase occupancy for respective LOB
Measures, monitors results and makes adjustments based on requirements and business deliverables
Makes process and system improvement recommendations to Operations and Client for continued operational optimization
Recommends and modifies staffing models to best suit contractual requirements
Remains highly familiar with all contractual deliverables and parameters
Partners with Account Management on problem resolution and solutions building

Job Description

Purpose
The Business Analyst contributes to Intelerad's success and growth by contributing to the reporting and measurement of marketing and communications programs and campaigns. The incumbent will work closely with stakeholders to optimize cross-business processes, such as the automation of processes related to marketing, sales, pipeline management, and social media platforms.
The candidate will also analyze, harvest business learnings and formulate recommendations to the marketing team based on the analysis of the data captured across a variety of platforms.
If you love numbers, if they speak to you and if you have a talent for translating their insights into actionable and measurable outcomes, this might be the job for you. We are looking for someone with a love of numbers who also has a solid understanding of how today’s communications and selling strategies take place across a number of digital platforms.

Major Accountabilities
Analyze data and translate it into actionable insights for the marketing team;
Interface with stakeholders to manage expectations and solve problems;
Contribute to the technical design and validation of business and reporting solutions;
Deliver monthly and quarterly reporting dashboards for the VP of Marketing, update the department scorecard;
Coordinate activities between process owners, users, software developers, system administrators and managers;
Contribute to the integration of the Marketing automation system and social media channels to other business systems such as Salesforce and ensure its optimization;
Develop processes to continuously monitor the quality and integrity of data;
Develop training content and provide training to users.

Qualifications

Pre-requisites
Bachelor degree in Business, Computer Science or related discipline
A minimum of 2 years of experience in data analysis for business, ideally, with exposure to marketing tools and social media
Experience with Agile development processes (e.g. Scrum, Kanban)

Desired competencies
Strong analytical, communication skills and problem-solving skills
Strong business acumen, especially at the financial level
Motivated and results-oriented
Strong attention to detail
Focus on quality
Collaborative approach
Additional Information

We offer:
Competitive salaries
Corporate bonus program
Employee recognition program
Employee referral program
Flexible hours
Comprehensive insurance plan
Training & skills upgrading
Social events
Dynamic culture

BGIS is seeking a vibrant, solution-driven HR Analyst to join our HR team in the Ottawa area. The successful candidate will have a minimum of three (3) years’ experience working as an HR Analyst or relevant Business Analysis experience. It is mandatory to have Advanced Excel skills and have demonstrated experience creating HR reports and working in HRMS systems (PeopleSoft, Oracle, SAP, etc.) as well as an interest in defining systems and processes.


The selected candidate must have strong interpersonal skills; have commitment to deadlines and the ability to lead initiatives to ensure data accuracy and usability of HR data in partnership with the financial/accounting team.


Roles and Responsibilities

Liaises with Senior Management and Internal Stakeholders to generate relevant reports
Partners with HR consultants and finance professionals to monitor, track and forecast headcount
Runs reporting on recruitment statistics via Taleo

Strong focus on detail and accuracy with the ability to take on full ownership of assigned work
Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Bilingualism (preferred)

ITS provides UNB with professional information and communication technology services, leadership, and expertise to ensure the UNB community can achieve its goals with the support of the best technologies of today and advances of tomorrow.
Representative Responsibilities
· Efficiently and effectively maintain infrastructure to meet availability, security, stability, usability, functionality and performance standards by using established procedures to install, configure, connect, patch, test, manage changes, maintain and deploy software, firmware and hardware; and by developing and maintaining associated documentation.
· Provide timely and professional daily operational support for infrastructure by investigating, troubleshooting and resolving, escalating or coordinating the resolution of infrastructure issues and security anomalies; completing assigned tasks, serving as an escalation point for unresolved issues from tier 1 support and by being available after hours to respond to emergencies.
· Provide knowledgeable infrastructure consultation internally for ITS and for UNB researchers, faculty and staff by identifying needs, applying UNB infrastructure and security standards, researching options, analyzing results, providing input on threat risk assessments, and presenting recommendations for approval.
· Provide timely assistance in the design of infrastructure installations, layouts and networks that meet documented requirements by helping develop and interpret written business requirements and technical specification documents and providing input on more complex designs.
· Regularly and consistently monitor, analyze and report on the infrastructure by checking logs, receiving automated system alerts, monitoring technical and security lists, collecting and analyzing metrics and creating performance, capacity and other reports.
Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with a Data Communications focus or Computer Engineering.
· Two years related work experience with operating technical infrastructure such as: UPS, server racks, switches, wireless access points, routers, cabling, VoIP technologies and firmware upgrades.
· Competent using various operating systems.
· Competent with systems, network, data centre and data storage technologies.
· Familiar with and able to apply applicable Telecommunications Industry Association (TIA) standards.
· Familiar with and able to apply standards related to working safely around electricity.
· Working knowledge of network security an asset.
· Must be able to work independently or as part of a team.
· Flexibility in working hours including participation in occasional scheduled on-call after hours support and time shifting.
· Ability to prioritize work, apply departmental standards and meet deadlines.
· Ability to adapt to changes in work environment. Adapts easily to and welcomes technology changes.
· Exercises initiative to independently learn new technologies.
· Participation in after-hours emergency response. Occasional travel required.

job_title: Fulfillment Analyst (Logistics and Vendor Management Analyst)
job_description:
Fulfillment Analyst (Logistics and Vendor Management Analyst)
Continuously drive Operations department forward towards business results, customer experience, and departmental efficiencies through a high focus on innovation and data analytics. Manage key performance indicators, recommend process improvement proposals, and own the change management. Drive the logistics and vendor management area of the business towards targeted results, particularly in the areas of: (1) vendor management and engagement, and (2) distributor rebate program administration and management.
As our Fulfillment Analyst, you will:
Identify, manage, and improve departmental key performance indicators
Be accountable for compilation and delivery of business performance scorecards
Work with business owners to implement recommendations
Act as primary conduit between Fulfillment Management and Business Development with major distributor partners for in-between activities and interactions across spectrum of vendor types
Responsible for RFP issuance, analytics, evaluation, and recommendations
Responsible for vendor program viability and feasibility assessments
Provide recommendations and enact both tactical and strategic decisions in accordance to overall vendor sourcing strategy
Be point person for vendor engagement activities such as business reviews, presentation preparation, etc.
Provide analysis of business trends, customer experience, and propose strategic recommendations
Build strong business relationships
Continuous learning and self-development
Identify and implement process improvements while continuously seeking opportunities to innovate
Track and report on status of all improvement initiatives
Document and maintain department risk management processes/policies
Maintain and create policy and process documentation and report to management and administration
As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:
Post-Secondary Degree
1 year of relevant experience
How Do We Hire Great People?
We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles.
Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time.

If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.

Softchoice is one of the largest IT solutions and Managed Services providers in North America! We are an influential, growth-oriented organization determined to enable our people, our clients, our partners and the communities we serve to realize their potential. Our unique culture fosters a friendly, open-minded workplace where employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. As a member of a dynamic, high-performing team, each Softchoice employee is hungry to learn, valued for their contribution, and approaches each day excited to make an impact.

Mississauga, ONThe joint venture between SNC-Lavalin and Aecon has been awarded a contract with Ontario Power Generation (OPG) to carry out the Darlington Retube and Feeder Replacement (RFR) project. The project involves refurbishment of all four reactors at the Darlington Generating Station and consists of two phases – a Definition Phase and an Execution Phase. The Definition Phase includes the construction of a full-scale reactor mock-up to simulate key elements of the refurbishment work, and the development, procurement and testing of specialized tooling required for the project.


The Execution Phase involves refurbishment of the reactor cores using the tools and methods that were developed and tested during the Definition Phase.

Creativity and customer service are what fuel the success of the Best Buy for Business team. This group provides unique product and service solutions to diverse clients across the private and public sectors — from hotels and restaurants to some of the country's largest corporations.
Access to commercial goods while minimizing costs of goods is crucial in today’s B2B market. The BBfB Analyst provides analysis, executes processes, and utilizes business tools and metrics to ensure that decisions to purchase are well informed. This role also identifies and provides recommendations of clearance practices for unutilized project purchases or underperforming open for sale stock.
As a BBfB Analyst you will…
Utilize the existing SP tool and be responsible for evaluating inventory purchase requests from the sales team, providing the approver with relevant information and delivering a data driven recommendation in a timely manner
Work with the BBfB Vendor Management team in reviewing the sales pipelines (via CRM), forecasted opportunities, history of sales/purchases, and other relevant data to build data driven recommendations on product purchases for the purposes of reducing cost and/or improving customer experience (i.e. speed of delivery)
Ensure available Inventory-On-Hand (IOH) quantity and quality is easily accessible to the BBfB sales team
Reduce aging inventory & product write-off by recommending substitutions for in progress opportunities
Find most cost-effective solutions for unutilized product purchased for project and make recommendations to reduce in future
Perform inventory call-backs from stores for unutilized project product
Work with members of Business Development/Operations team to communicate and incent where appropriate
We hope you are passionate about…
Communication – you enjoy communicating with internal and external partners to resolve issues
Logic and critical thinking – we’re largely a data driven company so consideration of all angles and viewpoints is vital
Innovation – as a tech company we are constantly changing and evolving; an openness and willingness to embrace change is critical

1-3 years of experience in retail as well as retail buying, inventory or planning experience
1-3 years of experience in retail management, operations or logistics

1-3 years of management / business development / manufacturing / supply experience (from vendor or manufacturing perspective) with responsibility to provide product to retail outlets

Cubic Field Services Canada, LTD. (CFSC) is the wholly owned Canadian subsidiary of Cubic Global Defense (CGD) Inc., based in San Diego.
CGD provides world-class training, readiness, and communications solutions for military, security, and public safety forces. In Canada, CFSC has a long standing presence with the delivery and support of Live Training Systems.Today, CFSC is headquartered at 45 O'Connor St. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K1P 1A4, and operates five field sites throughout Canada.
The Areas Weapon Effect System (AWES) project is in support of British Army training, and is related to its sister site in the Salisbury Plain, United Kingdom. The AWES provides state-of-the-art simulation of combat operations at the British Army Training Unit Suffield (BATUS) located at CFB Suffield in Alberta. The AWES gives the British Army an objective means of measuring troops' performance during large-scale military exercises.
INFANTRY ANALYST, INSTRUMENTED COLLECTIVE TRAINING (AREA WEAPONS EFFECTS SIMULATOR)

Analyses data to provide objective evidence of training lessons to the customer for the after action review at the end of each mission phase.
Supports military training staff as required in exercise planning and preparation in trend analysis.

 The applicant must have received formal military infantry training to Warrant Officer Level.

Energy Services provides the regulated rate option (RRO) electricity for consumers within Edmonton and parts of Alberta. Our highly skilled, knowledgeable, caring and engaged team is focused on providing outstanding customer care for the company, including our Edmonton-based contact and billing centres, and always striving to exceed our customers’ expectations.
Brief Description
The Analyst, Energy Accounting is accountable for preparation, analysis and evaluation of budgets and forecasts of energy revenue and cost, accounting for actual results of energy revenue and costs, and preparation of annual external financial statements. This includes achieving accurate and timely reporting of energy revenue and costs as well as month end reporting requirements.
Detailed Description
We are on the lookout for a financially savvy Energy Accounting Analyst to join our team!

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Reporting, the Analyst, Energy Accounting is responsible for the following:

Ensuring proper accounting treatments for routine, non-routine and complex transactions. This includes identifying presence of non-routine and complex transactions, analyzing and determining the accounting implications and integrating any tax, audit and finance implications into evaluation of treatment. Examples of non-routine and complex transactions include reorganization and financial hedges.
Researching appropriate accounting standards and developing recommendations on moderately complex accounting policies under International Reporting Standards (IFRS) accounting standards.
Preparing annual financial statements and note disclosures for the company, including ensuring the adequacy of financial statements disclosure against IFRS disclosure requirements.
Identifying and evaluating financial reporting needs, data requirements and business processes to support reliable financial reporting. Designing analytical and financial reports to address these needs. Assessing and making recommendations whether the reports should be developed in the financial reporting systems.
Assessing risks of changes to financial reporting systems, developing testing procedures/scenarios accordingly and evaluating the test results.
Maintain high quality internal controls, including providing inputs to the design of controls for new processes and transactions.
Maintaining all aspects of energy accounting, including rate uploads, accrual journal entries, in depth margin analysis and drafting related sections of the internal financial review as the subject matter expert
Preparing budget, forecast and rate filing application of energy revenue and costs
Assisting with special projects as required including providing input and support for software system upgrades or replacements.
Contribute to the ongoing process improvement initiative.
Job Requirements
The successful candidate will possess the following qualifications:
Successful completion of a diploma or degree in accounting
7-10 years of directly related accounting experience in:
Developing appropriate accounting policies and procedures
Evaluating accounting treatment for routine transactions
Identifying non-routine transactions by making reference to business model and industry, knowing that a transaction that is non-routine in one environment may be routine in another; determining accounting implications and integrating any tax, audit and finance implications into evaluation of treatment
Analyzing treatment for complex events or transactions, such as reorganization, financial instruments, etc.
Interpreting GAAP in the context of the entity’s specific circumstances and concluding on impact of GAAP standard changes on the financial statements
Preparing financial statements including note disclosure in compliance with GAAP
Evaluating the adequacy of financial statements note disclosure against GAAP disclosure requirements
Evaluating financial reporting needs, data requirements and business processes to support reliable financial reporting
Designing analytical and financial reports to meet reporting needs identified
Assessing risks of changes to financial reporting systems, developing testing procedures/scenarios accordingly and evaluating the test results
Preparing, analyzing and evaluating budget and forecasts
Evaluating sources and drivers of revenue/costs
Strong analytical skills including proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Ability to apply accounting standards knowledge and judgement to research and develop recommendations on moderately complex accounting policies
Preparation of financial statements and notes disclosure
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience designing, implementing documenting or auditing processes/controls
Basic understanding of Oracle GL systems would be considered an asset
Knowledge of the electricity industry would be considered an asset

The IT Analyst, Citrix develops specialized solutions, analyzing and diagnosing problems and formulating solutions requiring considerable knowledge of the complex computing environment to meet the organization’s server and remote application connectivity infrastructure and communication requirements and tests, maintains and supports infrastructure systems to achieve the highest level of server, workstation and system availability throughout the PHSA.
Key Accountabilities
Performs a variety of duties related to the utilization of server based or thin client computing by performing tasks such as configuring and maintaining servers and sessions through the implementation of technologies such as Citrix MetaFrame and Microsoft Terminal Server solutions.
Maintains operating systems by performing tasks such as analyzing current systems and recommending adjustments and /or new systems to improve operating activities. Develops instructional material for operating systems and operations staff.
Provides technical troubleshooting and support for a variety of server and remote application connectivity environments by performing tasks such as standardized building, scheduled changes, tuning and maintenance, analyzing and diagnosing problems and formulating solutions. Identifies unresolved issues and escalates to the Manager, following established problem management and change management processes. Implements solutions that promote the integration of technologies based on industry standards, and are compatible with PHSA’s network environment and standards.
Verifies all incidences are logged by methods such as reviewing system automated alerts for priority assignment, logs incidents and resolves or assigns to another team.
Performs performance monitoring/reporting and capacity planning/reporting as related to the Microsoft Windows server and remote connectivity environment by performing tasks such as running vendor supplied utilities to observe and record performance and utilization statistics.
Implements system upgrades and system tuning to ensure maximum performance, security and stability of servers including capacity planning such as storage, processor and memory bandwidth for current and anticipated loads in response to policy/client requirements or technology related to server systems by performing tasks such as completing system usage analysis, forecasting and new technologies assessment and implementation.
Develops technical support procedures, for areas such as server hardware and software installation and testing by performing tasks such as following industry best practices on hardware and software configurations.
Develops and maintains system documentation by performing tasks such as the online creation of standardized documentation which describes in detail the server configuration and image standards used, in addition to the creation and maintenance of server hardware and software installation instructions.
Develops and maintains documentation of items such as communication plans, scheduled downtime plans and emergency recovery procedures (ERP) by performing tasks such as creating and distributing IM/IT server related communications, organizing and implementing scheduled downtime events, and performing walk-through testing of existing ERP’s.
Provides technical support related to the acquisition of new systems and standards and/or the implementation of new applications on existing systems by performing tasks such as completing hardware and software compatibility testing and making recommendations on configuration and support strategies.
Performs a variety of duties related to infrastructure operations by performing tasks such as providing physical support to related Data Centre maintenance and upgrades to ensure all changes meet specified PHSA standards such as server rack mounting, network and power patch cabling and monitoring the completion of electrical work in computer rooms, by internal or external resources.
Performs a variety of duties related to software distribution by performing tasks such as packaging and distributing platform and software updates, including operating system and infrastructure technology application patches, fixes and drivers. Maintains and creates requested inventory queries such as systems management server (SMS) and crystal reports. Ensures workstation remote control capabilities are provided to support staff by performing tasks such as ensuring that it is incorporated into the standard workstation images deployed throughout the PHSA environment.
Performs a variety of duties related to server monitoring by performing tasks such as the configuration and monitoring of utilities such as Microsoft Operation Manager and Hewlett-Packard Insight Manager and escalating and resolving alerts generated by these tools.
Performs a variety of duties related to rapid deployment processes by performing tasks such as developing and maintaining standardized server imaging and deployment processes.
Performs a variety of duties related to operating systems such as Microsoft Windows 2003/2008/2012/2016 including configuring and maintaining active directory group policies, Domain Name Service (DNS) and Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) administration.
Performs a variety of duties related to application servers by performing tasks such as configuring, optimizing and maintaining business and/or clinical application servers.
Performs a variety of duties related to the implementation of security policies, procedures and peripherals by performing tasks such as security audits, infrastructure security best practices, server and remote application connectivity solution security hardening, site security assessments and the configuration and tuning of security and antivirus appliances.
Performs advanced monitoring and problem analysis activities for the server and remote application connectivity environments by investigating unknown system behaviour conditions, patterns and trends, and recurring issues to identify underlying causes to produce recommendations and remediations.
Conducts feasibility studies for computerization by performing tasks such as determining user department requirements, examining and identifying problems with existing systems and recommending modifications to and/or new systems. Provides details of estimated implementation costs including associated staffing requirements.
Develops specifications for complex systems such as integrated systems which impact several functional areas within a facility by performing tasks such as: gathering detailed information from user departments; developing and documenting systems and procedures by designing forms, preparing flow charts and detailing hardware and software specifications; preparing detailed implementation plans.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education, Training and Experience
Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in Computer Science, three (3) years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills and Abilities
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
Ability to write programs in a variety of programming languages.
Ability to operate related equipment.

North York, ONRequisition ID: 54378
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

DEPARTMENT SUMMARY:


The mandate of the Client Experience department is to envision, design, orchestrate, improve and measure the customer experience at Tangerine in order to deliver forward banking to Canadians and deliver on Tangerine’s mandate of being a client centric organization.

Client Experience Strategy
Service Design
Client Experience Innovation
Client Experience Design
Market Research
ROLE PURPOSE:


Do you want to build things that make people smile? Are you driven to make things simpler, faster and more innovative? Do you have a need to understand what’s under the hood? Are you daring when it comes to thinking differently to solve real world problems? Are you able to take complex business problems and create simple solutions and strategies to address those problems? Do you want to help build the next generation of banking in Canada? In this role, we are looking for people with vision and energy to help us in our quest to change the future of banking.

The role of the Client Experience Measurement Analyst is to analyze, research and understand trends in customer feedback. The Measurement Analyst will get under the hood of customer feedback and behavioural data to utilize the information to advocate for improvements in the customer experience. In this role, you will have a deep understanding of customer feedback and their experience with the bank across all channels. You will understand the macro banking eco-system and environment to measure and identify strategic opportunities to exceed customer expectations while still meeting the needs of the business from a regulatory and compliance perspective. This role will be responsible to ensure the voice of the customer is heard and that there are clear programs to solicit customer input and feedback. You will engage with various stakeholders around the bank to assess what is working and what is not for both the bank and the customer. You will be actively involved in projects to ensure they are developed in a way that enable the customer experience strategy.

ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Manage the Real-time Feedback (RTF) tool and manage the Net Promoter System (NPS) to support the Voice of the Customer Program, Tangerine Crush, by:
Working with Director of Customer Experience Strategy and Voice of the Customer to carry out implementations and program enhancements
Participate in the implementation design, setup, and review processes
Contribute survey content and other feedback mechanism development.
Provide support to the Voice of the Customer Program by leveraging in-depth tool and system capabilities
Work with internal and external teams in resolving technical/system related inquiries
Utilize tool and software knowledge to configure surveys and reports
Investigate and identify reasons for trend variances in the RTF NPS results.
Assist in the development of strategies designed to improve customer experience by:
Working to understand customer experience needs and develop the appropriate set of analyses and data insights to understand and address them.
Explaining basic and more advanced analytic techniques to internal colleagues in a clear, persuasive way to drive decision making.
Partnering with Client Experience Research Strategists to develop a data-driven story examining the customer experience and how to improve.
Exploring new and third-party sources of data and develop analytic methodologies to enhance and empower business decisions.
Produce deliverables such as PowerPoint presentations and reports.
Identify improvements to our feedback products and processes
Aggregating customer data (qualitative & quantitative) inputs from industry NPS, market research, competitive bench-marking, customer behavior (Google Analytics, Clicktale, Medallia, internal data etc.) to formulate key customer insights, and problem statements.
Conducting analytic deep dives by collaborating with cross functional analytics teams to gain insight into top customer experience aggravators.
Providing teams with key customer insights to drive impactful customer solutions.
Tracking, measure and report the impact of changes made to the customer experience.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience
Bachelor's Degree and 5 years’ work experience or equivalent combination of education and experience in an analyst role
Experience with a voice of the customer program and analysis
Specialized Knowledge
Working knowledge of user interface best practices for web, mobile, tablet sites and apps
Experience with Medallia, Google Analytics, Clicktale or other web and mobile reporting platforms
Technical Skills
Excellent analytical skills to identify variances between actual and intended experiences
Strong analytical and integrative thinking skills
Attributes
Ability to clearly communicate and explain strategy breaking down complex ideas
Ability to successfully multitask across multiple projects simultaneously
Strong continuous improvement skills with the ability to use tools to drive process improvements and operational enhancements
Strong collaborator; you welcome feedback and see team problem-solving as a natural part of the creative process
WORKING CONDITIONS:
The Client Experience Analyst will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.


DIRECT REPORTS:


No.

DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION:


Tangerine will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of an otherwise qualified employee or applicant for employment, unless undue hardship to Tangerine would result. Any applicant or employee who requires accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of a job should contact Human Resources or his or her supervisor.

MANAGING RISK:
All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions.

Tangerine is an equal opportunity employer

Winnipeg, MBDescription
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.
We are looking for a highly motivated person for an Analyst, Commodity Taxes position. This person will report to the Director, Commodity Taxes/ Audits, Compliance & Accounting.



Will assist Tax team with commodity tax audits (taxes and fees of all nature including Federal, Excise, Provincial, States as well as International taxes) and contribute to the development of commodity tax strategy for major audit issues.


Preparation of related tax reporting using large volumes of data and ensure integrity of data extracts.


Development and implementation of business process change and/or system improvements to mitigate tax exposure.


Support Tax team with commodity tax audits and ensure supporting documentation is provided in an efficient and timely manner.


Support in the implementation of corrective measures arising from tax audit assessments and findings to ensure compliance.


Monitor on-going tax compliance in reservations, travel and accounting systems.


Preparation of tax reports and account reconciliations to provide assurance on the collection and remittance of the related taxes, fees and charges.


Support the implementation of new tax legislation and verify corporate compliance with the changes in tax rates and relevant changes in legislation.


Assist Tax team with the initial and on-going of AC’s accounting and sales systems compliance with tax legislation.


Develop guidelines, training materials, job aids for internal departments as required.
Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Business or Finance.


CPA, CA, CGA, CMA designation preferred.


Work experience in commodity tax (GST/HST, QST, PST, Excise Tax and Fuel Tax) field is an asset.


Experience interpreting and analyzing tax legislation, an asset.


Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large and complex technical data.

Advanced MS Office PC skills such as Excel, Word & PowerPoint.

Experience performing data analysis using data analytical tools such as SQL, ACL or IDEA is an asset.


Knowledge of SQL language, relational database framework and/or Database Management System (Microsoft SQL-Server, TeraData, Oracle) is an asset.


Ability to understand complex systems and related change management is an asset.


Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with others.


Good organization skills and ability to work under pressure and to multi-task


High level of attention to detail


Self-starter, energetic with strong sense of initiative and creativity.


Excellent communication skills / oral and written.


Demonstrated record of initiative and work ethic.


LINGUISTIC REQUIREMENTS


Bilingual (English and French)


Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Why you should join us:
Do you have a willingness to adopt new approaches and methods as part of reporting process improvements? Are you someone who can provide high quality and accurate analyses of analytical reporting? We have an opportunity for you to work closely with the Stewardship Team Lead to extract data from various tools to provide insights. You will be responsible for working with leadership to produce accurate stewardship reports in alignment with reporting templates and metric definitions, while working in conjunction with colleagues to analyze and validate data and present it in relevant formats.
You will use your expertise to:
Provide Environment, Health and Safety (EH&S) Stewardship reports to different leadership teams and provide back-up support to other stewardship analysts supporting other business areas within Suncor
Become a super user for our Incident Management tool reporting (Enablon)
Work with the other Operational Reporting team members to improve the processes, procedures and tools used to perform stewardship activities and undertake specific projects deemed necessary based on the team goals
Manage the continuous improvement of relevant processes, metric definitions, and reporting delivery methods; complete ad hoc analysis and reporting as required
Compile the required data for reporting and complete ongoing analysis and management of the data used (complete QA/QC on data submitted by the business units); understand the trends and underlying issues
Provide mentorship support to internal partners pertinent to your specific business area and address ad hoc requests for analysis, while reviewing key components of the request, and you present such data in a manner to assist management in deciphering changes and trends and the need for action (based on each requests details)
Undertake projects (between stewardship reporting periods) as assigned to support the implementation of robust processes and/or new tools to address identified risks and opportunities within Operational Reporting
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
A post-secondary education and three years of relevant experience
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel formula and pivot table functionality
The willingness to become an expert in the use of Enablon incident database module and E-tracker software
The ability to work internally and externally with other teams to meet common objectives and you are willing to assist others to build their understanding of processes, tools, metrics, etc.
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
Business process knowledge and/or understanding of incident and injury classification
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
You will spend long hours utilizing a computer in an office environment
There will be regular periods of tight deadlines every month lasting 5-7 business days
Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future.
