JOB CATEGORY: Business Professionals

Mercer’s Career consulting business helps our clients around the world engage their talent to drive business performance. As a consultant within our Career practice, you will partner with board members, top-level executives, and HR leaders to optimize business performance through strategies that enable organizations to better manage, reward, and engage their people. We stay ahead of the competition by providing best-in-class information, unsurpassed global reach, dedicated support services, and innovative solutions. Our practice areas include: Rewards, Talent Strategy, HR Transformation, Communication, and Mobility.
Your career will begin within Mercer’s Rewards practice as a Career Rewards Consulting Analyst. You will work with a broad range of clients from various industries in a highly stimulating environment. Working along-side high-performing individuals within project teams, you will help diagnose issues and design strategic solutions that help our clients drive shareholder value.
Your role at Mercer will be to:
Work within a team to provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support to senior consultants.
Conduct research and analysis to understand industry and organization-specific issues, including business strategy, corporate performance, reward practices and industry trends.
Analyze clients' strategic, financial, and organizational information to provide insights that will develop into rewards strategies and solutions.
Prepare client presentations that will be presented to boards of directors, senior-level executives, and/or management.
Example projects include:
Benchmarking and assessing executive, board of director, and workforce compensation levels and compensation design.
Advising companies on human capital integration and retention strategies during corporate transactions (e.g., M&A).
Helping clients utilize best practices in corporate compensation governance.
Conducting job evaluation and pay equity analysis to ensure organizations are compliant with legislation.
Providing clients with market trends regarding compensation and incentive design practices.
Developing career frameworks and structures for an organization’s employees, including salary structures, workforce and succession planning and workforce analytics.
Helping clients re-think and re-design their performance management system.
Education and Experience:
A bachelor's or master’s degree in business, finance, accounting, HR, economics, statistics, or mathematics.
Consulting, business, finance/banking, accounting, HR, and/or economics internship experience.
Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative, and excellent Excel capabilities.
Experience in data analysis, financial modeling, and presentation design.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Intellectual curiosity, superior organizational skills, and strong attention to detail.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs.
Office Location: Calgary
To apply:
Please submit your cover letter, a one-page resume, and university transcripts via our website at www.mercer.ca (Careers Section).
Please note the start date for this position is in the Summer of 2019.

Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. We see people’s current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. Bring your passion for innovation, education, and performance in technology as you contribute to change lives in healthcare. You will work in a project based environment and support a busy Health Care Information Systems portfolio.
Fraser Health Authority is growing, the kind of growth you want to be a part of. With over 25,000 employees, 2,500 physicians and 6,500 volunteers providing a wide range of integrated health care services to over 1.8 million people living in Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley, Fraser Health is the largest and fastest growing Health Authority in Canada. We want you to join us in our growth as you maximize, improve and expand your skills.
Twelve acute care hospitals, BC’s first dedicated outpatient care and surgery centre and a wide range of services in public health, home health, mental health and residential care facilities - all within Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley. Known as one of the most desirable place to live in the world, these dynamic communities along with inspiring scenery and easy access to an abundance of outdoor activities provide an amazing quality of life.
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, integrity and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
As an Analyst, Education you will be a part of the education and training support team for Clinical Informatics – Direct Care . Working with clients on implementation plans, education and training programs, evaluating education/training effectiveness, providing communication support for related projects and providing operational support for our training labs throughout the health authority.
You will excel as you demonstrate instructional program design and delivery skills while working with all levels of the business, ensuring information technology education aligns with business requirements, with measurable results. You have the ability to model a variety of teaching methods, are well organized and have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Position Highlights:
Participates in the design, development and delivery of new/revised education and training programs; develops education plans for corporate technology tools and develops course curriculum and course descriptions; recommends training delivery options and registration criteria; develops tools to assess staff skill level and education needs.
Assists in the sourcing, selection, monitoring and evaluation of contractor supplied training, in collaboration with the team.
Analyzes requirements and develops templates for training and communications in support of IMIT project-related and operational requirements.
Participates in information systems projects by providing education support and leading small projects, as directed.
Develops self-support education materials such as videos, quick references, FAQs and other instructional material to assist FH staff and minimize calls to the Service Desk; maintains and updates education webpages and related content.
Analyzes the effectiveness of training programs and assists in establishing systems to support the department and Fraser Health’s strategic and organizational plans; acts as a resource to managers/supervisors for staff training needs.
Delivers training for software productivity tools and for small projects, as required; provides support to staff in the use of software productivity tools.
Coordinates the use and maintenance of computer training labs located throughout the health authority.
In this position you will be challenged daily to better improve the client experience. The work takes strong analytical capability - able to analyze a situation, identify a problem and provide solutions based on client’s needs. You will be using complex data to support business decisions and you'll need to demonstrate collaborative, creative and conceptual thinking.
Education and Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Education, preferable with a specialization in adult learning.
3 years' recent related experience in information systems education and training in a complex business environment.
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience is acceptable.
This regular full-time position is based at our Central City offices in Surrey, BC, with access to rapid transit, shopping, restaurants, on-site gym and other amenities.
Valued Benefits:
A career at Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with professionals who are eminent in their respective fields. We offer a competitive compensation package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends and family as a phenomenal place to work. We value diversity in the work force and aim to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

Who We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.
Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment

What This Position Is All About:

The Analyst, Markdown Optimization, Finance - will play a key role in providing the Buying and Planning teams the information they need to manage their in-season inventory. This will happen through timely and accurate reporting, through MDO adoption, and through detailed reviews prior to a new season set up.
The successful candidate for this role is someone who is detail oriented and focused. Must understand the business objectives, skilled in Excel, Access, and have the ability to learn other internal systems.

Who You Are:
 Possess strong analytical and technical skills
 Able to develop strong cross-functional relationships and partnerships to meet business objectives
 An Excellent written and oral communicator
 Able to prioritize and meet timelines

You Also Have:
 1-2 years’ experience in retail
 Experience in pricing while not required is an asset
 Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Finance
 Proficient in Excel & Access


As The Analyst, Markdown Optimization, You Will:


 Provide clear and concise reporting to the business so they can better understand their in-season inventory and margin position.
 Support the weekly maintenance and data accuracy of the MDO system including monitoring of acceptance and follow up where needed.
 Update MDO rules when needed and assist in the development and keying of new season rules.
 Provide ad hoc reporting and analysis when required.
 Interact with IT as needed for system issues and maintenance.
 Reconcile the system after merchandise re-classes and maintain accuracy of system permissions

Your Life and Career at HBC:
 Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
 Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate
 A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
 Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
 An amazing employee discount

Job Title: Sustainability Analyst
Department: Communications
Job Overview and Responsibilities
Do you want to work for a purpose-driven organization that is a social member of the global community and committed to our planet?
Are you passionate about corporate social responsibility and global sustainability issues?
Want to work with a fun and dynamic team?
This role is for you!
The Sustainability team is currently looking for a highly motivated and problem-solving Analyst to assist in the execution of the ALDO Group’s corporate social responsibility strategy and help our brands and divisions reach their sustainability goals. The ideal candidate must demonstrate resourcefulness, autonomy and have experience in environmental reporting and footprinting.
Support sustainability reporting efforts to calculate the company’s carbon footprint and other CSR related KPIs (collect relevant data, build and improve existing data models, interpret results, produce comprehensive reports)
Assist in product and material assessments based on a life cycle approach
Provide recommendations to support cross-departmental sustainability initiatives based on analysis and modeling
Assist in monitoring emerging sustainability trends, best practices and business opportunities
Facilitate communication with various internal and external sustainability stakeholders
Perform other similar or related duties as required
Job Requirements
University degree related to sustainability, corporate social responsibility, environmental engineering or other related field with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience
Strong verbal and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with business stakeholders to understand the business and gather requirements
Ability to communicate complex analysis in a clear, precise and actionable manner
Capacity to navigate complex database and business systems to extract key sustainability information
Strong organisational and documenting skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritise work
Knowledge and understanding of the retail and fashion/footwear industry
Advanced skills in MS Excel and strong Word and Powerpoint skills.
Fluent in written and spoken French and English
An asset: Experience with the Sustainable Apparel Coalition Higg suite of tools

Are you graduating from university in the spring/summer of 2019 and looking for the next step to launch your career? Are you eager to build your career in the world’s fastest growing industry with an international organization?

FDM is currently seeking a number of ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for IT to work as FDM consultants with our top clients, many of which are leading companies in the banking and financial services industry.

FDM creates and inspires exciting careers that shape our digital future. Through our Careers Program, we recruit and train those aspiring to become IT and business professionals before deploying them on to client sites worldwide. With centres across Europe, North America and APAC, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

Prior to working with our clients, successful candidates will receive intense technical and professional training in FDM’s Toronto or Montreal centre. You become an FDM employee from day one and are paid during the training period before placement on-site with our clients. Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizations.

We are now recruiting for spring/summer 2019 graduates. Apply Now to begin your application for post-graduation employment.

We are currently seeking candidates interested in building a career in a range of specialties:

DevOps Engineers focus on creating solutions using tools and automation to improve operations. DevOps roles can involve a myriad a projects, including: enhancing and streamlining operational processes though automation and integration; modifying existing software to correct errors, adapt to new hardware, or to improve performance; analyzing user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints; using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design; and much more.

IT Service Management Analysts (ITSM) balances technical skills, business knowledge, troubleshooting expertise, and excellent soft skills. IT Service Management is a great fit for those who are avid problem solvers and who enjoy working in fast-paced, dynamic environments such as the trade floor. IT Service Management Analysts must be great communicators in order to meet both the technical and interpersonal needs of the role.

Business Analysts and Project Managers often have access to business areas in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and high profile projects, and gaining first-hand exposure to the trade lifecycle. The role is crucial in helping organizations with the accuracy and timely presentation of data, in line with internal process, governance, and regulatory requirements. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.

Software Developers work with a range of responsibilities, including: writing, developing, testing, and reviewing code; supporting existing applications; liaising with end users to fix defects, find solutions, and test them; adding functionality to applications by designing and implementing solutions; and more. FDM has trained and placed developers in specialties including Java, C#, COBOL, .Net, and more.

Quality Engineers assure the quality of systems and applications through the full development cycle to meet client needs. You will be trained on the tools a tester needs to guarantee the developed system consistently meets the appropriate quality and performance expectations at all phases of a project. You will also develop cross-functional skills relevant to all aspects of solution delivery in order to work alongside the development team to aid in eliminating any issues. You will become immersed in DevOps-oriented culture through the use of automated testing technologies at the demand of our high-profile clients.

Big Data Developers design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using the latest Java and Big data technologies. You will be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members. You will be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle and will work through challenging and interesting problems. Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could grow into leadership roles working within multinational organizations.

What we offer you:
Industry recognized training and qualifications
Key skills development
A minimum of two years commercial experience working with some of the world’s most reputable organizations
Mentoring and on-going support throughout your career with FDM

Essential Criteria:
4 year degree or 3 year diploma (preferably in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar)
A strong aptitude in IT and the interest and drive to expand your IT skill set
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A problem solver with a keen eye for detail
Able to engage yourself in a project and enjoy the challenges and processes involved
Flexible, eager, ambitious, and adaptable to change
Able to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM consultant following the training period
Eligible to work in Canada (citizen/permanent resident/work permit with sufficient length of validity)

FDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

Why work for Lafarge?
Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainably constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Career with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge.ca/en/careers .

We are passionate about bringing cool, authentic restaurants to airports that reflect a taste of place.

The Culinary Systems Analyst is responsible for the input, administration and analysis of culinary-related data for SSP America’s menus, recipes, ingredients, food cost, food safety and nutrition. The position is under the supervision of the Director of Culinary Systems. The position will report to the Director of Culinary Systems.
 Essential Functions

Analyze recipe cooking techniques, ingredient quantities, assembly procedures and recipe yields to identify potential errors in recipes
Review menu & recipe nutritional analysis using Crunch Time software solution in compliance with USDA and FDA guidelines and regulations
Review and analyze recipe & menu theoretical costs for commercial viability
Professionally write culinary specific preparation methods and HACCP procedures for food service style recipes
Culinary Data Input:Recipes, ingredients, costs, cooking procedures and nutrition into multiple software systems (Excel, My Inventory, Crunch Time Restaurant Management Software)
Assist with the preparation, development and testing of SSP recipes in coordination with SSP’s Research & Development Chef
Ability to travel as needed
Regular attendance as required by SSP America attendance policy
Performs any other duties as assigned by manager


Minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a working Chef or Kitchen Manager required
Formal Culinary Education or equivalent professional experience required, with a background in nutrition preferred
Excellent communication (verbal and written), the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing, organization, project management, time management, and follow-up skills
Proven analytical, technical, and problem solving skills; capable of critical thinking
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) advance experience in Excel with the ability to manage spreadsheets and other software as needed
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management in the field and at the SSP America corporate offices, as well as the SSP Group parent company offices in the United Kingdom
Proven ability to handle conflict, work under pressure/deal with high stress situations, and resolve uncomfortable situations with clients, customers, peers and direct reports, and do so while exercising sound judgement and decision making
Ability to maintain a dynamic and positive attitude to support our culture and work environment and foster positive and effective working relationships with others in the organization, clients, vendors, etc.; Must be open to feedback and criticism and adjust performance/behavior accordingly
Capable of critical thinking and problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and among cross-functional teams with minimal supervision; ability to juggle multiple tasks, work in a fast-paced environment, successfully manage multiple projects, and effectively prioritize assigned job duties to meet deadlines and objectives
Strong business acumen with a desire to make a positive impact on the business; highly motivated to take ownership of assigned roles and to improve upon current processes and procedures
Effective organizational maturity to prioritize daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly activities
Competencies

Commercial Influence…Quality Conscious…Drive & Tenacity…Leading Change…Guest Focus…Communication & Impact…Working with Others…Planning & Analysis…

Administrative Responsibilities

This position works directly for members of senior management within the organization and will require the exercising of discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance to the organization. These include, but are not limited to analyzing techniques, ingredients, and recipe specifications and making and/or recommending changes that could affect the financial performance of the organization; making and/or recommending changes to recipes, production standards, or menus that could have an effect on the companies compliance with FDA, USDA, and HACCP regulations, and other responsibilities listed within this job description.

Position Type / Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work will vary, Wednesday through Tuesday and are dependent upon the hours mutually agreed upon with manager and based on the needs of the business. However, the position will work with multiple sites across the United States and Canada, so flexibility to early morning and evening hours is expected to compensate for the change in time zones, or as job duties demand. Work and travel on weekends and holidays and trips that require overnights may also be required.

Work Environment

This job functions independently, and/or in conjunction with cross-functional teams, with little or no direct supervision in an office setting, or may be home-based at the discretion of the manager. If travel became necessary, job duties would be performed in an airport environment, both pre and post-security, both within an office setting and in a restaurant, warehouse, and/or production environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and multiple computer programs, phones, smart phones, video conferencing and/or web conferencing, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Demands

SSP America, Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law. Consistent with those requirements, SSP America, Inc. will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability if such accommodation would allow the individual to perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would create an undue hardship. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to communicate with fellow team members and be able to accurately exchange information in these situations; resolve difficult situations and effectively manage and deal with stressful situations and areas of ambiguity within the functions of the job; while working within the office setting, will remain sedentary 100% of the time; while working out in the field, will be required to be mobile and move about to the company’s location(s) within the airport environment 100% of the time, to include standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, and crouching; operate a computer and other office equipment.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance

Must be able to establish eligibility to work in the United States. This position requires successful completion of a criminal background check.
Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Calgary, ABData Analyst, Nutrien Financial - (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 20,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.
We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.
Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career while earning a competitive salary and great benefits.
Reporting to the Financial Program Manager, the Nutrien Financial Analyst will manage and consolidate financial program data, perform analysis, and assist with system project tasks as required. The Analyst will assist with conducting market research on competitive grower financing and implement analytics and tools to assist the Retail platform in optimizing the use of customer loan products. The Analyst will have skills necessary to learn data modelling techniques, and the ability to leverage available systems to prepare and optimize reporting. Excellent communication and collaboration skills are required to manage Nutrien Financial relationships globally (retail branches, corporate offices, supplier contacts, etc.)
What you will do:
Maintain and periodically update finance program data in PowerBI
Update background tables and formula logic as reporting requirements change
Connect data sources to reporting platform in a sustainable and repeatable manner
Create new reports to communicate the status of finance programs
Gather data for input in Nutrien Financial’s long-term planning models
Make changes to model as new finance programs are added, program economics change, etc
Add inputs to presentations for various audiences, including retail, corporate, senior leadership
Gather data and perform analysis on competitor finance programs to assess Nutrien Financial’s position in terms of market share, risk & return profile
Evaluate third party finance programs against Nutrien Financial offerings
Coordinate preparation of finance program marketing brochures
Participation in ongoing projects, including: credit and loan management systems, third party data capture/storage, etc
Perform and document system testing results to ensure integrity of new and existing systems
Assist with transition from existing systems/processes to future solutions and assist with interim manual tasks as required
Ensure data integrity across various models and financial reporting
Communicate with various stakeholders in the business to understand processes and extract required information
What you will bring:
Undergraduate degree in business, economics, computer science, etc
Working knowledge of relevant systems (ARS, PeopleSoft, CreditPoint, SAP, EPM, PowerBI, Bloomberg, Share Point) considered an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft office (particularly Excel and Access) products
Analytical: ability to employ available data to accurately represent performance of current portfolio and assess future opportunities
Adaptability: flexibility to work on various activities and different types of tasks concurrently.
Change Management: work with others to produce innovative solutions that leverage established accounting practices (and establish new processes where required) to facilitate implementation of new finance programs.
Attention to Detail
Are you a good match? Apply today!
Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics
This job will remain posted until filled. You may be required to undergo a background check and substance test in accordance with Nutrien policies. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

job_title: Business Intelligence & Product Development Analyst (AMA Analytics)
job_description:
Edmonton, ABYOU LIVE BY THE MOTTO:
knowledge IS POWER.

Posted: 2019-02-13

Closing: When Filled

Location: Edmonton South
ABOUT YOU
Just like Indiana Jones, you love digging for information. You can whip up analytical reports faster than Indy can find himself in trouble. You have a knack for data and details and sharing what you've discovered in a way that makes it easy for people to understand. You're fluent in Power BI and Highcharts and don't need to reference Indy's diary to help you make heads or tails of the information you discover. You work well with a broad group of people and communicate clearly every step of the way. We like that about you!
WHAT MOVES YOU
You know the key to building strong relationships is being a great listener.
You're comfortable collaborating with people from all levels of the organization to accomplish common goals.
You have a knack for quickly understanding business unit goals and linking them to standardized analytical products that can be easily used across the organization.
You don't need anyone to light a fire under you; you know what needs doing and get it done.
You're a stickler for details and accuracy and have an uncanny ability to get your hands on the right information quickly.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Manager, BI & Product Development.
Develop highly effective and visually pleasing analytical products such as marketing segmentations, churn analysis, member profiles, etc., in such a way that it's easily consumed by the business.
Build BI reports in Power BI based around internal stakeholder needs.
Respond to internal, field and vendor requests for information regarding products.
Consult with stakeholders on options to modify or enhance analytical products; identify themes based on requests and raise them with management.
Design performance metrics, reporting formats and dashboards.
Ongoing development and enhancements of impactful dashboards, reports and products to effectively enable insights and business decisions.
Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of business strategy, financial goals, processes and requirements across multiple business lines.
Determine requirements, define key performance indicators, and develop BI solutions to business problems by regularly communicating with executives, business and operational leaders, and subject matter experts.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have a bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, business management, specialized training/certification or equivalent work experience.
You're no newbie. You have 5-7 years of Business Analysis or related technical experience – on this we must insist.
You'll get bonus points if you have experience with Microsoft Power BI and/or Agile/Scrum.
You're an expert when it comes to using data analysis technology and language (SQL, Python, DAX, SSRS, BI tools).
You can analyze and interpret data and do queries from multiple data sources (SQL< SQL Sparks) with one hand tied behind your back.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Imagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Edmonton
11504 - 186 Street NW. Edmonton, AB T5S 0J1

Uline - Shipping Supply Specialists

"The people I work with are as passionate as I am."
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Due to our tremendous growth at our Edmonton distribution center we are adding to our team. We are dedicated to doing the right thing for both our customers and associates which has resulted in exceptional growth. Come Grow with Uline!

We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Operations department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in supply chain logistics, transportation, fulfillment or business analysis, Uline is the company for you.


Business Analyst
Uline seeks a Business Analyst for its branch in Edmonton, Alberta.

Come join our rapidly growing team!

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze network and warehouse operations, including performance and productivity data, error rates and their root causes.
Analyze reports to identify operational issues.
Conduct ad hoc analyses on specific areas of the operation.
Develop recommendations to improve performance.
Manage small operational process improvement projects.
Monitor results of warehouse operation improvement initiatives.
Maintain and publish standard reports for distribution operations.
Maintain databases and develop weekly / monthly metrics reports.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree.
Strong Microsoft Office experience, especially in Excel and Access.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Working knowledge of SQL, data extraction and analysis.
AS400 and Cognos experience a plus.
THERE'S NO LIMIT TO WHAT YOU CAN ACCOMPLISH!

We're growing fast and looking for future leaders and problem-solvers who are ready to grow with us. If you have passion for what you do, then we'll provide the tools you need for success. Plus, you'll also receive fantastic benefits and perks that create an outstanding work environment for everyone at Uline.

BENEFITS
Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
RRSP with 5% employer match.
Paid holidays and generous paid time-off.
Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Scholarship program for children of employees.

EMPLOYEE PERKS
Reimbursements for fitness memberships.
Free chair massages.
Numerous employee appreciation events throughout the year.
Opportunities for community involvement.

ABOUT ULINE

Uline is the leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials to businesses throughout North America. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service and quality products. We offer same-day shipping on over 36,000 products found in our 788-page catalog and on our state-of-the-art e-commerce website.

Our quality products, huge inventory and ongoing expansion fuel our incredible growth. This is a great time to join Uline!

job_title: Solution Integrator (I&T, GIS) - Intermediate - Geospatial Data Management Analyst
job_description:
Montréal, QCEnglish version will follow

Fujitsu Canada offre à ses clients un portefeuille complet de services TI, de plateformes informatiques et de solutions sectorielles. Elle est réputée pour sa capacité d’exploiter la puissance des TI et de concevoir des solutions innovatrices sur mesure pour les secteurs du commerce de détail, de la fabrication, de l’éducation, des services financiers et de l’entreprise automobile, ainsi que pour les gouvernements. Chez Fujitsu, vous travaillerez dans un environnement de travail dynamique au sein d’équipes multidisciplinaires, qui réalisent des projets stimulants. Fujitsu Canada est une entreprise qui peut vous aider à atteindre votre potentiel au cours de votre carrière. Nous favorisons le développement de nos employés en tant que personnes, l’acquisition d’expérience en tant que spécialistes de notre industrie, et le travail d’équipe pour obtenir de beaux succès en tant que membres de la famille Fujitsu. Pour plus de renseignements sur notre entreprise, notre vision, notre philosophie, visitez

http://www.fujitsu.ca

.

Le titulaire de ce poste est responsable de vérifier la qualité des données géospatiales produites par l’analyste des données maîtres de l’Ingénierie, y compris les données maîtres du système de commande intégrale des trains (PTC). Il passera en revue toutes les entrées de données géospatiales provenant des unités d’affaires et fournisseurs externes qui gèrent ces données dans le cadre du modèle de données géospatiales d’entreprise. Il sera responsable de la qualité et de l’intégrité des données de toutes les publications produites par le Rail Network Data Management Railroad Business Logics (RNDM GIS Topology). Ce groupe fournit aussi des services de maintenance de l’entrée des données géospatiales au nom des groupes n’ayant pas une connaissance élaborée de la géomatique. Le titulaire du poste s’assure enfin de l’application de toutes les procédures établies de capture de données. La direction de la Qualité des données géospatiales est responsable de communiquer tous les problèmes ou défauts décelés par le système de surveillance de la qualité des données géospatiales, ce qui comprend la documentation et les communications aux parties appropriées.

***************************************************************************************

We are reputed for our ability to harness the power of IT and to design custom innovative solutions for the retail, manufacturing, educational, finance and automotive industries, as well as governmental entities. Fujitsu offers a dynamic work environment composed of multidisciplinary teams that drive stimulating projects to success. Fujitsu Canada accompanies you over the course of your career and can help you reach your full potential. We care about our employees’ personal growth as well as their professional advancement and experience gain. We encourage teamwork within the Fujitsu family so that our teams can attain great success. For more information on our company, our vision, and our philosophy, please visit

http://www.fujitsu.ca

.

We are looking for qualified applicants to join our Montréal team team as Solution Integrator (I&T, GIS) - Intermediate - Geospatial Data Management Analyst.

This role is responsible to oversee GIS data quality produced by the Engineering Master Data Analyst including PTC System Master Data. This role review any GIS data entry produced by the different business units & external Vendors managing spatial data in the enterprise GIS data model. This role is responsible for the data quality and integrity of all the publication produced from the Rail network Data Management Railroad Business Logics (RNDM GIS Topology). The group is also providing spatial data entry maintenance services on the behalf of non GIS savvy business groups. This role is ensuring all data capture standard procedure are followed adequately. GIS Data Quality management is responsible for communicating any issues or defects identified by the GIS data quality monitoring system. This includes appropriate documentation and communication to appropriate parties.

Qualifications

Aptitudes et connaissances

Profil
recherché

Aptitudes obligatoires :

De 4 à 6 ans d’expérience des processus du cycle de vie du génie

logiciel et des solutions géomatiques d’entreprise.


Réalisation de projets de grande envergure.
Stabilité.
Personne organisée et proactive pouvant se motiver soi-même et

travailler de façon autonome.

************************************************************************************

Mandatory Skills

4-6 years in software engineering lifecycle process / in GIS enterprise solutions

Large projects

Independent, Proactive, Self-motivating, Organized

Consultation

Emplacement principal

Canada-PQ-Montréal

Montréal, QCJob Description

Description
In collaboration with the other members of the finance team, the incumbent will use his expertise in data mining and modeling to support the management team in the financial and operational planning and analysis processes. He will produce a variety of reports, dashboards and analyzes to improve performance and value creation and will play a key role in automating reporting. The start of this new role will coincide with the implementation of Adaptive Insights, in which he will actively participate.

Main responsibilities
Manipulate, transform and consolidate data from various sources and formats into databases while ensuring data quality;
Understand our business model and processes, document business needs and establish links with data from our various business systems;
Design, develop, optimize and automate reports and dashboards;
Continuously identify opportunities for automating and improving the quality and relevance of data to support sound business decision making;
Build analytical models, perform financial and operational analyzes, interpret results and suggest concrete actions to improve performance;
Manage the Adaptive Insights platform, including security roles
Actively participate in promoting the single source of truth principle
Participate and support planning and forecasting processes
Develop and improve appropriate key performance indicators and track them
Contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and the optimization of computerized tools
Participate actively in various special projects

Qualifications

Professional requirements and desired skills
university degree in business intelligence, information systems, actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, or equivalent technical experience
Three years of relevant experience in data analysis, modeling, business intelligence
Hands-on experience with data visualization software such as Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Knowledge of Adaptive Insights software is an asset
Strong knowledge of database operations, including architecture, queries and report building
Strong analytical skills, good judgment and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a team and within tight deadlines
Demonstrate initiative and autonomy
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite
Additional Information

We offer:
Competitive salaries
Corporate bonus program
Employee recognition program
Employee referral program
Flexible hours
Comprehensive insurance plan
Training & skills upgrading
Social events
Dynamic culture

Miovision’s mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow’s smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world’s most advanced traffic AI, Miovision’s innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit
www.miovision.com
[http://www.miovision.com]
Miovision is looking for a Sales Operations Analyst to support the sales organization in managing the prospect/customer journey. In this role, you will work closely with the ITS Sales Director, Revenue Operations Business Manager, and sales team ensuring accurate forecasting and CRM usage from the top of the lead funnel through to PO execution. You’ll be passionate about data, Salesforce, forecasting, and working closely with internal stakeholders to provide support and guidance.

Why your work will matter:
Right now, cities are forced to make technology choices that stifle innovation. When innovation suffers, so do citizens. Congestion, noise pollution, air pollution, safety risks - these are all things that impact our quality of life. Miovision is committed to breaking this cycle and giving cities the tools they need to be smart cities. When you see the work we do, you will want to live in Miovision powered city.

Things we’d like you to work on:

Own the sales pipeline - intimate knowledge of sales opportunities - has their finger on the pulse of the sales organization and is the expert in all things forecasting
Support senior leaders by providing insights, action items, analysis and recommendations on pipeline development and management to effectively run weekly sales pod meetings.
Standard operating process development, implementation, improvements and analysis for the end to end selling cycle metrics - from prospecting lead generation handoff to active selling cycles and customer transitions
Regular sales process reviews to improve sales rep efficiency, data integrity, and forecasting accuracy
Ad hoc reporting, forecasting, pipeline development, and analytics directly supporting our senior sales leadership
Intimate knowledge of Salesforce.com from a sales user perspective, including (but not limited to) continuously improving operationally: leads, opportunities, CPQ, contracts, renewals etc...
Acts as the primary sales representative to IS/IT on Salesforce.com improvements, automations, and system processes.
Work day to day directly with sales reps ensuring data integrity, enhancing process flows, and building iterative efficiencies

Things we’d like you to have:

Bachelor’s degree or recognized equivalency or achievement of recognized professional level
2-5 years experience in sales related analyst functions
Proficient with Salesforce
Proficient with Gsuite apps (Docs, Sheets, Slides)
Intimate knowledge of long-term selling cycles
Highly organized and entrepreneurial with ability to work independently on multiple projects in a fast-paced, high pressure environment
Demonstrated ability to effectively assess needs, recommend solutions, design, deliver, and measure the results of process changes
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build trust and relationships quickly

Lightspeed is seeking a full-time Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team. Reporting to the Director of Corporate Development and Business Analytics, this role is responsible for developing and maintaining analysis that helps our entire organization make better, faster decisions. If you're organized, ambitious, and intelligent with a mind for statistics and analysis with experience working in Excel, SQL, and Python or R, then this may be the position for you. The ideal candidate will have experience analyzing, presenting, and interpreting complex data sets.

Now we get to brag about us: Lightspeed provides retailers and restaurateurs the simplest way to build, manage, and grow their business while crafting a better customer experience. Lightspeed empowers small business owners with a complete overview of their business in one place - businesses who process transactions use Lightspeed's mobile Point of Sale software ( https://www.lightspeedhq.com/pos/retail/ ) and eCommerce platform to manage inventory, customer preferences, sales, and analytics to get a complete overview of their business in one place. Founded in 2005 with offices in Canada, USA, and Europe, Lightspeed has received one of the largest funding for a Canadian tech company which has us well positioned to become Canada's next great technology success story. We're passionate about enabling people to do their best work. Come work with us and find out what you can do.

Primary Responsibilities


Provide data-driven strategic insights
Own analysis from start to finish: understand the underlying data, discover trends, and continuously improve
Work with internal stakeholders across finance, sales, and product teams to define and measure key performance indicators
Build automated processes using SQL/R/Python to improve data cleanliness, processing and analysis
Deliver accurate and cleanly-built work

Requirements


4+ years of analytics experience
Strong fluency in Microsoft Excel and SQL
Strong fluency with Python or R
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
Ability to work independently and drive towards an answer
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Comfortable with fast-paced startup environment
Fluency in English

Assets


Experience with Salesforce.com reporting
Experience with BI tools such as Looker and Tableau
Experience with Data mining techniques
Knowledge of Software as a Service (SaaS) valuation metrics
Fluency in French

And what about the rest?

In addition to the perks you see on the Careers page, you'll get access to:


A beautifully renovated office space in a castle; one of the best development centres in Montreal;
An environment that encourages initiatives and leadership;
Happy hour every Friday afternoon;
Birthday treats every month to celebrate our employees;
Social events throughout the year including the legendary annual holiday party;
Fun activities with your teammates - be part of the Lightspeed family;
Work with highly talented people who are as passionate about their craft as you are!

Medical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

The Retail Labour Analyst will work as part of the retail team to evaluate & lead labor optimization planning, including retail key performance indicator (KPI)management, labor scheduling, gap analysis and retail labor dashboards on a national level. This role will identify new opportunities, execute labor scheduling with store leaders and district management, conduct due diligence, provide labor management recommendation, track KPI’S and perform directed research. Success in this role requires strong written and verbal communication skills, an analytical and questioning mindset, demonstrated project management abilities, creativity and enthusiasm for optimization of resources and KPI’s.

Responsibilities

Evaluate, analysis, due diligence and valuation tasks that include:


Qualifying labor opportunities and performing comprehensive due diligence on a labor scheduling system to meet or exceed labor targets
Reviewing confidential vital retail information and data. preparing analyses and presenting summaries of findings/recommendations to internal decision makers on a store and operational level
Reviewing, developing and maintaining dynamic labor models that incorporate optimized service scenarios, sensitivity analysis, business decline/increase options, valuations, historical and forecast data to analyze non-routine & routine labor in a manner that supports decision making
Work with service and guest feedback partners to strategize and optimize labor execution correlation to guest/employee feedback

Research tasks that include:

Compiling, analyzing and synthesizing information from a broad range of sources such as financial databases, industry analysis, traffic pattern analysis, competitive factors, financial statements and HR planning software
Preparing ideal labor summaries and presentations to the internal customers
Assisting in developing comprehensive labor management dashboards to measure daily, weekly, monthly

Portfolio company support and reporting tasks that include:

Supporting the team in generating and executing value-add strategies within the operating businesses
Monitoring ongoing financial and operational performance of national retail planning, budgets and execution
Provide assistance in the preparation of performance reporting as required.
Conduct periodic site visits and on occasion oversee and understand labor constraints, opportunities and best practices

Experience and Background


2+ years of related work experience (retail or service industry preferred)
Demonstrated research, project management, financial modeling, problem solving, analytical and valuation skills;
Ability to systematically manage a challenging workload independently and meet deadlines;
Current technology skills with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, Advanced Excel skills, Google sheets & pivot tables;
Financial acumen and demonstrated ability to identify risk;
Awareness of economic conditions and indicators;
Professional, friendly and courteous demeanor;
A degree, designation or certification in a related field is preferred

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Smiths Falls or Kanata, Ontario.

Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. All resumes will be maintained in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Brampton, ONWho We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment.

What This Position Is All About:
This analyst role will report to the Director, Strategy and will play an integral part in the development and implementation of high priority strategic initiatives.

The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a highly analytical role. The candidate will have a strong strategic orientation, excellent communication skills, and superior analytical skills. He/she will also need to be a strong collaborator and influencer with all levels of the organization, including executives.

Who You Are:
You get things done by engaging in high level teamwork and flexing your interpersonal skills
You are flexible, resilient, and able to thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment
A natural problem-solver, who is also intuitively analytical and creative
You are skilled in modelling and data analytics; able to analyze data and develop actionable insights
You Also Have:
Excellent Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel skills
2+ years of experience in an analytical role
Experience at strategy consulting firm or in corporate strategy role is an asset but not necessary
Experience in retail and/or consumer sector is an asset but not necessary
Bachelor's degree
As the Analyst, Strategy, You Will:
Support Strategy team leaders and the Executive team at HBC in developing and implementing strategic initiatives to support the evolution of the business, drive results and reach our customer.
Design and conduct advanced analytics to support data driven decision making and development of best practices for the organization.
Conduct external research to support strategic planning and decision making.
Assist in project management related to strategic initiatives.
Assist in creation of internal reporting and strategy documents to support business unit activities and strategic planning.
Collaborate with cross-functional and external partners to provide relevant and actionable customer, competitor, and market level insights to the business units.
Assist in development of materials for key executive level meetings, including Executive Committee meetings and quarterly Board of Directors meetings.
Develop strong cross-functional partnerships and relationships to support key strategic initiatives as needed.
Support with ad hoc activities as required.
Your Life and Career at HBC:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner-operator
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental)
An amazing employee discount

Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

Dialpad's product suite covers the full range of modern business communications needs with Dialpad Talk, Support, Sell, and UberConference. All products are powered by VoiceAI, Dialpad's proprietary technology that helps companies unlock conversation insights, improve productivity and drive better performance across teams.

Who we are:
At Dialpad, we're a team of doers. A team that thinks outside the box and when that doesn't work, we reinvent it. We don't settle for the status quo, and neither do the things we build. Led by the same minds behind Google Voice, we create products that get businesses talking—whether it's across the hall, street, or country.

With $120 million in funding from ICONIQ Capital, Google Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, Scale Ventures and other top VC’s, Dialpad attracts top talent from iconic companies like Microsoft and Google as well as powerhouse startups like Hootsuite, Weebly and Anaplan. Every member of our team plays an essential role in creating dynamic products that don’t just combine design and mobility but works with you wherever productivity may strike.

About the role:
The machine learning team is responsible for building all of the models used to deliver our VoiceAI technology. We are looking for a QA Analyst who will support our Data Science, Speech Recognition and Data Engineering teams to help deliver new ASR and NLP features and improvements. The ideal person has excellent attention to detail, an ability and desire to deeply understand our customers, experience testing large scale systems, and experience working with large data sets.

The QA analyst will work closely with the machine learning team to test new features in our staging environments to ensure they are functioning as expected; create, clean and maintain data sets for testing; and create test scripts for all levels of testing from smoke tests to unit tests.

Ideally, you have experience testing telephony or distributed systems, have some knowledge of machine learning practices and data requirements and are comfortable operating in an agile environment. If you're inspired by innovation and you like working with a smart, talented, generally awesome team, we'd love to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

Perform automated and manual tests of new features in our staging environments to ensure they are functioning as expected
Create test plans and scripts for all levels of testing from smoke tests to unit tests and report issues in JIRA
Given a feature, be able to determine what tests should be run and what data will be required to ensure quality
Clean, label and curate data sets for testing
Create tests to measure both qualitative and quantitative aspects of the product
Report on testing results to technical and non-technical audiences
Participate in customer interviews and learn about sales and support workflows

Requirements:

2+ years of experience as a QA Analyst or equivalent role
Excellent communicator and listener
Excellent organizational and analytical skills
Flexible with regards to changing priorities & business needs
Experience with Python, SQL, and Google Cloud and Data Studio
Experience with automated, performance, and manual testing
Experience with NLP and ASR services is a plus
Experience with B2B sales and support workflows is a plus

Joining our team means collaborating with people that aren’t just passionate about their work but about Argentine tango, musicals, sushi burritos, comic books - you name it. Because if you’re going to redefine the status quo, you need a group of people hungry to do more, to see more, and be more than where they started.

There is no idea too crazy and no task too small — we work together to make things we’re proud of.

Compensation & Equity

Teamwork makes the dream work. We recognize that our dedicated team members are what make our success. That’s why we offer competitive salaries in addition to stock options.

Healthcare

An apple a day keeps the doctor away - and it doesn’t hurt that we offer 100% paid medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your dependents.

Reimbursements

We offer a monthly stipend to help cover your cell phone, home internet, and even gym membership costs.

Education

We believe in your future as much as you do! That's why we offer a yearly stipend for continued learning and education expenses.

Office Meals

Bon Appetit! Enjoy catered lunches, free snacks & drinks (both healthy and unhealthy - no judgment!)

Location, Location, Location

San Francisco San Ramon Austin Raleigh Vancouver Kitchener Tokyo New York Bangalore. From coast to coast, our offices are nestled in active and growing downtown areas

Dialpad is an equal opportunity employer; we believe in creating a community of inclusion and an environment free from discrimination or harassment.

Additionally, you will be responsible for providing level II technical support and data analysis to our install base of existing customers which would include code updates and fixes as well as software upgrades.

Expanding your skills and experience, both technical and interpersonal to accelerate your career progression.

Attributes:

Excellent organizational, troubleshooting, problem determination & resolution, and analytical skills.
Excellent oral and written presentation skills.
Strong team player and individual contributor with the ability to build relationships across the organization.
Process oriented in change and problem management disciplines.
Customer, service and results oriented.
Desire to lead, be accountable and taking the initiative.
Conversational in French, Spanish or another second language.

Travel Requirements:
We do our best to balance the lives of our people with the needs of our customers.
As you progress at Invatron, you may be required to be onsite for our larger implementation projects.
Existing engagements can be managed remotely with quarterly onsite visits.

Collect requirement specifications and analyze business process, and map process flow to determine the exact nature of users system requirements. Create processing steps and design new systems in accordance with users requirements. Interact with IT professionals, such as software engineers and programmers to develop data migration tools and attend to ad-hoc issues related to day-to-day activities. Work closely with IT professionals throughout the implementation and testing phases, to set up test environments and test data for a timely and exhaustive project testing. Assist programmers to debug or eliminate errors from the system. Prepare specifications, flow charts, and process diagrams for programmers to follow. Develop and maintain systems documentation such as design specifications, user manuals, technical manuals, description of application operations, and methodology documentations. Participate in technical collaboration meetings and provide project management team with periodical reviews on implementation status as well as weekly reports on task plan for custom software implementations.
Minimum Qualification Required:
Master or foreign equivalent in Computer Science/Applications/Engineering, Computer/Management Information Systems, any Engineering or related field. In the alternative, will accept Bachelor or foreign equivalent plus five years of progressive experience in job offered or related work.

Oshawa, ON$35,000 - $45,000 a yearEn-Pro works with companies from a variety of industry sectors including property management, healthcare, retail, hospitality, manufacturing and transportation, helping reduce and control their cost of energy.

We are looking for an Energy Cost Control Analyst to help our growing team.

Position: Energy Cost Control Analyst – Full Time – Oshawa, ON

The Role

The primary role of this position is to gain a broad understanding of the intricacies of energy markets and provide our recommendations and cost control strategies to our clients. The main aspects of the role include:


Advising clients and delivering our suite of services including natural gas and electricity procurement strategies, budgets, performance reporting and data analytics.
In conjunction with our analytical team, you’ll manage the client relationship, ensuring that client needs are exceeded.
Bring forth new opportunities and service offerings to maximize the client benefit.

We have an in-house apprenticeship program where you will be trained and mentored throughout your development. A development timeline of goals and compensation is clearly laid out with regular touch point reviews.

About You


You are a smart self-thinker who thrives on success.
You possess excellent computer skills and knowledge; You will have a strong background in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Excel.
You naturally have fantastic communication abilities with strong oral and written skills and a professional and articulate telephone manner.
Your terrific organizational skills and follow-through allow you to complete tasks on schedule with a dedication to excellence.
You are a self-starter, solution-oriented, able to prioritize multiple requests, with high initiative.
You have an education in commerce or finance and are very comfortable working with numbers. You have the ability to review and understand data and assemble it in a way that properly reflects the analysis while making sense to the customer.
Independent thinking is one of your strong attributes. You have the ability to understand the entire task at hand and see it through from beginning to end.

The very best in this role execute with confidence and precision. They know exactly what needs to be done, and exactly how to achieve the goals before them.

This job is a great opportunity to build a meaningful career.

Working @ En-Pro

We have worked hard to build a company that invests in our employees. We give our employees the tools and opportunities they need to succeed. We have developed a tight-knit, cohesive culture. Our company has a family dynamic, as we get to know each other through monthly staff lunches, golf tournaments and summer barbecues, along with a great holiday party in the winter.

This is a full-time position with a salary commensurate with experience. We also offer a full benefits package, and free parking.

Qualifications
